reviews.review: Beautiful . The beautiful and very popular in France from the movie the Gobe the Notre Dame, I suggest to visit this meraville...

Sanctuary! Sanctuary!. By far the largest cathedral I have ever visited. Definitely a must-do while in Paris. We visited about a dozen churches and cathedrals while in Paris and Notre Dame wins in the size category and her Gothic splendors are there for all to see, but she is not my favourite. We were lucky enough to see a procession of priests. TIP: Be quiet & respectful. People are worshiping. Easy to forget.

Concerts are a great time .... to visit the Cathedral. You actually have the place pretty much to yourself compared to the zoo that it can often be. There are only about seats for 800 people and you can truly enjoy the space even though you can't walk close to the naves on either side.We heard a very beautiful concert of 14 pieces with three young singers from the choir school at the Cathedral accompanied with some numbers with an organist.The music was great and the cathedral was even better.

A renewed visit. We visited Notre Dame after the renovation and it is breathtaking from the outside and very interesting visiting the inside with all the explanations of the history and the evolution of the building. It was a fascinating and educational visit and you should not miss it. Yona S.
No words! . There are no words to describe this cathedral, so worth the wait! We stayed for mass and although we didn't understand a thing, we certainly enjoy it. Do not skip this when in Paris!

Not to sure. Mixed feelings. Such a beautiful piece of architecture! Gothic history at it's best but very commercial. Signs clearly say no photos but everyone is snapping away. I found this beyond disrespectful. I think you have to see it due to its beauty alone but be prepared for insane crowds with little respect and over commercialisation. Also birds freak me out...they were everywhere like little freaky winged rats ready to attack. Its ok if you like birds though.

Go at Christmas!. This is a beautiful cathedral. Be advised that there is a long wait to get in. It moves pretty fast though. We had a city pass, and we could not skip the lines with it. The Christmas decorations were nice. There are a lot of cafes near Notre Dame, if you feel peckish.
The Price is Right!. Free is scarce in Paris, the only charge is to hike up the steps to the tower. The view is worth it and they provide appointments to manage you wait time.
Free, and beautiful . Good for those on a budget because it's free. Two beautiful bell towers chiming on the hour, lovely. Enjoy the inside then sit by the river outside and enjoy the area.
English tour. It was a bit confusingly where we were to meet but found the guide. Excellent art historian quieted us through this wonderful cathedral. Simply wonderful!!!!

Ms. To do this activity you have to be physically active and fit. It requires a good camera. The lake and gardens is very beautiful. Lots of walking wear lose clothes become very hot inside lots of water. So many people very humid inside. Needs growd control

Mr Ben batey. Wow!! This has to be seen to be appreciated as any picture I have seen does not do it justice. The lead light windows are incredible and so are the art works inside. Light a candle for a loved one. Tarnished only by the gift store inside which I thought was a bit tacky. There are heaps of great gift stores nearby and food aplenty. The line to climb to the top was around the block so we gave it a miss but spent some time walking around the outside of the cathedral and enjoyed the music of some local buskers.We caught one of the boats from the Eiffel Tower which was nice. Make sure your boat has an open top so you can get good pictures while you are travelling down the siene.

Absolute must do and see. I have travelled to Paris a number of times but never taking a tour of Notre Dame. I am so glad I did this visit and loved my experience. Estelle our guide was excellent taking us through the cathedral and then to the Too of Notre Dame. History, architecture and the view of Paris. Sorry I have not done this tour sooner. Go and enjoy!

Amazing. Fabulous building , just amazing . Was very busy so didn't go inside but was a must to see . It's near the Latin Quater so great for eating out . Just off the River so easy to access by the Batubus

Breathtaking. From the exterior, to the domes, to the organ, to the pillars - absolutely breathtaking! I cannot describe the feeling that overcame me for the duration of my visit. We were there during the evening mass, and it was an incredible experience.Don't waste your time with a guided tour, as entrance is free and you will be too awe struck to absorb any information anyway :)
Breathtaking . Notre Dame > Eiffel Tower. I am not very religious, but spent more time admiring details of this church more than the eiffel. Spectacular in every inch. A must visit!

The Towers. The church is beautiful inside and out, but one thing I really wanted to see were the gargoyles. Access to the tower can only be obtained by waiting in a line. You cant buy advance tickets and the museum pass wont allow you to skip the line. They allow 20-25 people up every 30 minutes. I wanted in line for about 2-2.5 hours. This was the only attraction I had to wait in line for in Paris and it was worth it. The view from the top is beautiful and I was so happy to see the gargoyles up close. You can also see the large church bells.

Que Impresionante!. This church was The one that made the most lasting impression on my wife during our European vacation. We arrived at the cathedral about 45 minutes before it closed and we saw a long line. My wife noticed that the line seem to be moving quickly so we formed at the end of the line and sure enough, after about 20 minutes we were entering the cathedral. There was a service in session, but it was great walking around the perimeter of the inside marveling at everything.

Gregorian Mass on Sunday. The cathedral is, naturally, quite impressive, but you have to attend the Gregorian Mass on Sunday morning. Extremely impressive. Probably more so if I had studied Latin in school. Even if you're not Catholic, you should experience this.

visitors of all faith ( including atheists) will be in awe of this stunning XIII century church. I am openly atheistic and yet when I am in Paris I do not forget to attend the "high mass" Sunday at 10 am, Gregorian chants and uplifting sacred organ music.

Another must see when in Paris. She's old and dated, but how can you visit Paris and not stop by the Cathedral, especially if you're Catholic. Lots of crowds -- and pickpockets -- but well worth the visit. If you're fit, climb to the top and admire the skyline.

Must one to see, as long as you don't go into treasury. Well - it is one of most widely recognised landmarks of Paris and architecture masterpiece. We visit Notre Dame every time we visit, sometimes more than once.Having said that - it was the first time we decided to visit Treasury (a door in the right side of Cathedral with separate cashier) and found it unimpressive compared to the price they want for the entrance (EUR 5) - couple of scattered artefacts with no labels in English (audio guide is available I believe for another EUR 5). Just skip this and spend time marvelling at other beauties this cathedral is offering, quite free of charge.

Better luck off the beaten path. I was so excited to come here... But honestly, it was much too crowded, people didn't respect the signs to be quiet out of respect, and there was an ungodly number of East Asian tour groups whacking people with those stupid selfie sticks. I don't really understand why people go to these places just to take a few photos without really looking or really seeing anything, just to say they were there but have no true experience. I found much better luck at the less famous cathedrals... On the way home one night I wandered into St. Germain l'Auxerrois and it was a beautiful experience. Maybe 10 people in the whole place, gorgeous old art, not a selfie stick in sight. I would have liked to see more of Notre Dame, but it was just too busy and frankly, too many people only there so say they had been and look cool on social media. Not worth the annoyance.
Norte Dame. Very impressive. Much larger than I thought. The stained glass windows were beautiful. The surrounding area was also very nice with easy access to the bus and restaurants.

Just had to visit. After all, this is one of the top attractions in Paris. Remember to enjoy the walking at the surrounding areas too. I did not particularly enjoy the dimly lit insides - they began to look the same after a while - statues and glass painting telling stories. The tall ceilings were overwhelming. The exhibit and write-up about the construction of the place was interesting. I had not appreciated how much money and how long it took to build this place. The view of the building from the nearby bridge and the quarters is nice.

got to go to the top its a must. we had a lovely time walking round the cathedral but the top is a must ..you queue for the top is around the side nearest the road ..we queued for about an hour as the steps to go up to the top are limited so only a few at a time and its a hard walk up the steps but worth it ..not good for ppl with walking or breathing difficulties and no lift for obvious reasons .the bells rang while we was at the top not to loud but it was amazing to hear them ..and the veiw is just lovely ..so if your lucky enough to walk up them give it a go
Notre Dame Cathedral . Visited with a small school group.. Great experience attended Sunday International Mass..Self guided tour before mass.. Allow about 1hr and then 1.5hrs for Mass..Amazing!!
Spiritual, Peaceful and Beautiful. It was a very beautiful experience. Cathedral has a great history and is so beautiful. Despite so many people inside; it still gave a feeling of peace. Good visit.

A must see in Paris. We had just arrived in Paris & walked up to the Cathedral, just as the bells started pealing to announce Wednesday afternoon mass. Luckliy for us, there wasn't much a queue to get in and we were able to experience the beautiful choir singing prior to mass. The building itself is simply stunning!
impressive atmosphere. There were impressive atmosphere. I reccomend you to take the money commemorative coin for 2 euros. certainly the best example of gothic architecture
Wonderful!. Wonderful cathedral steeped in history, we visited on a Sunday so mass was in, very atmospheric. Shame we did not have time for the tower tour, we will be back!!
A master piece. If you in Paris this is a must see place. A lot of history and great Architectural design. Beautiful paintings.

Lovely experience. The queue went down fast and the added security wasn't a problem (just open your bag). The outside is beautiful and impressive, you have to move right back to be able to get it all in your camera and see it all. The detail is exquisite and inside you can see all sorts of artifacts and treasures. There are photos allowed but no flash (which some ignorant people blatantly ignore). There are places to light candles and also to buy religious books and merchandise (souvenir coin machines too). Really beautiful. We didn't go up to the bell towers or anything as we were content with what we had seen.

Wow o wow . Another must visit when your in Paris. Fantastic experience and also free admission. It's an amazing built and look out for the wooden sculpture depicting the life of christ. It's a life memory for your bucket list
Must see activity. A must see activity. Go inside the church and take photos. Very beautiful. Near other attractions within walking distance.

Great on the Outside. While Notre Dame is an imposing edifice from the outside, it is not as imposing inside (but a must see). It is very long with some very nice side chapels with lovely stain glass windows, but it seems cold and foreboding inside with not much down the long middle aisle. After Labor Day, the line to get in was about 15 minutes and it did seem crowded inside. A walk around the entire building is a must, to see it from all angles as well as from the other side of the Seine where the vendors are. Do not miss the statue of Charles I outside and to the right(when facing the church. Be aware of the ladies with the clipboards asking for a donation. they are pickpockets. Do not give anything as they are looking to see where you keep your money.

Enjoyed the history and significance of Notre Dame. While I enjoyed the history and significance of Notre Dame, I'm sure I am in the minority when I say I wasn't in awe. Primarily because there are larger, more intricate, and ornate cathedrals throughout Europe. It's still a must see but if you've seen others- say the Duomo in Milan for comparison sake focus on ND's history.
Absolutely stunning. One of the most beautiful buildings in France, it has to be a must see when in Paris! Plus there's free entry into the church, what's not to like!
Magnificent Cathedral. This is a truly beautiful cathedral. As a bonus, you can enter and look around for free. The thought and artwork are just astounding. Just gorgeous.

Most see. It is outstanding to see and be there , there is a lot of walking we park the car outside the city and we walk need comfy shoes the weather was perfect not hot but not cold we had such a beautiful day with the family
A must visit place while in Paris. The cathedral is magnanimous and once inside it gives a sens of awe, appreciation and peace. A must visit spot while in Paris

Beautiful . Beautiful extravagant architecture . We didn't opt for the tour but we still learned a fair bit from the exhibits on display .
Security search was friendly and polite . General surroundings of Notrê Damn are also beautiful.

So beautiful and interesting.. This is such a beautiful church. There are several wonderful churches but this is amazing simply due to the fact it was saved from decay by the story of the Hunchback. Interesting history.

The most time I have spent inside a cathedral! . Not being a religious person myself I still found it interesting to visit with the stained glass windows and the history of building laid out in displays. Lots of nice photo opptunities from inside and out! There's a free toilet behind the cathedral and our favourite spot was actually in that park behind the cathedral. Autumn views of, peace, park benches and flowers perfect place to chill out!

Notre Dame cathedral is an architectural master-piece, is simply stunning and is a 'must visit' attraction of Paris!. Notre Dame cathedral is an architectural master-piece, is simply stunning and is a 'must see' if visiting Paris for the first time. You must plan to spend some time looking through the panels, ceiling and other unique works of art inside the cathedral; also, plan to spend time outside and in front of the cathedral entrance enjoying the views; lastly, if you are taking the Seine River Cruise, please do not forget to capture the view of Notre Dame Cathedral from the cruise - you will see a completely different perspective!Now a few tips on planning the visit: Since visiting the cathedral is free of charge, the line tends to be long (though it seems to move pretty quickly) especially as the day progresses by. I suggest visiting the cathedral after breakfast - the church itself is very accessible - it is located in the middle of the city, between two bridges over the river Seine; the cathedral is also surrounded by many cafes, restaurants - it will be easy to grab a bite after spending an hour to two hours in the cathedral.

Amazing a must see in Paris. Norte Dame Cathedral is arguably the second most famous Cathederal in the world. It is a beautiful structure inside and out. It's worth a visit during the day and another at night. This attraction is a must do when in Paris.

History and Art. A must see in Paris! It's worth touring the interior, and if you're in good shape, it's 300 steps up to the tower for a fabulous view of Paris. There is gravitas to this ancient monument. It's unfortunate that it hasn't been better preserved and it is dark inside. Walk around to see the spectacular stained glass windows. Don't forget to walk behind the cathedral, where there's a small park with benches where you can enjoy a lunch and rest your feet. It's also an easy walk over Pont St Louis to the smaller island where there are some good restaurants and shops and a calmer, more residential neighborhood. Good place to get a take-away lunch, espresso or ice cream.

The most beautiful building I've ever seen. Visited Notre Dame Cathedral with my fiance. The line to enter was long but moved very quickly (5min to entrance). Upon entering I was almost brought to tears with the beautiful architecture, art and character of the Cathedral. Definitely a must see if you're ever in Paris.

Stunning! A MUST VISIT!. I am sorry for the delay in writing this review as I was there in August 2015 but wanted to do so anyway...I had the pleasure of staying in an Air BNB ten blocks from the Cathedral so we were able to walk to Notre Dame each morning as we began our adventures. I had wanted to climb the towers but in the summer, the line was so extensive, that alas, I was unable to commit the hours it would have taken to do so. The line was literally a full city block long. I was able to enter the cathedral for an early morning visit and was able to show my children the rose window that is world famous. One cannot visit Paris without a visit to the Cathedral. It looks marvelous as its been cleaned...this is not new but when I was last in Paris in 1986, it looked nothing like it looks now. Seeing the cathedral from a Seine river cruise is also a MUST do! Stunning and a work of art not to be missed!

Visit the Cathedral if possible on a warm day. In the winter it can be cold if you walk on the top.. Stunning, amazing, you can looking left and right. Take good cameras to take pictures in and outside.

stunning. Stunning, breath-taking, jaw-dropping - give yourself plenty of time to stroll about admiring the architecture, the gardens, the Seine. Don't rush your visit to Notre Dame. Leave enough time either side to stroll from Ile de la Cite to Ile St Louis and to explore the lower level riverside walkways. It is a heavenly day out. Take some bread, cheese and a bottle of wine.

Majestic but Overrun. I have been many times but my daughter had not so this was on her list. The lines to enter were long but not as bad as in the past but the line to the top of the cathedral we too long and slow moving so we did not even attempt it. Get there extremely early if you want to do the top.

Notre Dame Cathedral Experience. The architecture of the cathedral is something to see. The murals inside and sculptures are also well worth looking at. The cathedral houses the Crown of Thorns worn of Jesus Christ.

Notre Dame de Paris. It is very beautiful. The craftsmanship is great. It is in the middle of the city, between two romantic bridges, surrounded by cafes, restaurants and a park. There are all sorts of souvenirs to buy nearby. It is free of charge and the line is always on the move, one waits about 15-20 minutes to gt in. To climb to the towers you have to pay, but i don't advice you to go unless you have strong legs because it is a steep ascend. Don't forget to photograph the gargoyles.

Majestic!. I enter this place with an awe such a majestic place at least I never saw one in my life the carving of the woods depicted the story of Jesus just amazing man... words cant be describe it.The only let down is that this place is so crowded you can't really concentrate in praying

Feel the history. Notre Dame is the stuff of legends. Just being in a structure this old is pretty cool. You certainly don't get that in America! The architecture and stained glass are amazing to look at and best of all entrance is free!
Beautiful Church. An absolutely beautiful church, both inside and out. I definitely recommend spending some time here.
World's most known cathedral. The cathedral is gorgeous and the surroundings are full of cheap eats.TIP: don't miss Paris' ground cero mark outside the cathedral.

Exterior is the most impressive part. I was in awe when I saw the outside of Notre Dame. So much history and such beautiful architecture. The gardens in the back are lovely as well. Visiting was, unfortunately, one of the most touristy things we did in Paris. The queue outside to enter the cathedral was long, but moved fairly quickly. There are merchants and beggars that harass the line, so watch your belongings. There was no entrance fee into the main area. I was excited to visit the top lookout of the cathedral, because it is covered by the Paris Museum Pass. Unfortunately, the Museum Pass allows payers to jump queues at each attraction EXCEPT the Notre Dame Tower. We didn't build in the 2+ hour wait that the line would have taken and had to skip it. The interior of the church was beautiful, but looked very similar to many other impressive church interiors I've seen. Every few minutes a loud reminder comes over a loud speaker reminding everyone to be quiet and plays a lot "Shhhh!!!!" noise. It was obnoxious, though it would temporarily quiet the loud tourists. There must be a better way to handle that though. The outside is a must see. The interior is a must see once.

Fascinating architecture. The building architecture and detail are awe inspiring. Magnificence at every turn and direction. Looking up will keep you spell-bound. Some descriptive panels provide some history dating back to the 12 century. Very unique works of art. Entrance is free. Must see. Access to the Towers is a separate entrance line.

Beautiful and Stunning. We love cathedrals and this is one of the stand out ones. Free entry and beautiful stain glass windows. Inside and out it really is a stunning building and a must see. Be warned of beggars who would not leave us alone to start.
Beautiful cathedral!. Notre Dame is a 'must see' if visiting Paris for the first time. Entry is free and there was not a long entry queue when I visited in the morning in early October.

One mansjourney to Paris. The Cathedral is an amazing structure. Do not let the long lines discourage you. It is best in the morning, walked right in. It is a working church, please be respectful of that. There is a fee to walk up to the top, For me, definitely worth it. The Gargoyles should be seen up close.

Gorgeous. Best example of Gothic architecture out there. To me, walking around the outside of the Notre Dame is even better than going inside. I see something new each time. Going inside, be prepared to go through security. If everyone is prepared with bags open and ready, it makes the line more quicker.

Beautiful . Much to my surprise there's no charge to go inside!!
This is a must see on vacation!
Very mesmerizing!
Beautiful stained glass windows , paintings and everything!!
Well organized!

Don't miss it!. I love visiting cathedrals, so this one was a given on my list!Have been here several times before, so this time I could also look away a bit from all the magnificence and splendor and also take some time to sit down and listen to songs and part of the sermon. French language make most things sound better... :)Make sure you take time to look at the historic exposition during the tour around the interior. It's mesmerizing to imagine that it took hundreds of year to get it finished - and to see how the structure went from modest to magnificent during that time!Round your trip off with a stroll around the cathedral, cross the pont and kiss your bride in the middle of it!

B-E-A-UTIFUL - a must visit in Paris. The glass work and the architecture inside the cathedral is worth paying a visit. Tips:1. Entry is free2. Very close to the metro station3. Plenty of souvenir shops nearby4. Public (paid) Toilet available in the vicinity5. Photos not allowed in the inner part of the cathedral6. You can light candles inside (it is free, but a voluntary donation in the boxes kept there is expected)7. The place has timings so please check online before going.8. Close to Louvre museum but quite a distance to walk if you have elderly folks with you9. The hop on hop off busses do stop at this place

Victor Hugo's Notre Dame de Paris live. It was a beautiful Friday afternoon when we decided to visit the Notre Dame. After the several terrorist attacks Paris has much less tourists. So we had not to queuing like the years before. Notre Dame de Paris is one of the most famous gothic cathedral in Europe. The pictures, the sculptures the glass-paintings etc. are impressive. And the stories about and in this place are grandiose. The view on top of the bell tower over Paris is amazing. It's a great symbol of Christianity especially when all the bells are ringing. And such symbols are important in our world of so many terrorist attacks - We didn't forget to light two candles and left the cathedral after several hours, respectfully.
Loved the central part. A remarkable building loaded with history and artifacts. Especially enjoyed the atmosphere in the central praying area

Amazing. Be aware of two entrances. One for the tower which is over 400 steps, steep and winding. The other is for the cathedral which is amazing. It is awesome to stand there and realize that the building is 850 years old and still standing. The cathedral is sooo beautiful. I don't know how the tower is since I couldn't make it to the top!
Beautiful. Free entry! The stain glass windows are just incredible, it's hard to imagine they are hundreds of years old! A must see when visiting Paris!

Give it a miss. Obviously this is one of the most famous landmarks in Paris... So I was disappointed to have a poor experience.A badly organised queue outside wasn’t a good start, especially being harassed by beggars and street merchants while queuing.Then on entering, the sales staff were asking visitors questions about what we wanted to buy. However they were competing with the church wardens who were aggressively (and ironically) shouting at everyone to shush! The two seemed to be deliberately competing with each other which was just plain awkward.I was surprised to read other reviews that it was free entry – everyone was being ushered to the tills on my visit, and everyone was being charged. The audio guides were extra cost and easily the worst I’ve used in years, being incredibly dull. Though the tour itself was pure disappointment with so many roped-off areas, bad lighting, and it being non-stop pushing and shoving all the way around.Considering that at times the tour was verging on preaching, it seemed a contradiction that there were so many places selling candles and tourist gimmicks.I’ve enjoyed several cathedrals but sadly cannot recommend this one. If you're planning a trip to Paris, give this a miss.

Les Miserable popularized this beautiful landmark. Ornate Gothic monument to the upheaval and civil turmoil during the French Revolution. It is worth a visit if only purely from an architecural study of this masterpeice.

Lovely visit. You can tell by the number of people this is a popular place to visit. It is clear that it is a place of worship that continues though the days and years. There was a queue to get in but it went down fairly quick. There are also security checks. A sign of the times
Magnificent. History smiled on Notre Dame. A NOT to be missed site in Paris. Somewhat darker inside than Saint-Chapelle which is close by but just too magnificent to miss while in Paris.

Skip the line - Group tour with Felix. Our guide was very knowledgeable, and provided us with a great bit of history of the Ile de la Cite. The tour throught the Cathedral was respectful and again full of information. Felix spoke terrific english and we enjoyed our time there. Thank you City Wonders UnlimitedSalazars form Los Angeles CA
great place. The cathedral is great inside out, lots of history and architecture is stunning. The entrance is free except if you go to the treasury which has a minimal entrance fee.

Amazing architecture. Long queues but free entry into the church itself, also long queues for entry to the tower where there is a charge. The church itself is spectacular with huge vaulted ceilings and at the same time a peaceful place of worship.
Read the History. I have never gone up into the top it is certainly worth walking around and just admiring the great structure and the history accompanying that structure

A cardio walk to the best view of Paris. Skip your morning exercise and walk the spiral staircase to Notre Dame's roof tops. It may not be the highest view but it's in the heart of the city and open to the feel and vibrant streets below. Get there early.
Awesome Cathedral. A real spectacular and beautiful cathedral, wander around and take in all the beautiful aspects of it, worth the visit!
Such a beautiful church. This is a beautiful church rich in history. If you can take the walk up the towers I would highly recommend it. the views from up there are like no other.
Nice experience. Interesting to visit a very popular place where you can observe the movements of people inside the building, and the different focus of users.

Could spend an entire day there!. Notre Dame is absolutely breath taking! Make sure your battery is charged and take a lot of videos. Take your time and soak up all of the history. Climb to the top....definitely worth the view. The steps are steep and narrow and takes a toll on the legs.
Ah-mazing!. There are no words to describe the beauty of the Cathedral. Pictures do this place no justice. It's something you must see in person.

Beautiful cathedral, beautiful service. Notre Dame is the classic place to visit in France. We walked through the cathedral about 5pm or so. We were lucky enough to catch the beginning of the evening service which we have never seen before. So many things to see in this cathedral

Wonderful and Spiritual! If you have time go up to the top! Do not miss Notre Dame!. The first time we went to Notre Dame was when we went to Paris for New Years and we climbed to the top to see the beautiful views and the Siene River. When we went back for our babymoon we had less time but wanted to make sure we went to Notre Dame. It was Sunday and we were treated to getting to see a mass conducted in French. It was very spiritual and both times we've gone both my wife and myself have been overwhelmed by what we feel in the cathedral. Definitely a must see!

Spectacular . The Cathedral is the biggest I have ever been into. The only reason I gave it a 4 out if 5 is that it is so big, and divided into so many sections, it feels more like a museum as opposed to a church. They were very strict with not allowing anyone in who hadn't paid and whilst I appreciate this to a certain point, I think it needs to be remembered that it is a church, a house of God and a refuge for some.
Fabulous and Amazing. It was pleasure to visit this place.So beautiful and Big it is.Carving and Architecture is just mind blowing.It's very peaceful and place to worship.Regards ,Sunil Gandhi

Beauty at every angle. Such a beautiful cathedral - one of the best in the world. Take out to go inside and be QUIET and enjoy the tranquilly of the setting. Windows are spectacular.Again, make sure to include time for security check points.

A very historic cathedral. The Notre Dame Cathedral, I believe is the head church of the whole of France as well as the city, can be quite dark and gloomy inside and lacking aesthetic decoration or beauty. However, it's free to enter, with even a queue which moved rather quickly. Since my wife is in a wheelchair, we were given priority entry through the exit doors. Much of its interior is wheelchair accessible, but there are steps to the transept, and therefore this part of the church would make access difficult if not impossible for the disabled.

A must see in Paris. The history of this place is astounding. It looked like there was a huge line-up that would take hours but to our surprise the line moved fairly quickly. We only needed to wait about 15 minutes. So don't be discouraged by what appears to be an excessive wait time in a line-up.
Quite a hike but great views!. It was more climbing stairs than I thought but worth the trip to see the skyline and great architecture!

Stunning !!. When we reached here in the evening there was a big queue to enter inside so we had no choice but to see from outside. The cathedral was beautiful piece of architecture. There was a lovely garden in the front where one can sit and enjoy excellent view.

Spectacular!. So lovely! Get there early in the morning (before opening). Do the towers first. Because only so many people can go up at a time and you have to wait for them to come down the wait times can be very long (hours). That being said, it is worth the wait the views are spectacular!

Romantic. Archaic and romantic inside, grandiouse, impressive from outside. Worth doing a Seine cruise to get the best view from the cathedralTo visit the carhedral tower you have to wait a lot and there is no elevator. But recommend.

It is a landmark. I am not into churches and this one had too big of a line. From the outside is a great place to visit and take into the surroundings. Do not forget to see the Baisilica from the other side of the river and visit the gardens in the back.

Worth the lines. This is a great experience. There are 2 lines. One to go into the church and one to go to the top. The church line moves quickly. The other one moves slower but it is well worth the climb.
Absolutely stunning. Luckily we didn't have long to queue but the wait was so worth it. Utterly beautiful. If you go outside of summer, you won't get the crowds. A must see when in Paris.

Stunning!. I was blown away by the size and details of the cathedral. I didn't pay to go up the tower or into the catacombs. It's free to enter and walk in Notre Dame. I liked that they also displayed the history of the classic Paris location.
Wow. You can feel the history. We went on Saturday during evening mass. Was very touched and we really enjoyed it.

Beautiful and free!. This was another must-do. It's close to the Lourve (walking distance) and very close to the Shakespeare & Co book store, so knock em all out at once! Tours are free and there is a box for suggested donations. Holy water available.

Beauty Abound. A breathtaking example of art--especially the back of Notre Dame. Beautiful garden where you can sit and enjoy the view. Many, many, many pigeons that are looking for a croissant, so be careful with food
Absolutely stunning. Notre Dame literally made me catch my breath when I walked in the doors. It is a magnificent building. It was certainly the highlight of my trip to Paris.
Victor Hugo would approve. The views out of the towers are amazing! Sweeping views overlooked by gargoyles! They really add something to the experience

Worth spending some time here. We had a slow walk through the cathedral looking at the architecture and sculptures. It is worth taking your time and taking it all in. The dramatic architecture is the wonderful buttressed walls and the spires. The outside of Notre dame is a view I haven't tired of while being in Paris.There is an excellent view of the church as you come from Ile St Louis and cross through the back garden.

What a beautiful building. Unbelievable architecture. I am just the happiest person on Earth to get to see this magnificent building. There was a line since of course, security, but the visitation is free. This Cathedral is just a dream came true.
Free and Gorgeous. Entry is free so you can't pass up the opportunity to see this site. Absolutely gorgeous and humongous.
Don't miss this. I have visited Notre Dame Cathedral several time in the past, this was my husband's first visit and he really enjoyed this location.
Beautiful. There was a Mass being held when we went round. The singing was lovely. The church is free to enter. The queue was only 5 mins. Bags are searched.
Another don't miss experience. We went as part of a guided Viking River Cruise Tour. Our guide Emilie was simply terrific. If I can figure out how to praise Viking I will do so.

Beautiful!!!. What else can you say about a church that's over 1,000 years old!!! It's crazy cool and amazing when you think about craftsmanship (thinking about the tools of the day to produce this massive cathedral).I would 100% recommend getting a fast pass or private tour up to the top. The line to do this was over 3 hours long...and I didn't get to do it.
Notre Dame. 12.September 2016 . The Notre Dame is a must , if you visit Paris . Even if you have to wait in a Queue , it is very interesting .
Must do free tour. Beautiful architecture, and inspiration to designers and art students. It was one of my favourite destinations in Paris.

Nice architecture. The built was amazing in and out. But be careful with the pick pocketers around. Dont entertain anybody, specially those asking you to sign on a paper to occupy ur both hands, and try to catch ur attention while picking ur stuff at the same time.

Gothic and Gorgeous.. This cathedral is stunning, inside and out. We waited in line, and while the line looked long it moved pretty quickly. While we were there a Mass began, and we were able to enjoy the cathedral while it took place. All but the center area was still fair game. It was interesting to take in the sights while listening to church music and the sounds of prayer. Definitely check out Notre Dame if you can, as it's stunningly beautiful.
Shear Beauty & History. Another tick on the bucket list, you could spend several hours here just taking in the shear size & history here. Well worth a visit while in Paris

This is truly amazing!. This place is almost an aesthetics overload. Its beauty is impossible to capture in pictures -- you simply have to come see it for yourself. Construction was finished in the 1300s, yet it is still so solid and well kept. It is totally free to enter, but there is a section off to the side that costs 5 euros to enter. I did so, and thought it was very worth it. I knew I would love this place, but I did not expect it to be as amazing as it was!
Must See Classic. It is just what you would expect. I was amazed at the details and altars and paintings! I would say this is one of the places you must see when a tourist in Paris!

Try to go during a service. I was lucky enough to go while they were having a service. Even if you are not Catholic (I'm not), it's oddly moving with the combination of French, incense and church Latin. The Cathedral has beautiful art throughout and a statue of Joan of Arc. There is an outstanding bread market outside which is somehow appropriate.

Amazing original gothic architecture. This is what started and created what is now known as gothic architecture. Best photo ops from the square to fit it all in. Didn't go up the bell tower 300+ steps and long lines but inside chose to enter the treasury- highly of the visit. Be in awe
Beautiful . This is well worth a visit if you're in Paris. Really beautiful structure and you'll take some gorgeous photos :)

Amazing!. Have heard so much about Notre Dame and was just overwhelmed to be there and see it in person. Download the Rick Steves Europe podcast to get a great tour of not only historic Paris, but the Notre Dame as well.
Love this place. Can't believe they don't charge to get in. Such an incredible monument. An absolute must for Paris. Don't miss it.

Beautiful. Especially from the outside. This is one of the few free sights in Paris. The line to get in might be discouraging, but it move very quickly. It is free to enter the church, but to go up the tower cot 4 Euros. We have been to the church a few time and choose not to go up the tower on our most recent visit. The tower offers views of the city, however it is located in one of the lowest parts of Paris. I have always found the cathedral more beautiful and interesting from the outside than from the inside. Be sure to walk around the Cathedral and view it from all angles!

Even a short visit is breathtaking. I am not much of a " Watch-old-churches-in-whispering-groups-kind of person. But me and my friend made a quick stop at this remarkable inheritage, waited only 2 minitues in line to enter, no fee and easy to just cruise through and lionize all the amazing cathedral windows and glass art -
Beautiful Cathedral. Notre Dame is worth stopping for an interior visit. It is a beautiful, huge gothic style church. We visited during Mass, so we were not able to see the alter area very well.

Amazing. What is a visit to Paris without visiting Notre Dame Cathedral. Free admission to enter the body of the church, incredible architecture throughout, moderate crowds, security screening as you enter. Once in, able to stroll at leisure within the church. Beautiful.

An amazing cathedral. Despite having been to Paris over 50 times, Notre Dame is a must visit site every time we are in Paris.The stained glass windows alone are worth the visit. I am enthralled by them every time I visit. Of course they are best on a sunny afternoon.The architecture with its flying buttresses is amazing.

One of the great Church of the world. Not to be missed, I enjoyed walking from one chapel to the other, taking my time to admire the incredible work that has been done over centuries. A religious service had just started so I sat in the center of the church and enjoyed moments of peacefulness regardless of the crowds nearby. We took some great photos but the one in my mind is still the best .......wow what would Christmas Eve be like here.....

A 'must see' venue in Paris. Initially I was not that keen to spend time checking out Notre Dame, but I am glad I did. The climb up the spiral stairs (all 388 of them) to the very top was a bit of a struggle, but the sensational views of Paris made it worthwhile. The photo opportunities are endless with so many angles to be captured in all directions. The inside of the cathedral is as fascinating, as you absorb the amazing architecture and significance of the building in relation to the city's history. As you'd expect Notre Dame draws large visitor numbers so a fair bit of patience and tolerance is required, with many tourists interested only in themselves and totally ignoring the directions to remain quiet, remove hats and refrain from flash photography. I am not a religious person, but I did respect people's right to pray in a particular area of the church. Unfortunately far too many tourists just ignored that and barged on through to take photos regardless. You would be missing out if you didn't include a visit to Notre Dame when you are in Paris.

Stunning. There is so much going on here and has been for the past 800 years. I would highly recommend getting a guide. I overheard a guide speaking to a group of people and I learned more in the 5 minutes of eavesdropping than I did during my entire visit just meandering on my own reading signage.
What a beautiful place. The outside of this building is incredible. The history amazing.Sadly due to a long queue and time restraints we did not manage to get inside. next time for sure.

A must when in Paris. It's not just another cathedral, the story behind it is very interesting. Beautiful inside and out, couldn't get to the top the line was to long but walked into the cathedral two separate times with no more than a five minute wait. You can only see so many cathedrals but put in on your list. St Peter's in Vatican City, the duomo in Sienna,Notre Dam, duomo in Florence and St Mark's in Venice have been my favorites.

The height of great architecure. Aside from inconsiderate tourists, this is definitely a great site one must see in Paris. One tip, the outside photographs better from the boats on The Seine. I walked around the entire building and got nice photos, but nothing as full-on revealing of the buttresses as I managed to get from being on the river. My only complaint with this site, as with other churches in Paris was why they don't dust the statues. There was literally six inches of dust on some of the most amazing status in this building, which seems like the Swiffer marketing team needs to step in. The stained glass in this building is something I always wanted to see in person and it did not disappoint. It's a must-see and don't miss the Quasi Modo café down the street, where the staff is young, friendly, and fun and the crepes are budget-friendly and delicious.
Great Cathedral I ever seen. This Cathedral is amazing, very beautiful architecture and for the one who want to pray, this is the place
Visit the Gargoyles at the top!. Loved visiting the top of Notre Dame to see the most photographed Gargoyles in the world! The view is incredible.

Go up the tower. Make sure you go up the tower; which is outside the cathedral to the right. There's no express entry with the museum pass here so you want to make sure you get on the line right away. I'd recommend waiting on line before viewing the inside of the cathedral. (If you don't have the museum pass I believe it's about 12€ to go up). You'll wait on line outside the fence, then inside the fence, then go up some of the stairs where you show your pass or buy a ticket, and can browse some souvenirs. They'll then let you up. They let up groups of 20 people every 10 minutes so this whole process takes about 40 minutes. Once you're up there the views are amazing. You will also see the famous gargoyles! There are two portions of the tower (you can go up even higher once you're up). Definitely worth the wait.

Fantastic View and architecture . Huge queue for entry to the church itself, but it moves really fast. Definitely go up the towers for an amazing view of Paris. Never seen the film like, girlfriend has, but I didn't see a lad with humps bateing round the shop

A must see. Beautiful cathedral, free to enter and top attraction. I've got some amazing photos here and had a great day out with my husband as part of our Paris trip. We got some great food close by and gifts for the kids back home.

Gothic Architecture . Beautiful and massive cathedral with has some modern touches such as security lines, charity machines and an inside street shop that reminds you that even the entrance is free, all donations are kindly welcomed.
Deserves some time to fully understand the place. There are many details and even secrets...

A bit disappointing. I enjoyed the outside more than the inside. Since this is so highly rated I expected more. I thought Sainte Chapelle was more stunning. The line to go inside moves fairly fast...if you want to do the towers you need to line up a second time.

You won't believe what you see!. The Notre Dame Cathedral is free. We didn't wait long but others waiting up to a couple of hours. Once inside, it is an emotional and inspirational experience. You are surrounded by its beauty and history. Take your time to stop and read the plaques on the wall that describes each section. It is worth the visit and wait.

Organ concert. We attended an organ concert one evening with the great French organist Jean Guillou. The concert was great and the only people allowed in the cathedral at the time were those attending the concert, so we got there early and got a much better look at everything.

Notre Dame visit. Went on Wednesday at 0830 with no wait time. Attended mass at 0900 in the choir. This area is closed for tourists and is right under the main altar. I then lined up for the tower at about 0950 and had a very short wait to go up the tower (brilliant) great view of paris the gargoyles and the statues. After this there were big line ups. Glad I went early

More beautiful from the outside, dark inside. One of my favorite sites to visit while traveling is old cathedrals, basilicas, mosques, etc. Notre Dame is a beautiful cathedral and I enjoy the outside views more than the inside, so recommend you take some time to walk around it and see it from both sides of the River Seine. While the line may look long, it generally goes fast. The inside is very nice, although the stained glass is not as impressive as many of cathedrals I've been in, and contributes to a rather dark atmosphere. There was a service in progress while we walked through and it was interesting the see how the worship space was used and how the acoustics sounded. Well worth a couple of hours if you are in Paris.
Visit when it first opens. There will be crowds but if you are there when it opens then you have a wonderful opportunity to really enjoy this spectacular cathedral.

Breathtaking!. I have toured a great many of churches and cathedrals but this is way over the top. It will bring you to tears. If you can RESPECTFULLY tour during a service, the music will blow you away.
Everyone goes here. This is amazing you go back in time here! Enjoy the architecture and the history of this church it's awesome.

Brilliant. Although the queues looked daunting ,they moved quickly and we entered after a short wait.It is incredible, everything I thought it would be and more.Even though there were lots of people around it is still serene and I was able to light candles and say prayers for my loved ones.The stained glass is truly spectacular.This is a place which you must see at least once in your life.

Most Beautiful Sight in the City. The single most beautiful venue in Paris in my opinion. The grounds outside are filled with people from literally all over the world. The setting in the middle of the Seine cannot be beat. It is free to walk inside and I highly recommend that you do. It is gorgeous.
Beautiful. Absolutely stunning interior of this very historic iconic of attraction in Paris. Can been seen from the river however, worth the trip to see inside.

Must do Paris site. Another cathedral with Victor Hugo drama. Security line moves fast but is as ineffective with some guy poking finger into your bag. Profilers at inside entrance we guessed.
Dark, dramatic a good review to watching the Hunchback of Notre Dame.
Can accept mercenary machines spitting out coins for 2 euros as souvenirs and pricey votive candles.

Nice old church. Located on the heart of the original Paris. The most historic part of the city. It is a nice cathedral with nice stained glass windows, but St. Chapelle's are better. Religion played an important part in people's lives back then. This gives you an idea how important it was.
Beautiful . Best cathedral I've been to. Breath taking. Better than Rome and well worth a visit. Short queue to get in as they bag searched but worth it
A Great View. This a great place to visit. One can tour the cathedral or just enjoy the beauty from outside. Nice views of the cathedral at night.
A must see. The bas reliefs in the apse have been restored and now are fully viewable. A notable thing to see. And of course, the cathedral is famous for its stained glass windows.
Beautiful Church in Paris. We have been to Paris 6 times and have never missed a visit to Notre Dame. It is one of the oldest churches in Paris and is still standing!

Notre Dame. Beautiful cathedral. Well worth queueing up to go inside. No entry charge. There are Mass and Confession on at certain times if that is something you want to do while you are there. You can also go up to the South Tower for a fantastic view but there is a separate queue for that .

Gorgeous inside and out- climb to the roof. I've seen a number of beautiful cathedrals, but there's a reason Notre Dame is THE CATHEDRAL in our collective imagination. The lines ebb and flow - i walked right in but also saw long long lines at other times. Free to enter the cathedral, pay to climb up to the roof (from a separate entrance). You should do both. And bring a camera.

Iconic . Another Iconic attraction. I found the outside structure and art work to be more beautiful and interesting than the inside. It is a beautiful cathedral with an amazing history. There was a security check, of course, but no fee to go inside. Mass was in progress so that was special. You can sit and participate if you'd like. The line to enter the cathedral was very long but moved very quickly so don't be discouraged. Restrooms are outside to the right facing the entry (downstairs) and cost .80€.

Go here by night!. I have never been inside the cathedral but looking at it from the outside is amazing enough! There are many beautiful details. Even though it is nice in daylight you should definitely go here in the evening when it's beautifully lit up! If you take one of the guided tours on the Seine you will also get a nice view of the cathedral from many angles.
Good. Cathedral is good inside and also outside, one of the place that I can relax, just need to pay attention to the gypsy around but for other is the best place that I see in Paris in that trip

Beautiful arcitecture.. This was worth the wait in line (which moved surprisingly quick). I was irritated and shocked at the disrespect of tourists. There was a request for silence and no flashes on cameras. So please try and be respectful.

Impressive and worth a short visit. While not as impressive as the near by Sainte-Chappelle, Notre Dame is worth a visit. The interior is especially impressive considering the age though the crowds make it difficult to really take it all in. We enjoyed going up the towers. Another great use of the Museum Pass!

Great, but Go Early to Avoid the Rush!! Climb the Towers!. As is true with all these big tourist destinations, go early if you want to avoid the tour groups! The tour groups dominate these major places starting between 10-11am so get out of bed and hit a big place right off the bat then fill in the rest of the day with the still amazing but lesser known sites. Then do the same thing the next day. Notre Dame was incredible, but also dark. If you have been in many big Buddhist temples, this is what that felt like only European. The architecture and art is incredible. I would say the best part was climbing the towers and seeing the upper parts of outside of the building up closer. Also it gives stunning views of Paris much like the Eiffel Tower or the Arc de Triumph.

Lovely and so much detail.. Very beautiful and free to go inside. Cost of only if you want to go to the top but it's worth it. Between here several times and always see something new. Lots of crowds outside so watch your pockets but good police presence as well.

Worth the climb.......... I climbed Notre Dame Cathedral on my first trip to Paris 36 years ago, and I did it again last week. Nothing compares to looking out over the Paris skyline with a gargoyle. I took the exact same picture both times. It's iconic, a must do when in Paris. We waited about an hour in line for the privilege, but once you're up there, it's worth it. You have plenty of time to enjoy the scenery with only a handful of other tourists.

Impeccable . Immaculate and stunning sculptures.. really represents hard work and divinity .. i was really mesmerize by how they built and made those sculptures in every part of the building really amazing .
Amazing!. What a wonderful monument to represent the history of such a beautiful country! Don't leave Paris without visiting this amazing Church first!
Spectacular. Amazing to see in person. Highly recommended stop on a trip to Paris. The shear size and architecture are spectacular, especially considering when the Cathedral was constructed.

Most notable monument . Very symbolic French Gothic architecture, but also influenced by the times during the construction (Renaissance, Naturalism); it has a unique and fascinating beauty through its architecture, painting and strengths.

The detail on the building is amazing. The sheer detail on the outside of the building will leave you gob smacked even if you don't take the time to visit the inside. My husband was especially taken (Not) with the Pope Medal slot machine inside.. lol

A beautiful cathedral. Free. A long queue to get in but this moved surprisingly quickly so don't be disheartened. Would be worth reading up about the facade and interior before you go so that you make the most out of your visit.If you get the opportunity and have a Paris Museum Pass visit the crypt opposite which is quite interesting and definitely the Notre Dame tower. The queue for the tower was very long, even early in the day, and very very slow moving. However it was worth the wait. The climb can be quite arduous but the views are amazing. Stop at the top to hear the bells chime. Views better than from the Eiffel Tower. Remember if you have a Paris Museum Pass you do not have priority to jump the queue.

Awe inspiring. If you go around to the left hand side of the cathederal you can walk up to the top of the cathederal with great views over Paris.A tip is to line up about 20 minutes before the opening of the gate at 10pm to the top as only a few people are allowed up at a time.

Busy world class site with long line ups.. Beautiful,packed with history cathedral, a must see with a guide, security appeared a bit of a joke though. Washroom access is again a real issue. Combine visiting this site with other local attractions, a fair bit of walking is involved.

Notre Dame...you can almost feel the Hunchback of Notre Dame in the walls. There are Cathedrals throughout Paris and in little towns surrounding Paris but nothing as grand or spectacular as the Notre Dame Cathedral. You can walk up and almost touch the gargoyle's as you look over the city or you can stand inside and take in the history and magic of the past. Either way you visit it is time well spent.

Not Even Catholic, but Mesmerized by Vespers. Have had the opportunity to visit the cathedral each short visit to Paris, but this time we have rented an apartment and staying for a month, which led us to discovering jewels that had never presented to us before. One being - early evening on Sundays is Vespers, and you can go inside and sit with in the roped area. The music and liturgy were expressed more beautifully as the acoustics are superb. One does not have to be Catholic to feel the essence of what the message means. One does not have to be religious to give or light a candle for someone dear to you having difficulties. It is truly a time of reflection.
Nice historical church. Beautiful historical church that shows authenticity. Antique work on the walls and windows. Also took part in the prayers.
Peacefull. This is a place where you get surprised by how beautiful it is, must see and get to know it well with a small tour.

The Notre Dame Cathedral with its sculptures and stained glass windows show the heavy influence of naturalism, unlike th. The Notre Dame Cathedral Paris or Notre Dame de Paris (Meaning 'Our Lady of Paris' in French) is a Gothic cathedral located in the fourth arrondissement of Paris, France, It has its main entrance to the west. The island is on the eastern half of the Île de la Cité.

All churched out!. We had visited so many churches we were getting church fatigue! This cathedral re energized us. It is so beautiful and grand. We didn't realize how large it was. It felt like we walked miles. The arches ,carvings and stained glass are magnificent. To realize how long ago this was built is awesome.
Again there was a large security presence.

Beautiful. Words cannot explain how awe-inspiring the place is. Would have liked to stay longer to see it all. There was a mass going on when we were there and although it was not in English it was terrific to witness.
Nice. I just been here today. It looks very nice from the outside. I didn't have time to get inside. Will visit it again
Not to be missed. C'mon. It's Notre Dame! No visit to Paris would be complete without seeing this. Climb the tower for fantastic views of Paris.

Must See. Took a Paris city tour which finished at Notre Dame cathedral. It was my second time to Paris but first to visit the cathedral. It is magnificent and for sure a must see. Although there was a bit of a line to get in, it moved quickly and once inside you could take you time enjoying.
Overwhelming!. This is an inspiring place! Take time to just sit and meditate on the faith of those who took the time and effort to build this magnificent church to God!

Breathtaking !. This gothic church should be the first place to visit when in Paris because it is simply majestic! What I liked the most is the fact that it is not a museum and people still pray there, thus I was lucky to attend a mass in French.

Cuing required. There always seems to be a cue. We got there early the cue was twice as long when we came out. The inside is beautiful but could do with a good dust. We paid to see the plate which was really beautiful. Learnt about Saint Denis which was interesting to us as my husband is called Denis. Advice would be go early to avoid the crowd and enjoy the peace and beauty
Historical but disappointed in it condition . This is a beautiful architectural building, but the interior is in much need of repair and cleaning.

Stunning. Beautiful, awe-inspiring and a feast for the eyes. Don't miss it. it was free to visit the main part of the cathedral. It is situated in the beautiful Latin Quarter. The stain glass windows and gothic architecture are stunning.

Special something about it. We went twice to the cathedral while in Paris. There is just something about it . If cathedrals were built to inspire awe, it sure works, even for a modern athiest, I am awe inspired.

Visited cathedral 1st time ever in life. Nice place. Standing at the very heart of the city, Notre Dame is an iconic cathedral and a staple entry on any list of what to see in Paris. With its looming ceilings and magnificent stained-glass windows, it's a wonderful place to visit. Its fame and location leave it slightly over-glorified, but it's genuinely impressive all the same. Entry is free to the cathedral. there is a entry fee of 15 Euros if you want to go to the top of cathedral.

Attended mass on Sunday!. This is the ultimate Sunday mass service! Don't have to wait in the line, just walk up and tell them you're there to attend mass. We went to the 11:30 jams service and it was outstanding. Really unbelievable that there were people trying to take pictures in mass (that were asked by ushers to stop or leave...) and such chaos going on around the mass service but it was peaceful!Great choir and organ! Program had English version of readings and gospel.
It's Notre Dame!. Amazing cathedral but dark on cloudy days, the architecture is stunning, the artifacts and icons surprising and the art only fades in comparison to the Louvre
Stunning Cathedral. Long an icon of Paris, this magnificent church delivers powerful aesthetic and spiritual rewards. Go early to avoid the crowds.
Amazing Cathedral. Can't believe people taking photos in a religious place when asked not too and during a service as well, disgusted with the behaviour

So impressive!. We arrived around 1pm and found about a 10 minute line to walk through security. Based on other people's reviews about wait times, it sounds like we might have gotten lucky with that. Anyway, the cathedral is so impressive and with a good audio tour, it comes to life even more (we used the Rick Steves audio tour)! We especially loved the displays inside that show the step-by-step expansions and improvements that have happened over the years.

Amazing Gothic cathedral. I am not religious but I am definitely a fan of Gothic architecture and would recommend anyone visit Notre Dame. It's an impressive building with a rich history. There is no admission fee. You can pick up an audio guide for around 5 euro - I didn't get one so can't comment on how useful it is. I climbed the tower but I was there early in the morning so didn't encounter the crowds some of the other reviewers mentioned. I wouldn't recommend it if you're unfit but the views are magical. Services are still held in there so just be quiet / respectful during your visit. I think they like it if your shoulders and knees are covered too.

Amazing architecture. We sat on the square in front of the building, just admirering it and the people passing by. Then we took a stroll around the building just to appreciate the architecture and the incredible detail in the ornamentation. Come here on a sunny day and enjoy the outdoors.
Amazing. Wow what an amazing church. Everything about it is just amazing. It is one of the most beautiful church I ever been too. A must see when you in Paris
Notre Dame Cathedral. Notre Dame is absolutely beautiful! This is a must-see if you are visiting in Paris. Check it out, you won't be sorry.

Pretty. What you'd expect. It was nice. Probably a lot nicer if you're Catholic, though you don't have to be a believer to appreciate the art. The flying buttresses were something I'd only read about in school, so to see them in person was neat.

Can't imagine Paris Visit w/o Notre Dame. A tour of French cathedrals starts with Notre Dame and ends with Rheims if you want to traverse the evolution (and competition) of French Gothic architecture, but no visit to Paris could be complete without a visit to Notre Dame. With a pavement medallion in front establishing the point from which all distances in France are measured, you can see the grandeurs and vistas that led to the writing of the "Hunchback of Notre Dame. "

A Paris landmark with free entry. Of course, the Notre Dame is a must see. I love the exterior. I thought the interior of the Sainte-Chapelle was more beautiful. We did not pay to go to the top- there was a long line. We already saw an overview of the city when we went to the Eiffel Tower and we felt we saw the gargoyles clearly from walking the perimeter. I appreciate that there was not cost to go inside. I enjoyed the little park behind the cathedral. It was a nice place to stop and relax. There is also a public restroom there.
Amazing!. Such a beautiful church, it is so amazing that something that big was built so long ago. We really enjoyed the info posters on how it was constructed. This is def. a must see!

Wonderful architecture. Wonderful architecture and nice inside as well. This was my favorite in Paris:)Great place to visit. There was long waiting queue but it is going fast so you don't have to wait for hours.
Beautiful . The architecture is absolutely breathtaking. We were there for 3/4 hour after queuing for 3/4 hour but it was beautiful!

Another Gothic Church. This visit was part of a Group Tour and would not have been our first choice normally as we have visited many fine Gothic ---and Otherwise----churches throughout Europe. Our guide even noted that this is certainly not the finest example of Gothic Church in France. But, because this is Paris and ND is considered iconic, expect large crowds.
You have to see it. It is impressive, and very busy, so go early morning to avoid the crowds. Great views if you approach from the riverside walks.

Largest cathedral that we have ever visited.. We visited during Sunday morning mass that begins at 11:00 every Sunday so we had to walk around the pews and altar in near silence because there are workers that will tell people to keep their voices down if they are talking too loudly. This place is enormous and it took about half an hour to walk all the way around the building. We did stop at the candles because Faridas' sister is a practicing Catholic so she wanted to light a candle. We also stopped in one of the enclaves to the right of the hall corridor where everybody is passing because we saw a little boy kneeling in prayer. This enclave had a very beautiful depiction of crucified Jesus looking down on the pews and kneeling platforms. The ceiling does not have elaborate murals painted on them as can be seen in very many churches and cathedrals throughout Latin America but we would not be able to see them very well anyway because The ceilings of Notre Dame are real, soaring structures; really high. To see everything,one really does have to drop out of the line of visitors and sit in various places. We sat in two places and spent about five minutes at the candle station so we were able to take in quite a lot. This place is a must see in Paris and it is free to enter. It does cost money to take the stairwell to the higher levels where the gargoyles are and we did not go up there because the line was very long and we had taken so many steps up Arc de Triumph, throughout the Paris metro, and to reach the Basilica Sant Coere.

Get to the top. I love the majesty of Notre Dame. It is a truly beautiful creation. This time we were able to go up the towers and see the bells plus a gorgeous Paris view. The stairs are tight and many, but it is well worth the effort. The tour is well orchestrated so there are not crowds up the top. It felt so peaceful looking over Paris. I would recommend getting there at least 30mins before opening if you don't enjoy queuing.

So majestic. Not a long queue to get into the Cathedral, but longer if you wanted to visit the catacombs. The cathedral is stunning, but the crowds inside make it very difficult to get a good appreciation of the interior. Still very beautiful and for something that is over 850 years old, it is very majestic.

A must see in Paris. The Cathedral is beautiful inside and out. If you want an experience of a lifetime climb the stairs to Tower. The views from the tower are breath taking. It is the only way to get up close to the gargoyles. I recommend that you get in line for the Tower an hour before opening. They only let up about 20 people at a time and the line gets very long after opening. But the experience if worth the wait.
Peaceful and beautiful. This is a must-do for your first trip to Paris. The line looks long, but it really moves very fast. Entry is free.

Go Early For Best Light and No Crowds!. I've visited this cathedral many times, and my favorite time is in the morning before the tourist are out in droves and the light that filters through the stained glass rosettes looks dreamlike. I am never disappointed when I visit, and love the feeling of walking in the footsteps of history. This is a must see historical treasure!
Massive. France is filled with Gothic cathedrals and this in one of the most impressive. But be prepared to stand in line and have your bag checked before entering.

Kind of dull. The cathedral itself is amazing but at our time of visit the rooftop was closed so we had no way to climb to the top. Since the top was closed from 10 am to 3 pm and we came at 11 am we didn't want to linger around for too long either.

Beautiful building. A beautiful building but despite being there quite early in the morning the queues were horrendous to get inside and we ended up after a huge wait giving up.The surrounding gardens are a lovely place to walk and to picnic with a lovely vista of trees for shade.Big downside was the lack of a disabled toilet. The only toilets were down two flights of steep slippery stairs which considering the length of the queues made our visit very hard.

Amazing Architecture. If you love history and grandeur this is a must see site. It is amazing to look consider the history of this building and the detail and effort that went into its construction. Not being a church going person I am still amazed by the grandeur and beauty of the building.

Climb up and be rewarded with a nice view of Paris. For just 10 Euros, you can climb the steep stairs to the top of the Notre Dame Cathedral. It can be a very tiring climb because the stairs are narrow - if you stop then the people behind you cannot continue climbing. However, at the very end of this is a beautiful view of Paris, including a scenic view of The Eiffel Tower, and have the gargoyle right next to you. It was late afternoon and the sunset view was wonderful. Climb a bit further and you will see the church bell up close, too.

Wonderful architecture. Great place to visit. Go early as lines can be long and summer. The hike up the stairs can be hard for those not in shape. Also, very tight so those with claustrophobia should avoid and stay on the ground.

Gothic Greatness. This cathedral dominates the area and you really get a sense of what an important centre it's been throughout history. The outside is just as interesting as the inside. We did not climb the stairs to the bell tower as this was at the end of our trip and we were out of energy. The gargoyles were impressive and the history inside just doesn't get any richer. Plus, if you go with kids pay the guys outside who feed the They got a bird to land on our 8 year-olds head. He'll remember that forever.

Impressive Architecture . This is an inhuman feat of architecture! I loved the back of the cathedral more than the front. I could sit in the little garden and admire the arches and gargoyles and manicured lawn all day. So peaceful. Made me envy the monks that lived there back in the day. The front of the cathedral is iconic but the back is what everyone needs to see.
City break . Stunning is all I can say really , plenty to see and do, the queues to go in were not to long but took a little while because of all the security but it was sunny so was ok .

Magnificent!. We attended Gregorian Mass on Sunday morning. It was an amazing experience. The singing was delightful. Quite a throwback to my childhood when mass was still celebrated in Latin. We did not experience any lineup and the church was not very crowded at this time of day. Wonderful stained glass and art works throughout. Do pay the extra for the "Treasures" area, many really outstanding pieces displayed here.

Just Wonderful!. I've been wanting to see this place for years and finally got the chance. I was not disappointed. There is something other-worldly about it and the history is so interesting. The windows are beautiful and you've got to love the gargoyles outside. This is very worth your time!

Spectacular stained glass . Even if they charged to get in ( which they don't ) it would be worth seeing this gorgeous cathedral and its stained glass windows. It's fully functional with people praying and lighting candles. There's choir music playing. The detraction was the gift store which seemed out of place toward the back but I suppose if it supports the operation I'm fine with it. Go outside and around the corner to queue up to go up and see the bell and gargoyles.

An experience not to be missed. We visited this beautiful church on Sunday and attended the 10 am Mass which was sung in the Gregorian chant. Do take the time to walk around this church both inside and outside as there is lots to see in the building. If you have the time it's also worth a visit at night to see it lit up.

Beautiful building. Fabulous building with beautiful windows and a real sense of serenity. It is difficult to keep to the silence rule since the surroundings are so lovely, you just want to talk to your companion about it.
Wow ! . Had read plenty but the books do not to it justice - an incredible piece of architecture built over 200 years. Just amazing. :)

Amazing views of the city. The Church is worth seeing though not the most amazing of churches in Europe. What is amazing is the view of Paris from the top However, LINES are long!!! We waited 1.5 hours to climb to the top! Stairs are winding and narrow and 400+ of them so it is not for the faint of heart or those out of shape. Great views of the city

Enjoyed. We were impressed by the magnitude of the building,the fact that it was build with such detailes and great precise.We also enjoyed sitting in the square and in the kids could play in the park

Awe-inspiring architecture.. I am not religious but I do like a fine historical building and this famous landmark does not disappoint. You do have to remember it is a consecrated place of worship and there are plenty of widely-ignored signs calling for silence and not to use flash photography (though non-flash photography is permitted). The near silence was ruined a little by a very loud PA system reminding everyone to be silent!The large airy building is very impressive and an audio guide is available for €5 each, which is worthwhile. It is a pen, which you place on the number on a printed plan of the church and starts the guide. The security situation at the moment means bags are checked on the way in, which slows entry a little. As there is no charge to enter you would be able to walk straight in otherwise.
Stunning. This cathedral is a must see while in Paris. Just stunning and beautiful. Close to other attractions in Paris and can get there and visit on Hop on/Hop off which is what we did.
Gorgeous!. Visited twice and loved both times! Gorgeous architecture! A bit too crowded during the day, so... not so easy to get good pictures, but... totally understandable

Take your time!. The Cathedral is everything you expect. Our most pleasant surprize was taking time to walk outside and to the back of the church. There is a quiet garden and the best view of the flying buttresses (in our opinion).

history personfied in an architectural/religious iconic building. One cannot but hear the voices of one of literatures great books echoing in your mind ,Assuming of course you are familiar with Hugos' classic story.

magnificent. easily walkable from the louvre along the banks of the seine, notre dame is in the perfect location, very busy around this area but lots of space to have a look around, well worth a visit

Magnificent. Spectacular from the outside in a prominent position and can be viewed from all angles, but to go inside is something else again.Quite dark, but majestic with the lighting and the height of the ceiling, imposing pillars exposing all the antiquity. One does need to line up in summer.

Historical Masterpiece. No matter what your religion, this is another of the Paris attractions that must be seen and visited inside and out. It s not the most ornate of Catholic Churches in the world but it is probably recognized most next to the Vatican. Be sure to walk to the top for another wonderful view of Paris. The entrance for the walk up is located on the front left side as you look at the front of the church. Be sure to view the back of the church to marvel at the architecture. Easy to reach via subway or bus.

A Perfect Beauty!!!. Beautiful where ever you view it - whether from the front, sides or even at the back of the cathedral! At the back is a park that offers benches and free wifi.On the other hand, it was nice to see gendarmes patrolling all over the place for everyone's safety.Would definitely come back to see the towers as it was closed to the public during our visit.
Good history. As part of don't miss in Paris, the Norte dame was really a nice experience, there was an option to visit the tower but was crowd of people....

Mind boggling architecture!. If you go to Paris and not see Notre Dame , its a big miss! This is a very very old and historic cathedral with a breathtaking architecture from outside , inside and from every angle. It has a very peaceful and sacred feel to it. Just sit inside for a while and u'll love it. Also read about its history, and how the entire structure evolved over the years. Thereafter , go to the park outside and take a feel of the magnificent french parks overlooking Notre Dame and the Sienne river . Go to Ile Saint Louis and spend time at the bridge with live music and shows , grab a Berthillon icecream and sit by the river side to get the most romantic view and feel of your life. Such an artistic place.You should love it!
