Beautiful from the outside. The cathedral is really huge and beutiful. You can not get enough of it. But on the inside, for me is just a little bit boring. But if you love churches, it will probably not disappoint you.
Must see. Extraordinary. Be sure to walk all around it, including the nice park behind it. The buildings itself is incredible, pay attention to the architectural details.

Amazing stained glass. beautiful building from the exterior. stunning interior with sunlight coming through the incredible stained glass windows. There is an area set out to explain the construction and history of the cathedral.

Spectacular Rose Windows. Agree with everyone that it is indeed a beautiful place and a beautiful church. The rose windows are especially impressive.But my personal favorite is still Reim’s Cathedral – Comparatively, Notre-dame Paris is much smaller and its exterior less elaborately embellished. It’s also more commercial – It charges you for a leaflet, an audio tour or for seeing its treasures. There’re also visible reminders to encourage donations at multiple places.This said, if you only have time for Paris, Notre Dame is still where you should go. Some tips for your visit:• There’re 2 queues. You go into the cathedral via the front entrance. It’s free. The queue is due to the bottleneck of security check and it moves fairly quickly. The queue on the other side (facing a café) is for going up the tower. It costs 10 Euro and they allow only a small group to enter at a time. I waited for ~45 min for my turn. And, be prepared to climb – have to go up about 5 floors just to reach the ticketing office. Then, it’s about another 5 floors up to see the towers. All the staircases are narrow spirals, which allow only one person to go in one direction at a time. So do wear comfortable shoes.• Also plan some time to stroll around the cathedral from the outside. There’s a small garden at the back and part of the promenade is along the river bank. You can walk to the quay to get a closer look at the Seine. Along the way, there're some good angles to take picture of the exterior of the church.• There’s a paid toilet at the garden. Or, if you get to the Palais de Justice (~5 min’s walk), you can use the toilets there for free. I quite enjoyed seeing the important-looking lawyers all dressed up and walking up & down the place. So, a nice stop-by

A masterpiece!. We took a guided tour through the Cathedral which really helped open our eyes. Unfortunately we didn't have time to stay for mass (next time!) but is such an amazing symbol of Paris. Lines were long for the walk up the Towers but after going up the Eiffel Tower we were not too disappointed. A must!

Be Prepared. There is no adverse criticism to be leveled at this extraordinary remnant of medieval religious fervor and architectural innovation. It is up to the visitor to appreciate beforehand what is offered. The visitor should read about the rose windows, the colors, the statues but select just one thing to draw in on as his special person or place, and be patient when other visitors keep getting in the way. Every one else wants to see it too. If time allows, plan a second visit because it is just too much to absorb in one viewing.
Birthday . If you've never been. You have to go. It just amazing. Despite the high security. It's just beautiful when you finally get in. It's a must see attraction if you're in Paris definitely

A must-see when in Paris. Everybody has heard of it. Everybody should see it. The lines are long, there are crowds, and pickpockets. But Notre Dame should be visited. The stained glass windows are lovely. The lady chapels are interesting in themselves. And if you have the time, climb to the top of the cathedral. The views of the city are wonderful. You can check out the gargoyles eye to eye!

Awesome!. I was lucky to arrive during a service with lovely singing and an amazing atmosphere. I loved the Mary chapel and the beautiful statues and pictures of Mary. Awesome stain glass and awe-inspiring architecture!
Awesome history. I really enjoyed walking through the Cathedral Sunday morning, enjoying the music of the service and at the same time learning about the history of the cathedral through 3d dioramas.

Not religious but a great building and a Paris must do. I am in ore of the builders of these great buildings especially as they were building this over 800 years ago!we went on Sunday late afternoon and accidentally arrived at the start of a mass - lots of priests, incense, organ music, chiors and hymns - it really gave me an understanding of how the whole thing worked and whilst I am a non-believer myself it gave me a respect for all of those who do believe

Awesome!. The Parisian cathedrals are overwhelming. The ceilings are a zillion feet high, the the aura is one of timelessness. People we actually giving confessions. Jesus' crown of thorn was there.....chilling.

Quite a sight!. Really enjoyed spending time with a guide here.Learned so many details with regard to the exterior as well as the interior.Ranks right up with some of the best cathedrals in the world.
a MUST see. And don't miss the "flying buttresses", one of the best reasons to come to Paris in the first place.
Must-see in Paris. Please, check the website. they offer free excursions in many languages around the Cathedral. Great thing, I think!
Enjoyed from the outside. I sat in the gardens and read a book and ate macarons and watched the art students paint. It was a great experience

Looking for a belkeinger. Paris in the spring would easily be a top choice for many people and whether you are religious or not Notre Dame Cathedral is somewhere you must see. The style, architecture and fittings are stunning. The history of Notre Dame is a part of the very essence of France.
A Total Must see. Get there early or get there just on closing time you only need 25 minutes inside but the crowd to get in during peak times are long.
Hunchback of Notre Dame. Beautiful and amazing place! Free on Sundays, and the lines moves fast. Very worthwhile to see the most visited attraction in Europe.
Beautiful area. This must visit if you go to Paris. I went there t 9pm and short queue to climb. The tour is worth. I guess sunset was amazing from there
Incredible . If your in the area or within half hour driving distance, this is a must! A breathtaking work of art

Must See - Get There Early!. The hunchback may not be real, but the beauty of the Notre Dame surely is. Another must-see in Paris, but be sure to go early in the day as there is always a long line that develops. Beautiful gardens on the east side. Although not the highest point in the city, there is also ability to go to the upper part of the church for a nice view.

Nice Sunday stroll. We visited this place on a Sunday afternoon. The line was fairly short. It took less than 5 minutes get in. It's a beautiful building, with so many intricate details that can take hours and hours to truly appreciate the labor and workmanship that went into building this magnificent cathedral.The only thing that I wished it didn't have was the endless ways the church is asking visitors to contribute financially either through donation or purchasing products or tour guides. It kind of diminishes the spirituality of the cathedral and commercializes its purpose.

Excellent. My favourite place in Paris...This building has everything...the history, the stunning architecture and designs of the statues, the towers, doors and the inside is beautiful too...Very popular area with tourists Also rife with beggars/pickpockets so be careful with your things as we had quite a few beggars come up to look for money and also children looking for signatures (distractions whilst they pickpocket...)Apart from that it was a lovely place to be day and nightOur last day, I took my nephew in with me to view the inside. We had to queue outside and wait approx 5 mins (it's a very popular attraction so if you want to go in...get there early when it's quieter)Went through security who checked handbags etc and went in to look around...if you wish to go in and pray you can do so but 99% of people going in are there to look around...You can go upstairs to the top but I'm not a fan of heights so passed on that...instead had a look aroundIt is a beautiful building inside and outHighly recommend visiting the Notre Dame - it's free (which is compared to some other places around Paris and donations are welcome) 5 stars (only downside as before is the long queues and the beggars/pickpockets hanging around)Metro stations nearby, boat stops nearby, bus tour stops nearby (hop on hop off buses) so is easy to get there and around Paris if need be...

The Grand Old Lady. The Beautiful Iconic monument of Paris. I walked up the Seine and saw her afar off, wow, she just drew me in. The crowds were great, people from all over the world coming to see this gem. Entrance is free, to walk around inside but there is extra charge and lone lines for the roof. 5 euro to see the church treasury. Every time I went in mass was going on which is cool, it was in French. Loved it, Loved it, Loved it! Please beware of the petition girls, they are gypsy pickpockets!

Spectacular Church. This church and the Chartres church were quite impressive structures inside and out. The view of the outside of this church from Montparnasse Tower is impressive. It is hard to see the whole outside without going to a tall vantage point.

Beautiful both Day and Night. I have been inside Notre Dame Cathedral at least ten (10) times and never get tired of its timeless beauty. This trip I booked an apartment very close to it with a balcony looking at the face of the Cathedral; we spent six (6) consecutive nights eating dinner on this balcony while looking at the illuminated Cathedral while drinking good French Vin Rouge. First thing we saw in the morning, last thing we saw at night. Magnificent!
Good. The architecture is immaculate.It is good to check out the mass time and plan accordingly. It is free but the museum needs a payment.

Beyond words. Wow, jaw dropping Go early and take your time to walk through this extremely beautiful building. If you can be around for the noon bells, beyond words and must be experienced. Many scammers out the front, be on guard and say no.

Nice place to visit. Entry is free. We lined up to enter and the line moved reasonably quickly. You do pass through security before entering. Was lucky enough to be there during a service and the music was so lovely. You are able to light candles (with varying costs). There are also memento coins available for 2 euros. There is a small gift shop at the exit. Audio guides are available at the entry for a small fee. Was busy during our visit however crowd moved through at a good pace.

It's free to get in. the cathedral is free to enter and has gift shops. There are lines and tickets to be purchased to go the 325 steps to the gargoyles and bells. I took a front of the line tour which was worth it. The lines are long and they only let 20 people in at at time.

Amazing. I grew up Jewish but have gone to more churches in the past few years than I have been in temples my whole life. This church was stunning and has so much history. Did not have to wait in a line and no charge to get in

Beautiful. The line is quite long outside but it does move very quickly, so dont worry. Admission is free and they are open every day. If you plan on climbing the tower there is a charge for that and you must go early to beat the long lines.

Beautiful. Well worth going inside this beautiful cathedral. Photos are allowed and no charge to take a look around. There is a charge to see other parts of this lovely building with great views along the Seine. Don't be put off by the queue to get in, it moves very quickly and once inside take your time look up and be amazed. There was a service whilst we visited which only added to our experience, because of the service small areas was roped off but this did not affect the visit as everything was still within sight. Light a candle for a fee. Sit and reflect. Take your time.

A Masterpiece . Please do not miss a chance to see this Cathedral. Enter the doors on the right facing the Cathedral. Then follow the tourists around the main altar and along the left side of the nave. Be sure to stop and admire the wood carvings on the outside wall of the choir area. After seeing the Cathedral be sure to stroll around to the gardens on the backside. You will get a great view of the flying buttresses that support the walls. No fee is charged for the Cathedral but a small fee is charged to see the Treasury.

Don't be afraid of line.... I heard that Notre Dame was the monument that received more visits every year ... it is truly a very beautiful cathedral outside and inside, it is free, and if there is a huge line to go in it moved very fast and you will get in maximum 15 minutes. Inside don't miss the beautiful vitraux and check program because you might enjoy organ or chorus concerto which are amazing

Beautiful. Notre Dame is a beautiful cathedral and definitely worth visiting even if you're not religious! It's beautiful outside and inside and it's free to go in! Light a candle and pray for someone, walk around and take in the peaceful atmosphere and read about Notre Dame's history.
Definitely worth seeing while you're in Paris!
Amazing feeling. I was amazed when I got in. The architecture is incredible and the feeling and connection to God is impressive

Historical Must See. Everyone who visits Paris should visit Norte-Dame. The stained glass windows and architecture are breathtaking along with the historical information you gain. This should be a family destination while in Paris.
Very interesting place. Nice grand church either lot of paintings on windows, ceiling. candle lighting is good expierience. exibition of gold artfacts are interesting
Go early. We got there as soon as it opened and walked right in. Mass was going on which was an added treat. It is is very impressive and it is free. The lines can get very long later in the day.

Great Views and plenty of Pidgins. This is one of the most historical and beautiful chapels in Europe and is a must see. Free entry but you have to pay to go up top. Entering it is good enough, you can light a candle for a prayer or just be captivated by the scenery. Besides the Eiffel Tower this is a second on the list.

Family visit to the Cathedral. Visited the Cathedral with family on August 18, 2016. Took the English guided tour (free) and got details about the Cathedral. After seeing the inside of the Cathedral and viewing the beauty of the Cathedral from the square, went to the side of the Cathedral to join the queue to go upto the towers of the Cathedral. The queue took us over an hour but was able to get some very tasty crepes while waiting in the queue. Took the steps up to the top and got a great view of the tiny island housing this Cathedral and a view of Paris.The Cathedral was beautiful and the view from the towers were spectacular.Highly recommend people to take the free guided tours and if you are able to climb steps to go upto the top.
Beautiful!. Come in the mid morning and avoid Tuesday is the busiest day. Weekend is not good either. So mid week is the best bet. Go in mid morning so you can experience the upper level!

Long line ups ..... You must come to Notre Dame if you are in Paris. There will be long line ups to enter and for the tower.Judge the visitors inside for yourself. I wish more of them respected that this is a place of worship.

Went to Mass on 9.24.16 a great experience.. Had the best time at the mass because they had 2 great classically trained singers that made it a pleasure to go to mass.They also have 2 organ players one lower, one upper.The church itself is breathtaking.Go to Saturday evening or Sunday Mass here you will enjoy it.the Doctor hit me with a helpful vote.

50 % cool and 50% boring . The free entry on the church its really cool( if you are Catholic its really deep), but the other visit(payed) you spend 45 minutes waiting and you just see a bell and the panoramic view... (you got more beautiful spots to see it)
Very beautiful!. The architecture alone is worth the trip. But on a sunny day the colors on the stain glass windows is something from a movie.
Beautiful!. We did not go inside as the lines were quite long, but you can walk around the outside. There is a beautiful statue dedicated to Saint John Paul II.

Notre Dame Tower Tour. This tour is part of the Museum Pass or can be purchased seperately. You can also purchase a "skip the line" tour from other tour vendors. We were in line around 9:30 and entry began at 10. Approximately 20 people are let through every 10 minutes. Our group was let in around 10:40. While there are 400 steps, the climb is broken up by a couple of stops. On a clear day, it is a great view of Paris. There is netting on the viewing platform but openings where you can take pictures without the netting. The platform is at the level of the gargoyles. It also includes a visit to the bell tower on this level. The last stop is about 100 steps to the top of the tower. The visit at the top is limited to 5 minutes. We are in our sixties and were able to do the climb.

Definitely worth a visit. There's a lot to do in Paris. One place worth visiting is Notre Dame. The Cathedral is impressive. Don't miss going up to top of the structure. It costs €10 and worth it. Be prepared to climb a lot of stairs!
Cathedral. This is another big attraction to do when you visit Paris, this cathedral is spectacular inside and outside.
Lovely cathedral . It was a very lovely cathedral, filled with tourists, historical architect, sculptures, etc. When I visited, they were having a service, so it was very cool to hear the singing.

Amazing visit. Due to a security issue that morning...we lost about 20 minutes of visiting time but made it through. The niches are full of history. It is a very moving place. Yes I am Catholic but my friend traveling is not and she was deeply moved by the cathedral.
This is so majestic and peaceful.. What a beautiful place. We were filled with awe by it's size and craftsmanship. It carries a sense of peace within its walls.

Stupefying cavernous interior. The Notre Dame Cathedral impresses on so many levels that it can essentially be a sensory overload. Take time to walk the halls, admire the stained glass and statues, and marvel at the lofty ceilings. Building started in 1163 A.D. in the French Gothic architectural style and was completed by 1250 A.D. Of note is that Napoleon Bonaparte was crowned Emperor here on December 2, 1804. Today, it is a sacred testament to the resilience of the French people and their faith.

Magical . Everything is amazing with this place.
The nice glass windows looks like it's on a HD-screen.
Tip, don't eat food outside of the cathedral, you will be jumped by beggers.

Just Wow. Beautiful. Free to enter and the queue, even though looks long, moves very quick - 10 min wait max, as no big security checks at door. Once inside free to explore. Make sure you go round the whole building outside as even more beautiful from the rear and side.

Pilgrimage. Visited and felt so peace there. Love to visit because it's so beautiful that I can not describe to you. Beautiful. Worth to visit! No pressure to visit. I would able to go back there again there if God knows.

Always great. Actually went twice this trip, once on our own and again with our Avalon river cruise tour guide as part of our walking tour. Both times quickly through the security bag check. Definitely enjoyed it more with the guide. You may also rent the cathedral audio guide. Paid extra once inside to see the Treasury, which we enjoyed. Don't miss the Crown of Thorns on display; we did the first time when we were just walking around on our own. Watch out for pickpockets!

Magnificent building. The hordes of tourists rather detract from the atmosphere especially when none of them seem to have actually seen anything of the building except through their phone screens. There are signs everywhere asking for silence and to be fair people were generally being quiet. The cathedral is free to get into but there are little extras you can pay for - an audio guide is probably worth while but you have to leave your ID and I didn't have my passport with me. However for 2 euro you can buy a little booklet (nine languages available). I would recommend some sort of guide as it makes more sense that way. The treasury is another 5 euro which I didn't really think was worth it. The soaring magnificence of the nave is typical of Gothic cathedrals and the rose windows are really worth paying attention to - probably the most magnificent I've seen anywhere. There is a sizeable display going through the history and stages of building which sets the cathedral in context. I would have liked to go up the towers but didn't join the lengthy queue - they take 25 people every 10 minutes. Bear that in mind as a guide.
Amazing. The cathedral took over 100 years to build and stretches for over a city block. It is so large. A person can spend hours going this this wonderful cathedral.
Must See and Free!. Gorgeous interior, rich in history. Great little side tour to see the treasures. Also the crypt has interesting Roman ruins. You cannot go to Paris and not see this!
A must. Amazing. Go early if you want to go up (worth it but can be long lines). Just an impressive sight and one of my favorite places in Paris.
top. excellent, beautiful church, lovelly experience, a very emotionally moment, i would like to turn back

Notre-Dame. This majestic and beautiful Cathedral Notre Dame de Paris, or usually just the Notre-Dame Cathedral, is a cathedral from the 1100s. Incredibly beautiful inside and out. The cathedral is located on the Ile de la Cité in the Seine River. This masterpiece must be visited.//Mats Samaras, Stockholm, Sweden
How can you rank Notre Dame as anything other than excellent?. Its an important, historical and cultural site. Informative history of its development is displayed inside.
Beautiful . Breathtakingly beautiful interior. Brave the crowds and visit the inside for a spiritual and architectural treat.

Beat the tour groups... Read lots of reviews about showing up early enough before they opened. We did not rush breakfast and showed up right at open time. The line was "long" but it surprisingly went by fast! We didn't wait more than 15 mins before we were in. What I did realized while in line is that tours groups seem to start showing up 945ish and on... So beat the groups or the line is that much longer. The cathedral is free and there some additional accesses you may purchase and/or rent audio guides. I believe admiring it from the inside out was good enough and did not find it necessary to purchase anything. It took us about an hour to walk it through.

Going back in time. Although I read the Hunchback of Norte Dame by Victor Hugo, I didn't truly know just how romantic and grand this French gothic cathedral really is until I experienced it in person this summer.

Magnificent . This is one site not to be missed in Paris if you appreciate history or architecture at all. It is an utterly breathtaking interior with soaring vaulted arches and beautiful stained glass windows and the exterior is covered with sculptures and of course the famous gargoyles. I had to sit down just to collect myself after entering the cathedral for the first time. It is that beautiful.

Notre Dame Cathedral. Magnificent architecture inside and outside. I highly recommend seeing this place for yourself. Touring the inside of the cathedral is free. If you want to go up to the Bell Tower just note that it costs money to do that.

The tower is very special - a real must do.... Absolutely loved this - the whole thing was an event. The route up to the top is so exciting and feels as though you shouldn't be allowed to be doing it. Highly recommend timing your visit for sunset. The colours and shades of the sun are just beautiful upon the building and over Paris.
Mesmerising. I thought we had to pay to get in to the cathedral, but we didn't. This is a beautiful place and a must see!

Very impressive building and a hub of activity.. Notre Dame is one of the must-see attractions of Paris!It is an amazing looking building and really quite big. Once you come out of the Latin Quarter and look over the river you can't miss it.You can go inside the building, it has a huge impressive ceiling and you can walk around and admire the architecture. Be quiet in there though as there are people in there who are praying or just enjoy the peace and quiet.The outside of the building is a hub of activity, with thousands of people coming and going all the time, lots of picture opportunities, lots of birds to feed, and people performing all sorts of shows like dancing with fire and what not.This building is ultimately impressive at night, so make sure you see it when the sun goes down, even thought to midnight there are still people everywhere just hanging out.You can get tickets to go up to the first level (just where the bottom of the towers are) and tickets to get right to the top. Be aware though, there is very little room up there and there are a lot of people there, so if you hate crowds you shouldn't go up. if you do go up and want to come back down just walk straight past the queue at the exit, because the queue is for people wanting to go to the very top, not for people waiting to leave, since the doorway to both is the same it's hard to tell who is doing what, and I stood in the queue for 20 minutes before realising what was going on.You should also walk around the side of the building and view it from the back, very impressive.
A beautiful church, historic, vibrant. Notre Dame is awe-inspiring. The architecture is exquisite. The grounds are beautiful and the staff very helpful and friendly. Simply and amazing structure
a must see!. Massive, historical cathedral that you just won't believe. The history captured in this building is just amazing

Forget the Eiffel Tower, this is the Paris attraction no 1. What can I say about the Notre Dame that Victor Hugo and a host of other writers have´t said already?See it, study it, admire its beauty, go inside, sit there for a while. See it lit up at night. Walk along the Seine towards it. Walk around it and see how it is constructed with long construction arches reaching up in the rear. Read French literature.Most towns are marketed by a few monuments and places; in Paris it is the Eiffel Tower (a relatively modern construction) and the rather boring, though probably once impressive "main street" les Champs Elysées. Skip them both. See the glorious Notre Dame.

Shocking audio guide... They have adopted some new age style of audio guide which may seem more clever at first, but is really counter productive.With most audio guides, you select a number, press play and listen. Very simple. With the Notre Dame audio guides, you must carry around a map with you and point the audio guide at a number on the paper before it will work. Technology should make things easier, not make things more complex and give you more items to carry around. The Notre Dame is an impressive structure and it was interesting to see an exhibit of its evolution over time, however it does not stand up to other cathedrals in my opinion, no where near as impressive as St Peters or Westminster

Inspiring and beautiful. My husband and I got into the moderately long line which moved quickly. We spent more than an hour - so beautiful and so much to see. Opportunities to sit in some of the side altars made the experience comfortable and inspiring.
SUBLIME GOTHIC ARCHITECTURE. Go very early in the morning (7am -9am) so you can enjoy the cathedrale without a bunch of tourist! Just beautiful...

Stunning architecture. Went to see Notre Dame first thing on a Sunday morning (8.30 am) for 2 reasons. No wait - we walked straight in, and we were able to listen to Sunday mass with the magnificent organ! While it has some nice internal features, it is the external architecture that I believe is the unique aspect of this cathedral.
Amazing. Love the architecture, simpy amazing! you can get nice keychains along the street. they are selling it cheaper than the one near eiffel!

Amazing story. When you have your local tour guide with you, it is more amazing how the Notre Dame came to. Inside the interior has their own stories and the big round window glass on the east and the west side has their own uniqueness. The place itself is packed of people so beware of pickpockets inside and outside, which appear like tourist people or local people.

Who would not visit this magnificent church.. Just check out the stained glass windows, and walk around the church. Outside and inside. Some people miss the back oart of the church, and then walk on to the Isle d'cite.

Long Q, but move Quickly! . Long Q but but really fast moving. So don't be chance your mind, Follow the Q! Very beautiful cathedral, the glass windows with different colors. If you wanna visit the top of the cathedral by stairs, exit the cathedral and turn right. There is the place for Q and ticketing.

Must See Place in Paris. We were ridding a hop on and hop bus and we hopped off here to visit this cathedral. Wonderful, historic and cultural center of Paris. Don't need to spend more than an hour here but well worth the visit.

A Proposal and a Deep Sense of Faith. This was a magic time when we were in the cathedral. It is informative, beautifully adorned and full of ancient history. But, most of all, as a Catholic, there was a sense of the presence of God there on the day of our visit. So much so, that I proposed marriage to my lady while we were in the prayer area. It held a great deal of magic that day. But, even if you're not Catholic or not expecting to propose marriage to a loved one, I recommend this historic and beautiful place on your visit to Paris.

Masterpiece of architecture. Wonderful example of flying buttresses, this beautiful Church dedicated to Our Lady never disappoints. There are numerous side altars but the main altar captivates. Many rose windows make picture taking so easy. The tours under the Cathedral and up high are worth it. There is a little gift shop at the back for rosaries and CD's of organ recitals.

A Must See Paris Attraction. Notre Dame is an impressive cathedral on the banks of the Seine. While there is always a line to get into the cathedral, it generally moves quickly. Once inside, you can spend as much or as little time as you prefer. Even though the area is touristy, with many souvenir shops, it's still fun to walk around the streets and stop for a coffee or glass of wine to people watch.
Now this is the best of Paris.. Very simply put the best of Paris. We recommend this over all the noise of dirty, over crowed Paris. The one building that makes the trip to Paris worth it.

Really nice but too crowded. The "vitraux" of Notre Dame is a MUST to be seen in Paris.But unfortunately, it seems that everyone else in Paris at the time though the same.As the entry is free, we end-up queueing for about 1h to come in... but it's so worthing it ;)During that time, we check the spot on the square in front of the church where all mileage of maps of France start.I advise everyone to take tickets to climbs the stairs and see the view from the bells level: an amazing view of Paris!
Always a great visit. We always come here to view the wonderful stained glass and spend a few moments in quiet contemplation.

Must see and it's free . This was my 3rd trip to Paris and I finally got to go in the Notre Dame. Each time before the lines were so long we finally gave up. This time I was lucky and there were only a few people in line. When I came out the line was extremely long, so I lucked out for sure. The Cathedral is breathtaking and I highly recommend getting a tour which isn't much. If you do not get a tour, you do not understand most of the things you are looking at. They do search your bags before you go in for obvious reasons, so be prepared to open your stuff up for security.

Lines can be long so go first thing in the morning and plan for rain. Entrance is free but as it's a church you will have to wear clothing to cover your knees and shoulders. The queues can be really long so go first thing in the morning and plan for rain.

Long lines, but worth it. We were there during a service and it was super crowded inside. There are candles everywhere that you can buy to light, and a few souvenir stands as well. The architecture is beautiful, and the choirs sounded amazing inside.

Amazing historical edifice. I enjoy visiting Notre Dame, it is a wonderful place of reverence and should not be missed. Lines move quickly and the cathedral can be viewed in an hour.
I am always humbled by its magnificence.
You will be as well since it truly is a work of art.
Notre Dame. A stunning cathedral, accessible by the hop-on, hop-off bus or a cab; I presume the Metro goes there, but we didn't travel that way. Incredible photo ops.
Impressive Architecture!. Our Notre Dame visit was a good one. Very pretty church but I would recommend Sainte Chappelle over Notre Dame if you can only visit one or the other.
must see in peris. this cathedral is beautiful, when lights comes from glasses of different colour. one of the attraction in paris. if you walk side by river you can cover this as well.
stunning. a gereat building from all angles in every street surrounding. We did not enter the building the queues were far too long, patience is required...however we enjoyed it from outside.

A must see. of course this is a must see when in Paris. But this time we stumbled upon its late night opening. We must have arrived about 9:30 p.m. to find a multimedia show on the history of the cathedral. It is free though they ask for donations . Seems to be on Saturday and Sunday nights.

Beautiful Gothic cathedral. Hands down this is a major site to see, unfortunately if you arrive behind a tour group all you hear is noise. So keep that in mind when you go to visit. If you do want to really SEE & EXPERIENCE this church, go and sit in a pew, and gaze at the ceiling, walls, floor and stained glass. Imagine the history, the people and construction of this spectacular building. Be ready to go through security and inspection before you enter, normal now in all the museums and churchs.

Spectacular. I went to the Sunday 10am service, no queue when I arrived and the Gregorian Monks were singing. I then wandered around slowly and at the next mass there was a lady Soprano. The acoustics are amazing and the cathedral is so beautiful, to have the background of these live performances was thrilling.

Great site to visit but questionable safety. I happened to visit the Notre Dame Cathedral on the same day that they found the car full of petroleum barrels. Thankfully nothing happened and my wife and I were not caught in a firestorm of chaos. Personally I am of the train of thought that bad things can happen anywhere so I won't let that deter me from my review of the cathedral - although I will say there is a lot of parking space around the outside of the Cathedral which does not seem "safe" given the circumstances. Nonetheless, my wife and I visited on an overcast / rainy day and the pictures of the outside of the cathedral were ideal. The weather really played into the gothic motif of the building. Gargoyles look a lot more fierce with a little dreariness. I have been inside the cathedral during past visits and certainly recommend doing the climb to the top of the cathedral to ring the bell. Unfortunately, after traveling Europe in the past, I tend to be somewhat underwhelmed by churches - they get a little exhaustive after awhile. Once it was pagan, then protestant, now gothic......and on and on. Anyway, if churches are your thing, this is a must see! But I don't recommend standing way out by the vehicles to take pictures - probably safer closer to the building.
Wonderful . An incredibly beautiful church with amazing architecture. Inside is spectacular and majestic and well worth the visit. The line isn't long to get in
Stunning masterpiece.. Beautiful church. Be sure to see her from across the Seine river and not just from the front of the cathedral - both during the day and at night.

Concert at Notre Dame. There is little I can add about the stunning architecture of the cathedral that has not already been said.I've been through in the day and to do something different this trip booked a concert through classictics. There is huge seating capacity so plenty of tickets available at the door. Indeed the line for those buying tickets was shorter than the queue of those with tickets!It was 4 choralists plus one of the organs.It is a delightful space to listen to the music and it is totally different lit up at night.

good ionic place. This is a definite must see when visiting Paris. The cathedral is very beautiful and is one of those places you have to see. Very historical and charming. The place is free which is great.

Beautiful Architecture!!. The architecture and styling of the Notre Dame Cathedral is wonderful. You feel as if you were transported back in time when you step through it's hallowed doors. The Building is a beautiful Catholic monument during the day, but things get better at night, when all the surrounding lights enhance the great architecture!!

Beautiful. Simply beautiful experience here at Notre Dame Cathedral. The interior is stunning, the surrounding areas are beautiful and we loved the experience here. The atmosphere inside the Cathedral is off the chart and it is definitely worth the visit. Don't miss if in the area as you will not see anything like it...
Great church. We went there about to know whats actually inside and how the architectural design of this place. Its so famous and full of tourists!

Icon. The island the Cathedral sits on is where the first Parisians settled. Beautiful view of the Seines to be had here too. So nice. Park areas around the Notre Dame are convenient and scenic for a picnic or just to relax.

Catholic or not, this is a jaw-dropping experience if ever there was one!. Every time I go to Paris I make time for Notre Dame. The Mother of God is my life's guide and her presence is everywhere on the property. It is the most magnificent monument to Mary anywhere in the world.

Amazing Gothic Church. Viewing the Cathedral from outside is amazing ! the details, size and Gothic presence was something that you just have to see if in Paris.There is a very long line up so best to get there early or late in the day. Can expect to line up around an hour or so for peak times. Toilets are close by as are shops for water if it is hot

Beautiful Gothic Cathedral. We visited Notre Dame on a Friday at 1130am & waited approximately 15 minutes in line. The cathedral is free to enter but 2 euro for a paperguide & 5 euro for an audio guide. The church is absolutely beautiful inside and out. The stained glass was absolutely stunning. I noticed some of the panels were opened which is something I have never seen before. Don't miss the information detailing the history of the cathedral & the minature display showing how they painstakingly built it. The sculptured details on the outside of the building are very impressive. Took 300 years to complete. The best views of the cathedral were from a river boat cruise.
Excellent views of city from the top!. Excellent views of Paris from the top! Would highly recommend with 360 degree view of Paris. Has two levels to viewing city!

Didn't go inside but loved the view.. Just go. We were done with tours and this Cathedral is considered a museum so if you want to go in you can. We opted to view the magnificent architecture and then explore the Latin Quarter which is very close by. A must see. We saw it on a boat tour but seeing it on the ground was even better. The island the Cathedral sits on is where the first Parisians settled. Beautiful view of the Seines to be had here too. So nice. Park areas around the Notre Dame are convenient and scenic for a picnic or just to relax.

Late in the Day. I have been in Notre Dame several times. My 2 best experiences were both late in the day 5-6pm. Tour buses and walking tours are finished. You can file into the Cathedral in a few minutes. One time, there was a Saturday evening mass going on. Although in French, I am a Catholic and could follow along easily and took communion, which was special to me. This last time, I went late and also spent the 5 Euros to go into the Baptistry area, which had beautiful vestments, chalices, monstrance, little cameos of all the Popes, some illuminated manuscript pages, and other precious items. Not crowded at all and a little more up close and personal. I would also recommend taking the time to donate 2 Euros to one of the chapels and light a candle, then reflect for a moment either on something spiritual to you or just on man's search for beauty. You don't have to be Catholic or Christian to enjoy this special (free) space.

Meh. OK, I know that giving NDC in Paris an average rating is probably some kind of heresy, but I wasn't that impressed. The NDC in Bayeux is way more astonishing, as is the NDC in Rouen. If you want the real sort of creepy "Hunchback of Notre Dame" feeling, approach it first from the back, where the flying buttresses and gargoyles make you feel like any crazy thing could happen. If the lines are too long to get inside, don't feel bad that you've skipped it. It's really very ordinary in the context of Gothic churches in France.

Amazing, moving experience. Incredible to feel so close to history! Many of the tombs and chapels have English descriptions which we found easy to follow, although they also offer an audio "tour" for a few euro. We passed the church several times and saw long lines to get in but the lines are very short first thing in the morning on weekdays.

Breathtaking. A free attraction but I would happily pay if required. The history and splendour of this cathedral is breathtaking and definitely worth a visit. No flash photography is allowed and silence is encouraged out of respect for this building and rightly so. Although free, if you want to venture to the top you have to wait in line for ages and pay, we didn't bother but if you want to climb aloft plan ahead and go early. A must see attraction.

Wonderful church to visit, but sure to climb to the top. The church is nice - not as big as I was anticipating, but worth seeing. I recommend climbing the stairs to the top of the church - great views of Paris.

Impressive Gothic Cathedral!. Notre Dame Cathedral is one of the oldest and most prominent cathedrals in Europe.The Gothic architecture is well preserved and impressive. We arrived early on a Sunday morning before it became crowded and were able to get beautiful photographs! We also attended the Sunday morning service. The mass was all in French and was a very spiritual, memorable experience. The only distraction was that other tourists were touring the cathedral and were talking and snapping pictures during the mass! The inside of Notre Dame is very ornate, with interesting artwork and other valuables. The side alters resembled exhibits. The stained glass windows are very lovely. We enjoyed our time at Notre Dame Cathedral and would highly recommend it to others.

Go early in the morning. You can enter at the time of the first mass in the morning (8 am) and, providing you are silent and respectful, you can see the interior without the crowds. Climbing the towers is a bit claustrophobic and definitely not for the faint of heart. It is a long climb, but the view is great.
Must see. You can't go to Paris without stopping to admire this beautiful Cathedral, so much interesting architecture,beautiful stained glass windows and statutes.
On the "must see" list in Paris. Went early to visit the cathedral and missed the crowds. Beautiful cathedral. Loved the detail on the outside of the building.
Free entance. The biggest advantage of Notre Dame is the free entrance (access to the Towers is not free). The church is very beautiful.
Beautiful inside and out. The Notre-Dame is so popular and rightly so. It's so beautiful. Despite the numerous tourists buzzing around the place, it still felt so holy.
Fascinating and Spiritual. Just to walk around the outside of Notre Dame is lovely, but entering you are entranced by a spiritual place.

Magnificent. Amazing architecture, and although the line looks long, moves along reasonably quickly. It is of course more intimate than Sacre-Couer, and a little less frantic. There is such an atmosphere, I would love to go back on a Sunday.

Unforgettable. We cannot visit Paris without going to marvel at this wonderful building that is so beautiful inside and out. From the intricate sculptures and ornate carvings to the spooky gargoyles, Notre Dame has it all.My biggest recommendation is to arrive for when it opens otherwise the queues to get in will stretch the whole length of the courtyard (I'll refer to it as a courtyard but it's much grander than this word indicates) and you will wait for ages to go in. I can confirm though that if you have no other opportunity to visit Notre Dame (and queuing is your only option) it is worth it to see inside. Briefly returning to the courtyard itself, just as you enter it there's a small staircase leading down to a crypt, there is a charge to go in (unfortunately I can't remember how much as we didn't go this time but I think its €5-€6). From what I remember it was quite good and worth doing but at the time we felt that we'd done it once and wouldn't need to again. As previously mentioned we didn't go to the crypt this time instead, we headed straight to the Tower. Again, I cannot recommend highly enough that you arrive as soon as it opens. We got there 30 minutes beforehand and we were already 20th in the queue but it did still enable us to be the first group up. It was about €12 for the ticket which you buy just as you get to the top of the first staircase. There's also a small gift shop at this level (as well as there being another one in Notre Dame Cathedral itself). I will warn you now, there's 422 steps the majority of which is via steep spiral staircases and once you've committed yourself to the climb there's no turning back as it's a dedicated staircase for people going up only! That being said, the views you get from the small windows during your ascent give you a 'teaser' of what is yet to come and once you do make it to the first viewing platform, you instantly realise it was so worthwhile!The views across Paris are breath-taking and being able to see the sculpted gargoyles close up is a real treat as their expressions and mannerisms are fantastic and can only really be appreciated from this angle.Once you've had the opportunity to fully take in the scenery and also see the famous bells of Notre Dame (and take as many photos as possible) you then ascend again but this time to the very top.From here you can get a fantastic panoramic view but you have a time limit of 5 minutes and there is a guard there to monitor this. It's good that they do this though as it enables everyone to get a great view and besides there is only one short staircase so the one you go up is the same one you come down so they have to stagger the visitors reaching the top so as to avoid chaos! Once you have done this though it's then straight down and its a dedicated staircase for people going down only.It's free to go into Notre Dame Cathedral itself and the beauty and splendour inside is staggering, after doing the Tower we decided that as the queue wasn’t too bad we would go in. The statues, décor and outstanding stained glass windows are breath-taking and if you are lucky enough to arrive when there's a service going on and the choir is singing (or even if they are rehearsing) the acoustics are unbelievable. Upon entering there is a vending machine that dispenses fantastic miniature guide books for €2, I highly recommend getting one as it's a great souvenir as well as being very useful!I cannot recommend Notre Dame highly enough. It holds so much of a presence and it's architecture and history are known and appreciated by people of all ages.

mezmorizing. one has to look into the intricate details of this beautiful building in order to know why it is such a touristic attraction and an artistic building. when we visited , mass was going on inside which made certain parts of the church inaccessible however this did not diminish from the experience. it is a beautiful church.

I loved the grandeur of this cathedral and it looks amazing at night.. If your legs are up to it you should climb the spiraling stairs to the top as the view are amazing. The line moved very quickly so we were inside inno time. It took only an hour in the line for the access to the roof and the bell tower. Well worth the short wait.
Amazing structure and history!. The story behind the cathedral and what it has endured is amazing from 1100 a.d. To present and through the French Revolution. 110 meters long. Quite beautiful.

Fantastic stained glass windows. We were mesmerized by this cathedral with my girlfriend! It’s so beautiful! The stained glass windows are superb and the architecture is amazing. You should definitely take the stairs as the view from the top will take your breath away – you’ll see the Eiffel Tower, Sacre Coeur and La Defense quarter with its skyscrapers.
stunningly beautiful. what can i say? it is really beautiful. the amazing details of the structure is a must see, come early though the lines are really long.

Notre Dame is beautiful - has been for centuries!. I have been to Notre Dame many times over the years. It is a beautiful cathedral with lovely stained glass. For the first time, I also went to a concert there this year. another great- and highly recommended experience.

Must see. Fabstatic church history around it amazing well worth a visit when in paris easy to catch the boat tour frm the river next to it or a taxi. The bike taxi frm here into town is a fair bit but the experience is nice

Beautiful cathedral. Historical and beautiful! This is a great place to see. The architecture is iconic as are the stained glass windows. Make sure to come before it gets too late! When we were there they closed early on some days.

A most see Catherdral. What can I say? Notre Dame in Paris is one of the most magnificent cathedrals one can visit. It has a lot of historical charm which demonstrates some of the leading architectural advances of its time, and is still a wonder. For the healthy, the view from the towers is splendid. The stained glass throughout the cathedral is still inspiring. To me, each time I am in Paris, I have to pay a visit to Notre Dame.
Awesome. It was raining - lots of people in line. Line moved quickly. I could not believe this was free. Inside was so peaceful and beautiful. Loved our time here.

Easy access to a stunning building of Christendom . This place is stunning. I am really glad I have visited this monumental cathedral. Under construction / expansion for most of Frances history it's truly awe inspiring. The history behind it is fantastic and inside is well structured for ease of use etc.

Amazing architecture, but dark inside. Although remarkable, we preferred the outside to the inside of this famous church. The inside was far from warm or welcoming! You could almost feel all the ugly events that occurred here long ago. We didn't stay long.
Trafalgar. Beautiful and iconic, and inspirational regardless of beliefs. Also surrounded by nice restaurant and shopping for afterward. Just wish people were more respectful.

Notre Dame. This Church is stunning. Tours available but we did our own thing. Cameras allowed and makes for some awesome pictures as the architecture and stained glass is incredible. You can choose to attend a service also in the church if desired as the center section of the church is kept available for this. The queue moves fast, everything seems to just flow with ease here in Paris, would be an absolute shame to leave Paris without visiting Notre Dame!!!

Sure, it's a tourist magnet, but it's still spectacular. What can you say about this place? It's been around for close to a 1000 years, took a few hundred years to build, survived all kinds of wars, but it's still magnificent and serene and beautiful.

Crowded And Busy, But Worth It!. This is truly quite a beautiful church! If there is anything that we may recommend, then we must say that it's is VERY crowded. Make sure to arrive when the church opens, or expect to wait in a long line. Also, if you want to go to the top of the tower where you can see the gargoyles, you MUST be early. If not the lines becomes very long. The church itself was very nice with beautiful artwork and stained glass windows.

Blown away. Notre Dame Cathedral is a must. It was absolutely spectacular and just breath taking. Stunning from the outside to the inside. It is incredible how churches can be built like this over time. I was able to see the cathedral during a service and this was pretty cool. Definitely worth seeing

Amazingly Beautiful. Oh I thougt I was dreaming. I never thought I could visit this famous church. It's so lovely and solemn. It's a must to try to visit this place. I know Paris is very amusing, but don't forget thief are also amused when they see a lot of tourist even inside the church.. It's never safe..
Constantly busy!. Great architecture but it is very busy and difficult to appreciate with so many people. Be prepared to queue to get in or to climb to the top..
Notre Dame Cathedral. Very impressive visit. We were able to catch a Mass while visiting. A must see experience if in Paris. Should have booked a tour, but wasn't able to due to time constants.

Get there early. Get there early! A beautiful Cathedral with wondrous architecture and stunning stain glass windows. You can reserve online if you want to go up to the top of the towers and get a true Quasimodo feeling and become the next Charles Laughton.
Beautiful, although try to avoid the lines!. This is a must see when in Paris. The lines can be horrible so try to go early in the day or on a weekday if possible.
One of the Oldest Church. One of the Oldest Church built in 12th century. It took almost 300 years to built this church. Hence, you may see various styles of architecture.

Stunning and awe-inspiring. The level of detail that has gone into the architecture and sculptures inside the cathedral are just breathtaking. There is no entry fee but you can pay to go up to the very top. The place is peaceful and serene inside - silence is encouraged.

Beautiful Cathedral. Notre Dame is a treat to visit....and one that I must see every time I visit paris. Do be aware of your surroundings not just here but everywhere in Paris. Enjoy the beauty of this place.

Beautiful . We did this on the afternoon of the first day in Paris. The building is absolutely spectacular. The area was actually busier than the Eiffel Tower! We queued to go inside the building and then paid to climb the stairs. It's more than worth the money to climb the tower as it's like a fairytale - you kinda expect all the gargoyles to come alive like in the disney movie. It was magical!

Grandeur . When you lay your eyes on the Notre Dame from outside, while you are impressed, nothing can prepare you for what lies inside. It's a grand and massive church and the gothic architecture outside and stained glass comes together beautifully. You can get an Audio Guide for 5€. It's easy and convenient to use, you need to leave some form of ID or card with them to collect back later keep in mind. The problem with the audio guide is, if you no nothing about Christianity or churches, you won't understand much. There is a paid section inside to see the treasury of the church, 5-6€ but I skipped it. Instead head outside and get in the line for the two towers. On average the wait would be some 30-45 minutes as they can only let in a few people at a time. But it's well worth it. The entry is 10€ and there are some 380 steps to climb. One can go up a flight further to see the huge bell towers. It would be around 2 hours to cover the church and the tower.

Amazing Landmark of Human History. We visited the Cathedral of Notre Dame in June, 2016 as part of a tour group for our daughter's French class. The cathedral took several hundred years to build and located on the Île de la Cité in the fourth arrondissement of Paris, France. The cathedral is very much considered to be one of the finest examples of French Gothic architecture, and is among the largest and most well-known church buildings in the world. Entering the cathedral one sees the statues of the apostles and Christ and the feeling is amazing. The structure is fully built of free standing stone with flying buttresses to hold the walls up and displace the heavy weight of the roof. For water drainage, there are various gargoyles that spew rainwater from their mouths during a rainstorm, which would create a magnificent effect.The wait line to get into the cathedral (if you have advance tickets) is not too lengthy, but beware of the pickpockets! We were warned of teams of 3-4 teenage girls what would approach tourists asking if we spoke English, where one of them would hold a clipboard with a questionaire whilst an accomplice would pick your pocket. We saw a team of them but they never approached us, thanks to our tour guide and her warnings. Inside the building is an active cathedral, with all of the gothic features found in medieval churches, only on a much grander scale. Many burial crypts and honoraria to past saints adorn the periphery, and the sanctuary, organ and layout are nothing short of magnificent. The craftsmanship and artistry that adorn this cathedral that took so long to construct are amazing. There is also an area inside that details the history of the building of the cathedral, and a gift shop (?interesting?). A must see when visiting Paris!

I regret not taking a tour. Like the Musee Orsay, we chose not to take a tour believing it would be too much money and time. Neither assumption was true. It's an awesome sight but I left wanting to know so much more about the history.

Very beautiful . 1st time visit and not a fan of church/cathedrals but this is a truly beautiful place. Well worth a visit and free to enter and look around. Architecture is amazing. Be careful outside with the people hassling you but just tell them to go away.

April in Paris. Go! Need I say More?? The. The history the architecture the atmosphere the fact that you're standing in and near something so old and so beautiful you will not be disappointed trust me

Beautiful. Visit the cathedral very early in the morning- you will be able to walk right in and avoid the queues that become very long by late morning. I would recommend climbing the steps to go to the top- the views are breathtaking. If you are under 18 don't forget some ID as it is free entry!

Must see when in Paris. Everything we thought it would be, we were able to attend a service there which was very meaningful. They have a service which is partially in English on Sunday morning at 1130.

Impressive . We were blown away by the striking architecture of this cathedral. So much detail. It's super popular. There were tons of people there. You can get a lock for $3 or so USD and attach it to the bridge on the way. You can also watch the street hustlers work their magic. Don't engage. But, it's fun to watch the production and figure out how the scams work and who's in on it.

Beautiful. On the first day of our visit they were not allowing people to enter the cathedral however, the gardens and surrounding area was lovely. We went back another day and was allowed in. The queue looked long but it moved very fast. After entering we made our way around and ended and the shop. It was free to enter, beautiful inside and worth a visit.

Magnificent cathedral . Like most of the main attractions of Paris the cathedral is always busy and you have to be prepared to queue to get in. Security is high. It is worth the wait to see the magnificent interior with its famous rose window.

Massive...wow! . Breath taking... It's beautiful! The atrium was full of people but the entry line moved smoothly and everyone is well behaved. The stain glass work is so pretty you really want to cry... I was moved. There are no words to describe this beauty you just have to see it for yourself. It's a must see.. Checked off my list!

Grand Old Lady . Close to our accommodation in Saint Germain & not far from Saint Chapelle (also worth a look). Get there early or expect to queue, especially if you want a guided tour. The non-guided tour queue moved pretty quickly so in about 10 - 15 minutes we were in. The cathedral was quite spectacular & definitely worth a look.

A true Yorkshire review. After visiting the Louvre we walked onto Notre Dame. Absolutely beautiful/ornate from the outside with plenty options to take that perfect shot. To be honest I was a little disappointed with the inside but having been to St Marks in Venice (the best ever basilica) and St Peters in Rome there will never be anything that meets the same standards in my opinion.
Awesome Cathedral. This is a great experience, although you won't be the only one who had that great idea. Wear comfortable shoes, take some bird seed and a camera. Enjoy!
Purchase the audio tour . The audio tour is a great way to appreciate the history and details of this cathedral. Only 5€. We used our own headphones for added comfort.

go up the tower. We had booked on line to go up the towers of the cathedral. Worth the climb for views over Paris. Better still, time it to be up there when the bells ring. No wonder Quasimodo got deaf or mad, or both. It's overwhelming

Tour the Cathedral of Norte Dame . Another iconic stop when in Paris. Audio tour is very good and have some extra euros to light a candle for those loved ones who have passed before is a great tribute.Free to get in, but always a donation is welcomed. Look for the donation which goes to the children. Watch out for the gypsies whom hang out outside Notre Dame. They will walk up to ask a question. Keep waking and don't talk to them.

Beautiful cathedral. Beautiful cathedral, lots of history. The grounds are pretty. Verybusy but worth the visit. We didn't do the stairs to the top because it was too hot, which we could have. The stained glass is unbelievable. The gargoyles were just like the pictures. Rich in history and worth visiting.

One of the great cathedrals in the world!. Wondering around inside the huge cathedral always feels like a special treat! So much history in this cathedral. Hard to believe that a couple of hundred years ago it had been earmarked for destruction. Paris would be so much poorer if those supporting to knock it down had had their way. Thank God they didn't, so that visitors to the city can enjoy its splendour and beauty still today!

Very interesting and amzing to visit. The Cathedral has a rich history which some graphics touch on. It was so interesting to learn about the building and how it changed over time. I believe it is free to get in.. was had the Paris museum pass so I can't remember the places that charged. The archeological crypt is nearby and you should definitely visit. The tour to go to the top of the cathedral is on the left side when you are facing the front. This was the only thing we had to wait for and the museum pass does not get you priority entrance. We waited about an hour. It was worth it. It was nice to get to go to the top and get close to the gargoyles and the 2 bells. Definitely walk around the right side and the back of the cathedral as you get a really good look at the building architecture and there is a nice garden area. If you have kids there is a playground area in the back and on the side.

Absolutely gorgeous must see. Definitely include this attraction in your list when visiting Paris, be it by boat by the bus touristique, or walking. It's right in the middle of everything, and it's definitely worth a see. I would also recommend to go inside as well!!!

Feel the history. Its a fantastic place to see given that its still free to get in. We paid for a guided tour and tower access but those on a budget would really enjoy seeing this great cathedral inside and out

Beautiful. Absolutely a must see. We didn't even go inside, but it was so beautiful to see in person. The details are magnificent and every angle is different. I'm sure the inside is equally gorgeous but even if you just stop by and admire it for 20 minutes it's worth it. It was smaller in person than I thought it would be :)

Sunday visit. We had a rainy morning whilst in Paris and decided to head to the Notre Dame. Being on holiday the days merged into one and we completely forgot it was a Sunday... and therefore Sunday mass. It was a fantastic surprise and we absolutely loved watching the mass and hearing the singing. Would definitely recommend going on a Sunday. Also the queue looks huge, but goes down very quickly!
Climb up the tower. It was well worth the visit. Very special. Cross the bridge for a great glacee and crepes. Excellent street musicians on bridge behind Notre Dame.

A magnificent Cathedral. A beautiful place to worship.. It's stunning to stand in it there with all of it's beautiful art and architecture helping us visualize our loving heavenly Mother Mary and our merciful God. It feels so peaceful amid a mass of visitors. I was lucky to be there on August 22 the day we celebrated the Queen ship of Mary. It was a splendid visit.
Beautiful . This was a beautiful building. It was well worth the visit. The gigantic line during shoulder season makes me shutter at what it's like during tourist peak.

Baroque concert in Notre Dame. Unforgettable evening. A small group of 4 musicians and singers provided the most unforgettable evening of divine music and song. I was amazed at the variety of sound that resulted from different configurations and locations of the musicians. One for the memory bank of wonderful experiences.

Beautiful Cathedral and worth visiting. This is a definite must see while in Paris. It's located in a great area, is really easy to get too, and doesn't take up a lot of time so it's a nice filler attraction. There was a long line to get into the cathedral to see inside but it moved very quickly and admission is free.

does'nt live up to hype. all the movies portray this as a spectacular cathedral. the entrance might be but the interior is rather pedestrian. Notre Dame of Rouen and the church at the site of the burning of Joan of Arc also in Rouen impressed my wife and I much more. Side note St James Anglican church in Hyde Park is beautiful and just a short walk from Kensington Gardens

A must see in Paris - wonderfully gothic. I got up early and got there for 9am - absolutely worth it, no queue and lots of space !An absolute must see in Paris - so atmospheric. Really can't describe the sense of grandeur or the amazing glass windows. Fantastic just to be able to wander around and soak it all up ...

Superb Gothic Cathedral, Challenging Crowds. One of the top sites to see in Paris, even if you have only one day. On the plus side the architecture is superb, a work in progress for almost 900 years. A small display catalogs progress over the centuries. Side tours of the tower and the treasury are worth the cost; the line to climb the tower looks really long. The rose windows are about the best we've seen in the world and the architectural details, inside and out, have to number in the thousands. We were not able to hear the organ or a choir, but they would have to be magnificent in this setting. On the down side are the incredibly long lines and hundreds, no maybe a couple of thousand tourists present inside and out. We went on a Friday afternoon and it was packed including a full cadre of Roma types, military guards, and beggars. However, this is part of the overall charm and experience one has in Paris. Others have said, go early in the morning and minimize the crowds. I can believe it. Along with the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower and several museums, this is a must see. Cheers!

Beautiful! . This was so awesome! We went inside then came back the next day to climb the tower. Be prepared to wait a long time in line if you don't buy a tour. I know sometimes you turn up to places and realise you've spent way too much money on a skip the line ticket.. But if you can for this place then it may be worth it if you don't show up before open time.

One of the best. This glorious cathedral regally stands like a crown on the Isle de la Cite in the middle of the River Seine. A fabulous and impressive church. Go early when there are less tourists to give the cathedral your full attention. Both historical and artistic, showcasing spectacular stained glass windows. A special place not to be missed in Paris.
A must see. The Notre Dame was amazing l totally loved going hear and its was free which was a surprise. Would recommend, it's a must see in Paris
The architecture is amazing. What a beautiful building. To think that this place was built without the modern tools we have today.

Well worth it. We saw a huge line to enter but we're told it would not take long to get in, and it didn't. The line was perpetually moving. Free entry and a choir singing inside made it even more worthwhile. But the church itself is worthy of the short wait time.

Lovely, peace of mind, prayers. One of the best places to visit in Paris, can be easily reached by public transportation.The lines to enter are long, but ppl get in easily especially that u don't pay tickets.The place gives peace of mind, and the prayer area is perfect for those who needs it. I attend some part of the prayer and it was a different experience. The gift shops has very nice selection of gifts.
Shouldn't visit Paris without seeing Ndame. Best sight in Paris. Go early to avoid queues. Be prepared for getting bags searched on way in. You can take as much time as you want inside.

EXPERIENCE. Though crowded, the visit does not take time ... It makes you realise the effort, the artistic vision & of course the faith, of the workers who built this monument ... Pay attention to the color coding used to symbolise different states of mind ..
Must see. We stayed close by and maged to see it a night and in the day. The engineering and design for such an old building is breath taking.

A must see. This is a wonderful cathedral steeped in history that is really worth visiting when in Paris. Entry here is free.
There will be a Lin to get in (for a security check) don't be put off if it looks long as it moves quite quickly and you will soon get inside.

An amazing masterpiece. It is an amazing masterpiece. Even the kids (7 & 11 ) love it when we reach the top, though they complained all the way on the stairs :)
The view is breathtaking. It was good to visit as you feel you become a part of the history of mankind.
Concert at Notre Dame. Although impressive, I have seen more beautiful churches through out Europe, both their exterior andinterior.
Beautiful church. Went while service was going on. Think it is better to walk around after services. Beautiful church inside and out. Well worth the visit.

Piece of history. A regular voice ask you to s*** up for a good reason, the pieces of History behind these old but warm stones is increadible and require all the respect it deserves.
5€ to visit the treasures room

Beautiful!. I love the outside of the cathedral along with the views with the gardens to the south and the river. I've checked out the exterior a few times, but this time we went inside. Long line, but it moves quickly. No charge to tour. No special access with the Paris Museum pass. We planned to go to the top of the tower, but we ran out of time. Maybe next time... The tower is included on the Paris Museum pass.

A Must See in Paris....Top 5. Have been to Paris twice before and have walked around the exterior and seen this beautiful place from a distance! Why have I never been in? Just go and do yourself a favour. Grabbed a headset and a map for 5Euros and spent the next hour exploring. Truly beautiful and so glad I did it. Stained glass is truly amazing, as is the grandeur of this Cathedral. Helpful hint: take the family to the best ice cream place after this....a 10 minute walk but well worth it.
Fell in love!. Just stunning inside and out! Words can't describe it just go see it! We were lucky enough too see a wedding taking place inside.
AHH-mazing!. The grandeur, the beauty, the "feeling" upon entering this magnificent Cathedral is something I cannot describe. It is BEAUTY!.....then to hear that organ! Oh My! Tears!

Beautiful - Free for EU 18-25 yr olds. I stayed in Paris for two days.On the evening of my first night I went into the Cathedral and a short film was projected on the inside detailing the history behind it. This was quite interesting - and free.The second day, i arrived before the opening time to find a lengthy queue (i would suggested getting there early to start your day). Once the Cathedral opened, the queue moved quite quickly as they let people in in large groups.With my passport i was able to show that i'm an EU member between 18-25, and go up free of charge.It was quite a climb to the top, thankfully they keep a one way system, so you don't collide with other tourists coming back down.Although it was quite crowded and the top, the views were spectacular. I would highly recommend this.

One of the places you have to see in Paris. The Cathedral is very beautiful and you can take all the time you want, to walk around inside. The company I work for, has installed a lifting platform in the middle of the Cathedral, to help wheel chair users to pass the steps inside the Cathedral.That means, also handicap people in wheel chair can come around inside.
Interesting . Very interesting to see - happy we viewed inside, queuing outside went through quickly and was worth the wait.

Must do in Paris. We queued up for 80 mins for the walk to the top,Be warned there are loads of steps so be at least a little bit fit,Its hard work.The views are totally worth the walk,The famous gargoyles looking out onto Paris are iconic.We then queued up for the Cathedral entrance and this moved a lot,lot quicker.the cathedral is stunning.You must come here when in paris.

Well Of Course It's a Must If you Are In Paris!. This is a landmark that should be visited by all no matter what faith you believe in. So much history. So much beauty. The building is large and there are many small chapels within the cathedral. There is a wall that shows each stage of construction. And the music from that pipe organ. It will send shivers down your spine.

Old Church. Nice architecture. Old church. There are birds outside for you to take pics. The queue is long but maybe good enough for having a free entry. Take photographs around the church or from the river, the architecture is lovely. Oh, careful as there is a modus which ask you if you speak english and sign the paper she has, then while u r busy signing, one of her partner will take a look of your bag to get something if has chance.

Breathtaking!!. Walking up the the cathedral, it didnt look like it was much to see, just another church but once inside it was unbelievable with so much history. I didnt know where to look as there was too much to see, I didnt go to the top but im sure from up there the views would have been amazing.

Absolutely stunning. My 91 year old mom was in a wheel chair and they let us in right away without having to stand in line. There were a couple of stairs inside the cathedral but no problem - EVERYONE was so helpful - Men just offered to pick up the chair and walk up the 3 steps - we were so thankful and they made it easy for us to see everything
Amazing Architecture. This is a great place to visit when in Paris!!!! Can be crowded and hot but well worth seeing. Very impressive.
Beautiful space. This is a wonderful place to go into and see. It's architecture is world renowned and amazing. Definitely worth seeing.
Breathtaking . This is such a beautiful building and in a really lovely, busy area. It is free entry. You are reminded to be quiet inside as some people are praying. Lots of art of religious figures.
It's a cathedral . Since you are in Paris you should see this if you have time. Go early so you can just walk in and out without have to wait in lines

Notre Dame . We got to the cathedral on Sunday at 10am, when the priest started his 10am Mass, I'm not a religious person but I got to witness it which was pretty amazing.
The details in the main door are amazing and the interior of the building was very detailed

Wonderful experience. It is hard to describe being inside Notre Dame Cathedral. It is quiet and beautiful, make sure you take your time to look at all the artwork and go to the top to see the view of Paris.

Beautiful piece of architecture. Notre Dame is a must-see, the building this beautiful inside and out plan on spending an hour or so there lots of history lots of things to read and there's a great book store right across the street.

What can I say? A must-see. Ok. I'm not an art historian nor a tour guide nor a historian. This is unique in the world, unique in Paris and if you are in Paris, you must see it. End of story. Do your research in appropriate places. If you have any doubt whether you should go, you should go. You will not be alone, of course...

Concert and visit. We stopped in the afternoon as its a must see whenever we are in Paris, and discovered there would be a concert that evening of Gregorian chant & medieval music. How could one not go?!? This is a beautiful and amazing cathedral and the history and architecture alone are worth going for.
Great history and majestic. I highly recommend to learn about the history of the church, it's actually really interesting and funny at times (well, to me). Take your time as it can get busy!

Exquisite monument. The Notre Dame is definitely a must-see monument in Paris. Even if one is not keen on Gothic Catholic churches, the history and significance of this cathedral makes it well worth the visit. The beautifully decorated portals outside, the stained glass and organ inside, the sheer number of chapels with paintings and statues... If only seen as a work of art, the Notre Dame is an important landmark for every tourist in Paris.
One word: Packed. . Loaded with so many people. May want to drop by alot earlier to get in que to get in. View was great though.
Very crowded. Great architecture, but sooo overrun with tourists. We were present at the mass and it was beautiful. It feels more like a museum than a cathedral.
Fabulous Architecture. Centuries old and stunning. Architecture and Stained Glass are beautiful and a must see. It is close to the Louvre and the D'Orsay.

A famous Paris landmark. It may not be the most beautiful cathedral in the world , but it is one of the most famous.Located on Ile de la Cite in the middle of the Seine river , it is the most famous monument of the original Paris.
