Amazing place, looks better on the outside than in!. fab structure, amazing place, a bit disappointing on the inside, no flash photos.....very impressive though, we have been to the Vatican and it kind of pales into insignificance, but well worth the visit...high security, loads of armed soldiers, long unavoidable queue due to security, but hay, that's good right?
Favorite Site. My husband and I visited here on our honeymoon. This was probably our favorite place we stopped. The architecture is fantastic, and he particularly enjoyed the progress timeline.
Beauty - day & night!. A must see! We never went inside but I believe it is beautiful & you can access the towers. Beautiful day & night.
Beautiful Architecture. Loved seeing the beauty of the Cathedral. Another item knocked off my bucket list. Enjoyed it tremendously.
Serene. Must see. Beautiful stained glass. So much history. Definitely a highlight of the visit. So very sad to see the security needed now.
Beautifull. It is magic and spectacular. I recomend to wear comfortable shoes and be ready to make a long line .
Beautiful!. Notre Dame Cathedral was everything I expected. So lucky to be able to experience its beauty in person.

Beautiful Church. I enjoyed wandering into the church and admiring the different art treasures it contains. The statues, decorated windows and painting are just amazing. There are also a chapel inside reserved for those wishing to pray (close to the general tourist), which I found very nice. The building itself is a very old monument. It is well reallly worth the visit.
Beautiful experience . This is a must, it was a spiritual experience, even with hundreds of people also viewing the cathedral. A must when in Paris

Impressive monument, wirth its fame!. We went to ND on a Saturday, did a long but fast queue to visit the Cathedral (not the tower), and enjoyed half an hour visit to the beautiful interior. The two Rosoni (rose windows) are spectacular, beautiful sculptures, the two organs, and a unique charme. The visit is free, there are a lot visitors, but it goes fast. It is a pity that, also here!, many are busier to take picture than enjoying the beauty of this monument.

It is Worth because you are in Paris . There is usually a queue because of the security controls but it is Quick .It is free . It is a Nice Church Even if I found really interesting also S.Sulpice Closed to Les Halles and many others
Very cool. Building is super impressive and the stain glass windows look amazing. Over crowded with people. Needs to let smaller amounts in.

Beautiful cathedral. This Cathedral is amazing and very beautiful,it is free to go inside and look around and the architecture is amazing.There is a service on a few times a day so you have to be really quiet so if you have kids check before you go in and wait till it has finished before taking kids in.If you want to go up the towers the entrance is outside round the side but it is nearly 400 steps so only for the fit but the view is fantastic from the tower but it's really hard work up and down.This is a good place also to get something to eat with restaurants and cafes right next to it.Ten minutes walk from here is also the Sainte-chapelle.

A Paris icon. Notre Dame is one of those Paris icons that you can't miss. The chapel is free to visit, although you may have to wait in a long line to get in. It is absolutely gorgeous and it is interesting to learn about the history. To climb to the top there is a fee. This is included in the Paris Museum Pass, which is great, or you can buy tickets there. We did wait a long time for this part, but it was worth it. The view is great and it's cool to get a close up view of the gargoyles. There are a lot of stairs and not a lot of open space, so be aware if you are claustrophobic.
Beautiful!. It was almost an honor visiting this Cathedral. Not sure what else I can say other than do not visit Paris without spending some time in this awesome place.

900 years of religious history. No one can visit Paris without visiting Notre Dame. Built about 900 years ago, it is the pride of Paris situated on the Isle de la Cite in the middle of the Seine. Free admittance, tour the inside, and if you are up to it, climb the stairs to the bell tower.

Gothic sensation. What could one possibly say about this magnificent structure. 700 years old and still counting. The treasury is also a bonus to visit, with opulence and spender aplenty. A wonderful few hours can be spent here. While the entrance is free there are things you can pay for in addition to the great building.

You can feel the history!. I have been to Notre Dame a few times and always notice something I had missed before. One of the 'best' visits was the time we stayed for a special worker's mass on a May 1st a few years ago. It was celebrated in many languages but what affected me the most was the sense of history that overwhelmed me....imagine who has sat in this very cathedral over the past 600 years..the kings and queens and princes and philosophers and artists and so on. You look around and you are seeing what has been seen by others for centuries...wow.The fast moving line and in/out visit allows you to glimpse at the past but the experience is muted by the noise of the crowd...try to get to a service to experience the serenity and that wow of history.

Touring the tower is not an easy climb. Went to Notre Dame about 9:30 AM and got right into the church. Took our time and did the audio tour. By the time we left it was getting crowded. Then decided to wait in line to climb the 400 steps to tour the tower. Line moved at a snail's pace. We waited for over an hour. They let in several tour groups ahead of us. Be aware that these steps are not for the weak! Incredible views once you are up there but it's something I only need to do once.
Catherdral. Recommend visit to Notre Dame to see the historical beauty and mystique of this cathedral - no sign of Quasimodo.

Great example of a medieval cathedral. Whenever visiting places such as Notre Dame, you are never quite sure what to expect. The good news is that to walk around the main body of the cathedral is totally free and when we visited in early September there was only a very short queue. Tours to the towers/bells and other parts were at a modest charge only. We were content just to visit the free parts. Lovely stained glass, a nice exhibit on how the cathedral was built over a number of stages/centuries and great to sit in contemplation of just how this was achieved way back when.....
very Beautiful church. very beautiful church in the heart of Paris. There are several bars and restaurant around as well. I do recommend Au Vieux Paris d'Arcole just a block from Notre Dame.

Amazing 11th century Marvel. Amazing is the word I keep using to describe this wonder of Mideveil architectural building! Get an audio guide or book to tour this holy place and spend some quiet time sitting in the Cathedral to pray! Just beautiful, especially if you have the opportunity to get a ticket for the once a month concerts held there to hear music and angelic voices sing! Moving!!

Just amazing for a church. AFC not this one, grand stunning and even the non religioue can not help feel awe struck standing in this piece of history. Still can't talk in the church so the quiet is very soothing and sobering.Not to be missed. Happy travels

Like in fayritale 😍. The most beautiful cathedral feels like in heaven ) if u are in paris u should coming there !)so powerful place and wonderful feeling be there !also inside the cathedral can buy perfect souvenirs for family and friends)and please come in the right time , because can hear sounds of bell

Notre Dame. This stunning Gothic style Cathedral is more impressive than the photo's. I arrived on Sunday morning during Mass, which was well attended, thus limiting access to a large area of the interior. It is impressive now, it must have be a wonder to the local people of France after the completion.

Magnificent . One has read or seen many pictures, stories, movies, or imagined about Notre Dame Cathedral. But, until one visits the cathedral, one has experienced nothing. The architecture tells a story of religious beliefs. Enter the edifice and discover the world as told by artist of the day. Paintings, statues, carvings, tapestries, stained glass windows with explanations about it all. There will be lines so plan accordingly with this in mind. Be sure to go to the upper levels to discover more treasures. The underground graves are interesting. Located along the Seine river be sure to spend a few hours exploring, or take a guided tour. Just don't miss visiting this iconic building.
Another Notre Dame. One of the many many cathedrals in France and Europe. Not worth the long lines. Plan your visit very early or very late in the day.

Another must see. Notre Dame Cathedral was our groups #1 must see, and we were not disappointed. The line was about 100 yards, but kept moving and we were happy to see the site, and learn about the history. I recommend the headphones if you want to learn in more detail.

Serene and captivating... Not to be missed!. Me and my Hubby recently traveled to many various locations in Europe for a holiday and found this Cathedral to be our ultimate favourite. For a start it was actually free to visit and take pictures which many others are not, but I actually felt like you could sit there and take it in for a prolonged period and not tire from its beauty. Couldn't recommend more!
Faboulous. Historical Building with an amazing story and in a beautiful setting overlooking the river. The architecture,Stained Glass Windows, Bell towers are all so artistic and well worth seeing

Notre Dame...the essence!. We came on a Sunday morning...visitors are allowed around the outside cloisters while traditional Sunday choral Mass was being celebrated complete with organ.....unforgettable and moving. Free entry! To climb to see the bells and towers requires queueing on the street alongside...this costs !

Spectacular!. This is a remarkable structure and a wonderful spot for photos. Definitely worth going to the top. There are spectacular views of the city and the gargoyles make for fun picture taking. I went with my teen and we had a delightful time. There can be a long line so go early or late in the day.
Long line up- but got in fast and it's free. Beautiful very old cathedral- worth going in to see and learn all about how the church was built-lots of history and very interesting!
Th Bells!. This is truly spectacular, the craftsmanship that went into building this Cathedral is amazing.The whole area around here is amazing for lunch, coffee or just hanging out at the Seine.

Beautiful to visit at night. Many people tour the area during the day, but the church is very beautiful at night and while you cannot go in at night, you can get a perfect picture without many people around. We took a night tour of Paris and Loved it.

Majestic church. This church is famous for a reason. It's architecture and details are impressive. When inside you can't help but think of Game of Thrones. It's a walk back through time.There were lines to get in, but it wasn't too bad. We got the audio guide which was very helpful. It also granted entrance to a small museum that in itself is worth the visit. We did not want to climb up, the lines were way too long. We decided to drink wine and eat cheese instead. Enjoy!

Spectacular architecture; Authentic spirituality. When one visits Europe, one likely visits dozens of church. But many of them are museums and have not held services in years. Not Notre Dame. When we arrived, a service was in session, and although we are of a different faith, we eagerly joined and were warmed by their sincerity.

One of Europes Most Magnificent Cathedrals!!!!. One of Europe's largest and most famous cathedrals as well as an example of beautiful French gothic architecture. You will recognize the large stained glass rose window that has been widely copied, painted and photographed. You will want to climb up to the top of the towers and get a view of the Paris over the gargoyles. It is also beautiful at night when it is lit and great for photos.
Colossal . This is one of my favorite Catholic Churches that I've visited. The entire architecture as well as the view inside and the of course a very beautiful place to pray at.

Hunchback of Notre Dame . The place was jam-packed when we went there around noontime, but still the queue was tolerable and entrance is free. The site of the cathedral reminded my 6 y/o daughter about the film of hunchback of notre dame. She was mesmerized that it was actually a real cathedral from the film itself. She keeps staring at the gargoyles and wondering if they are gonna move and climb up to the rooftop!
Beautiful. We have been in many churches, chapels and cathedrals but Notre Dame is truly breath taking. Be prepared for long lines.

Notre Dame is a Must See When in Paris. Some of you may be worried about security in Paris. For the most part, we felt secure all during our trip in France. However, at the famous Notre Dame Cathedral, be prepared for the heaviest security we experienced on our trip. The island in the Seine on which Notre Dame stands is a very busy place. And the crowds that come to see the cathedral are large. When we were there the cathedral was holding a special Vespers service for the Virgin Mary - a French Holiday. We were allowed into the side areas of the cathedral and were able to see and hear the service in progress. This means we heard the cantors, the congregation singing, the massive organ, and the professional choir. What a treat to both see the beauty and massive magnificence of this building and hear the sounds of music. Both inside and out the cathedral is the most impressive gothic structure you will ever see. You wonder why the island didn't sink into the river when it was built. This is why this is one of the two top attractions tourists visit when in Paris. Just be prepared for crowds and multiple levels of security before you are allowed to enter.

Just awesome. Just to think this amazing piece of arquitecture and art begun construction in the 1200 is enough to make your jaw drop. I really enjoyed it, i didnt enter the catacombes but would have loved to.

Organ recital in Notre Dame .... On August 27, 2016 we attended an evening organ recital in Notre Dame, of mainly French composers I believe, and thoroughly enjoyed the concert. This was our last evening in Paris of a 10-day stay, and we were so pleased to end our visit to one of our favorite world cities this way. Often we have attended organ recitals in San Sulpice to enjoy its wonderful organs and organists: this was our first occasion to enjoy a Notre Dame organ recital.

Beautiful. We were really lucky that when we went there was no queue, I'd prepared myself for a somewhat long wait. We spent about an hour inside, we also paid to go in the treasury, wouldn't say its a must do thing but the treasury is interesting. We also did the towers which I'd highly recommend doing - the view from the top was stunning, be warned though the towers make for a tough climb! We spent over an hour in the towers, there was lots to see from the bells to the panoramic view at the top!

It's just another big city church, isn't it.. Not really what to say about it. It's a centrally located, big building that used to inspire/scare people into handing over money and keeping things in order.These days, people like the wife and eye, wander around and take pictures.As a big building, it's awesome. However, seen one, you've seen them all.meeh...
Beautiful. It is a fabulous place, you can't help but be in awe when you visit! The queues can be very long so visit early and avoid the rush! Some great little cafes to the side as well!

Stunning. I was amazed how peaceful it was walking through the the church despite the large number of people. Everyone was very respectful and the crowd wasn't so big that you couldn't take everything in.

A must place to visit . This has to be one of my favourite buildings I have visited. The stain glass windows are just stunning. The building itself is full of surprises with statues and amazing stone work.There are plenty of places to eat and drink close by. A must visit.

Beautiful Cathedral in the heart of Paris. Another must visit in Paris. From the outside in it is spectacular. Just think the construction began over 800 years ago! A visit during Sunday mass makes it even that much more special.

A must do!. I visited this beautiful building last week, I'm not religious but it was definitely worth going in to. The detail throughout the whole building is amazing! You have to be quiet which I think is very respectful and you get the chance to light candles, make prays and just explore all the beautiful aspects as well as learn about the buildings history. Free entry was even better! Definitely recommend!

Beautiful!. Well worth a visit to there and the neighbouring notre dame area due to its boutiques, cafes etc and all at a more reasonable price than the Louvre side of the Seine.We didn't pay to climb to the top of the cathedral, but walked round inside and it was gorgeous however absolutely mobbed and warm - so bring your water so you don't dehydrate!

Tranquility. Cathedral has a distinct way to catch you. It is quiet a litlle call and calm. The darkness the the candle lights forms a wonderful atmosphere together with the paintings and the monuments. When you are Notre Dame you do feel all the emotions accumulated there through the history. There is a line at the entrance because of the security check but it moves fast. One hour is enough to see the inside roughly. You can spend all day if you want to the emotional state to continue ans drive you.On the outside garden is great and easing.

Brilliant - but do yourself a favour and go EARLY. I've visited many times and can never resist making another visit each time I return to Paris. The best tip I can offer though is to be there when it opens. No queues and you beat the tour groups too - it's peaceful and you can enjoy exploring without the crowds
beautiful tour. the chapel was breath taking, plaza very crowded. Someone had just gotten married and the photo shoot was just so beautiful. The building is just so pretty

another cathedral. we were here mid September 16. Short line to get in. Spent about 2 hours inside. Hubby is a thorough looker. Thought outside was more impressive, and its location enhances it. Guess I 've seen lots of abbys and cathedrals in last month. My favorite for beauty inside is St Paul in London, and for overall appeal is St Michael in the Wild, also in London.Notre Dam is worth a look see however if only for its history and the flying buttresses.

Awe-inspiring. A visit to Notre Dame is a must. I found it mesmerising. A great opportunity to reflect and remember loved ones. There is no entrance fee however there is a cost to visit the treasury and towers. A stunning building

Try to get there for a mass with the choir. We got lucky and went in just as a mass was going to start (Sunday at 630pm). It must have been very special since there was a processional of over 30 priest and wonderful choir music. Some of the church is closed off, but another visit can take care of seeing it all.
Breathtaking . If you ever make it to Paris, this is one of those attractions that you must see. The architecture is amazing and a once in a lifetime experience. Simply Amazing
the notre-dame. lovely cathedral with a great architecture. it seems af if you would have been taken back in time and to another era

Serene and inspiring . A classic place to visit whilst in Paris, take time to go inside. If you get a chance, it looks great floodlit too at night but then you can't visit the interior. You can climb the steps to the Tower, but there's a charge for that and usually a queue.
Couldn't get in.... As the heading says we couldn't get in. The queue to get in was so long that we had to abandon are visit. Such a shame as from the outside it truly is a sight to see.

Stained Glass. Cathedral of our Lady of Paris. The rose windows, flying buttresses, the history, the stained glass windows & the surrounds are not to be missed. There was a long line to get in but is was a quick line, so the waiting was not too long.
Magnificent. It's breath-taking to enter and absolutely awe-inspiring. Spend an hour or two admiring the magnificence.

Breathtaking. It's the quintessential gothic architecture. So sad to think that around a hundred years ago, it was basically a ruin. I can't imagine going to Paris and not at least stopping in. It was free, but you can pay for an audio guide or guidebook. The audio guide is worth it if you're at all interested in history or the story of the cathedral!
this is what you come to Paris for. awe inspiring, reverent, timeless and beautiful. Transports you back to the medieval moment. If you only see one cathedral, make it Notre Dame
Magnifique. Lovely scene especially at night. Rich history attached to it and a place to visit while in Paris. Totally loved it.

The Rose!. The amount of work to build such a structure and the amount of money to rebuild would be nearly impossible to compute. It's a magnificent structure with the highlight being the Rose Stained Glass Window.

Sightseeing . Just beautiful, one of my favourite cathedrals to visit. Easy to get to using Metro. Be away of touters wanting to take a photo of you using your camera. They do take great pics but then they ask for a tip. We were fortunate enough to be there whilst the bells were chiming. You can purchase keep sakes from inside cathedral. Lots of Cafes surround as well.

Wow. We could not see much , but it was great just to circle it and take a look from the top .... This historical monyment is with a fantastic architecture , long history , memmorized in storyes , movies, games etc ...Was a great experience just to be close to it ...Ond bad thing .... way to long ques to go in and not to good managed ... closing doors in front peoples noses ... some where not as lucky as we where ..

Beautiful cathedral. This is a must for lovers of history. Free entry but if you want a tour of upstairs be prepared to pay and wait. Once inside take your time it's a wonderful experience and for the religious light a candle and pray
Speechless . Wow! I had never been so excited for the architecture of a place... Speechless, incredible, unbelievable. No words to describe it!
Spectacular. Wonderful inside and out, from a distance and close up. Far too many tourists, get there early I guess

Notre Dame for Mass while on vacation in France. We decided to go to Mass as part of our visit to Notre Dame. Mass is at 5 pm/ 17:00 on Saturdays. Security check for everyone. It is a must-see in Paris and visit Saint Chapelle also!

One of Paris must see. A visit to Paris wouldn't be complete without Cathédrale Notre Dame de Paris.
Not only is it worth for its amazing architecture, but also for the ambiance of its numerous alleys and corners.
You will undoubtly be in the center of Paris for various reasons; so you can't miss the visit!
Beautiful. We lined up early to enter the Cathedral. We were impressed with the detail and beauty it has to offer. Give yourself at least an hour to walk through and be amazed.
What a gorgeous building . No wonder why it took 200 years to build this church. The details and its shear size are massive. Take a walk around the sides and back its just incredible

Another Must See!. Another must-see if you're in Paris though we didn't spend much time inside. Still, we were glad we'd visited & the history of the building was very interesting. Probably one of the few attractions in Paris which has free entrance to the public.

Fabulous. We did a visit early in the morning so it was not crowded. Our tour director said that is the best time. He was right as we had no line about 9:00am. The Cathedral allows photography which a lot of places do not. Absolutely beautiful!

view. one of best cathedral , i visited the work of glass was amaze
I will suggest if your in Paris you must see it

Beautiful building and free. Even though this is a free to visit the building, I would happily pay to see this. It's really that good. Do yourself a favour and sit outside in early evening time (around 8pm in summer/early autumn) and listen to the bells ring.
Notre Dame Cathedral. Beautiful- worth seeing. Usually a large crowd and a long line to climb the tower. We skipped the tower. Beautiful at night- especially seen froma boat in the Seine.

massive dark age cathedral. What can you say, it's Notre Dame...the grand Dame of France and a must do in Paris for anyone with any remote historic knowledge. My favorite event in it's history is the crowning of Nepolian.

Famous For a Reason. Yes, this is a very touristed place, but deservedly so. Both outside and inside, this is one of the most stunningly beautiful cathedrals in the world. A visit inside is free; to climb the tower isn't cheap and there's usually a long line. The stained glass, the paintings, the statues and the tombs are amazing.

Enlightening & peaceful . A beautiful cathedral!! Well worth the visit!! There are security checks everywhere. After everything that's happened in Paris the past year I felt very safe. Notre Dame is a very peaceful & quiet place.

Just stunning!!!. I'm not a religious person, but I must to say that Notre Dame Cathedral is a whole experience. the architectural beauty of the building is just stunnig, inside and outside... Dont hesitate to enter and sit there for a while... the silence and peace (even with a lot of tourist there) is incredible.
Average. This cathedral's interior is nothing special. There are nicer churches in Paris. But the garden in the backyard is cosy.
Beautiful!. Another true treasure in Paris, and much more beautiful on the inside than the outside. Make sure to see the rose windows.
Wow. You have to admire the people who built these monuments to their faith. Just the scale let alone the detail and the shear magnitude of the entire project. Just stand in awe...go there.
AWESOME. It is SO cool to see Notre Dame!!! We stayed close by and got to pass it everyday. So fun! Went inside only once and loved it.
must see. should take in this site for historical purposes. we saw it with a guide who explained the significance of items and the history.

Breathtaking at night. Beautiful cathedral in a gorgeous area. Seeing the cathedral was one of the highlights of my trip. Definitely one to visit at night.
O

Astounding. The massive queue to get into the Cathedral moves very quickly so we didn't even feel we had to wait long. The Cathedral is fantastic inside and so very impressive, the extra charge to see the treasures in a side annexe isn't really worth it though.One thing you have to do is the visit to the top of the towers and visit the chimera and gargoyles

In the presence of God. We went to see Notre Dame around noon and only had to wait roughly 15 minutes as the queue moves very quickly. It was a huge benefit to have a professional guide explain the history, artwork, paintings, etc as it gave us a real appreciation of the spectacular beauty of this cathedral. There is no admittance fee but you are able to provide a small donation to light a candle on behalf of needed prayers or a loved one. The stained glass rose windows are breathtaking. I clearly felt I was in the presence of God throughout.
Very impressed . I liked this sight the most. Very impressive building in the heads of the city. Some nice streets and restaurants around it.

Beautiful church but filled with tourists. So. Many. Tourists.
The church is beautiful inside and out. I did not climb to the top as the line was far too long. Inside the church is beautiful and worth the long but quick line outside.
Love it!. I absolutely love this place. It's so beautiful. There are also lots of places near and it is in a wonderful location!

Great atmosphere. From the book I expected it to be bigger, so at first I was a bit disappointed. And there was a queue...But as we came inside, the service has begun. The music and women voice along with the light made it magnificent!
Amazing Architecture. It was so lovely from the outside but when I went inside it truly amazed me! It's gorgeous and a must see!
Beautiful and peaceful. Very beautiful church where we can find peace. We attended a Catholic Mass and was really revitalize

Brooding interior and incredible view. We visited Notre Dame and saw both the impressive and gothic interior (free) and queued and paid to go up to the top. It's an incredible building which is only made more impressive by its age. The climb to the top is quite reasonable with a stop just before the towers split and another at the top of the south tower with great views at both heights.

An awe inspiring cathedral.. No words can really describe this cathedral. You can walk in for a visit, book a guided or attend a service but regardless no visit to Paris us complete without a visit! It took about 500 years to build... And you leave feeling that you have only glimpsed a very little of its mystery and the secrets Hel within its walls!
Paris vacation. We toured on a Sunday and took part in mass. Having been through many Cathedrals I enjoyed how well lit and active this one is.
Another Beautiful Building. Hardly queued late afternoon to get in, arrived by Bateau Bus (a great way to see the sights !) Very heavy police/army presence.

The architecture, the history... Amazing. We were there on a Sunday and the Sunday mass was on and it was simply amazing! Huge crowd seated inside and even though you are at the back there are TV monitors for you to see the mass and hear the singing through speakers.. Awe inspiring church organ and gothic décor inside, out.. Security was around the premises and at the entrance, thorough checks as you enter

Very quick visit. We visited very briefly as part of a tour. We just beat the crowds, because the queue was massive when we were leaving.Very interesting; there was a display there showing how the Cathedral was built. You don't have to be religious the pay a visit.

Breathtaking. Amazing to visit. The stain glass work was exquisite. The confessionals were modern and added. ( really thought that took conflicted with the architecture of the inside of the Church.) If you only plan to visit one Church please pick this one.
Donation only - go early. We went to the Cathedral as soon as it opened and even though it was prime tourist season, had no waiting. You only need about 15 mins but a nice stop to say you have been!
Lovely church. This church is huge. I loved it though so peaceful. The building itself was nicely built,would visit again.

Good day out with the kids.. Its is very difficult to review such famous sites. The best advise is if travelling with young kids, that it keeps them occupied enough for long enough for them not to get too tiered. A couple of your is just right

No photos means no photos. Our visit was ruined by people who clearly can't read the signs that read "No photos". Couldn't stand and look at something for very long before someone squeezed their phones in for a photo. Have some darn respect! Safe to say we didn't stay in there for very long.

Surprise visit to Notre Dame. We were early at the meeting point for another tour outside Notre Dame early on a Sunday morning. No queues around so we decided to go inside. Sunday service was on and the music was beautiful. We had a good look around lite a candle and enjoyed the experience very much.

Great and... free !. What an atmosphere inside this cathedral especially in winter during mass...just go, watch and enjoy this atmosphere. Please have some respect for the place and Christian faith...not sure on the interest to pay to go in the tower...

Stunning , sacred,. this stunning and really sacred church was incredible. The sheer magnitude of the building is impressive. I will say it is rather dark in some places so you can't see everything but nonetheless beautiful. Bring 2 euros for the offering, you can light a candle and say a pray.

Inspiring. This is a must do visit in Paris - started in the 12th century with initial build of 200 years- it has all the atmosphere of the dark ages with an excellent pictorial display inside the church
And if I'd a working church with free access - awesome place

Tours de (The towers of) Notre Dame was best. Notre Dame is amazing inside but what was more spectacular was the view over the city from the Towers. Not ideal if you don`t like heights or claustrophobic but worth the 402 stair climb! Also amazing to note that the stones have been climbed by millions of visitors (13 million for the main church) and this amazing place has been in existence since the 13th century!
Sunday Mass. What a beautiful Cathedral. We had seen it 25 years ago and it was just as lovely. It's a must see in Paris.

WOW! It's free so why not!. We arrived here to see a massive long line. Dont get intimidated by it, the line is quick to move and it's worth it.Although it's a little dark inside, the magnificent structure is awesome to see.It's great to read up on the history.Dont forget to wear sensible clothing to get into this cathedral!
A must when in Paris. Even though the line to get in or on top of the Notre Dame is rather long, it is still nice to do so and much cheaper than getting on top of the Eiffel Tower.

Suck it up and take the stairs!. Walking inside is beautiful, especially durin mass but I'm not very religious. The stained glass windows are gorgeous though. I'm more about the architecture: flying buttresses and gargoyle galore! The stairs are a bit cramped but it's worth it! I'm a student so i got in free. The view is unparalleled you can see the Eiffel Tower and la defense and les invalides and a bunch of other places. You can see the old bells in the tower too. A second flight takes you all the way to the top and its marvelous. A bit weird bc they make people go in shifts but other than that, very nice!
Amazing. Such an amazing and beautiful place very busy but still worth the visit. Would recommend seeing this place on your trip to Paris
Awe inspiring. A beautiful cathedral with lots of tourists. A lot of activity in the plaza outside of the church as well. We stayed right across the street and the ringing bells were a delight.
Mum and daughter visit . Beautiful cathedral. Strict security as you would expect but only small delay in entering . Lived up to expectations and well worth going for all ages.

Beautiful both inside annd out. We walked over from the Latin Quarter area. It is beautiful from every angle. It was a beautiful day. We walked around inside, make sure you take your time, there is a lot to see. I wanted to climb to the top, but it was already closed (I believe the last time was 4:30.) I would not miss this and it is right on the Seine River, Just a beautiful area.

A Cathederal of rich splendour. I have been to Paris many times and I think that any visit would be incomplete without a trip to Notre Dame Cathederal. I consider it one of the 3 must see cathederals in the world where the accoustics must be experienced to be appreciated. If you can visit during a Mass you have the bbest chance to hear either a choir or the organ and I am sure that you will not be disappointed.If you can visit

It's a big cathedral just liek othe big cathedrals, magnificent. There's some good history around the building and architecture of Notre Dame, but at the end of the day it's just another big cathedral.

Old church, not to be missed. A church of legends (or a lot of stories for sure). The architecture is fantastic and the inside of the church was amazing. Must be seen to appreciate. The line for the tour of the towers was too long, so we weren't able to see those.
Amazing Place!. This was a beautiful cathedral and worth a visit. If you have extra time, pay the 5 euro and see the special collection of wealth and the fragment and one nail from the cross.

Free Entry. Called in here on a cloudy day, we were surprised to find it was free entry, (unlike st Pauls).Truly a masterpiece of gothic architecture, if ever you are in Paris it's well worth a visit.

Surprised and Somewhat Disappointed. I've seen a lot of beautiful churches and I expected Notre Dame to make them pale by comparison, but it didn't. I think what disappointed me was its condition. Paint was peeling and it wasn't very clean. I can understand it not being immaculate with thousands walking through it every day, but yet I expected better. By all means, do go to see it. I just had unmet expectations.

Ssshh and be quick!?!. I loved this but the kids didn't. They were bored! Security was very good. We took less than an hour here. The stained glass windows were amazing, as was the structure. It was packed and difficult to get a real sense of history. I preferred the Vatican. My husband and I shall return without children perhaps?!

Must be seen by all tourist visiting paris. Very nice Cathedrale ! Don't forget to visite Saint-Louis Church "La Sainte Chapelle" witch is just nearby Notre-Dame church and whom is even more impressive

Superb but needs better security. Absolutely awesome, beautiful canal next to it, some amazing statues and very emotional in and around notre dam. Poor security around the area and we all felt unsafe. Just be vigilant and all is good.
The Bells :). Beautiful & majestic, another must see when visiting Paris and if you have the energy and patience to queue walk up to the top of tower, the gargoyles are something to behold!
Inspiring cathedral. We enjoyed a Bach concert on a Tuesday evening and then went back the next morning to tour the cathedral. It's beautiful and serene, a lovely house of prayer!
Charming!. The Notre-Dame Cathedral is wonderful! It took 200 years to be built! It really pays off to climb its 422 degrees and see Paris from up there .. And also, the gargoyles! So beautiful!
Well worth the visit. Incredible, imposing building with the highlight being a visit to the roof and close up look at the gargoyles.

Get Your Guide - Skip the Line - Guided Tour . Defiantly recommend doing the guided tour, you go right up to the top - ON THE ROOF!
Our guide was lovely, and knew a lot of information.
We didn't actually go inside the Cathedral as we ran out of time.
Well worth the money.

Uplifting visit.. We had the pleasure of touring the cathedral. The architecture both inside and out was phenomenal. During our visit there was a mass and it was uplifting to sit within this grand Cathedral and enjoy service.
On My Bucket List. Felt so luck to have been able to visit this Cathedral. Extremely beautiful and will take your breath away! I must visit for all who appreciate history and amazing architecture.
Don't miss it!. The Notre Dame Cathedral does not disappoint, it is a must see. The amazing items seen here are one of a kind and absolutely worth any line one could stand in.

Go to the Top!. We visited Notre Dame and got a skip the line tour through CityWonders. Not only did we skip the line but we got access to the top of the cathedral with amazing views of the city. Highly recommended.
Notre Dame. With a bit of a queue but still not that much. Really beautiful cathedral. Another place you definitely can´t miss in Paris,
The one and only. The one and only Notre Dame. A must see in Paris. No sign off the hunchback was just about the only disappointment :) :P

Simply beautiful and peaceful. The architecture is simply marvellous. Its very peaceful inside the cathedral. It is one of the finest examples of "French Gothic architecture", and is among the largest and most well-known church buildings in the world. I sat inside for sometime and it was quite peaceful.

Absolutely gorgeous! . Upon arrival at this stunning Cathedral you're presented with very articulated archways, and a beautiful facade. When you enter the cathedral you get to see all of this stunning stained glass on display along with a beautiful altar. On top of the amazing architecture, when you climb up to the tower you get a beautiful view of Paris; one that simply cannot be beat.

Breath-taking!!. Absolutely amazing .. The grandeur .. The architecure of the place is unbelievble.Make sure you save some time to climb to the top . The view is wonderful .It costs 10 euros per person and they only tell you this after you wait for an hour then climb to the first floor.But the view is defiently worth it.It's not so hard to climb . You will take ur time and do it slowly but it will be worth the effort in the end .

Dirty and not worth a visit!. I have visited many churches and enjoyed the beautiful art and decor. This was an exception. Thick dust and dirt everywhere - on the walls, on rekvilikier, everywhere you looked up, there was dust and dirt. No, certainly not worth a visit.

Majestic. Usually not impressed by religious structures but the Notre Dame gave me some chills through my spine. Peaceful, majestic and huge. I`m happy we went inside, lit a candle and walked though the church.
An a amazing Building. What an amazing building and even better from the inside. It's a must see if your in Paris and it's free to enter!

Beautiful!. Norte Dame Cathedral is actually a free visit! Along with the breathtaking beauty of this cathedral, you will see amazing works of art. You can guide yourself through at your own pace, use an audio guide for 5€ or download your own guide before going. Regardless, it's worth the visit. Don't let the long line discourage you, it moves very fast!

Nice outside - nothing inside. It is free to go inside but you have to pay (and stay in the line) is you want to get to the tower. Much better view from Eiffel Tower. Notre dame looks nice outside especially when it is dark.

Second trip to Notre Dame. Visited Notre Dame the first time in 2010. This visit was different because security was in effect. We were able to attend a Sunday Mass and it was magnificent. This is a must see.

Iconic cathedral. This is a very good designed cathedral with two square prismatic tower. The inside is great and you will love the paintings on the walls. But if you want to hear about the history of it, you better ask your guide about why it took more than 100 years to build it and why the towers are not symetrical. It is located on the Cite island.

Beautiful. The que was huge but disappeared very quickly. It is free to enter and the inside is as beautiful as the outside, big stained glass windows and lovely statues!The only thing I didn't like was the coins they were selling with the popes face on but as they do not charge an entrance fee I'm sure they need to find a way to make money for cleaning etc.

Definitely go and don't get suckered into a "skip the line" tour. I love Notre Dame. It's beautiful and iconic and your heart may skip a beat like mine whenever you see it from afar. It's moving to think of the devotion, love, and dedication that went into its construction and maintenance.But whatever you do, don't buy a skip the line, guided tour.First of all, Notre Dame is a functioning cathedral and does not charge for admission. It is FREE. And everyone has to wait in line for the security check and to get in. There is a line (and a ticket) to climb to the top. I didn't do that so I can't comment. My recollection is that it wasn't very expensive.Second, don't pay for a guided tour. Everyone has to be very quiet and this puts a damper on your ability to listen to a guide let alone ask follow up questions. At regular intervals, they blare: "SILENCE!" in about a dozen different languages as a reminder that people are there to worship. Upload an audioguide on your phone and walk around on your own.For these reasons,

The high tech structure of its day. The cathedral is dedicated to Our Lady and the rose window in the facade is testament to this. The beautiful ribbed vaulting and pointed arches were possible due to the high tech structural technique of the day - the flying buttress. There is a line to enter the cathedral and a security check but it moves quickly. Admission is free. We will return.

I kissed the Holy Crown of Thorns, the relique of Nortre Dame!!!. I visited on the day there was a ceremony for the Holy Crown of Thorns. Many people were seated and was participated in the ceremony. I was one of these who sat down and were praying rosary at the far from the altar area. But the seated people were eventually asked to stand up to form the line toward the relique. Everyone on the line kissed the holy ring. So did I. The relique prayer card was sold for 2€ for these lined up people. What I liked most was these people had no discrimination from their ethnicity. Just the French ability would be a matter but that was all. The prayer cards had several language choices such as French, Spanish, English, and so on. If you are a Catholic and speak French, these big French cathedrals are worth a visit during the big mass and cerebration time. The nearest metro station is Cita and not far from it. The entrance sometimes got crowded for the security checks.

An icon from my childhood. What is not to love about Notre Dame Cathedral. The building is extraordinary, the stained glass windows, the towers and turrets are out of this world. It defies belief that this complex building could have been constructed in times long gone. I studied the flying buttresses (a key component to the engineering of the cathedral) while at school in the 70s and it was a joy to see and understand them.I didn't see Quasimodo but I can imagine him swinging trough the rafters and sitting on the gargoyles.Security was very tight but the queues were short.
Skightly over rated. Historical structure, but the fact is not much happened there. The stain glass is from the 40's. Go to mass and have a quick look around and leave (don'tplan too much time here).

Walked up the tower. This is the 2nd time we walked up the tower - I wanted more photos of the gargoyles. We arrived around 10:30 on a Sunday morning and waited about 15 to 20 minutes for our turn. Cost 10 euro each.
Beautiful building. We visited late afternoon/early evening which coincided with the Vespers service which made our visit rather special.

Spectacular. An absolutely beautiful Cathedral that is certainly worthy of visiting should you be lucky enough to be in Paris. The Cathedral itself is free to explore but there is a small fee to climb the towers. I recommend paying and visiting the towers as the views are unsurpassable.

One of the wonders of contruction. Notre Dame Cathedral is a wonder of construction. How it was constructed so long ago without the tools we have today is amazing. The stained glass windows are beautiful. Very busy with people.
Medievel Miracle. Notre Dame is awesome and when you consider when it was built you really get an appreciation for its beauty and architectural greatness.

Beautiful stained glass windows. Lovely example of gothic architecture. Beautiful stained glass windows to see. Queue to get in was very quick moving. You have to pay to go into the treasury and is not included on your Paris Pass, if you have one. Sign is not very prominently displayed and the staff member was tired of telling people this. Didn't go up the stairs to the bell tower as had already climbed the Arc de Triomphe in the morning.

Much bigger than you think!. This is a beautiful church that is open to the public to view. It does cost extra for you to go to the top viewing levels. There are sections that are not open to the public but you can take pictures from the gates. It does not a great ventilation, so be prepared for smells and heat. But that's the only downside.

Beautiful architecture. A must see for any architecture fans. The cathedral is beautiful and very solemn. It's a great place to take a few minutes out and contemplate life. There are various side chapels around the side of the cathedral, several enormous stained glass windows and of course the bells. There is a separate tour of the crypt I didn't take but would be of interest to history buffs. There are queues but they move very fast. Worth a visit just for the carved montages of the life of Christ around the outside of the main altar.
Gorgeous. Must see .... Beautiful stained glass windows Great for art lovers and architecture . Stunning architecture

Simply VAST. Should be a welcome spiritual experience but not when the crowds of tourists ignore the requests to stay out of the areas intended for prayer, worship, and praise, and forever take flash photos of things they have no intention of understanding. Is it a place of worship, or a tourist attraction? The tourist visit code / etiquette undermines the principle purpose of the building, is far from respectful of the faith it represents, and loses the opportunity to present an awe inspiring, or even meaningful understanding of a formative basis of Western society. Perhaps it does represent our evolving society, selfie obsessed, loud, brash. "Help me to feed my children" the beggars plead to the queues outside who have neither eyes, nor ears to help. "For the blind shall not see, and the deaf shall not hear", but they can queue up to take photos to share on social media telling their friends "I'm having more fun than you are!".Free to go in but expect to queue for the security checks. Just imagine for a moment the guards represent St Peter, at the pearly gates of heaven, and they are asking to peer into your hearts rather than your bags..... what might they find?
Beautiful building. Phenomenal to look out, so famous, must look out for the gargoyle statues, lots of history here, well worth a visit

Beautiful. A must see. It is very beautiful, and serene.On Wednesday there is a free tour with a guide at 2 , if you want to know more about the cathedral.The entrance is for free, but if you want to go up to the towers and have a great view of Paris, the ticket is for 7 Euros.
Beautiful!!. Must visit place in Paris.The architecture is phenomenal and its beautiful inside out.The entry is off course free and the place has an amazing vibe.
Beautiful architecture for the period. Loved looking at the inside and external features of this historical site. Always busy, so prepare yourself for a small time wait to enter.
breathtaking. a real must visit when in Paris, inside and out were truly amazing. It is free to get into the cathedral, the stained glass inside is breathtaking, a very pleasurable experience :)
Amazing!!!!. Just wow - so much history in this one building! Buy a skip the line ticket if you can, and get tickets to the bell tower - best view of Paris!

A must see during the Paris visit. One of those places you have to visit when you visit Paris. The building itself is really beautiful and it doesn't cost anything to visit the church itself (to get into the towers extra payment is needed).

Visit the towers too. You're not going to come to Paris and not visit Notre Dame. But you may not think about the towers. I got in line accidentally and ended up climbing the towers. Well worth it. Great views of Paris. Included with the Paris museum pass.
Open tour bus | Beautiful. The Notre Dame Cathedral is a must to see. If you are lucky enough to have a look inside it would be recommended. Only saw it from the open tour bus but is a must see.
Unbelievable! . Unbelievable! I will never forget. Everybody should see it. The history, the spirit!!! Strongly recommend

A Must See. Don't let the long lines to enter stop you from visiting, as the queue does move quickly. Admission is also free and the building is cool, which is especially nice on a hot day. There is an option to go to the roof to tour the gargoyles, but we ran out of time and I am not sure if this costs money. Others however recommended it.

Must visit in Paris!. One of my favourite cathedrals in Europe. Entrance is free but there is a security line where they check your bags. I went on a Sunday morning at 9.30a.m and got in within 5 minutes. However it got really busy in the next 30 minutes with tourists arriving via the tour busses. I recommend attending the mass for the experience even if you are not religious. A must visit when you are in Paris!

Historic Beauty Presence. Very impressive architecture as marketed in movies, beautiful must see when you are in Paris - however do not forget to visit the Sainte-Chapelle beside the ministry of justice, that one is magic.

Amazing glass windows. Playing to see the treasury was a good investment, it's small, but have some spectacular items. Only bad thing: everything is written in french, so you don't quite understand exactly whats written unless you speak french.

If you are going to climb anything, climb Notre Dame!. Notre Dame was the most beautiful cathedral I saw while in France. I climbed all of the important monuments but Notre Dame was my favorite view by far! Well worth the climb and money!

Enjoyed the tour. This is a magnificent Cathedral that took a few hundred years to complete to what it is today, and of the famed Homer novel that features Quasi Moto. You must be in good shape to walk the 377 steps up to the top, and you can't be too wide in girth since the passageways are quite narrow. The view is outstanding, and you can see two of the 4 bells in one of the 2 towers since they always close one off to use for ringing the bells and the other for tourists to take photos. The architecture is magnificent and inside on the main floor is HUGE! The stained glass is something to view in awe. A must see! It is free to go inside the Cathedral, and a nominal fee to go up to the top. That is why I checked off "not sure" below for "Is it free?"
Make sure to go up till the towers!. The view is amazing from the top but watch out the close early around 4. If you are under 25 and from europe the entrance is free to the towers!

Simply amazing!. My partner and I are not religious however the Notre Dame Cathedral is spectacular!We went during a Sunday service to look around (you can still look around even while mass is on without disturbing anyone) which I highly recommend as you get to hear the amazing sound of the huge Notre Dame organs.Doesn't really make a difference what time you attend the line is always massive to get in however early morning would be best and shortest wait time.Although it wasn't strictly enforced I would recommend females have their shoulders and knees covered and males the same. It isn't enforced as strictly in Italy however it is preferred and considered respectful.There is an option to climb the tower which we didn't do however I hear it's amazing.
A Must. Free entrance, incredible entrance. The stained glass is pretty amazing and visiting the towers for the view and gargoyles is worth it.

Must see. I have been here every time I come to Paris and it is still amazing to see. Don't miss it!!! The neighborhood around it is great for walking . We went to a Sunday mass which I will always remember .

Beautiful view of the city from the towers. Cathedral itself is very impressive and free of charge. Access to the towers are covered by the museum pass and worth going up. You get a closer view of the sculptures on top and can even go see the two bells. Just beware that there are quite a few stairs, however, it's broken down into three main climbs so you are able to take a break in-between.

A vast and towering adventure!. In Notre Dame, there's a place to place your lock and make sure your write your name and toss the key to the river. Love in Paris, the city of love: two sweethearts on a bridge over the Seine. They write their names on a padlock. They hook it to an available spot in the bridge’s wire-mesh parapet, the railing that runs along its edges, and fasten the lock, securing it—and, they hope, their love—forever. They throw the key in the river.The bridge links the 4th Arrondissement, at the Île de la Cité, to the 5th Arrondissement, between the quai de Montebello and the quai de la Tournelle.
Busy!. Very beautiful but very very busy! Thoroughly enjoyed myself nonetheless. Good luck trying to get a picture without anyone getting in your way!

A great place for history. Wow! What an amazing experience. The fact that this place has been around for 1000 years, I love how it is kept up. The stain glass windows are worth the visit by itself. Go if you can

Love the visit...but lines were way too long. Always enjoy visiting Notre Dame Cathedral when I'm in Paris. Also enjoyed visiting the Archeological museum out front. The only negative is that the lines to get in are way too long. I remember when one could just walk in and visit like going to any church. Too bad there are crazy nuts in this world who ruined things for the rest of us with having to have all the security.
Magnificent . Definitely should not miss. I visited in Dec 2007. The visit is still memorable. There was a light drizzle and the queue to enter was still long. Magnificent interiors.
Charming Church. We felt the grace and charm of a old church when we visited this church. With it's low light environment inside and the sunlight through the windows it was really beautiful.

Loved this cathedral. This is free to visit (quite rare in Paris to visit for free) everyone was quiet in here and very respectful and it really has the most beautiful stained glass windows. Well worth a visit
Sightseeing. Outside is a spectacle all on its own...and free to go inside....amazing.We went end of season but expect long crowds albeit it goes through very quickly

Bigger and more beautiful than I expected . We were staying in the Marais area and walked past Notre-Dame nearly everyday. The garden behind Notre-Dame is so peaceful. The actual cathedral with the standard glass windows is beautiful from the inside. We also claimed the tower which gave great views of the city.

Beautiful. Absolutely stunning. We were luckyand had no waiting to get it. Tight security which was reassuring. Gorgeous ornate architecture. Free to get into but have to pay if going up to the tower. Worth a visit.

Stunning architecture, Beautiful interior. This Cathedral was free to enter. There was a small queue but it moved along quickly.Inside you get to wander freely and admire the truly beautiful stained glass windows and altars. It's so peaceful and impressive. Definitely worth a visit!You can pay too climb the bell towers. The queue for this was around the side of the building and was very long so we decided not to do that this time.

Beautiful architecture, central location. One of the must do in Paris. We walked from Hotel de ville to Norte Dame and then all teh way to Louvre. It was long but a really good walk with our 4 yr old in buggy. we went in August and the line was really long so it took us approx 60 mins to get it. I have been here before a few years back but was still charmed. wish it was little less crowded so could have admired the beauty a bit more.

Musy see. One of the highlights in Paris. I like the view from across the River, from the "back" side at the point of the Island.. A good place to take a break is in the park on the opposite side from the main entrance.

Righteous!. Visited at around 9:30 on Sunday morning and get to experience an amazing service. The building is beautiful, amazing architecture. Be wary of the queues, one minute it's 30 metres long, the next you can just walk straight in.
It was brilliant!

Amazing attraction!. Have been to the Notre Dame a few times and I get amazed every time - but this was my first visit to the museum inside. They have some interesting artifacts but the 5 Euro entrance seemed excessive for the stuff they have.Entrance to the Notre Dame is free so I think it is ok if they are trying to make it up with the museum! Try to go when during the service when they are playing the music- it is an amazing experience.

Worthwhile free entry visit. I visited the Notre Dame Cathedral on Saturday 27 August 2016. If you queue up at the front entrance of the cathedral it is FREE ENTRY. When you are in front of the cathedral there is another queue on the left hand side which charges for a tour. Once inside the cathedral I was able to walk around at my own pace and take photos. There is many signs advising visitors to be quiet. I think this is due to service taking place or allowing others to be able to pray without the distraction of noise / talking.

A beautiful, stunning, gorgeous place to spend an hour. Take time to sit and reflect... beware old ladies who admonish you for using an iPhone camera in a prayer place... (but, really... it was not disrespectful... just because she got there 15 minutes after I'd been doing my prayers). *winks*. No visit to Paris would be complete without "the bells, the bells"!

Quick line. Beautiful inside! . Beautiful! I arrived around three and was lucky there wasn't a big line and it was moving rather quickly. Inside is fantastic beautiful architecture. I wanted to do the climb too but the queue was very long and wasn't really moving. If it is a sunny day I would recommend a hat and an umbrella to provide some shade in the sunshine while lining up!

A great quick walk though. As a Protestant, the church didn't have a huge religious value to my wife and I so we just wanted to do a quick walk though. It's free. Can't go wrong. We stood in line for maybe 5 minutes in the later portion of the afternoon. Go in just to see it. You've never seen anything like it. It's huge. Some of the stained glass is absolutely amazing. That's coming from a guy that isn't interested in art at all. We spent 20 minutes there just looking around. Amazing.
Beautiful. Captivating. Like entering a different era in time. Limited access to the whole cathedral for obvious reasons but a must see.

Beautiful. Well worth a visit to appreciate the internal and external beauty. I liked the fact that there is no admission charge but there is plenty to spend your money on inside of you wish to. There are numerous places where you can buy a candle and light it in memory of a loved one or a prayer. The machines selling medals with representations of the Pope and others were not in such good taste I think, although I appreciate they do need to generate money.
Notre damw. Great for a little look around, doesn't take more than 15/20 minutes, but you do have to queue at security which is to be expected this can be a little while

an amazing piece of architecture. To avoid queues visit the cathedral before 9 am. We walked straight in and were able to walk around without too much of a crowd. Walking up to the top is a must do, the view is amazing and you can appreciate the building so much more from the top. However to do this you need to re-queue around the left hand side (as you look at the front) of the building. This doesn't open until 10 but if you want to avoid queuing for hours begin to wait around the side at 9.30. You will of course have to wait until 10 but it is well worth it to avoid hours of standing around.
Really beautiful . Didn't go inside since it was such a long que when we walked by around noon ( and the sun was scorching) but even from the outside it's magnificent!

A must. Pretty magnificent. We happened to be in the church when one of the services begun and so we had some nice music and opera singing while we walked around. Really impressive. Worth waiting in the long line to see this.
Notre Dame Catherdral. We were lucky enough to visit the cathedral while it was open. There was a mass going on and the singing was beautiful. The cathedral was stunning.

Absolutely Magnificent!. The most famous of the Gothic Churches of the Middle Ages, this was one of our favourite stops in Paris. Located on the banks of the picturesque Seine, it is an imposing and unforgettable sight. The audio tour/ guided tours take you through the cathedral's architecture and history - and I think are well worth getting to really know the place. There are plenty of places to eat around the Seine, and schedule time if you can for a walk by the river before or after..

Beautiful gothic csthedrsl. I've visited a couple of times - there's a security check, but it's quick and free to enter. The stained glass windows are mesmerising and the gothic architecture is suitably awe inspiring. The information panels describing the phases of construction and renovation of the cathedral gave a useful overview.

Brought tears to my eyes. It is so beautiful! Words can't describe how moved I was. So much beauty and it was free! We went early in the morning on a Tuesday and waited less than 1 min for security though when we left the line was all the way across the plaza. It's free to enter, most of the painting descriptions are in French though there is a detailed history of how the cathedral was built in English. My only complaint is they ask that you don't talk and the other people there couldn't respect that. They have active mass going on and they are kind enough to let tourist see the beauty so I would hope more people could show them that respect. But a must see.

Wonderful . Visually stunning both inside and out. Worth walking inside as it amazing. Get up and close to see all the little detail on the building itself and study the inside and all the intricate details.
Beautiful. Stunning, a service was ongoing when we arrived and the choir were fantastic!!! Such a peaceful place even with a huge abundance of tourists within!!! Well worth a visit!

Still awe-inspiring. I never get tired of visiting here. The interior is amazing and so is the exterior. One of these visits I hope to be able to attend mass here., so I will have to keep returning to Paris until I do. It is also a very lively area at night with the street performers and the exterior lighting is nice here just like everywhere else in Paris.

Notre Dame Csathedral. The beauty of the Cathedral takes your breath away. We even were fortunately to be there when they were having a service. Walk to the top and even got to stand near the bell. One of the best places we visited.
Beautiful. It's a picture and a half from just outside, but the inside is just as good. With free admission I suggest you take a look yourself, the stained glass windows are beautiful.

Beautiful inside and out. Notre Dame is a must see, if for no other reason than everyone back home will ask you about it! It is beautiful though, and it's free to tour inside. You can even attend a service if you want -- just look up the service schedule on the internet.

Nice work. We loved the walk along the river up to Notre Dame. Very peaceful and inspiring. The cathedral is done beautifully from the outside and well worth a visit. We didn't go in as the queues were very long and have seen the best one this trip already in Amiens (check that review out). Still well worth a trip even only to the outside like us and a stroll along the river Seine.

Awe-Inspiring. The works in this church, from paintings to sculptures to the altars are unbelievable. I was in awe of the work that had to be put in to make these things. Felt so proud to be a catholic being in this cathedral.
In all its glory.... I did a quick walkabout before the tour offered at the cathedral itself. NDC is a must visit which is easy to get into as the lines move fast!!

Sunday Mass. We were fortunate to enter during mass on Sunday. Hearing the mass and hymns in French was a beautiful experience and nearly brought me to tears. Don't matter what your faith is to appreciate.

Went up the tower, saw Paris from top. Entering the cathedral was free, but to go up the tower, we (tourist) paid 10 Euro each. My sis was studying in London and was below 25 y.o., her ticket was FREE. Winding up the tower was fun, enjoying the Paris view from high up was fun. Taking photos with gargoyles was fun, looking at the bell was fun also. Everything was fun! Worth the money and exercise. Note: go early, enter the cathedral (opens at 8.30am), then line up for the tower at 9am+ (opens by 10am). If you come at 10am, the line will be long and it moves pretty slowly, going up by batches.My sis and I came late the first day, we gave up and left, and came back another day early to beat the crowd. It's a rather affordable way to see Paris!

Beautiful. We didn't have time to head inside but walked around and sat in front of it to enjoy the amazing architecture and people watch. My daughter enjoyed watching the guys selling food to feed the pigeons and people take photos of numerous pigeons perched all over them! Going inside will definitely be on my list for next trip to Paris!

Original Gothic masterpiece . We thoroughly enjoyed the walk around the main cathedral, including the information boards charting it's almost thousand year history. It's free too and the line outside moved quite quickly. You can pay to go up to the towers but we didn't have time. Recommended.

Incredibly beautiful Cathedral!. Located at the Ile de la Citè and surrounded by the River Seine, this glorious gothic Cathedral has been immortalized by Victor Hogo with his renombrated novel The Hunchback of Notre Dame. Outstanding front with three porticos: The Mother Mary at the left (exit ), The Last Judgment at the middle and The Saint Anne at the right side (entrance) . Enormous naves with lots of marvelous sculptures and paintings, and of course the very famous stained glasse "roses" makes this Cathedral one of the most visited and recognized churches of the world. The outside is also a very particular one, with the innovative flying buttresses, the very well known gargoyles and chimeras the beautiful relaxing garden at the back and the tower which you can climb up (almost 400 steep stairs) to get fantastic views of Paris. Daily masses at 8 a.m., noon and 6:15 ( Mon-Fri), and at 6:30 p.m. Sat.-Sun.

Absolutely beautiful. Security was thorough which made the line a tad long to get in, but it was worth the wait. The architectural beauty and stained glass were absolutely beautiful. There was a mass being conducted when we were there and we enjoyed listening to some beautiful music. Definitely worth a visit.

Sacred Music in the nave of Notre Dame de Paris. What a setting! Napoleon proclaimed himself emperor metres from our seat. The organ is majestic and the A Capella voices were heavenly. Notre Dame is free to visit before 7 pm. Steeped in history and with a special place for John Paul II it is definitely worth finding if you're in Paris. Enjoy the mediaeval stonemasons view of heaven and hell. The gargoyles are a treat.

Beautiful. Cathedral was just as pretty as anticipated. Unfortunately, the day we visited they were having an ordaining in the evening and roped off the front half and the entire center of the cathedral. Extremely disappointing. We still saw the artifacts on the outer walls but missed the grandeur of the altar. The outside has some great history and we listened to a free tour guide there. I will say I feel the Notre Dame in Montreal was more breathtaking. Not sure if it is because I visited there first our because we were limited on our view here or maybe the combination of both. Still a sight to see.

Amazing. My niece and I loved visiting Notre Dame! The queues were a bit long for security checks but I'm glad they're being so cautious. It would be terrible for something to happen to this incredibly beautiful cathedral. It is not t be missed!
Maybe my favorite place in Paris. do not miss this.If you are able to climb the 400 steps up the tower...the gargoyles and view is terrific!And to hear the bells...outstanding!
Must see list.. This is a fantastic building, detailed gothic architecture,peaceful yet beautiful. You can feel the history come alive with the stained glass and artifacts like The Crown of Thorns.

Interesting. Must see! You can climb up to have a panoramic view of paris which is 10 euros and too many stairs. Or you can just see the cathédrale for free which is also amazing with the history information in it. Which is quite interesting...
Must see inside. First day we went there noon and the line was crazy long.. next day we went there right when it opens and there were only about 20 other people inside with us, that was really cool.

Spectacular. Line going into the church was somewhat long, but moved fast. Tightened security in effect. Magnificent inside. Recommend walking outside around the church for another perspective. Didn't take the steps to the top as the line in the middle of the day was huge.
Magnificent building but a bit tacky. It's a beautiful building with all the glory/story but like other landmarks in the area it's always crowded.
Amazing cathedral. We visited Notre Dame eon our second day in Paris. There was no cost to visit this beautiful cathedral. The stained glass was magnificent.
Spectacular Gothic architecture. From the outside alone this Cathedral is stunning! Could spend all day walking around it. Inside it's beautiful and well worth visiting.

Not the most atmospheric place of worship, but worth visiting. A "must-see" but it's worth choosing your time carefully in order to miss the worst of the crowds. Attempts have been made to try to instil a religious ambience but the door staff issuing commands to "Shushh" don't exactly improve things. Dark and gloomy interior - the exterior is worth studying though, including the east end, with its flying buttresses and gargoyles.
A lovely Cathedral. A must see if you can find the time, since we were tied up for time we had to see it only from outside, nevertheless well worth a visit, even if its only from the outside.
Spectacular!. What a place! Just from the outside you notice the rich history that this cathedral holds. It was raining the day we visited but beautiful nonetheless.

Worth the wait. This is a beautiful building and you should not be put off by the line to go for a visit. We visited on a Sunday and mass was in session when we were inside but this only added to the grandness of the place, particularly when the choir started to sing. The visit to the main part of the cathedral is free so well worth visiting if you are in Paris for the day or longer.
Wow!. Can't believe it is free entry to this fantastic cathedral. A must visit!! Good rainy day excursion and the gargoyles are awesome if you are not afraid of heights!
Beautiful cathedral . Free entry into cathedral. Amazing stain glass windows.Sat quietly for a while. Great for peace, prayer and quiet.

Lovely building....worth a visit.. Don't be put off by the queues outside..with the current heightened security status, the entrance staff were checking bags and although there seemed to be at least 200 people in the queue stretching across the square, we were inside the building within 10 minutes. There are sections around the outer circle of the cathedral, each dedicated to a different saint, person or monastic order etc. It makes for a very interesting visit and you get to 'choose your saint' if you wish to light a candle for someone you would like to remember while there.....suggested donation of 2 Euro's per candle. You can also take a while to pray or take in the stunning surroundings in the middle of the cathedral if you also want to. The building only takes you 30-45 minutes to walk round, but there's just enough time to make sure you to rub St Peter's foot and guarantee your entrance through the pearly gates also!!
Beautiful church. We visited this as part of a tour package, with a guide who explained all of the beautiful statues, windows and pictures. It is worth a visit to see the outside and inside.
Must see. You can feel the hunchback looking down on you as you walk around. This is a wonderful building, ornate, beautiful, tranquil, ..... oh lal la really worth a visit.

Free of charge. Touring the Notre Dame is free of charge, expect long lines and a charge for the tower.
Great history of the timeline and building of the Cathedral inside for history buffs.

My Favorite Cathedral in the World. Hands down, this is my favorite cathedral. It is huge and ornate and beautiful and fascinating, but the thing I love the most about it is the atmosphere. It's like I can feel the history, thousands of people passing though, centuries of building, centuries of prayers. The square out front is my favorite people-watching spot in Paris, with plenty of benches and low walls to perch on. I like to visit both on my first day in Paris and my last.
Stunning stained glass. Do not miss this beautiful cathedral! Although crowded, we were able to get in rather quickly and enjoyed the brilliant stained glass.
Mystique... After waiting near 30 minutes to enter, once inside, you'll feel the mysteries of this impressive architecture..

Exceeded my expectations . What a magnificent place! I have seen the great structures of Rome and Istanbul, but Notre Dame tops them all. It doesn't look so big outside, but inside it goes on and on, and for an 800 year old building it is in great shape and we were lucky enough to also catch a mass. Not to be missed!

Pari Icon. Beautiful architecture and stained glass windows. This is a must see icon of Paris. Make sure you go outside and walk around the cathedral. In the back there is a beautiful park with fountain, flowers, large square shaped trees with several park benches. It is so peaceful to sit and hear the cathedral bells and fountain.
Vitreaux windows. the most beautiful vitreaux that i have seen, is a majestic building, i like to have read the history of the church, it took centuries to build it
Crowded but beautiful. It was an amazing experience but just be prepared for crowds. Don't be afraid of the line outside, it moves pretty quick.

Beautiful. Defiantly glad we went back and did this...this church is unbelievable and it's free. It is a church so please don't disrespect it by talking as you go around..and please don't wash your hands in the font of holy water..it's for blessing yourself with, some disprespectful family did it this morning ...I could not believe what I was seeing...go see how magnificent this church is...you won't be dissapointed

MIND BOGGLING and just beautiful!. Get there early to avoid the queue. Well worth the visit as are the archives underneath. If you want to climb to the top and get a view of paris you need to join the queue around the side of the Cathedral. It is very long and though I am sure it would be worth the wait we just couldn't face another 2 hour queue

Great time. Loved my visit, I had a Paris pass so no lines for me. Took a great picture feeding the pigeons and just felt so a peace while inside. There is a tour of the tower that I didn't get a chance to do and will do next time. Go early to avoid lines
Awe inspiring. A truly beautiful experience, fantastic Church with wonderful atmosphere. Well worth a visit. The view of the city is superb.

Brief but beautiful.. Approaching the cathedral by boat on the Seine was fantastic. We went along the riverbank, up stone steps and across a bridge to get to Notre Dame. The architecture was detailed and inside, the church was dark and atmospheric. The church was in service and so our experience was backed with hymns resonating between lofty columns. Candles were lit and the sunlight framed the stained glass windows. As it were late evening, we were not able to stay long and were ushered out after only about 15 minutes. As we were not on a guided tour, we did not get to go up into the tower, which was the only disappointment to the day. They also want visitors to remain silent as there are always church services, which I respected but I had been looking forward to singing a few songs from The Hunchback of Notre Dame! OUT THERE!
