I highly recommend a visit to Notre Dame. Book a guided tour of the towers and get there early to avoid any disappointment.

Take the Bell Tower Tour. We had to arrive an hour early to get in at the opening 9am. There were vendors open so we just grabbed a crepe for breakfast while we waited. Make sure you are able to climb MANY STEPS in succession. Small spiral staircase leads immediately from the sidewalk to half way up the towers. Then another small spiral staircase leads from there to the top of the Bell Tower. WORTH THE STAIRS!!! The views are incredible and being that up close and personal with the gargoyles and roof sculptures was a treat. Then we went inside for a look too.

disappointing. visited notre dame after a morning journey to the conciergerie and sainte-chapelle (nearby). kind of wish i'd done it the other way around, because notre dame was very disappointing in comparison!if you want to visit to climb up the steps, or go for religious purposes, then sure. but i really wasn't impressed. especially because there were slightly too many ways they tried to get money from you. although the cathedral is free to enter, so it must be maintained somehow, i guess.history of the building is far more interesting than the place itself.

Beautiful!. Easily my favorite place in Paris. Notre Dame is glorious and leaves you speechless. The inside is beautiful and is definitely worth seeing. However if on a time crunch the outside doesnt disappoint either!

Lovely religion. The Notre Dame cathedral is a beautifully constructed building for religion. It is so peaceful and beautiful to look around. For those Disney fans out there, don't be surprised that you won't in fact see the hunchback of notre dame, however outside, you can see the gargoyles, although they aren't alive. It was a lovely day and we enjoyed the sights!
Great experience to walk thru. We arrived early on a spring morning and the light coming thru the cathedral windows was amazing - as was learning about the construction of the cathedral over time.
Beautiful . Not a big religious person but this is a must for any visit to Paris. Stunning stain glass windows and best of all it's free, even out two eleven year olds enjoyed it.

Captivating. An amazing piece of architecture to visit, would have loved it even more if there where only a handful of people inside. Found the crowd to be too much which takes away from the experience however the site is amazing, lovely to walk around on the outside of the building and take it all in from a different perspective where its also quieter. Definitely a must see, you can be in and out in an hour but do go its gorgeous.

Interesting but hot. The queue was really long but luckily it moved quite quickly. Inside it was boiling hot and really crowded. If you like history I guess this is the place for you, but if you are there just to check it out, 20 min it's enough. For an untrained eye, as I have, from inside it looks like any other cathedral. It's more spectacular from the outside.

Worth Waiting in Line. As is the case with most public buildings, there is a security detail at the entrance to the Cathedral to search the bags as people enter, but it moved quickly and then we were engulfed in the quiet of this massive church. We took our time to wander through, enjoying the windows and the statuary as we soaked up the silence in this Paris icon. We wanted to climb the tower to enjoy the views from high up but the line was very long and not moving quickly so we abandoned that idea.
Details are stunning!. Absolutely worth a look at...the structure is loaded with sculptures and details, and the inside is majestic...don't worry about the line to get in, it moves fast enough.
Great. Wonderful place to visit. Apparently you can go to the roof but couldn't find the way up! Also it's one of the rare free places to visit so well worth a look.
Truly impressive. A truly impressive gothic cathedral. The stained glass windows are amazing. Certainly well worth the wait to get in. Even better that there is no charge.
Nice. One of the most famous cathedral of the world with mysterious story and special cellar. Don't the the cellar.

Must See . I have always wanted to visit this world famous cathedral, and let me tell you it has been worth the wait! It's architecture is phenomenal, and the statues and stained class windows are beautiful! It's free to visit unless you want to climb the tower, do not miss out on seeing this beautiful cathedral.

Stunning!. The sheer size of this church will amaze you. The architecture is a wonderful experience. One thing that is bothersome to me is that you tour the church while people are having mass. Entrance was quick but I traveled in June and July and August may be very busy.

Beautiful and old. This is by far a beautiful cathedral but if you venture out a bit further you will find even more beautiful churches in France. Rent a car and drive from Paris to Lyon. Stop along the way in the old towns and you will see what I mean!

A must see. We went to the cathedral to see Joan of Arc's memorial and the glorious architecture utilizing the flying-buttress style of load distribution.
It's a classic and a must see when in Paris.

Historical must see on the Seine. No visit to Paris is complete without a visit to this historical gem. Once passed the long security line, you will be glad you waited. The displays are wonderfully situated and sculptures are magnificent!
Beautiful. Just magnificent, outside and in. Head in and have a stroll around, look at the amazing windows and architecture. Well worth a visit.
Nice but..... Beautiful, but after the Louvre and other Paris sites, it was a bit disappointing. You have to go, but don't let this be your end goal.

Where's that bloody bell ringer??. After being to London and being charged 18 pounds to enter what were after all churches at St. Pauls and Westminster Abbey (oh, a slight aside is do, and I do mean do visit All Hallowes by the Tower, I went because it is the Merchant Navy church and has excellent stained glass windows showing shipping companies I once worked for. A bit of peace in the hullabaloo of the City.) However, I digress, Notre Dame was a first sight overpowering both for the magnificence of both it's position and of course it's place in French and European history. Plus , that fact it was free to go in!! One for you Frenchies !! The line waiting to go in was long ,but courteous , something not often experienced on the continent, however the line made up of all sorts, not only christians, but just about every other religion judging by the garbs being worn. The line moved fairly quickly and after entering free movement was allowed, apart from sections engaged in prays. I even found myself lighting candles (much to my wife's amusement ) and swimming in a sea of history. Take your time, absorb as much as you can, then go looking for a nice estaminie for lunch and a few reflective" ver du vins". If in Paris do NOT miss visiting!!

IT's a beautiful Gothic Cathedral. Every one that comes to Paris should go to Notre Dame Cathedral.This time there was some kind of renovation on the paintings by the center of the cathedral, (I'm not sure of the appropriate name this site inside the cathedral), I took some time to watch the artist while she was fixing those paintings, it was an amazing work.

Unbelievable! . Beautiful Notre Dame! Even if you don't go in (the lines are long) it's totally worth walking the perimeter. Unbelievable structure considering that groundbreaking occurred in 1163 and was completed 1345. A testament to human ingenuity. A cathedral rich in history, a must-see while visiting Paris!
Breathtaking . Stunning flying buttresses. So beautiful and peaceful. Would recommend once you have seen the inside go outside and around the back.
Amazing design. This cathedral is a must see for a visit to Paris. Amazingly, entry is free, as well. You can even take pictures inside it, just no flash.

Beautiful building with a lot of history. Even as a non religious person this was an incredible building, the architecture is stunning with beautiful stained glass. The history of each chapel with its statues and artefacts is explained meaning that you don't need a vast knowledge of the Catholic Church to understand and enjoy your visit. The view of Notre Dame from the riverside is fantastic with benches to sit and admire the details.

Climb the stairs!. We waited in a pretty long line to climb up the 400-ish stairs to the top. Excellent views of Paris - the kids loved it! You really get a different feel for just how old the church is. The line takes a long time - get their early. Museum pass does not get you any short cuts in the line.
Be aware of the stairs. If you want to go inside and be near a Gargoyle be prepared to the near 400 steps on the way up. I have asthma and wasn't easy, but as a Vitor Hugo fan it was worth,
It's like the Disney movie . Kids loved to view the real Norte dame they know from the Disney movie. Lot of people nice to sit and admire the architecture.

Amazing. VERY IMPORTANTthere are 2 lines to go see the church The line in the square outside the front is for the interior ( not to be missed )The line to the left of the church front is for the towers spectacular This line usually takes 2 HOURS before you get in . The towers open at 10 we arrived at 9 and waited 1 an 1/2 hours to get in The line does not move fast

Great. The world famous cathedral is situated on a beautiful island in the middle of the Seine which is easily accessed by river, bus, train or on foot. The cathedral is free to enter and is a working church, so please respect accordingly and be quiet. Entrance queues move very quickly and it only takes a few minutes to get inside. If you want to go up to the tower(s) there is a separate entrance on the left side of the cathedral where you have to queue. Times will vary but it took us 45 minutes to gain entry in late August at 11am so that should give you an idea. Entry is free for under 18s and adults are 10 euros, so very well priced. Please note that there are over 300 steps inside and the stairwells narrow as you get higher, so not one for people with mobility problems and/or claustrophobia! There are two different floors, both with fabulous views of the city and the gargoyles.

Stunning Church. We took the tour for the church and went up to the roof top. The tour was OK, she didn't explain much of anything about the church and we pretty much do everything ourselves. If you had already gone to the submit at Eiffel Tower, it is no need for you to clam the bell tower again, it has the save view of Paris. The stairs at some point is very narrow and difficult to navigate with other visitors who also try to get up and down on the bell tower. All and all, you can do this tour on your own and plan for 1-2 hours. We had a great time.

Climbing the Notre dame. My husband to the top of Notre dame. He thought the views were magnificent and loved the gargoyles. We also went inside and the statue of Joan or Arc was Awe-inspiring. We had visited a lot of cathedrals during our trip. I loved how Notre Dame has been kept more or less the same.
Don't miss it.. There are plenty of great cathedrals in Europe, but this one is excellent. It is worth your time to see. Take time to walk around the rear for a different view.
A must see when in Paris. If you have travelled Europe a lot then it is just another cathedral but it is a wonderful specimen. Lots of history and beauty abounds.

A Must See, Again and Again. We have visited Paris more than 20 times, and have never missed coming to Notre Dame. It is simply the finest Gothic cathedral in the world. Each time, the beauty, and peace, one can find here is incomparable.

A breath-taking Cathedral in one of the prettiest locations.. A breath-taking Cathedral in one of the prettiest locations. Its a very popular tourist attraction so there was always a queue to get in. However, it was only 5 minutes. One thing that isn't advertised well is the second entrance down the left side of the cathedral where you can clime the stairs to the bell tower.

Worth Seeing But So Crowded. This was worth seeing, but rated average because inside there is no organization so navigating around can be difficult. Many good photo ops, though. Plan on spending a while here as lines are long and the outdoor plaza was crawling with pick pockets and people scamming $$ so be careful.
Free entry, small queue in morning. Great to see inside and small queues in morning. Keep quiet and enjoy the windows and architecture. Worth a visit and good value restaurants nearby

A Must See. The Cathedral was much, much larger than I thought before entering. It is incredibly beautiful and merits a good tour guide to explain all that there is to take in. Wait time to enter the Cathedral was about 15 minutes and well worth the wait. This is a must see in Paris.

Lovely, but crowded. Of course this is one of Paris' iconic landmarks, a quintessential example of the Gothic style. But it is also incredibly crowded, with long lines to get in. To get the most out of it, be sure to arrive early, and to walk around the outside -- especially the small garden area on the south side where you can also get a good view of the flying buttresses.

Beautiful, but crowded. It's famous for a reason. An historic church that still has services every day. There is no charge to get in, but they ask for donations for lighting candles. The crowds can be a bit much, especially on the weekends.

Fantastic to visit even just the outside. I didn't go inside I admit (the queues are insane) but really enjoyed just walking around and admiring the architecture. It's best enjoyed from the garden at the back. and from the river as well.
Excellent. To avoid long waiting times, you should be there in the morning!! But also the outdoor areas are well worth a visit.

Forget climbing up!. The cathedral itself is really nice and a must-see.This time we stood in line for climbing the tower. Great disappointment! The panorama are only to be "enjoyed" through nets. With the 10€/pers they get, they could invest in a new structure; The Tour Montparnasse has done the best of jobs for the photographers and tourists!!!

A must see especially for the budget traveller. There is a queue but it is constantly moving and worth it when you get inside this busy working cathedral. There is not entrance fee, but make sure yo light a candle for one of your loved ones or for someone you know, this will help to also maintain the cathedral. For the fit there is a separate queue climb the stairs to the top to admire the views. Lovely location for eating and drinking and not far from the Seine, hop on bus or Metro.

Great place to spend the evening in Paris. Beautiful sights, romantic atmosphere, and always some interesting street acts for entertainment. Lovely place to go at the beginning of the evening, either before or after a nice romantic dinner with your loved one. It's a nice walk along the river, where you can find many options for a delicious dinner.
Be aware of pickpockets though! Unfortunately, it can happen.

Lovely in the early morning. Go and look early in the morning, before 8am, when the light is lovely and there's no one around. You'll see other early morning runners, people having their professional photos taken and the street cleaners tidying up after the night before.
Fantastic . What a nice place to visit!!!!! We were lucky to find that place on the last day of our four!!!!!! It's worth visit.

Incredible history, architecture, and stained glass. There's really no need to review such a world-famous cathedral, but I would encourage any and all to go. We've lived in Paris over three years, and I've gone with just about every guest we've had and I never get tired of it. So beautiful inside and out. Advice - don't be dissuaded if there is a long line out front - the lines move really quickly! Also, the two round stained glass windows at the transept are probably the greatest on earth. I say that having visited probably 100 of the most impressive cathedrals and churches throughout Europe.

Free and beautiful.. The line to enter the Cathedral looks long but it moves quickly and we only waited about half an hour. Free entry. You can buy a handy guide book in one of several languages near the entry for just 2 euros. Well worth it. Very beautiful, especially the stain glass windows. A bit disappointing to see a cash register set up inside the Cathedral to sell trinkets - cheap marketing.

Amazing city views from the top. Firstly - there are two areas to visit, the cathedral and the the top for amazing views. Both are an amazing place to visit for a number of reasons. Primarily is the incredibly beautiful cathedral, to be admired by everyone, it is also free to access the cathedral. However if you are wanting to ascend to a higher level, then you exit the cathedral and head to the side entrance, this does cost you but the panoramic views of Paris are only topped by the eiffel tower in my opinion.Once again getting tickets online are beneficial but the wait is about 40 minutes depending on the time of day etc. Now they warn you as you pay but this has over 400 stairs to the top, so be warned as they have no elevators. You do this in sections at different times but it is a bit of climb. Access to the viewing balconies are limited which is both good and bad as you have a good amount of space to take photos but it also stalls the experience as you cannot go to the next area until the other group clears out. When you make it the very top the views are absolutely stunning and offer a full 360 degrees. If you are an avid photographer then plan your visits around the positioning of the sun so to avoid dissapointment. After an amazing view from the top you have the stairs to tackle back on your way down.

Highlight of Paris. Not a lot of news here. We visited on Easter Sunday and saw the unveiling of what is said to be the crown of thorns relic. Surprisingly, Notre Dame wasn't much more crowded on this day than others. Make sure to climb the stairs for the view. Note also that if you have small children with you then they will likely let you go to the front of the line.
Breathtaking!. Go during mass. It's amazing! However, if you go on Sunday, you can't climb to the top because the stairs aren't open. But there are plenty of gargoyles to see from the ground.

Beautiful place. Paris is awesome so Is Notre Dame, the art the architecture, all those details, it's just a great place. You can see history of this nation on the walls and paintings, it is a must, you will enjoy it. Note you will have to queue for a while due to the amount of people going there. At the back there is a little park, nice place to rest.

A must for any trip to Paris. No trip to Paris would be complete without a visit to an amazing Notre-Dame Cathedral. It is truly one of the wonders of the world. It took centuries to finish. Just looking at the north rose window is breathtaking experience.
Beautiful. We were fortunate to stop by Notre Dame Cathedral on a Sunday evening during Mass. Beautiful sounds, beautiful place. Do not miss seeing this extraordinary Cathedral!
Amazing visit. Worth a look. Highly recommends visit to this historic venue. Lovely atmosphere, get sere if not a little full of tourists. Check out the area in front, the crypt etc

Gargoyles found. Norte-Dame in person is aw inspiring! A miserable hot day in the high 90's, but finding Notre-Dame was like walking back in history. The stain glass...wish the pictures did them justice.

Great way to pass an hour or so in Paris. So beautiful! . Visited here yesterday with my 9 year old twins and husband yesterday. It was so hot outside but lovely and cool inside. "Wow!" Is all I can say. Stunning architecture! The stoned glass windows are beautiful! Entry is free but you can pay for an audio guide if required (we didn't). My children enjoyed the visit too. The queue outside moves quite quickly and I'm glad to see a security stand checking bags on the way in. A must see in Paris!

The famous Cathedral. We visited Paris in Aug 2016 & visiting the Notre Dame Cathedral was definitely on our agenda & we were not disappointed. The cathedral is beautiful from outside as well as from the inside. It has a big open space in front of the Cathedral & once you enter, it gives you a majestic look. One of the must sees in Paris.
Beautiful. Famous for a reason. Beautiful. We'd just been to Barcelona and the styles are just different. Try to get there early to avoid crowds.
My favourite. Comparing this to Sacre cour oh well this is a winner.Is what I call a proper church, you feel in peace with yourself once in. I didn't go up to the tower .

Magical, moving place. We were there on a Sunday and were surprised that we were allowed to tour during mass. Im not Catholic but I was moved by the service. Even though I read so much about the architecture I was not prepared to be awed and I was.
Love the architecture . A must see in Paris if not for its famed architecture but more so that it is an active church! The rose windows are exquisite !
Beautiful Cathedral. fourth visit in 35 years and still amazes me. This is a must do in Paris and probably the only thing that is free of charge

Alright. It is an amazing feeling to be at Notre-Dame in person but once inside, the cathedral is similar to most cathedrals you will experience in Europe. The Treasury, which costs 5 euros to enter, has an interesting collection of religious artifacts that are interesting to see. I wouldn't have missed my visit for the world, but it was not the most interesting, beautiful or exciting thing I did in Paris.

Beautiful and FREE Cathedral!. I visited Paris with my sister this summer and I was surprised to find out that viewing the inside of this magnificent work of engineering and architecture is FREE! You can donate to the church once inside or pay to take the stairs up to the top of the church for a view of the city. But if you are travelling on a budget, this is one of the sights that should be on your list to go to. You can donate a few coins, light a candle and be be prayed for, you can go to confession or even just sit reflectively in the pews of this sacred church.I absolutely loved that they allowed photography (without flash) inside as well. That way I get to keep the memories of my visit.
Breathtaking. Magestic and historic. Must see in Paris. Lit candles in twilight. Very impressive and moving. Dont miss it when in Paris!

Amazing . A bit of a line, but what a beautiful, beautiful building. We did not get to go in the Tower. Some had to use the bathroom. There was a public one across the street on the sidewalk north west of Notre Dame and the line was rather long. (Wife said the bathroom was very clean and self cleaning)

Very important...Skip the Line. IF you want to go "up" the tower for the views, do yourself a HUGE favor and get "skip the line tickets". We went on a guided trip so that was included. Only 120 people PER HOUR are allowed up at a time. There were easily 300 people in line at noon. Do the math....The cathedral itself is so stunning inside. (No tickets needed. The only line is for passing through security.). The architecture is something else. Super high ceilings, stained glass windows, enormous statutes....why doesn't the building collapse? There is so much history here...take a tour for details.This is a must-see in Paris!!!P.S. If you don't get skip the line tickets, I personally don't think the climb is worth the long wait.
Amazing . This is a must the views are stunning inside and out its alot of steps if you are scared of tight space dont do it but its amazing when u get to the top .a must do while in paris
Amazing Cathedral. I have been all over Europe and have seen many Basilicas and Cathedrals.....this is my 2nd favorite.
Fantastic. A must for any traveller. Very long queues but went down quickly.I spent 2hrs in here taking my time to see everything

Notre Dame. A climb of the towers and the Cathedral floor are two thing you don't want to miss on a visit to Paris. We happened to visit on a French holiday and the lines were not near as long as we thought they would be.
Must see !. Don't let a long line out front deter you as it moves very fast.. There is no cost to tour the main cathedral. Excellent historical displays to see.

A must see to experience the feeling you get when you see the inside.. When we stood in the line outside, the bells of the Church went off. Just amazing to experience that. Inside, the evening service was going on in French. After sitting for ten minutes, we walked around, lit candles and admired the gorgeous stained glass windows, the view of the vintage organ, paintings and sculptures. We did not take the tour as we wanted to experience the Church in peace and to take our own time.

Famous architecture, with different components. Visiting the cathedral itself is free of charge, though you will be waiting in line, and it is quite busy inside. The church is impressive and beautiful though.To climb the towers, there is a charge, and you will be waiting in line for a while - unless you arrive too late in the day, when they have closed the line for the rest of the day.

Ok but dissapointed. On the plus side went on a Sunday during a service so was free to get in. No information on anything in the church was available eg who the people were very dark and dull building
Historic - Island Church. Church on the island which dates back to early days of Paris. This where Paris started. 1 hour should be more than enough for this place.
Awesome. Takes my breath away, awesome working Cathedral. Long crowds, take water, no jump the queue available. Well worth the wait.

Amazing. There are additional new security checks, so you have to wait a little bit in line. Insideyou partly don't find the silence of church by the crowd of the people which gives yousometimes the feeling that you are inside of the Louvre and not inside of a church. Despite of everything you can enjoy this wonderful windows and the magnificent atmosphere which flows out of this gigantic construction which was built by thousandsof workers with simple instruments by their own hands. From outside you can climbthe towers and will have an wonderful view over Paris and you will see that Notre-Dameis built up on a island in the middle of the river Seine. Amazing.

Most impressive. Notre Dame Catherdal is such an essential part of Paris landscape. We attended a delightful concert of Middle Ages church music for a few euros. The performers were superb and the acoustics quintessentially Notre Dame. We purchased tickets at the back of the church earlier in the day. Find the queue for Mass once inside the ticket kiosk is directly in front of you to your right.

Awesome experience. This is a must see in Paris. The outside is stunning with beautiful carvings and statues. It soars heavenwards and demonstrates how this building was designed to attract people through it's doors. Once inside the stained glass windows are also stunning. Most are original having been removed and safely stored during WW2. Despite the presence of many tourists this cathedral inspires awe and is well worth the visit. Remember to be respectful as it is still an active church and there will be parishioners in attendance.
The Notre Dame Cathedral. Arrive early has very long ques to enter-Architecture is amazing, phenomenal view remarkable history and breathtakingly beautiful.Well worth a visit

Great Experience. I took the advice from some tripadvisor reviews and went to the cathedral while there was still daylight to be able to appreciate the stained glass windows. It was also the time of evening mass and the atmosphere was sublime! I had a great experience at the cathedral...

Don't sweat the lines!. You can't skip this must-see attraction on the ile de la cité. There will probably be a long line....don't worry about this as it moves very quickly.Make sure to go get some ice cream at Bertillon's on the Ile St Louis...just across the small bridge on the east. It is a great to get a cone, and just admire the cathedral.

Very prwttyy. It is free admission. It opens at 7:45am and it is a great time to go. Very few people and you can avoid the lines to get in. They do check bags and purses. If there is a line, it moves quickly

Admire the History. Long line up to get in during peak months but worth it once inside. Words do not explain the magnitude. If you have time, it is worth the climb up to the bell towers. Unfortunately another line for that though. Once on top, the view is awesome and seeing the gargoyles up close was pretty neat!

Don't let the lines out you off, take binoculars. We stopped here with our tour group but plan to go back next week on our own to tour the top. The church is a wonder inside and out. It is worth it to walk around the block and examine from all sides. The architecture and sculptures are amazing. Inside the stain glass is lovely as are the side chapels. Be sure to go back and see the crown of thorns, can actually view on Fridays which we will try to do!

Minority view . This church/cathedral gave me certain expectations, so I left feeling somewhat disappointed. The exterior of the church is indeed spectacular, especially the gargoyle spouts. However, the inside did not meet my expectations as I have seen a dozen or 2 of more spectacular churches throughout Europe. The stained glass ROSE window was beautiful but overall the interior was below average.

Beautiful. This was the number one thing to see according to my wife, and it did not disappoint. One of the oldest in Paris, with so much history. In the Vikings show, this is the place the Vikings try to climb the walls.When the Huns were preparing to invade Paris, Saint Genevieve prayed here and the Huns did not invade.

You Must Visit Notre Dame Cathederal. When in Paris, this is a must. It is not the most spectacular church in Paris, but it is one of the great symbols of France. It is worth the wait, unless you can go when it is not crowded. The inside is huge and you can sit an ponder the history. Spectacular windows. We did not go up to the viewing area, but it might be worth it if you like stairs. Be sure to look at Notre Dame from all sides. While there, go into the crypt - at the end of the front plaza. It is on the Paris Pass.

Amazing!. So beautiful and the history of its making and also the contents is so interesting. Consider going with a guide that can explain everything to you. I did that this last trip and took so much more away from the visit.

Impressive but more significant for religious individuals . So impressive - the towers, vaulted ceilings, stained glass, and statues but I much prefer the Tour Eiffel, Arc de Triomphe, Louvre and Pantheon over Notre Dame.It comes in 5th, similar to Sacre Coeur. I'm sure the significant grandeur and history is not lost on more religious individuals.

disappointed. When planning our trip to Paris, one thing I could not shut up about was Notre Dame. I guess because of all the stories I heard in my childhood, I was soooo excited to visit this famous cathedral. What a terrible disappointment this was :(Free attraction so it was completely crowded and it felt more like a museum than the holy place I imagined.....
Easter Morning Spent Here. We were lucky enough to be in Paris for Easter Sunday and attend a Mass at Notre Dame. Words cannot describe the beauty! Take a tour too and go up for the look-out!

Bigtime !. An enormous cathedral , and yet so beautiful . When you have heard the audio guide and read the plaques and realise that the structure came up more than 800 years ago , you have a new respect for the middle ages .. Such symmetry , such beauty ! And the frescoes and the friezes ! All so grand and all so beautiful .
Beautiful . Notre Dame was very beautiful. There was a big line to go in, but the line went very fast and didn't last longer than 10 minutes. Notre Dame is very worth the wait
Magnifique!. Breathtaking structure, very historical. just beautiful... visited almost all the sections of the Cathedral! almost like i was in a fairy tale

Great visit. We loved the Notre Dame Cathedral. On a previous visit during the day the queues where massive. We went back at night about 9 ish and walked straight in. It closes at 11 pm. I think to avoid the queue's this is the best time to go. It's beautiful and well worth the visit.

Nice Arcitecture. I saw Notre Dame only outside because there was Vladimir Putin inside at that time and no one was allowed to enter. The outside view was astounding... so how much more is the inside!!! . I need to go back there and to see the beautiful view inside!!!!

Beautiful. What a stunning cathedral, the first time we arrived it was really really busy and there was a particulary long queue to enter so we went back the following day just before it opened, we were lucky enough to see a service and hear the choir singing and it certainly added to our experience, the cathedral is absolutely beautiful especially all the stained glass windows, a must visit for anyone in Paris

Being one of the oldest and most imposing cathedrals in France.. I was amazed at how they built! They used hammer, chisel only without Construction Equipment! Having mainly a French Gothic architecture, but also influenced by the times during the construction (Renaissance, Naturalism).The cathedral Notre-Dame dominates the Seine and the Ile-de-la-Cité as well as the history of Paris. Bishop of Paris, decided to build a new cathedral for the expanding population. Although construction started in 1163, it was not completed until roughly 180 years later in about 1345. Built in an age of illiteracy, the cathedral retells the stories of the Bible in its portals, paintings, and stained glass.It was also here that Napoléon, wishing to emphasize the primacy of the state over the church, crowned himself emperor.

Famous Cathedral in Paris. This Cathedral is located in the isle of Cite in the Seine River. It is in the center of Paris and only steps from the City Hall [Hotel de Ville]. It is a great architecture, and very beatiful both inside and outside.

Nice architecture. Very nice architecture , great building , located at the heart of paris city, but if you came here by the afternoon , it will be very crowded with tourists all over the world, you can hear almost every language here from the tourists lol,, thats awesome
At Peace. Very Peaceful despite it was quite crowded. Beautiful architecture, especially the famous Notre Dame Stained Glass as it is actually better than the picture!

It is an amazazing Cathedral with lots of history. It is one this sites you have to be able to tick of your list in Paris (if you lick churches). It is a masterpiece from an architectural point of view and has a lot of history to offer for those who enjoy that part of the Church. For those who go for a purely religious experience they also do Church services on a regular basis. The church is free but to go the top there is fee and a separate cue. (We run out of time and didn't go). For those who like Churches, I would also highly recommend the "Sainte-Chapele" near by. It offers all the above on a smaller scale but the most beautiful Stained Glass Windows! There is an entrance fee to the "Sainte-Chapelle".

Impressive building. You cannot miss this attraction while being in Paris even when it is maybe to obvious visit for some. Cathedral is very nice and impressive but it can get crowded and can be there long queues but that is normal to expect in Paris. What I remember and I liked was feeding a small birds in front of the cathedral. If you have bread the birds would fly and sit on your hand which is very sweet. But the area is nice as well and it is worth to experience a cruise on the river to see the cathedral from a different perspective.

Gothic perfection. The history steeped in this Cathedral is amazing. How pristine and respectful they keep it. I was luck enough to be there during mass and it was breathtaking. Everything is polished and so well kept. Don't fear the line it moves really fast.
Beautiful. Just amazing, a must see if you're in Paris.Free to get in, but donations are accepted for lighting candles or just general donations to help with the up keep of the cathedral.

It's Notre Dame people!. It's Notre Dame! Think of all the prominent figures in history that have been there. Napoleon's coronation was here, etc. etc. etc. Excellent location in Paris. Notre Dame is recognized by the gov't of France as the geographical center of all France. All cities and towns distance are measured from Notre Dame being the starting point. Right on the Seine River in an excellent location!
Nice and impressive . As not a christian it is hard to understand everything but can't say the huge cathedral isn't impressive and it is nice to have a free attraction in Europe...

Breathtaking. If you visit Paris and do not enter the Notre Dame Cathedral, you are doing yourself a disservice. This architectural beauty cannot be described in words and is more grand than you can imagine. The day we went, the line to enter was so long it was reached the other side of the courtyard however it moved VERY quickly, so please don't let the long line deter you from entering. We went on the tour to the top and DEFINITELY recommend it. The view from the top is so beautiful and allows you to appreciate the sculptures on the exterior of the building as well. My only warning: if you have any problems whatsoever with stairs, this tour is NOT for you. The number of stairs that you need to climb to get to the top is shocking and there is no elevator (that I'm aware of). But the climb is worth it!

Beautiful. This church is amazing example of gothic architecture. The spires tower from the distance and marks the island where the city was formed. An absolute must see which was the coronation church of France

So Beautiful!. Its free to enter and walk around. The cathedral is beautiful inside and out. We did not climb to the top due to the time we visited and the line being closed. A must see and plan some time there to really look at all the details and read all the info provided.

A place to visit. The notre dame is a beautifull cathedral both on the inside and outside. You can also climbe up the stairs in towers but that cost money. If you visit you should really soend som time studying all the arcitecture outside as well

Amazingly beautiful. Very beautiful indeed and free to visit the church- you may have to queue while they do bag checks (we did- the queue looked awful but we were in within 10 minutes) but well worth it. Take some time to wander round the outside of the cathedral too- its equally beautiful, especially around the back to see the flying buttresses.
VERY SPIRITUAL. Notre Dame magnificent church very moving to see, glass stained windows , were lucky there was a church service going on and the singing was beautiful xx

UNIQUE, NOT TO BE MISSED. You should buy your tickets in advance and get there early to enter before the crowd. The story is fascinating and do some reading before to understand really where you are. The visit will take you 30 minutes to one hour or ore depending on what you are interested in and don't forget this is a church with mass hours : you can visit but be respectful.If you have time to visit the tower and see Paris from there, it is a real plus but long line in the summer and be aware of the opening hours...

Beautiful Cathedral Amazing Stained Glass. After visiting so many ornate cathedrals and churches in Italy, Notre Dame was a pleasant contrast. The architecture and stained glass were the stars of the show as opposed to frescos (which we also loved). It was cool and peaceful. My husband lit candles and went to confessional. All in all a wonderful time.

A lovely sight!. We called Notre Dame 'home' for our stay, as our hotel was just around the corner from it. Although we did not go into the cathedral itself, we did have a wonderful time walking past it and seeing it in all it's glory every day! There were always hundreds queuing to go in, as there are in the majority of the main tourist attractions.

Gothic beauty, stunning architecture. Seems rather bizarre to hold a full service whilst thousands of tourists oggle, photograph and discuss all around you. The cathedral is steeped in history, it's beauty is mesmerising!! So very beautiful
Wow. Words cannot describe how amazing this place is. Absolutely magnificent piece of gothic architecture.

Do not miss!. A free attraction that is still a functioning church. We happened to be there as Mass was being celebrated. Everyone was respectful. The area where attendants sit and pray is cordoned off as is the altar during Mass. So stay behind the ropes and be somewhat quiet.A true gem in the history of architecture. Soaring Gothic ceilings, massive carvings, gorgeous windows, amazing external buttresses and gargoyles. Each alcove is set up as a different place to meditate or worship. If you are not so inclined, just admire the art and statuary. The admission is free and the line moves quickly to get in. Be ready to have any bags inspected. The guards take a quick look inside. You can rent audio equipment, I believe and there is a souvenir shop on the way out. Do yourself a favor and study up before you go so you can appreciate the marvels of building such a grand place so very long ago.To help out the cathedral, you can drop in a few euros and light a candle for a loved one.
unbelievable. this is something you could go to rain or shine... and it's FREE!! nice shops up the street for those things you need to get your friends back home

Do NOT miss this iconic European Cathedral!. The Notre Dame Cathedral is a must as part of your visit to Paris. It is in a beautiful area of the city, is loaded with history and beauty, and I recommend going to a service as the organ music is devine! As the rest of Paris, it survived WWII, and is in fabulous condition. The tour is worthwhile as well.
Climb the Tower. This was a highlight of my short trip to Paris. I got there at 9pm on a Friday and had a 15 minute wait to climb the tower. Timing the hike up at sunset was amazing!
Unplanned visit. Late afternoon, queue moved quickly, free entry lit candles for €2 & listened to the vespers for a while - beautiful but hot on a hot day

Amazing . Probably one of the most beautiful places we have ever visited. Even the children were in awe of the buildings, the beautiful stain glass windows and an overall feeling of calm and mystique throughout. The Que was long but moved very fast, and there was a service on while we were inside which made it even more special.
Iconic Church. This is a beautiful church. The security around Paris and inside the church and area was very visible. Thanks. Crowds did move quickly. Worth the visit.
Gorgeous!!!!. Very nice architecture. Queue was long but moved very quickly. Well worth going in to see the inside as well as the outside.

A Must See. The inside of the church is stunning but the best part was the tour up above. When you come out of the cathedral on the right side of the church a lone forms to go up. Go early to avoid waiting. 10€ per person and worth every penny.
Simply breathtaking. When you enter the cathedral you see this amazing work of art in every corner, in every aisle, in every chair and window. It makes you feel calm

Amazing. Such an amazing place. Don't forget to see the treasure. It's not free but it's worth it.Even if the queue at the entrance looks long, it goes quite fast so don't walk back and don't miss it.

Fantastic day at Notre Dame. Walked along the river to Notre Dame, fantastic building steeped in history, listened to a service, eerie but moving. Can recommend to anyone looking to see a piece of French history, could close my eyes and see Quasimodo in the tower......

Notre Dame - Paris. Did a walking tour through the cathedral at no cost. The site is magnificent & impressive both on the outside & inside. The line to enter was long but move quickly in mid August. Avoid the beggars in the plaza outside the structure.

“amazingly beatiful”. it is one of the places to visit in Paris. As all cathedrals in Europe it takes time to appreciate all what is in the Cathedral. Even from the outside it is an amazing building. Nowadays churches are very simple. The craftmanship of those days it is amazing.

One of the musts. Definitely a must do whether you are a religious person or not. The structure in unbelievable and taking a look of the time, resources and energy that went into this is amazing. Be polite and enjoy. You definitely want to get there earlier if possible as the cathedral line gets long by late morning but still would be worth it.

Beautiful architecture. The architecture is stunning! We didn't spend much time there because it was closing soon. The lines were not that long and it's located where you can easily see other attractions by foot as well.

Fantastic and free to get inside. While the line to get in looks long, it goes quickly so I'd strongly recommend a visit inside.In addition to seeing the interior and the beautiful stained glass windows, they had a display showing the extensive sequential construction periods.Our visit was 30 minutes without climbing up. The summer Monday wait was 30 minutes which wasn't bad. The view was great.

Inside or outside it's Fabulous. Just walking from the Metro, a cab, or your hotel this landmark and Cathedral can be seen from all directions and its presence grows as you step closer and closer.This is an incredible place to learn about history and feel like you might have stepped back in time as you enter into the cathedral and it's less Darkness filled with a presence.... one might even hold their breath and hopes that they might see the Hunchback pass by.Plan as much time as possible so you may enter the interior and if they are open you may go up the stairs to the Bell Tower.There are incredible Gardens on the side in back of the exterior which lead to the River Seine where you can picnic or watch the bateux mouche go whizzing by. And along the banks is yet again an incredible place to picnic. Are you can just sit and watch all the city life unfolding in a panoramic view all around you.

Astonishing!!!. When arrived to Paris, I believed that I will be enchanted by Tour Eiffel. However, Notre Dame Cathedral and its square is the place that I liked the most. Standing in front of the curch and just watching this superb architectural construction is just enough. The vibes are just great. Try to get inside too - i was very lucky and there was a ceremony the day i visited!! Just great!!
Impressive cathedral inside and outside. This cathedral cannot be missed in the middle of Paris. Long waiting rows sometimes for guided tours and unguided visits but it is worth it

A great architecture. The most 2 famous basiliques are the notre dame and the sacre coeur cathedral. They are very unique in their architecture from outside and inside. But take care that it closes at 6 pm.

Absolutely Stunning. This is truly one of the most beautiful buildings I have been to. The queue outside to get in looks massive, but it moves really quickly. Make sure you look at all sides of the outside as well as the inside, because each side has something different to show you. I thought that it was such a beautiful location that after scouting out most of Paris for the best location, I proposed to my now fiancé beneath the statue of St Pope John Paul II on the side facing the Seine. I'm not religious, but this location really felt significant to me. It was really embarrassing because I don't have an ounce of romance in me, but I'm glad I did it there, and she was too!

Lovely sight . Lovely place to visit if you have the time such wonderful history held in the notre Dame, worth a visit just for photos! Recommend to go on a sunny day as the crystals in the Windows sparkle for your photos 🙂

Gothic and atmospheric cathedral. One time I went, I had the good luck of bing in there while a choir was practicing and it was lovely. Also, the queue outside looks long, but moves super fast, so just get in it!
Beautiful inside. This was the first attraction that we visited in Paris. The inside is really beautiful. The rose windows were amazing. Plus the painting on both sides were lovely...

Allow enough time. The Notre Dame Cathedral is beautiful inside and out. The gardens at the back are well worth the visit and the photos from across the river and every angle are exceptional. We could have spent much longer here than our tour allowed. It would have been great to climb to the upper areas and see the great view.
Old and historical. Great to visit. An awesome building from the past. It is still functional as a church when you visit at the right times.

Sumptuos Gothic Cathedral. I just love to admire Notre Dame Cathedral; every time you will visit it will be something different catching your eyes; the well preserve glass stain windows, the respect show by everyone waiting patiently in the queue as it is a free attraction. This is a most visit while in Paris.

Notre Dame. The Notre Dame is such a cool place, the history of it is amazing. I was blessed to be able to attend mass there one day and it is something I will never forget. It is such a nice place, and I highly recommend you stop by when you are in Paris.

Inspiring. A must see. I went early and there were no crowds, a huge Christmas tree was decorated, a wonderful place of beautiful stained glass, art and history. Plenty of cafes right across the street to sit near window front sitting a coffee while viewing Notre Dame. Batobus will take you right to it and for the cost of a taxi you ride Batobus all day.

amazingly beatiful. it is one of the places to visit in Paris. As all cathedrals in Europe it takes time to appreciate all what is in the Cathedral. Even from the outside it is an amazing building. Nowadays churches are very simple. The craftmanship of those days it is amazing.

c'est magnifique. Free- you heard me- free to the public. The inside is humbling- the gardens surrounding are beautiful! We went in spring when the blossoms were blooming. Just incredible. You can pay a small fee and climb the tower too for beautiful views of the city through the infamous gargoyles of the notre dame!
Notre Dame. A must see when in Paris.... Magnificent and beautiful..... Depending on the time frame, it gets rather crowded but a must to see
Must see in Paris. Notre Dame is just amazing. Such a beautiful cathedral with great art inside. Did not get to go to the top becuase the line was too large.
Otherworldly. Mesmerizing beauty and history. Very difficult to describe the cathedral, as words cannot adequately describe how heavenly this place is.

Beatuful as always.. Notre Dame is such a beautiful church. I like that its free to visit and stay for a service if you're so inclined. They offer all the same functions as a regular chapel. There are however a TON of people everywhere so be prepared and watch your belongings.

Holy moley. After visiting this site many times over the years I came at a time when there was barely a line. Mass was being celebrated which made it a bit more ceremonial. The church is an architectural innovator and masterpiece. It was the model for many great churches after it. At least see it up close get off the bateau or bus or taxi and walk around. Have a cold or hot drink at the Esmeralda.

Beautiful. This place is amazing. I've always admired the building from the outside in many occasions but this time I decided to go inside & have a look. I was really impressed, beautiful stain glass windows, larger statues and painting. Definitely worth a look. Don't let the queue discourage you, it's just to get through past security checks.

Architectural marvel . Whether religious or not the notre dame is a must see if you visit Paris. The architecture is incredible, the views of the cathedral from the riverside are fantastic and not crowded at all.
Great little space. Visited this as most people do while in Paris and you can get up the towers for some great views. Inside is as you would expect. An historic gem of a place.
Super jolie. Very peacefull place . One of the highest point of the city....security, and le petit train was so cool
Beautiful!. The Cathedral is such an icon of Paris, it's a must see. The architecture is beautiful. It's surrounded by beauty. Well worth it.
One of the best cathedrals I've visited!. Breath-taking structure, both from inside and outside.. One can to the cathedral terrace and enjoy the architecture more.. Highly recommended!
Fantastic view. I was eager to visit since my childhood because of the Hunchback of Notre Dem. And it certainly meet my expectations. Vibrant place.

Go early in the morning . Magnificent as you would expect, just come first thing in the morning,while there is no line and you can actually see stuff inside. Line to climb up is huge always, if you are just interested in the views, maybe try Arc de triomphe and save yourself a lot of time,which is so precious in Paris.

Really grand and magnificent. This is must see attraction apart from Eiffel tower in Paris. One should not miss it. Its huggge and grand. The history portrayed inside the cathedral is inspiring as well. The cathedral itself is free and it might take 30-45 mins depending on the crowd to get inside.

Loved it. This is not the biggest church we have been to but man it is beautiful. From the outside architecture to seeing those rose stain glass windows. Something about this place that just make you sit and say a prayer. I wish we had spent more time just sitting and reflecting.Try to walk down past the church a few street and come up from behind. Seeing the beautiful architecture is amazing. Also, do a boat cruise so you can see it from the water. It is just beautiful.

Not worth bothering. This would have been a better experience had we just walked past the Cathedral. The interior itself was nothing special but the wait to go up the tower was around 2 hours long, once you reached the top, you were also unable to see much more than any of the other views in Paris. To top it off, the staff hurry you through the experience in order to get more people through

Not to be missed!. When in Paris a visit to Notre Dame Cathedral will not disappoint. It is an amazing structure and an extremely popular tourist site. We visited with a guide so access was almost instantaneous, the information imparted during our tour was extremely interesting, taking a tour was definitely the way to go. We didn't climb to the top, the line was far too long to even consider trying. Beware of pick pockets, keep your valuables safely stowed.
a MUST in Paris. This is iconic for Paris and it is really worth taking a look at. It is one of the most beautiful churches.

A must see. A bit of a queue to get in but well worth it. The Cathedral treasures are a separate exhibition and there is an entry fee. This is a place of worship so noise needs to be kept to a minimum and no camera flashes inside. Worth noting is that outside and behind the cathedral is a small park and public toilet.

Blown away. I was completely obsessed with this Cathedral. Its so beautiful it will make you cry, entire Paris in general has this effect on me! A must to see if you're in Paris. Please be aware that thieves operate in all tourist attractions in Paris, they normally look like gipsy travellers and pretend that they are collecting money for some kind of cause, as soon as you get your wallet out they grab it and run , see it happening myself , please be aware !

Iconic building on the île de la cité. To be honest, I expected something more of the Notre-Dame. The building from the front looks kind of weird with the square towers. When looking from the back or sides of the Notre-Dame, its beauty shows. The Notre-Dame also has a backyard that is worthy of visiting. I did not visit the inside of the cathedral so I can't judge this book solely by its cover. The pictures I saw on the internet look stunning though so if the line it worth it for you, you should definitely have a peek inside!
Dont forget the towers and the crown of thorns. Great views to be had from the bell towers and you can view the crown of thorns in its case behind the main altar

Awe inspiring . For all the folks queuing and looking up at the front of this gem I would recommend a stroll around the back. A beautiful garden from which to view the architectural wonders that await - just unbelievable!!

Very enjoyable even after several previous visits. Were given a free guided tour around the inside of the cathedral which took about 45 minutes. The guide was a volunteer who was exceptionally nice and very knowledgeable. The tour made the trip more relevant and children were encouraged to ask questions.We then went to the archaelogical site below the cathedral and this gave much more detail about the history of Paris the site. Very enjoyable.

A must see!. My kids love it when watching a tv or a movie and you see landmarks that you have been before. That is definitely the case with the Notre Dame. You see it all time and it is really cool to hear them exclaim "We've been there!". The building itself is very cool to look at with some great architecture but for us it was more about saying we've been there.
Beautiful. I didnt think i would like this but i loved it. its so big. and so much to see. would bring my family here .
Interesting . Go visit this interesting cathederal steeped in history and the home of Quasimodo. Also a lovely place to catch a church service in French . Worth a visit it's free to get in

Impressive exterior. I like the exterior of this church more than the interior. I've seen better churches with magnificent frescoes but hey, it's the Notre Dame so you've got to see it. The gargoyles were so high up, they were hard to see without zooming your camera.

Stunning Gothic Cathedral. Amazing architecture, great information on its history inside the church itself, wonderful peaceful feeling despite the large number of tourists. Even though there was a long line in the square, it moved pretty quickly to get in.

best place in paris. this review is for outside the building, not inside.the outside, is where everyone goes, especially at night. All the street entertainers come out and the atmosphere is really good. its a shame wheres armed patrol walking about that will shoot you dead if you try to take photos of them, which is kinda hard since they are standing infront of one of the most iconic buildings in the world. You'll also find many people standing around like statues with their hands in the air. these aren't insane, they are actually feeding birds. if they keep still, all the little sparrows will land on your hand and eat out of it. On a really hot sunny day, the white sandy floor will be as bright as the moon surface and will BLIND you, so if you want photos taken of you, best wear sunglasses or your photos will have your eyes all screwed up, so watch out for that. I spent hours here, and never bothered going anywhere else, its my favorite place.

A must when you visit Paris. This should be on your bucket list when you are visiting Paris !
The whole place will just make you travel 12 centuries back.
Sit in a quiet place at the end of the Cathedral and meditate by closing your eyes, you'll feel something inside YOU.

Beautiful Paris Landmark. We enjoyed our visit to Notre Dame. The cathedral is beautiful inside, and we loved the stained glass windows. There was a long line to walk through the cathedral at 1 pm, but the line moved quickly. We did not wait in line for the tower. Be sure to walk around the entire cathedral outside since each side is different and the details on all sides are amazing. We also tried the crepes sold by street vendors across the street, and they were delicious. If you want to go up in the tower, arrive early in the day.

Queue too long. The church was lovely looking from outside, but unfortunately the queue stretched the whole way across the square & our kids did not want to queue. We walked around the whole outside of the church instead & sat in the park behind the church for a rest. This was a Fri pm about 3 o'clock. Sigh, will just have to come back to Paris.

Awe inspiring. There was a lengthy line when we arrived at the cathedral and after a short discussion we decided to join the queue and were pleasantly surprised how quickly the line was moved despite the rather brief security check at the door.Once inside we were gobsmacked at the the size and beauty of the interior and the stained glass.It was nice to see everyone was respectfully quiet when asked to be so at prayer time. Notre Dame must certainly be in the top 3 of the world best cathedrals in the world and is must see for everyonewho visits Paris. With free entry you can't go wrong.

Free and the line outside moves quickly.. Again, you should not miss this stunning Cathedral - the exterior and interior are stunning. And afterwards, head on over to the Latin Quarter for a wander through the small streets filled with restaurants and bars.
Stunning. History like I've never imagined even for the non religious like me.The queues for security checks moved fast Would think this is an unmissable in Paris

Inside Notre Dame. We went to Notre Dame on a Tuesday. the line to enter was all the way back to the far end of the courtyard but it goes fast we were inside within 10 min. It is a must see if you are in Paris.

Magnificent Cathedral. Being a catholic, this is one of the most awesome cathedral I've seen. It invokes the story of the Hunchback a character in Victor Hugo's novel where this cathedral is central to its story. Rich in history and steep in tradition, this is definite must-see for any tourist visiting Paris.

Don't miss the Bell Towers - read if you get claustrophobic. We didn't book many tours on our visit to Paris as we wanted to explore freely on our own, but this was one we booked because we didn't want to miss it. I recommend an after hours tour to climb the bell tower (we booked with Viator). I was a bit nervous after reading reviews, because I can get claustrophobic, but I was glad I overcame my fear and did this. The fact that we went on a cool evening so it wasn't stuffy, and there are small openings frequently all the way up the tower helped to ease the climb. It's 422 stairs through a spiral staircase that gets even more narrow near the top. Bring water because it's dusty, and going after hours (6:30) helped because it wasn't as crowded. This climb was so worth it to hang out with the gargoyles and chimera and to see the bells close up. The views of the city from up there are wonderful! The tour was informative as well as getting us the access after hours. Be sure to arrive early to visit the inside of the gorgeous cathedral before closing.
Mass time wonderful. We timed our visit for a Mass service. This was wonderful to here the music and the singing echoing through the building. It was quite a moving experience.Well worth the visit.

Beautiful. One of my absolute favourite places to go in Paris, it is an absolutely stunning cathedral. The line to enter may be long but it generally moves quite fast! Unfortunately, the cafes close by are generally over priced and not the greatest - it's better to walk further to get something to eat.

Beautiful. Very beautiful cathedral but crowded, the was quite a line when we went to this cathedral so it took a while to get in. Great stained glass windows, but the place looks like it needs a good clean, enjoyable....
Beautiful Service. We were at Notre Dame during a service. It was amazing. People were respectful and quiet. The church has not changed since I was here 30 years ago. Great upkeep of the building.

Amazing. The church is amazing but crowded. The line for the church out front looks bad, but moves quickly and is just a security line. We did not climb the tower due to the incredibly long lines that did not seem to move. The park between the church and the river was even better with incredible views. In the back of the church there is a cute small children's play ground. It is not everyday you can swing outside Notre Dame. For even better picture cross the river next to it and see it from slightly further away.For the best gelato, cross the bridge right behind the church and walk down the street!

Magnificent! . The line to get into the cathedral moved fairly quickly even though the line stretched all the way to the street. We did wait a little over an hour to get into the tower. The view from the tower is absolutely stunning and definitely worth the wait.
Gorgeous cathedral!. We went on a Sunday during mass. Got in 20mins despite the long lines! Marvelous architecture & gorgeous inside! The ceiling is breathtaking! Loved it!

A Paris Must-Do. Though the cathedral itself is free, don't miss the climb to the towers (for a modest fee) to get an up-close look at the gargoyles and amazing views of Paris. Arrive early or late to miss the heaviest crowds.
Loved it!. How beautiful and amazing! You have not seen Paris if you skip this historic landmark. Be sure to make time to see this.
Nice Place to visit. It is one of the most well known places, for me was a good place to go for one or two hours but not the first list to be in
Overrated. Even though it is worth going if you have the time, it is overrated and not what I was expecting. It mas more of an ordinary cathedral which you can see in most old, large cities.

See it ti believe it. Not going to say much but one thing
Before you drop off this mortal coil this must be in your bucket list !

Unforgettable. Notre Dame cathedral is a must-see in Paris. It's history and architecture are stunning. The lines are long but move quick to walk through the cathedral. There is a separate tour that allows visitors to climb the towers and ring the bells (prepurchase the museum passes to take this tour and the lines are long). Be prepared to see high security. They had many branches of armed forces present with all roads leading to the cathedral closed to car and bus traffic. It was unnerving but probably the safest place to visit in Paris. Be sure to walk around the entire Notre Dame, the back is breathtaking, there are small parks you can sit in and enjoy the views (and much less crowded than the front!). Be aware that the cafes surrounding the cathedral will price gauge you for everything fromCoffee to toilets. It's best to step outside the perimeter to have a coffee or lunch. At the front of the cathedral there is the attraction of the Archeological Crypt. It requires a ticket to enter but I hear it is worth seeing the underground ruins of Paris.

Must make time to see Notre Dame. What knocks your socks off is the shear majesty and size of this cathedral. It is quite old and more 'medieval' looking than the fancy cathedrals like Westminster Abbey, etc. But if you are in Paris, you should include this in your itinerary. It took maybe an hour to be in line and then walk through. There are some great sidewalk crepe vendors on one side.

Beautiful Cathedral. Always wanted to see this church and of course from both history and the story about Esmeralda´s Disney when raising the kids wanted to see this. High expectations but right on the dot. Remarkable building and totally worth taking time for

Mass. I love visiting Notre Dame. Try to make a mass it is quite beautiful. Gift store has some very unique gifts. BUT watch your purses and bags as it is a great place for pick pockets. If you attend mass do not put your purse or bags on the floor or you may leave without them.

Fantastic Lead Light Windows.. As a tourist you can't really miss Notre Dame. The hop on hop of bus stops almost in front of the cathedral. All of the river cruises sail right by the cathedral. There are beautiful lead light Windows to be scene inside and it is also worth a walk around the back of the cathedral to see the gardens.

Awesome and FREE!. The whole family enjoyed taking in the beautiful building inside and out, that is Notre Dame. We queued politely outside, but quickly go into the cathedral and admired it's beauty. We were able to freely explore, but tours were available had we wanted it. I would recommend anyone in Paris to add it to the list of sights to be seen.

Notre dame. Visited on a tour - typical old church review with architecture comments and building process and how it was saved during the war there are many old churches in Europe all with different stories but a lot the same if you like old churches this is interesting very clean and well organized the long line ,moved very well

Magnificent Structure. One of the ancient beauty must to catch up during Paris visit.Considered sacred for religious people but leaves anyone awestruck with it's interiors.Do note the time before visit as you may have to wait for long during prayer time or may not be allowed in certain parts of the building.Visual treat for Gothic art lovers. One can have a glimpse on transformation of this iconic beauty as pictures and paintings are displayed to uncover the past.Also spend some time around the cathedral to explore more on the outermost architecture and lovely view of the Seine river.

Guided tour of the towers: what a view!. We did not visit the cathedral itself but only the towers. It is quite a climb of 422 steps up but it is worth it. You visit the bell towers and if you are lucky you can visit the roof of the South tower with 360 degrees view over beautiful Paris. You are exactly in the city center so you see all the beautiful buildings from above. Amazing.

A must see. Don't just see the outside, go inside. Sometimes you can happen upon a reheasarh and the organ may be playing or the choir rehearsing. The sounds, architecture, sculptures and paintings are worth viewing even if you are not into art history. A must see if in Paris.
Grand, beautiful & majestic. Visit during the day to see inside: visit at night to see the street performers outside... adds a bit of local flair!
Lovely piece of architecture. Nothing bad to say, must see part of Paris. The queues could get very long and expect an hour or two of queuing.

Beautiful Gothic Cathedral . This is a beautiful gothic cathedral. It is very beautiful inside! There is a fee to get inside but well worth it. One thing we did do is go to see the history of the cathedral that is located across the square and go down stairs to learn all about the cathedral. Sad to say this is the second time we did not get to discover the top of the cathedral as the line was so long. I'd suggest getting there early or an hour before it closes to climb to the top!
Lovely. Beautiful inside and out. Worth a tour. This is a historic cathedral that should not be miseed. Closes early.
A must. See Notre Dame and die. a must in Paris. The center of medical Paris. Go up the bell tower worth the wait.

Stunning . Absolutely wonderful experience. If you're interested, pay the ticket cost to the Tower tour. Be warned: It involves a lot of stairs, but the views are amazing. Also, it's not really a tour; you can go up, ask questions and go down, but it's not guided per se. Also, the wait gets long quickly; it starts at 10 am, we arrived at 10:15, but didn't get in until close to 11:30. You can show up at 9 to make sure you're first in line, but then you still wait an hour to get in. Either way, it was worth the wait and cost of admission!

expansive cathedral. This historic and expansive cathedral contains a number of beautiful stained glass windows, and a large vaulted interior. A must-see on your first visit to Paris, but probably not somewhere I would return to on future visits. (Unlike Westminster Abbey in London, there is not a ton to see and do here) You can climb the towers of Notre Dame as well, which in French is "Tours de Notre Dame" (Tours=towers).

A Symbol of Paris. It is old, it is well known all over the world it was a huge construction work and it is impressive in everything, bas-reliefs, statues, sculptures, small chapels, the organ, everything. It is another must to visit for Paris.

After hours tower climb. This isn't a review for the cathedral itself, though I remember it as really spectacular from past visits. Instead, this is a review for the after-hours visit to one of the towers. Yes, there are 422 steps. And yes, you can line up to do it during the day. But if you're put off by the steps, start practicing before you go and know that this slightly overweight 52-year-old made it. And if you have any hesitation about the cost of going after hours, all I can say is there are no lines, no rush, and you and 20 or so other people and a guide get the place to yourself. It was worth every single penny! Oh those views! Of all the amazing things we did in Paris, I'd put that hour and a half at the very top of the list. Just don't forget your camera!

Breathtaking!. The architectural details and size of the cathedral are amazing! There is so much to see inside. Walk in a circle inside along the perimeter and view the separate altars, frescos and details.

Gothic Architecture . It a must visit in Paris since this popular architecture is free. Yet you will have to pay if you wish to extend the tour to the top of the cathedral. The exterior itself is already phenomenal for me. The carving and the architecture is mind blowing. Typical gothic inspired cathedrals in most European countries but each one have its own beauty. A long line to enter the cathedral is no surprise since it is one of Paris famous landmark. The is a list of do's and don't outside the cathedral and before came to visit just read it, otherwise you will deny to enter the cathedral. The security is quite strict. The interior is amazing and there is a replica of the cathedral show at the back which give the whole look of the cathedral. For free entrance, Notre Dame is a must in a list to visit while in Paris.

Another landmark. Don't leave Paris without seeing this classic piece of architecture inside and out. Once you have wandered the cavernous and immaculately ornate interior walk around outside and take in the amazing masterpiece it is.

Awesome!. The cathedral is great! Its old and beautiful. You can see how it was built. The stained glass in the sun shine was incredible! You could see the wood of the Lords Cross. I liked it very much!

Moving.... As you walk the grounds of this Majestic Cathedral you can't help but want to photograph every angle and attempt to capture every moment. It is simply stunning and takes you through time as you try to imagine how did they accomplish this. To get in is free and you will see a wrap around line at the front door. It moves quickly. Once in, WOW... Make sure you walk the entire Cathedral. Towards the back you will learn of the timeline and how it was created. A must in Paris! See it at night as well, lit up as the picture below is breathtaking

Cathedral of wonders. The Notre Dame Cathedral was most impressive, it gave me a sense of serenity, calmness and at peace. The window glass patterns is a must to see, as well as all the sculpture inside and outside of the building. I have been blessed to have been inside the Cathedral.

Yes, awesome. Crowded though it can be (and it was, the mid-summer's day I visited), if one can look beyond -- and above -- that, then Notre Dame is a moving and even awesome experience. The architecture within and without are the epitome of French Gothic; on a bright day the stained glass rose windows are sublime. Note the tri-lingual display panels that show the successive stages of building over many years, and ponder the history it represents. Be sure to walk around the outside to fully appreciate the cathedral's delicate beauty, and the exquisitely buttressed east end. And spend some time in the plaza out front, too: one can encounter people from all over the world, not to mention the pigeon man (or pigeon lady, depending on the time of day...).

A really beautiful cathedral. Queues move petty quick, do not need to pre book. This is free to public and worth seeing. You can go under neath the cathedral also to visit the Roman ruins. You can also go to the top fir a view. You do have to queue but worthwhile if you have the time.

Gothic masterpiece. Huge queue but it moved very quickly. Free to enter the cathedral to access centuries of history. We didn't wait to go to the top, if you want a good view of the city go up the Eiffel tower, Notre Dame looks tiny from up there.If you can time your visit to attend a mass it is really worth it (if that's your thing). However if you're looking for a peaceful haven to be with you're thoughts outside of mass then this is not the place for you, many, many, many people forget that this is a place of worship. Not just for catholics, history lovers and architecture buffs, everyone can be in awe of this spectacle.
Breathtaking. A trip to Paris without seeing the Notre Dame Cathedral would be wrong. Beautiful building with a wonderful atmosphere and very interesting too. Well worth a visit.

Fascinating history!. Notre Dame means "Our Lady of Paris"! It is a Medieval Catholic Church built over 800 years ago.
It has incredible art work inside that is free to enter and see.
But you must remain "silent" at all times during your visit to this church as people do go there to pray.

Beautiful. You have to visit the cathedral while you're in Paris. There was a big line outside in the morning, but it was worth it. They have a security check now before entering, and that's why people line up. We were able to hear mass while we were there!
Beautiful. One of those places you just have to go to.... History - spirituality and architecture - simply breathtaking

Timeless, Simple. As others have mentioned, the line to get in moves quickly. Notre Dame is simple, classical, and elegant all in one. The side chapels are interesting, the stained glass windows are wonderful. See the garden behind the cathedral. Note the Mile Zero marker for France in front of the Cathedral.It is free to get in. It is world famous for a reason.

Beautiful Building. Definitely worth a look if you like beautiful buildings. Even from the outside, it looks lovely. If you walk around it and see it from all angles, it has new surprises in store. Worth seeing from a distance to get good pictures from different angles. Lovely shapes :)

Mass. Skip the queues and go to mass there. It is a functional building and people are very friendly. We arrived late and we're dressed for Summer. People were only welcoming.The architecture and music make it a very daunting place but the mass-goers are not from the middle ages.

Stunning regardless of your religious views. Didn't expect such an impression but it was really deafening - the sculptures, the music, the stained glasses, the scale of the whole thing. Don't be fooled by the fake deaf & dumb volunteers - they are simply beggars who after you've put your name on their list demand not less than 5 euros)))
Great view. Great view from the top. Nice to check on all steps the cathedral went through until now!! It is worth it.
Amazing. By far one of the great Cathedrals of Europe. Classic French Gothic. Beautiful and accessible. If you hear the choir then it's the icing on the cake.4th visit and still love it.
