Beautiful!. Very beautiful and another must see while you are in Paris. The outside architecture and intricate details in the stone are actually more beautiful than the inside, but the history of the Cathedral draws you in.

A must see. A must see! Most cathedrals are very much the same in Europe but Notre Dame is one of the best and most iconic churches. The Gargoyle at the top are very impressive and you can see the Eiffel tower in the background.

Impressive. Impressive building. We didn't go in but were told afterwards it's free to enter as it is still a church. Long queues though.
The building and surrounding area are a good choice for a half day visit then u can walk along the seine from here to the louvre which is what we did. Lovely walk.

If you do not mind the long queues then it is all right.. Wonderful piece of architecture.Even if you buy skip the line tickets, remember that almost everyone is trying to buy those tickets and so the crowd can be overwhelming at times.

No words for this. This is a must see! It said no pictures but people were taking them everywhere. It is one of the most beautiful places I have visited. I love the churches of Rome and Italy but this is outstanding. Peaceful serene, the line was short as we arrived early

Even more special during a service . It was early Sunday evening when we entered the cathedral and it was packed with worshippers attending a service. This meant some areas of the basilica were closed off but you could still enjoy the wonderful rose windows. The exterior looks bright and clean - perhaps some recent power washing ? Fabulous stonework and statues.

sublime. The inside of the cathedral is well known by most folks from photographs; still, to stand inside beneath those arches, to see the light come through the stained glass is a grand experience. The climb to the top is a challenge, but the view is stunning and it's so much fun to get face to face with the gargoyles.

A beautiful building .. Especially fabulous at night all lit up. Great atmosphere at night as well as crowds gather to watch the street entertainment. Stroll down to the Pont de la Tournelle and cross to I'ile saint Louis and view Notre Dame from the back. Equally as beautiful.

Amazing beauty. We happened to arrive at time for mass on a high holy day. It was beautiful! From the bells tolling heard as we approached to the interesting architecture ( gargoyles and gothic structure) to the stained glass, statues and frescos, it was breathtaking. The service itself left us in awe. We don't speak much French but it didn't matter. The singers, the organ music, the chants and the boys choir were all unparalleled! There were a few tourists who were taking and being disrespectful but the cathedral staff did a pretty good job of keeping the 1000 or so people under control. It was very inspiring. Well worth the visit.
Wan interesting cathedral. A more modern place than a lot of the English Cathedrals but still interesting to see. The place needs a good clean. There is usually a queue outside but it moves quickly

Go in the morning - worth a visit!. The cathedral is absolutely beautiful! - No cost to get into the Cathedral, but there is a cost if you want a guide. They also have specific times (i think it was 11 and 4:30 for English) for guided tours for a particular language. - Make sure you go up to the top of the towers, it is worth it! There is a $10 fee per person, but if you show that you are under 25 or from Europe you get a discount. They only let about 10 people in at a time so the wait for the tours is VERY long - it took us about 2 hours so I would say to go here first thing in the morning! The towers have incredible views of the cityThe stairs are very narrow and the view portion is very thin as well so if you are scared of heights or a little claustrophobic it could be tough, it was a little hard for me but completely worth it!

Huge building. I have to say that I had high expectation for this cathedral but inside I got disappointed. It was really anonymous and for example the duomo of milano is much better.
Outside is beautiful and going to the top is what is really worthed, you have a wonderful view of the city!

Stunning. Despite the massive queue to get in it only took a half hour from standing in line to enter the cathedral. Be careful of the times though because before mass each day they will close the queue let you enter. Was amazing seeing such a depth of history within the cathedral itself and they allow photos just not with a flash.

Notre Dam!. The ever so famous Cathedral!The one where all French Kings' weddings have taken place.It's just like Westminster Abby but French.Lovely Cathedral though.Even Napoleon visited this.Worth a visit!
Nice !. A must visit place at least once. There was a long line but it didn't take much time to enter the cathedral. Enjoy spending some time in nearby streets

Go inside! Skip the tower tour.. The Notre Dame Cathedral was great. The line to go inside looks long, but it moves really fast. I thought it would take an hour to get inside, and it only took 15 minutes. And it is free! The line for the tower tour queues up along the side street and took about 2 1/2 hours, and cost 12 euros I think. Good for a one time thing, I would go again. From the tower tour you see some of the exterior accents up close, like gargoyles, and the bells. The view is great, but if you go up the Eiffel tower, or Montparnasse tower, or Sacre Couer, then you have seen a great view of the city of Paris. Plus I had a great view of the Paris skyline from my hotel window. Skip the tower tour, go inside.
Must see!. We visited while in paris for the week. It was very beautiful. It's hard to comprehend how much time and effort went into building it.

Incredible architcture, lots of stained glass. I did not go to the roof so I can't offer a review of the view from there. However, the interior of this cathedral is worth seeing and is free to the public. Lines can be long but move rapidly.

Great place to spend some time!. Lots of people can be found out front during the middle of the day. We went late into the evening and there were no tour groups and less people. Made it easier to take photos. A must see in Paris!
Gorgeous!. This is an amazing cathedral! I love how gothic it is with the gargoyles but yet placed in such a beautiful setting. Wonderful just to look up in awe at it!

Stunning Cathedral. Beautiful cathedral and free to enter, the queues move fast and worth seeing. Only negative there is another queue to go to the roof, which is very slow and takes a long time to wait.

Worth a visit !. Beautiful building and we were lucky to visit at a time when a service was going on. Quite a nice experience.
I guess Notre Dame is on everyone's list of places to visit in Paris anyway

Worth every minute in line. There are two lines: one for the interior of the church, which goes very quickly; the other to climb the towers, which is very slow. Both are well worth the time. Visiting the interior is free and allows one to see the church's extraordinary stained glass and other interior details. The tower charges a fee, requires climbing many stairs, and is crowded, but both my 14-year-old and I very much enjoyed the result. Some of the gargoyles are spectacular, and we found the visit to the bell tower unforgettable.You might also check for handbills advertising concerts in the church -- a much richer way of experiencing it.

Worth the visit!. Notre Dame busy, but it's easy to get in and walk around. We visited not long before a mass started and enjoyed all of the amazing art, architecture, and history. Don't miss it! The exterior is absolutely gorgeous. Make sure to stick around to hear the bells chiming!

Amazing. While staring at the absolute beauty of Notre Dame, I realized it was Sunday and they were having service, about that time the bells started to ring. To be standing in Notre Dame and hear the bells is something one can never forget.

Majestic!!!. Notre Dame is so majestic that anyone visiting Paris needs to see it and it is unavoidable. People get married in its garden, and people visit it for any reason. It is a must see for anyone who goes to Paris.

Heart of Paris. I was very impressive the gorgeous cathedral Notre Dame Cathedral since the first time I watched the movie The Hunchback of Notre Dame. Today I saw one in real and the feeling still like the first time. Notre Dame Cathedral is real heart of Paris

Reverencing Notre Dame Cathedral. I visited in October, so although there was a line, it moved very fast. The plaza in front is great for taking photographs, and tour buses and especially, the tour boat, drops you off right in front of the cathedral. When you step inside, you are filled with the history of the place, the people who have walked the same steps as you and worshipped in the cathedral. It is a must see stop in Paris, and it is free. Try to come back for a worship service. There was a service with song that I wanted to experience, but it didn't work out with our schedule.
Only saw outside . Standing outside the building looked huge, but the queues looked too big to get in, cafe close by was amazing

Second visit. A must see destination. This was our second visit of this beautiful cathedral. Security has increased significantly since our first visit but this serves to keep us safe so no complaints.
Simply a beautiful church. Must see amazing stain glass everywhere you look. Don't worry about the line for security it moves fast and who can't stand looking at something so wonderful.

A must to see. This is always a must to see in Paris. The queue for the security check can be very long especially on Saturday and Sunday. I suggest you to come early or better during the week if you can. Inside the church is always very nice.

Stunning!. This cathedral is just absolutely stunning! It's incredible to think how old it is compared to any building in the US. Even for the non-religious, this is a must-see. It's architecture, the paintings, and the amazing gold trinkets, goblets, and other stuff will blow your mind. A little pricey to light a candle in honor of anyone - but totally understand how much money it must take to keep this place in order.
Great place. Loved going into Notre Dame Cathedral. It is free but if you want to go the very top you must pay and there is usually a line
Amazing photo location. This is a great attraction for detailed photographs, the cathedral is stunning and very detailed, deserves a second visit surely.
Line moves quickly. Don't be deterred by a long lineMoves quickly and worth the waitNo entrance fee eitherEnjoy the outside architecture while moving through queue

Beautiful, but packed!. This church is breathtaking from the outside. We visited on a Sunday and there was a service going on so we were not able to go in. I was surprised by how fenced off the building was and by the number of police around the area. There are a lot of tourists, but definitely worth it!
900 years of history. Fantastic building full of history. Wonderful strained glass and terrific atmosphere. Even my teenage daughters were impressed.

Gorgeous Cathedral. This cathedral is free to enter. Do NOT be alarmed by the line because while it is long the line moves very quick! I was surprised that with the long lines the cathedral was not over packed which was great! The cathedral itself is beautiful! It is very large so you can spend a lot of time inside the cathedral if you enjoy them! The art work is very intricate and it was a great escape from the heat! I only did the main floor with my boyfriend but I believe you can pay money in order to go to the top of the cathedral! We already climbed at a few of our destinations so we passed on that option but I am sure it is worth it!
Outstanding cathedral . A must, this cathedral has been built at different times and it is just beautiful! All the craftsmanships of the stone at the different facades are just breath taking!

Come for the Rose Window and the grandeur. Not much more can be said about this majestic sacred place. When I visit, I try to savor the light and how it spills into the nooks and crannies of the Cathedral.

Not to miss if in Paris. We lined up early to go up the tower to see the gargoyles and view from up top. We were certainly impressed with both ! Note that the queue for going up the tower and in the cathedral is usually long most of the time.~ and you need to pay to go up the tower.

A must see in Paris. The Cathedral is absolutely amazing. The French Gothic style of the cathedral is beautiful and you can really appreciate the time it took to build this masterpiece. Considering it is free admission, if you're in Paris, you must stop by.
Free entry. Amazing place!. Everyone has to visit here. It's really grand from inside. For a free entry, this is totally worth it.
Beautiful but packed. Norte Dame is stunning, both inside and out, the only negative is the number of people inside which does detract slightly.

Inspiring. Another must see in Paris. Loved the history in this place. Beautiful old building and stained glass windows. No issue with peddlers think the soldiers and police wandering around have dampened them down a bit. Great place to kill a few hours

Very Beautiful . I visited Notre Dame Cathedral by myself , it was free entry so that was a bonus . Inside its so beautiful and pretty . Amazing very wow , the architecture and pictures and icons are very beautiful. Very big inside , u can walk around inside and read and take Beautiful pics as that's what I did .
excellent for everybody. so old and so magnificent. on a sunny day the vitrals are even more magnificent. to climb gives you another different look of the church and the sorroundings.

Amazingly beautiful. I knew this was a "must see" item for a trip to Paris, but I had no idea just how truly beautiful it is. Wow, the stained glass (colors are so vivid!), architecture, all of it - is truly breathtaking. I'm not Catholic or even very religious, but I could definitely sense the spirituality while I was here. Don't miss it!

Moving!. A visit to Paris is not complete until you have been inside Notre Dame Cathedral. It's a moving experience that words cannot begin to describe, especially if you are there for mass. Withstand the lines and you will will be glad you did.

Havent ever been in, but it is a beautiful building in a beautiful setting. Travelled here by Metro, walked round the corner to Nortre Dam and enjoyed it in the evening light. I've never been inside, and never felt compelled to go in. It is a beautiful building well worth visiting even if it is only to look at the outside of it!

Fantastic.. We've visited Westminster Abbey, the Duomo in Florence, St. Peter's in Rome. Notre Dame is truly world class; the French must be (and should be) very proud of this architectural and religious wonder. We toured both the interior (during the international Mass), and the towers. Phenomenal views from the top, as well as closeup appreciation of the menagerie (the various gargoyles and creatures adorning the facade). The bells were pealing incessantly and spectacularly at 11:15 for the call to service, what an experience.
seen nicer Cathedrals. was ok saw big rats running about during the day did not seem to be fazed by humans .did not go in was better at night when it was all lit up
Fantastic gothic cathedral. Notre dame is truly gothic with its numerous gargoyles and high spires ! It is well worth a visit just to admire or have a cheeky lunch date on the river by it.

Beautiful . Well worth a visit it is free entry. UnlessYou want an audio guide or to go to the top. Which we didn't do. It is absolutely stunning inside. I would recommend getting there earlier on as it does get really busy. But the metro station is very close.

Impressive Cathedral. It took over 60 years to finally complete the entire cathedral. The interior design enhances the lighting and brings the peace and quietness. It is a must visit for its reputation, and beautiful architectural itself. Entrance free. There are fixed timing messes and choir performance in the evening. Bus 27 goes there, you shall get off at St Michel
Historic and fascinating . It's breath taking, the long queues move very fast, remember it's a church and don't use flash photography and respect the area that is set aside for prayers.

Magnificent cathedral. Beautifully maintained cathedral with awe inspiring architecture. Several hour wait for tickets to climb to the top of the tour. Suggest first thing in the morning. But does not open until 10:00

One of the most beautiful cathedrals in thew whole world.. I do not understand visiting Paris and not going to Notre Dame. Famous for movies, it is one of the most stunning cathedral I have visited in the whole world. Shocking and unforgettable.

Awe inspiring. As a fan of both religious and gothic architecture, this was one of the highlights of my trip. I had booked a hotel close by, as I knew I would want to go look at it many times in many lights. If you have a choice, try to choose a sunny day when you go inside. Even though there are many windows, it can be dark on a cloudy day. Note that there is almost always a line to get in, but it’s a security line only and moves pretty fast. Due to the line I went inside only twice. The last evening being the highlight, as we found that there was a special mass being held, with 2 bishops and representatives of other religions, to pray for peace and an end to violence after the attacks in Rouen that occurred a few days before I was there. To attend mass at Notre Dame is an experience I will always remember. Make sure you go around the back. The view from the small park there is even more interesting than the façade. You get the best view of the flying buttresses. The back is also less restored than the facade: you see more weathering on the carving. Tip: there is a small public toilet facility back there.
So Amazing. I couldn't believe my eyes it was the most amazing church I have ever been in,the stone work was amazing a must see.
Notre Dame Cathedral - Church of Our Lady. Nicest cathedral in the city where you astonish the paintings and the giant worshipping place to the people who seeks the historical finish of churches.

Incredible Cathedral. Sometimes you wonder if places this famous are overhyped, but Notre Dame easily deserves its worldwide reputation as one of the most incredible and impressive cathedrals in the world. You don't need to spend much time inside (unless you want to in which case you definitely can/should), but this is a MUST visit for the beautiful exterior and the incredible scale of the ceilings and stained glass windows.

Deserving of the word Awesome!!. Visited on the Sunday after the Nice attack and stayed for the special mass. A truly inspiring wonderful place. The bells are tremendous and rung frequently. You cannot visit Paris and not go here.

Stunning.. The detail on the Notre Dame is impeccable. A must see!A friend and I walked around the Cathedral grounds rather than going inside, as the queues were very long and it is just as stunning from the outside.

Notre Dame Cathedral. Notre Dame had a one hundred yard long line, but the quickist line in Paris- don't be intimidated. Free entry here to see one of the more iconic religious buildings in the world. The exterior and interior of this church is gorgeous, and well worth a stop in while in Paris
Notre Dame . This is a stunning piece of architecture. The study of the history of the building and the human effort to complete it is very interesting

Stunning. Take your time. This is a magical place full of extraordinary stained glass. Despite the crowds, a great place to visit. Interested in history, I asked someone why it wasn't bombed in WWII and was told the German officer who was given the order to bomb it refused. I can't wait to get back to find out more about that. Very sacred, extraordinary.

Big queue outside and not so good inside unless you're into churches. Great impressive building from the outside, but after queueing to get inside, not so impressed. So many donation points it got a bit silly. Quite dark. Couldn't find the entrance to climb to the top so we gave up.

Amazing place to visit. One of the places to visit to tick off of the Paris check list!The initial queues were a bit off putting but they were constantly on the move and we made it inside after around 20 minutes of queuing.This cathedral was fantastic to see with all its nooks and crannies, but one thing I couldnt stop commenting on was the DUST! Dust everywhere I tell you! It became something to laugh about by the end as everything was covered in it. Well worth a visit.

Facinating. Facinating atmosphere. There is always a very long que for entrance since it is free. The good news is it goes really fast. It only took 10-15 minutes to get in. We were lucky to experience a mass. You tell there mass timings by bell chimes. You will not be sorry to wait.

Miracle happens here! Praise the Lord! . We visited here on a busy morning with dozens of tourist groups visiting the church at the same time. It was really dim inside and there were loads of people taking photos. As a photographer i naturally went to shoot at the quiet end of the building. It wasnt until when i have walked out of the church down the street to realize i have lost my newly acquired sunglasses which cost a small fortune. I went into full on panic mode and didn't know what to do. I closed my eyes and my inner voice told me to go back to the church. I went back to the spot where i was taking photos but the sunnies werent there. Disappointed as i was. I decided to leave from the other entrance. As i approached the front chairs close to the alter i saw something silverish glittering in the dark. I turned around and my sunnies were folded and sitting on a chair in the middle of the row. This place truly works wonders!

Spiritual and Beautiful. Definitely get an audio tour. Rick Steves has free download tours. So much beauty and spectacular history. I also attended church service even though I didn't speak fluent French and not Catholic. It was amazing just to worship in such a beautiful setting.
Gargoyles. I loved going up in the bell tower. As you climb, the marble steps are grooved by 900+ years of wear. The gargoyles and grotesques are fabulous.
A must-see. Queue's can be long though. If you're around for several days, try coming back at a different time. And don't forget to visit the tower !

Amazing with a big wow factor. When we turned around the corner and saw Notre Dame my wife just stopped in awe and said wow.. It does have that effect on people. It is a stunning building. Entrance is free to the Cathedral and although there was a long queue to get in, it only took 10 minutes of waiting in line so that is definitely acceptable. The inside of the church is beautiful and I would definitely recommend people to visit it. You can get up in the towers, but we didn't go as there was around 2 hours waiting in line.
My favourite place in paris. If you get there in time for the service you won't be disappointed. Free for under 25 who belong to Europe. Make sure you do all sections. It's completely worth it!
Definitely worth seeing. The line might be long to get in for general entrace but it moves fast and the history of this cathedral makes it worth the wait.

Amazing. Lots of History to this church, Beautiful inside and out. A must see, if you have the chance to venture out. Go to Chartres Cathedral,just as beautiful as notre dame.We didn't pay for the tour, we ended up walking up to the church and walked around ourselves.

Magical!. I visited this wonderful place with friends unfortunately I didn't go inside as I was wearing a singlet that day and wasn't sure I'd be let in with bare shoulders, the line is long but moves pretty quickly so don't be put off by it. As I sat and waited for my friends I saw people enter with bare shoulders so must not be something that they worry about, I don't think that you pay entry to go inside either. So my next trip to Paris I will be going inside to be able to experience this magical place if the outside is anything to go by the inside would be amazing!

Steps up to Emmanuel. Notre DameWalking up the 400 steps was just magical, saw the great bell Emmanuel and the city views were magnificent.Notre Dame's history is long and impressive, inside the Cathedral is splendid too!Walking up the steps, in the evening, is a must to enjoy the spectacular views to their best.

Magnificent. This world renowned cathedral is all that it is acclaimed to be. A beautiful majestic church no matter which side you photo it from and truly awesome inside.No matter which religion you believe in, this is a must see. Security is tight around this site.
Stunning. Absolutely beautiful and enormous cathedral. The queues to get in can be crazy long, but don' be deterred, they only take about 10 - 20 mins to move to the door. And it's worth the wait!
Great. I like it, very nice place. I want to come back and spend more time inside the church. Great great experience.

Bad luck. As we arrived to this well known destination we had to stand in an endless line. We did so however as we reached the middle of the queue it started raining heavily so we had to disperse and hide from the rain. 30 minutes later it was still raining and we decided to leave. It will definitely be on my next to do list in my trip to Paris.
Beautiful breathtaking place!. It's so big! And looks so beautiful from the inside your heart will pound.Considering it's free to visit - that is a must visit place in Paris. (Bring an audio guide).
very beautiful church!. I was with my family at the church. very huge. When we were there lucky we can see ceremony. we are lucky !!!
Awesome Cathedral. Getting to the cathedral is easy, but lines for the tower are long so get there early, or go in the evening after dinner.

Notre Dame. Another great destination place in beautiful Paris, the cathedral of Notre Dame. This historic church, a magnificent monument to faith and architecture, the history, art and music is a must stop on your visit to Paris. I used to go a listen to organ concerts at the cathedral, and shall always remember my first sounds of Couperin and Messaien in the large, dark and beautiful Cathedral of Notre Dame.
Its all about paris. This a very iconic place in paris, it tool almost 200 years to build the famous cathedral church, a little crowded as compared to the rest of the city but a must visit place !
Breathtaking. The Cathedral and the history surrounding it was just amazing-from the HUGE stained glass windows, to the Mass in progress as we visited.
Beautiful church. Amazing views, lovely souvenirs, awesome to see how far human creativity can go. You have to be quiet inside though!

Beautiful attraction and a must see!. I visited this attraction for free using my Paris Pass - highly recommend anyone to see this beautiful church made famous in The Hunchback of NotreDame book and Disney film.

The lines are very long . The area surrounding the cathedral is beautiful and full of history. Great place to walk around. Unfortunately the queues to go inside the cathedral are too long. Not a pleasant wait in the rain or in the summer heat.

Gothic masterpiece. It is situated at 4th district of Paris. If you want to get inside, wake up early, cause lines are... from here to eternity. For me the most interesting are organs and of course chimera statues. Nearby you can see Sorbonne University, Pantheon and Luxembourg Gardens.

Too busy for me. The church is beautiful, no question on that, but too busy for me, I could not really enjoy it. We had to wait in line, which didn't take too long, though the line was pretty long. Inside the church was really crowded.

Organized tour of Notre Dame. We paid for a walking tour of Notre Dame which included an hours boat trip afterwards. We had not been in the Cathedral for many years and it was good to revisit. The guide was informative about its history and construction . Especially useful was the fact that the tour avoided the queues- a major advantage as there are always queues! Learnt the significance of the fictional hunchback to the ongoing existence of the Cathedral.

Historical place / A must during your visit in Paris. Majestic place in the center of Paris, fantastic temple globally recognized and full of history of Paris. An hour will be enough, free entrance and amaizing mosaic windows!!

Our lady cathedral. Not to be missed. Yes we did que but it went down very fast . Beautiful ancient building . Has a wonderful atmosphere .. The feeling lots of people has prayed here . We had a lovely look round . It is free to enter . The shop sold gifts but a bit expensive for me.

Gorgeous!. What a structure! Although a bit crowded and not quite able to listen to the mass taking place at the time of our visit, this was such an amazing cathedral!!! The black Christ is absolutely beautiful!

Monumental building. It is just as amazing as you would imagine. The only problem was the queues are horrendous, but to be expected on a city break at one of the main attractions. There are also lovely park areas outside of Notre Dame to rest tired feet!

SO. PRETTY.. The line to get in goes very fast. It is free to the public. The cathedral is huge and gorgeous. I was completely in awe by the building. The gargoyles on the outside were really fun to stop and admire!

A must see but not my favorite. Yes, you need to see this gothic church that took almost 200 years to build. No trip to Paris is complete without it. The outside is so detailed that you could spend hours with a guide explaining it all. Notre Dame seemed excessively dark after visiting Sainte Chapelle prior coming here. It is still a magnificent church even though we did not get a chance to climb the stairs because the line was too long.

Over loved!. This is an iconic place in Paris, the problem lies in the fact that it is an over loved tourist attraction. Mindless hordes waiting in long lines all day long, whom I suspect have no real appreciation for Gothic architecture but are really just looking for a hunchback or Desdemona...(They are most certainly not here!)It is a dark and poorly lit Cathedral. There are much more beautiful Cathedrals in France and prettier churches in Paris. The tourists themselves detract from the whole experience...but hey..join the throng, shuffle into the gloomy interior and see if you appreciate the divine......or you can play Pokemon Go with the hoard of young men who seem to be fixated on their smart phones lurching in and around Notre Dame...I have better things to see and do.

Ancient Building With Great Detail of Arts on Wall. Was a long queue at entrance (in hot sunny day) and we decided to skip the inside look and spent time outside looking at art on walls and architect of building.

Beautiful. Many people, but were able to enter quite quickly. A beautiful cathedral, not to be missed. There is a possibility to climb one of the towers, but the line is quite long so we did not take advantage of that

Impressive. Love the cathedral, and so much history, queue was huge to get in, due to extra security, queue time however was quick. Get a guide book or read up on the many sculptors before hand, I read up afterwards and missed a lot, so another trip will be in order. Pay to go up to the towers, do the Quasimodo bit, apparently the gargoyles are a must, another one we missed
Stunning . This is a must if you visit paris. It is such a stunning cathedral inside and out.Easy walking distance to popidou
I've seen a lot of churches but.... Amazing! Amazingly big, amazingly beautiful, amazingly full of history! See the Disney move "The Hunchback of Notre Dame" before you go there ;)

Go on Sunday morning and sit in the audience, wonderful. Its the most lovely Cathedral in Paris, the stain glass windows are glorious, the crowd is respectful and quiet, and its full of interest and magnificence. Another "Dont Miss if in Paris".

Underwhelmed . Whilst the exterior is inspiring, the interior and the general feeling left me feeling less inspired and was pleased that we did not join the massive queue to get to the top. If you are religious, I am sure it would be a different experience but for the less religious, like myself, I was left underwhelmed. For a more inspiring and uplifting location, visit the Sacre Cœur. Now that's an exceptional building!!
Breathtaking place to visit.. I visited Notre-Dame with my 7 year old daughter in April, we loved it, it was beyond stunning. Would definitely return again.

Fantastic , not to miss !. This is a free entry activity , I think there are tours to the top but are charged, we liked it so much that we came back to attend a music concert ( Bach and Purcell recital ) on 9 Aug 2016 This was worth attending in teh ambient and pristine setting of the cathederal so look it up and plan ahead of any visit to Paris
Beautiful and peaceful feeling. Too many people visit this place but still gives you the feel of calm and peace at heart with the mural painting that are just amazing.
Serene and historic. Worth thinking about a guide to learn about the history and political importance of this site. Go upstairs to see the island itself. Understand the glory of the church.
Majestic . Amazing experience entering during mass. The architect tyre is amazing! The stained glass is like nothing I've ever seen! Must visit if in Paris!
Magnifique. Absolutely a must see when in Paris! Climb the steps the the top for a spectacular view! The steps to the top are a separate line outside the church.

Iconic. You cannot go to Paris and not see Notre Dame. The cathedral is impressive, especially considering when it was built and how long it took to build it. Imagine starting work on a cathedral in the 1100s, knowing that your great (or great-great) grandchildren would be the first generation to worship within it. Such faith. Personally, I think the exterior with the gothic flying buttresses is the most interesting part, but it is well worth stepping inside to see the interior as well.My one regret from our trip to Paris was that we did not climb the tower to see the gargoyles up close. By the time we arrived (when it opened, around 10am) the line to climb the tower was already down the entire length of the church and did not appear to move for the hour or so that we were in the area.

Awe-inspiring visit. Can an American truly grasp that a building dates from the twelfth century? Notre Dame provides an amazing trip back through the centuries. We just walked in and viewed the cathedral--at no charge. We found out when services were held and came back for a Gregorian mass. What a way to understand the real heart of the building! Another morning we walked around the river side of the cathedral--before most people were even awake. Love those flying buttresses! The tower had an admission charge, and lines were hours long every time we were near, so we missed that. But don't miss the beauty and peace of a quick stop at least in the cathedral. Early mornings will give you quick access.
Gotgeous. It's a Must see!! We walked not too far from the arch area. It runs long river so nice walk. Also near restaurants and shopping. Beautiful building!!!

Moving experience. We arrived around midday to a massive line up. Undeterred we lined up and it moved quickly. The interior is simply stunning, the choir were practicing while we were there and it was quite a moving experience.

The towers are worth the hike!. We were do glad we went to the top of Notre Dame for the gorgeous views, even though it was crowded and a long climb. Get there early - before the doors open. There is a separate line around the side for the towers. Don't be afraid of the long lines you see to go into the church, as they move really fast. We loved the less common view of the church from the back side where there is a pretty little garden, as well as across the river from the church.

Wear comfortable shoes..... ...and climb to the top! Do not make the mistake of wearing wedges or flip-flops. The views are so amazing! It seems like a lot of people did not realize you could go alol the way to the top, but you can. Look for another set of steep stairs when you get mid-level!

Always à favorite!. All my visitors want to come here, entry is simple and quick, but keep valables close in the crowds inside. My favorite bit is the huge blue round Windows and some of the other high up ones, so dont get too distracted by the things at eye level!!

Beautiful!! . This Cathedral is beautiful from inside and out the architecture of it is stunning!! From the design at the entrance at the doors you just see how beautifully designed this building is and what's mind blowing is that all of this details where done such a long time ago I highly recommend going to this place when visiting Paris.

Stunning architecture and feel. I fell in love as soon as I walked inside. Every detail of this cathedral was captivating and I felt like I could sit in there for a long time in silence. I was in awe of the beauty.

Very Impressive. We had a guided tour of the Notre Dame Cathedral which was very impressive. The architecture, stained glass and artwork is absolutely beautiful. Apparently on the 1st Friday of the month from 3-4 pm, Christ's Crown of Thorns is displayed. Unfortunately we were there on a Wednesday.

Great architecture!. This gothic church has so many stories in its architecture. You need a tour of the church to understand it. We took a walking tour which starts outside the church and the guide explained some parts about the history and design of the church.
Beautifully historic. Ok so my Son didn't find the hunchback but it's still worth a visit.The fake mute charity com people outside didn't put us off but were extremely annoying.

Nice to view this historical church.. We did not take a tour of the inside of Notre Dame, but were able to see all the wonderful architecture outside. Whatever you do, take the time to observe all the minute details that went into designing and building this fabulous structure.
Super. We arrived by 9am one morning and went straight in. It was lovely very peaceful. And free which is great with the expense of Paris.
Great place!!. Charming and mystic atmosphere!!! Organ was playing- it was magic. Beautiful photoes and feelings! Must see by all means!!

Everything you could ask for. This church is amazing. The location is excellent - an easy find via city bus. This place is busy as expected, but the lines move faster than expected. When we arrived the line spanned from the doors all the way back to the end of the courtyard and started to turn back toward the church. We decided to wait in line anyway - and it was worth the wait. We waited 10-15 minutes from the back of the line.Admission is free.The church is huge! Service was going on while we visited which really added to the experience. I've attended church growing up, but I have never seen anything like this - the customs and reverence was greatThings you may like: free, amazing structure, iconic, spiritualThings you may not like: lines, selling things inside a church (I'm pretty sure Jesus had a fit about this in the past :p)Let me know if you found this helpful!

Fab place . Really lovely here, although even in freezing cold March it was rammed with tourists, so just be awear you will not be alone, however the atmosphere is so relaxing and beautiful. There is so much history a guided tour is worth while, but have a wander around on your own too. I love this cathedral and j'adore Paris. Paris is always a good idea
Lovely. What a lovely place to visit so peaceful, very busy but doesn't take long to get in after the hustle and bussel of Paris centre a nice quiet place to sit and people watch

Just amazing. There is a reason why this building is a must see!It is beautiful and grand from the outside, but on the inside it is simply awe inspiring! You can't help but look up, then catch sight of the stained glass windows, then to read some history, then look up, then...

Wonderful Cathedral. There is very little I can say about this Cathedral. It is quite simply just amazing. I had to cut the visit short as my little boy decided he needed the bathroom and as is normal in Paris there is none there.

Great views of Paris. The line to go up into towers was so long almost did not wait in it. My husband really wanted to so we did. It took over an hour to get in. The spiral staircases were killer. The views at the top and along the way were great. A bit closterphobic.
The amazing Notre Dame. The Noter Dame is huge gothic cathedral, I highly recommend this place because it is amazing and magnificent. It has beautiful stained glass and a famous organ there.
Absolutely Stunning. Notre Dame has a presence that is tangible as you walk around. I particularly enjoyed the outside of the cathedral, and really felt at peace just strolling around.
Does it need words?. Just an amazing cathedral you should not miss. As are all big cathedrals in the world. Unfortunately very crowded, but hey, it's Notre Dame...

Wonderful Place. This awe inspiring building was of massive Interest to myself and other I travelled with. From historic religious and myself and a couple of others a masonic point of view. In fact France /Paris had many places that were of great interest

So beautiful!. We were so very lucky to stay right around the corner from this beautiful cathedral! What a wonderful sight to see everyday as we walked out of our apartment. Imwas fortunate enough to experience mass while inside and it was just amazing!!

Worth going inside or getting up close to the cathedral! Line moves really fast!. We stopped here and at first were a little worried that the line was so long it would take a while to get in when actually the line moves really really quickly. The line is long just for security reasons. The building is immaculate. Amazingly intricate architecture and design. You have to be quiet inside - so if you have young kids that tend to speak loudly or a screaming baby, try not to go inside. They have displays about the history of the cathedral and the different phases of construction. There's a very impressive scale model of the place too. It is a very dark and gothic feel cathedral - quite different from a lot of other places you will see in Paris. It's definitely worth the visit. It's located on the original island where the city of Paris started! Might have been better to do an audio tour or guided tour to know more of the history, but even as mere "lay people", I was really impressed and enjoyed the visit.

August 2016. A very beautiful church. Be prepared to pay for a guide booklet, an audio guide and also to enter a side chapel, all extra. We skipped the side chapel, the person collecting the money to get in was rude. The audio guide was helpful but you have to pay and leave a form of identification with the person at the desk. I was a bit leery of that but it was fine, I got my license back.

Meh.. I am not religious, and so some of the significance of this landmark is probably lost on me. I did read some of the history, but I suppose I'm not moved by enormous churches?It was quite crowded, and the guards at the gates openly scowled at visitors like we were vermin. Inside you could donate to light a candle, or sign up to confess to a priest. I'd recommend this to religious people, but for the rest, I'd say it's skippable.

Glad we went . I'm glad we went but the outside was the star of the show for me - both in the daylight and lit up at night. I thoroughly recommend the view from the river.The inside, for me, lacked any wow factor and there were many tourists, as you'd expect. We found a beautiful, equally as old, church across the road to light a candle that did have a wow factor due to its atmosphere-sadly lacking inside Notre Dame.
somptueuse. Speechless, really magnificient,,, best time to visit is very early morning to avoid the queue. this place is a temple of quieteness like every religious place

Most churches in Europe are the same but this one is one of the best!. A must see! Along with Sagrada Familia in Barcelona, Notre Dame is one of the best and most iconic churches. I suggest going to the top and taking a picture of the Gargoyle with the Eiffel tower in the back. It will be one of your best pictures!

Impressive on the outside. We took pictures from the outside of the cathedral and across the river. Managed to take beautiful shots of the whole building. There were 2 lines in front of the cathedral and unfortunately we didn't know what they were for until I read the reviews today. There was no signage or anyone around to ask what was going on. The lines were quite long and because my mum and I were getting tired, we didn't join the queue to view the cathedral from the inside. Definitely a must do on my next trip.
Top 10 sight.. Join the queue and take a brolly. Well worth the visit, very impressive. A true gem. Should take about an hour to do it justice.

A Historic Site but a Little Overrated . It's Notre Dame. It is stunning from the exterior. It is grand. As an American it is amazing to be in a cathedral that is so old. I love history and antiquity so I was very pleased to see it. My husband was much less impressed and didn't quite get what all the fuss is about.Watch out for scammers and pickpockets. We were approached many times while in line and in the square. One time was almost certainly a pickpocket attempt.

Spectacular. Notre Dame cathedral is amazing! When is Paris I highly recommend a visit. I could of easily stood outside and took many pictures however once you get inside you realise there is so much more to it. When I have visited it has been Christmas and there is always such a wonderful scent of frankincense wandering throughout the building. There was also a lovely nativity on display which was great. There are some wonderful tapestries hung from the ceilings and if you can try and go when the choir are singing as it just adds to the experience. Simply beautiful.

Once is great. Beautiful, historical (architecture, religious history) also crowded and hot. Young kids survived, adults were happy! A lot to see, consider the brighter daytime hours light up the stained glass the best.

Absolutely beautiful!. A beautiful church indeed! Be sure to look for the medallion on the cement in front of the church as this is supposed to mark the center of Paris. There was a line but it moved quickly. We had the Paris museum pass but apparently this "museum"Is open to the public. I laughed when I saw the gift shop inside of the church. The people traffic moved swiftly once inside. We did not do the audio guide which we were fine with. They did have a history of the church written out on large panels. Regardless of whether you are deeply religious or not, you will appreciate the beautiful architecture and stained glass windows of this church!

Beautiful. Well worth a visit. in the top 10 for Paris. No special skip the line with the Museum Pass but it moves fast. the entrance to the towers is from inside. If you leave you will have to line up again!

Nice cathedral - nice area around. It's free it's nice. The stain-glass Windows look beautiful from the inside. It's in the Latin quarter so go to rue de la hutchette from here and enjoy a nice al fresco dining experience

Huge. Amazing gothic architecture and history. Queues are long because of extra bag checks on entry but they are managed well. Photography is allowed but with no flash. Entry is free and there is a charge to go up to the top if you want.

The bells!. Went up on a Sunday. That was amazing. Got to see a service early in the morning. Beautiful when accompanied by a choir and very moving. Then queued for an hour to get to the top despite getting there at 10am when they open the top. I suggest getting there at about 9.30am or earlier to queue! We even got to hear the bells being rung whilst on the belltower what an amazing experience!
Worth the long wait. Impressive details on the inside that made the kids interested while they were nagging for waiting in the sun. Always a must-see.

Beautiful!. A beautiful church located right within Paris. The line to enter the church can go as long as 70 meters but it is all worth it. There are 2 entrances the one that takes you to the top floors and the one that shows you the Cathedral from the inside. Be prepared to walk a lot especially if you're going to the top floors. As for the inside of the Cathedral it is just beautiful. Truly a must see.

Beautiful and Moving. Visit early. We arrived about 9 am and there was no line. Breathtaking stained glass windows. I sat down and had a prayerful visit and it was so meaningful to me. Allow yourself time to fully embrace the Cathedral in all its grandeur.

My Dream Come true. It's a total MUST to visit Notre Dame. That cathedral holds a lot of history. The architecture is EXCELLENT. Although the line to get in is ridiculously long, it moves very fast so it's was worth the wait. I took plenty of pictures and I was happy to be there. Unfortunately I wasn't able to go to Mass there.

We stood in the wrong queue for 2 hours!!!!. We visited the cathedral Aug 2016. Beware there is 2 queues - we stood for over 2 and only realised we had a queued to climb the tower after we began the climb. Yep me and my 8 year old daughters walked the 422 steps to the top. I have to say it was worth it! Amazing views on a beautiful clear day. Very narrow and steep stairs though. So beware!!!We then queued on the other side to gain entry into the cathedral. Thankfully we were no more than 10 min in this queue. Utterly beautiful and a must visit for everyone. It is free to enter, although there is a souvenir kiosk and a donation suggestion once in. A highlight of the trip!! We would do again.
Always magnificent!. It is and is going to remain magical... there is always something special to see, if you go with kids they will love it and remind about the film.
A Must See. The line goes fast. It's nice and cool inside. Walk the sides first then go straight up to the alter. Confessions are offered daily.

Beautiful. The line is long but it goes very fast. Don't get me wrong, its a beautiful church, but I was underwhelmed in general. Hard to be too impressed once you've been to St Peters, but this is still a must see location. Shouldn't take you more than an hour even with a long line.

Another Beautiful Paris Icon. The beauty of this church radiates inside and outside. You can spend hours looking at the different architecture, and chapels in the church. It is a definite place to stop in and appreciate the work that was put into the church. We had a tour guide, which provided little pieces of information that were interesting.

Beautiful inside and outside. Happy to queue for this beautiful building however when we arrived there was a tiny queue which meant we practically walked in off the street. Lovely and interesting insideYou can take a audio tour if you prefer for five euros.Otherwise it is free The towers on the side if feeling energetic have a fee but we didn't do these as the queue was long.

Very Special. Been to Paris loads of times but never gone inside Notre Dame. Although we had to wait in an orderly queue,it was more than worth it.(Free entrance ). The interior is spectacular.The carvings,the stained glass windows,the artwork are all absolutely stunning.The sense of history is everywhere.
Underwhelming . This is possibly the worst cathedral I have visited. Plain, busy, overcrowded. Take the beautiful walk around the island and skip the church!

Weekend in Paris. What can I say! I just love this Cathedral. We visited it in December 2014 by night, so very beautiful that we had to go back in May this year. It was very busy by day, the queues were long, we formed a snail shape que in the square outside. It was worth it though. Who can resist this wonderful architecture.

Beautiful outside, amazing inside. It's famous for many reasons, the outside is very beautiful. But, when you get inside, at least for me, is the most incredible building in Paris, no matter how many people on the line, you must get inside of the church, I'm not catholic, but I loved the inside, it's amazing.

Sit down and "listen" to the Cathedral. Go to the 8.30 am Sunday Service. We got there about 7.45 and there was no queue. We were allowed into the Cathedral about 8.00 am and got front row seats for the service. I am not of this faith but I am able to follow the format of the service. It was beautiful to hear it delivered in French. The young lady doing the singing had a wonderful voice further enhanced by the acoustics in the Cathedral. Don't just walk by taking pictures like the rest of the tourist hordes - sit down and absorb this for 45 minutes. Do your walking around and photographs afterwards

Not a place quiet prayer. Visit early in day, pay the extra euro to visit treasury to see how rich the church is - the religious art and stained glass windows are beautiful best to get a guide even if you know this religion - Is included in Paris Pass

A most beautiful building with flying buttresses and gargoyles. Going to look at the Notre Dame Cathedral from the ground instead of the river was a good choice for us. We saw the building on a cruise around the Ile de la Cite in 2006 but ran out of time to take a closer look. This time we saw the full granduer of the outside architecture and we were thoroughly impressed by what we saw.We were not prepared to stand in the hot sun for hours to enter the building however since the queue outside was almost half a kilometre long!Given our lack of inside knowledge, so to speak, I cannot comment on the interior but the exterior of this fine building is fabulous.
Beautiful. Go first thing in the morning (9am) and avoid huge lines. You can tour around inside for an hour and then do the artifacts are when it opens.

Beautiful cathedral.. Doesn't matter whether your religious or not, the beautiful architecture of this cathedral is worth visiting. Like all tourist places in Paris, you have to go through security to enter the cathedral, but once your inside, you'll be amazed at the beautiful religious artifacts, stained glass windows and the history. No fees to enter. Not many beautiful things left anywhere that are free.
Amazing cathedral church. Always go to top to get the best of the visit. There is street with lot of sandwitch selling cafes next to church. Have food there.

Beautiful . Amazing church, we lite candles. Beautiful little shop. Services still go on while viewers watch on. Double check if your allowed to take pictures, sometimes the church don't allow the use off cameras inside. Worth a view

Beautiful church . Notre Dame is a beautiful church with lots of big beautiful stain glass windows. It's a real sight to see from outside with great architecture. You may have to que for a few minutes but it's worth it. Highly recommend it.
Great!!!!. Notre Dame Cathedral!!! beautiful!!! Superb!!! Great Architecture!!! Mesmerising!!! One of its kind!!! Must Visit!!!

Amazing church to see! . Came to visit this church on Saturday! The building is simply stunning! Only visited the outside as the queue to get in was enormous! The architecture is stunning and can see why it was so busy!
Wow. Seen it on TV ,,but until you stand in front of it ,you haven't seen it at all ,get there early cues are long ,

Beautiful, just beautiful. Well. You have to stop here when you're in Paris. It's not a rule, but it's understood. If you're camera-happy you can take pix without a flash, but be sure take everything in with your eyes, not just your camera. The art and architecture are stunning. Free to the public, so enjoy. Too, be respectful of those who have come to pray and/or worship.
Mloco. Nice to see, windows were nice but generally Cathedral was very dark inside. The building was very nice outside. The queue was not very long so entry was quick.

A visit is a must. We visited Notre Dame Cathedral as a spur of the moment thing. We had not pre-booked either entrance to the cathedral or the bell tower. We queued for the cathedral for about 15-20 minutes and the queue moved continuously (it was about 11.45am) so we were very pleased and surprised to be inside so speedily. It's a beautiful cathedral and well worth visiting - a real must. We strolled around the outside and gave the queue to the bell tower a cursory glance - horrendous! If you are going to do this I recommend pre-booking unless you get there at stupid o'clock in the morning. I don't ever feel the need to climb 387 stairs to make myself nauseous and turn my legs to jelly but I'm sure there are plenty of you who will delight in the view and I'm sure it's awesome if it floats your boat. Notre Dame is a true gem of Paris!
All the same. The architecture wasn't bad, but the use was the same. Also, it says it closes at 6:45, but if there are too many people, they will cut the line. You have to arrive at around 6:00.

Mass at Notre Dame. Especially if you are Catholic, go to Mass at Cathedrale Notre-Dame de Paris. It's a very moving experience. After Mass, visit the treasures surrounding the church in little chapel areas.

Immense and gigantic. One of the main monuments of Paris that you would see from the four corners of the city. When you get close to it, you will discover the gigantic aspect of this colossal structure. All these sculptures, towers, gargoyles, etc. Make you feel frightened of the ability of men.I visited Notre Dame in August, I couldn't get a ticket due to the very long queue. Advise it to book a ticket online.

Awe inspiring. What a work of art and serenity! From the entrance to exit, every moment was awesome yet serene. There was an air of calmness. Good idea to pick a 2 euro booklet available at the entrance and go around the cathedral twice…..to understand the nuances of this wonderful place
Lovely old church in a great area of Paris. The cathedral is beautiful with lots of history and architectural interest. Make sure you visit Ile de St Louis behind th cathedral!

Iconic, must-go, but it is actually just a gothic church. Notre-dame is definitely a major landmark in Paris, and a reference point as well. You do need to go there. And you probably want to climb the towers as well (a separate entrance to the side of the church). There is a long line to enter the church (free) but it moves relatively fast. It is very common to have services inside. It is really great to be in such an iconic place but I should say that the interior and exterior is like just any other gothic church. Still, you can say this is the original. A must for first time visitors.
Beautiful. Visited her with my gf and wow! Such a beautiful building full of character and history. Such a quiet and pleasant place just to relax and gather your thoughts.
Always amazing . Always enjoy a visit to Notre Dame. We happened to walk in durning Sunday mass it adds another demission to the experience. In many ways I enjoy the outside as much as the inside.
Beautiful Church..!!. One of the must dos' in Paris..free entry, amazingly constructed...nice square outside, really close to Seine. The place is usually overcrowded, long queue but fast moving..!!
Dark but magnifique. When you arrive to Paris you must see this Cathedral. C'est magnifique! Beautiful stained glass windows. For addition fee you may upstairs to tower. No lift.

Amazing building. Arrive early to avoid the crowds (and queue to get in) Lovely to wander with not many people. Architecture was interesting to look at. If you want to go up the towers, entry is on the outside and the queue for that was so long 30mins before it was due to open. Its a shame that you cannot prebook tickets to enter. We didnt bother as it was warm and meant sitting around for too long.

Interesting Architecture. Of course this is a Paris landmark, and on the tourist list of must sees. It was crowded and hard to move away from the crowds inside. The outside is beautiful and worth a walk by if you do not have the time to wait in line to go inside.

Incredibly beautiful!!!. We went to quite a few attractions and this was one of my favorites. So breathtaking and I just could not get enough. It seems there is never enough time to take it all in. We did spend some time there but I could easily go back again.

Beautiful but too crowded. It is free to go in the cathedral so there can be quite a line usually after 10. It is a beautiful church. The chandeliers give off the romantic feel. What ruins the experience for me are the tourists (mainly my peeps from the mainland) who leave their flash on when taking pics. There is an announcement to be quiet in many languages yet tourists talk way too loud in church. Or when you have a sign that says no taking pictures in a certain section because people are praying and you have tourists who don't bother to look at the sign. The gothic gargoyles really make me think of the hutch back of notre dame.
Well worth a visit. A very impressive place to visit and free entry apart from the tower which we didn't do. Easy to get to on the Metro.
Fantastic!. Fantastic cathedral, when you are inside you really feel WOW!! Historical and nice place to visit! As well if you want to spend some time in silence it is a good place for that.

Beautiful church. Well worth queuing for - the queue moves quite quickly - there is no charge, but there are bag checks.
We didn't climb the towers - this is a separate queue to the left of the church and has a charge.

Grab a camera and get to Notre Dame cathedral. This place its beautiful in every stone it is there. Try to get early since long lines are every day in this beautiful cathedral. Don't have words to describe what you can feel underneath the wooden christ. Great place.

Breathtaking beauty and architecture!. Really a must-see while in Paris if you appreciate ancient architecture and cathedrals. Notre Dame's flying buttress design enabled the incredibly high walls to be built and not collapse. You will notice the buttresses on the exterior of the cathedral along the sides. Every surface seems enhanced with amazing sculptures and gargoyles, and we were mesmerized just taking in the details of the exterior artworks. Inside is breathtaking... the sweeping arch of the vaulted ceiling, the many side chapels each with their own statues and themes, the elaborate and huge stained glass windows. Well worth the wait, and steps away from several sidewalk cafes and other attractions, all in the most historic section of Paris. Don't miss it!

Another no visit complete without coming here. How could you come to Paris and not see Notre Dame.... The queuing was fine with not major delays. Free to get in but donations greatly received. Marvelous trip.
Amazing. What can be said, it is one of the most beautiful structures ever built. We walked through the entire cathedral and lit a few candles... Great visit...
Beautiful cathedral . I loved this cathedral!!! It is a good thing to do on a rainy day! It is free to enter but can cost money if a tour is desired or a head set.

Beautiful Church. Notre Dame is a beautiful church to visit. There is a line out front, but it moves quickly. Take the time to enjoy the Rose Windows and hang back with a tour group to hear the history. It is a church so you may see mass or hear a choir sing. Touring the church is free.

Great place to visit . Superb place and free to enter ! But you need to pay if you go up the bell tower. We timed it perfect as we went straight in but on our way out there was quite a long queue.Well worth a visit when in Paris.
Notre Dame. Another must see in Paris. Entry to the cathedral is free. Queues are long but fast moving. Allow about an hour to take it all in then go up the towers to admire the view

Not just another church!. I don't know why, but the lines were not long. We only had to wait about 20 minutes tops to get in the main cathedral. The entry is free, but we did buy the audio tour, which was good. It really explained everything really well and even have some hokie, cute videos in it. This should NOT be missed. Even my teenager and 23 year old loved it. The line was a bit long to go up to the towers, so we skipped that and put it on our agenda for another day. Go, go, go!
Queues move fast. Don't be put off by the horrendous queue. It moves quickly and its worth a 10 minute wait to step inside such an iconic church.

Fantastic. Arrived at 7.3oam. Not a person out the front. Went to 8am Mass with three dozen locals, one of the most amazing experiences of my life. Sung in French intimately in front of the Altar with the gates closed, it was just beautiful. The hordes of tourists were arriving as I left. I had already seen everything before the crowds, it was amazing. Be there early.
One of must see places in Paris. Located in a huge piazza and the Cathedral is massive and a lot to see inside the cathedral. Never miss to visit this place when visiting Paris.
Beautiful place lovely feeling .. Wow what a lovely sense of peace and love .such a lovely place to visit .really enjoyed being there . didn't want to leave .
Stay for service!. Try to stay afterwards if you can for evensong (an hour or so after tours end). The boy choir is phenomenal. Well worth the wait!
Wow!. Since it was Sunday, we actually got to in for free since they were having service. Notre Dame sure is something. It's a gorgeous cathedral the details are unbelievable!

Amazing place, great church. Take the time to line up and attend a service inside the great church. Not only will you get the whole experience but you get to sit down and look around at all the artwork inside. Make a donation to the Nuns sitting at the front of the church and they will bless you, something of a religious experience.
Notre Dame. Absolutely love this Cathedral. My third visit, and there will be a fourth! Can't get enough of Paris.

Amazing!. Norte Dame Cathedral is the most stunning church I have ever been in. The ceilings and stained glass are stunning. I was in total awe the entire time, and I have been in hundreds of historical churches on my travels.
Blew me away. Extraordinary building with extraordinary exhibits - and free entry. It's a must visit - not because of the novel or Disney - but because it is amazing.
Amazing. This was our second visit to this magnificent cathedral. Not much more to say than this place is spectacular. Beautiful stained glass windows in the front and back were truly works of art.
Best place in Paris. The best place I have been in Paris. And the view from the top was great!! Number 1 thing to visit in Paris

Beautiful . Didn't go up as queue was the length of the square and hadn't got time but it was so beautiful from the outside and the area was amazing. This is the true historic and romantic centre in Paris. Highly recommend as I regret not getting in.

Must be on your list. This is an amazing and beautiful Cathedral, don't get me wrong I have seen what I believe more beautiful Cathedrals but for location and history this one must be on your list. If you have the time do the climb up to the bell tower, you wont regret it. To me its one of those places you could easily visit more than once.

Amazing. It was one of the best places I have visited in Paris . It was really amazing. You just stop in front of that Cathedral and feel the soul of that time, that people and you have already known why there are so many legends about these place ! The only thing I didn't like - there were too many tourists there - noisy, but for such kind of place is normal .... Anyway- go there if you have chance
Family Holiday. Historical place and educational visit, basic facility, bussy, hope to see and enjoy more in the future
beuatiful historical. one of the most fascinating buildings a person could see, we were truly amazed, loved the historical features
A historical beauty. I did a tour around the Ile de Cite and Notre Dame and learned a great deal about the history and significance of the site. Well worth a visit.
Cannot miss. What more can you say - one of the most important Christian sites to visit in France. It is incredible and inspiring to see this pace of worship.

Great Architecture. We had to line up to get in, but the line moved quickly.
A must see in Paris, but to be honest I was not awed by the overall experience.
I found the church of St Sulpice more enthralling.

Historical and magical building. The cathedral is more spectacular from the outside, a bit dark and busy on the inside. But its free of charge to enter, the queue goes pretty fast and its nice to see the structure also from the inside. The kids very much appreciated the visit

Amazing Architecture. Worth to visit inside this Cathedral....loved the architecture inside it. Entry if free for everyone and though the queue for the entry is big, please dont ignore, it hardly takes 15 to 20 mins only, to get in, because people keep moving inside very quickly....overall, its a worth visit and it will take atleast 30 mins inside and if you want to know about in deep, then may take more time inside.......
Beautiful architecture. Stunning architecture and great place to visit.Very busy inside and out.Outside is lovely to sit and look up at the vast structure

It worth see it . Hello ,Beautiful sight seen, you will see the mosaic glass and the prayer rooms for different priests.You will have the opportunity to pray or enjoying watching the prayers.Do not forget to buy the coin .It is great experience to have your dinner in one of the Restaurants around and enjoy the watching the Cathedral with the light reflections .
Wow. I have heard about it, I have seen it. I am amazed. Again, most of these sites are in the 1 arrondisment...take the train..you won't be dissapointed...

Truly beautiful. Go and see the church and skip lunch if you have to. The line goes very fast and when you are inside take a lot of pictures and enjoy the view. It was a wonderful trip and I enjoyed every second of it!
Quick walkthrough. Really long que, but it actually went really fast. Probably like 10 minutes waiting. Well inside it was amazing. Worth the visit.

beautiful, long visit. the lines are so long. it is worth it because it is beautiful but be ready to wait in line for a while. it is a beautiful church and mostly it is famous so we wanted to go inside, wouldnt wait in line forever for a second visit but it was worth it.

Wow. Amazing.. We didn't go up the tower so only queued for the main cathedral. The queue moves very quickly so inside in a matter of minutes. Also it is free.
Inside is beautiful with interesting historic information to read. The structure and glasswork is outstanding and breathtaking.
We'll worth a visit.
Beautiful and awe-inspiring place. This iconic cathedral in Paris is well worth a visit. We attended a High Mass and found the experience very worthwhile. Beautiful stained glass, fabulous music...

Fantastic!. The climb up to the bell tower was totally worth the view! (Here's a picture.) The stained glass windows inside are amazing and the grandeur of the architecture is inspiring. There was a Mass going on while we were there and people were not very respectful, (talking loudly) which was disappointing. Please remember that this is a cathedral.

Beautiful Cathedral. A beautiful Cathedral and a must see to appreciate the intimate art work.
The entry is free, but there are entry timings that you need to keep in mind. You can clock photos inside unlike Westminster Abbey.
It will not take more than an hour to see the church.

Wow Wow Wow. If you have the time and money I would recommend a group tour guide as there is so much fascinating information about this beautiful church. Tours can take 45-60min. Go early to avoid a rush and try to visit during the week if possible, weekends and public holidays are much busier. Also watch out for beggars striking up conversation with a clipboard wanting you sign a petition and then give them money.
AMAZING. A must see attraction in Paris. It's architecture is impressive and if you have the chance to go to mass there it is a very moving experience.
Beautiful place. This place is worth a visit when in Paris. The architecture and the overall atmosphere of the place has had a huge impression on me.
Beautiful. Well when is Paris, do the touristy stuff right? As a Catholic I was thrilled to visit. Even if you're not, it's still a beautiful church. I would certainly recommend going!
Amazing. We arrived to see Notre Dame while High Mass was in progress, it was truly amazing. The whole church was lit in candles with music and choirs singing. Quite an experience.

Listening to the bells ring is delightful!. Notre Dame is jaw dropping! Even if you do not want to wait in line to see it, you must walk by and stay for a while to see the outside. You can also see it by taking the Batobus, or doing a Seine River Cruise, but best way is to walk to it.
Massive queue. Looked beautiful from outside and I'm sure it would have given a great view from the top. However due to the immense queue for the entrance we did not go inside.

It's huge. Lovely area that branches off into different neighbourhoods. We didn't even go into the church and were amazed at the size of the structure. It's nice to just walk around the outside of it.

Just a magnificent structure, truely a must do tour. The cathedral is just a work of art in itself. From the entrance and beyond some of the most fabulous architecture in play. We took the audio tour and found it was well worth the few euros we paid. a must visit..

Selfie cental. At 8.45am, there was no queue. When I came out at about 9.15am the queue was quite long (but moving fast).
The building is huge and spectacular but spoilt by the amount of people taking selfies at various statues. Highly inappropriate I think. I don't mind photos of the building buy selfies just seem wrong.

Skip the line with Fat Tire Tours!. Did the tour with a great, funny, informative guide...it was beautiful and I'm glad we climbed all those steps, the view was spectacular. Loved the close up of the gargoyles too. I think the cathedral itself is free, but admission is required to climb the tower.

Not to be missed!. Beautiful and famous Gothic cathedral that must be visited anytime you're in Paris. We visited in July 2016 and found a LONG line snaking into the plaza in front of the cathedral - this was a security line and went by very fast so don't let that intimidate you!

Spiritual experience.. We arrived on the Sunday, and visited just prior to Mass.There was the most heavenly music playing, adding to the experience. We felt transported and peaceful at the same time. This is a must for Paris visitors.
Well worth a look. Queues are mental! Try to visit on a sunny day to get the best out of the stained glass windows. Beware of beggars and pickpockets trying to distract you too.

Glorious Gotic cathedrale. Very elaborate statues on the portal, famous facade and reliefs. fascinating atmosphere from this place. Cathedrale is very gigantic and this gothic bulding looks magical at night.

Always impressive. If you are in Paris as a visitor there are a few places you have to go to and Notre Dame is one of them.If it would not have been for the long queue to get in which is normal and expected during summer time it would have been a great experience.There is plenty to say about this cathedral but is is better to read up on it on the Internet or in special books than for me to give you a tour.It was the first time for my children and they liked it.
Wonderful . Absolutely amazing. Breathtaking. I'm glad I was there early in the morning so it wasn't too crowded.

Best Stained Glass Show In Town. If you think you would only want to see one church with stained glass in your lifetime, make it Notre Dame. I have seen a lot of them, most considered "jewels" in the towns and cities where they are located--- this one is a must see.

Always a special treat to visit. Allow yourself at least 1 - 2 hours to visit Notre Dame. I was fortunate enough to be with a Choir Group that was singing in the Cathedral. We were admitted through a side gate and got to go through the bowels of the Cathedral where the Choir could prepare for their performance. Even that was amazing, with all the beauty that comes with a Cathedral and it's history.You walk in an anti clockwise direction around the Cathedral and if you'd like to get some good photos - go early. By lunchtime there is a long, long queue to get in, although it does move quickly. There are some excellent interpretation boards in a number of languages to help guide you on what you are seeing.Notre Dame is central to many places in Paris and is well worth a visit if you like Gothic architecture.Note: admission is free. If you want to climb the bell towers expect to pay a fee. Expect a security bag check. When we were there, lots of Malitia and Police due to recent attacks in France. Be careful. Malitia don't have a sense of humour.
A cathedral with story. Beautiful cathedral. Full of tourist. Nice square outside. Definitely a city icon that worth the visit.
Worth Visiting. Worth visiting. The Cathedral is very nice. Expect long Q for security check. Candles are very expensive. Staff are very friendly and helpful

Lovely - free admission . The most beautiful catedral I have ever saw. It's always overcrowded but you don't have to wait too much time, even if the row looks big it will only take around 20 minutes to get in. It really worth it.
Beautiful. What a beautiful building! The outside of the structure is as awe inspiring as all of the incredible beauty inside. Definitely worth the time to see!

Amazing beauty!. It's worth it to spring for a tour guide for this attraction. The history and context give so much more meaning to viewing this treasure. It's great to view at night too from a Seine riverboat cruise!

A Marvel of Construction. I am constantly amazed at medieval construction. Absent of the advantages of the industrial age, buildings like this, still standing and fully functional after all these hundreds of years are truly remarkable.Personally I don't like the fact that too many tourists disregard the request to not take pictures, it's disrespectful. not just because it's a church, but because they were asked not to do it. Don't do it.DO take in all of it's detail and the patina that has built up from the years and years and years of daily use. it's beautiful.
beautiful cathedral. wow! it's a must visit in Paris. We even got lucky and participated in a mass.But do expect long lines at the entrance

Gorgeous building, inside and out. Its unbelievable that its free to visit here, as its a truly spectacular building. A must see if you are in Paris. There is a queue if you visit midday, but it goes quickly, and as with all the other major attractions, is mainly due to security bag checks. Once you're inside its well worth it, stunning architecture and a wonderful ambiance.

A must-see in Paris. A beautiful example of gothic architecture, Notre Dame of Paris is a must-see when you visit Paris. Note that admission to the cathedral is free but the museum pass does not save you time. Climbing to the bell towers, however, has a fee, and while the museum pass gets you in without the admission fee, you do not get to skip the long line. I waited over an hour, but it was worth the wait!

Must see in Paris.
