We went inside Notre Dame as part of a free podcast audio guide & map by Rick Steves, which also takes in the left bank, latin quarter, Saint Chapelle & the deportation memorial, altogether a good 4 hours walking tour. Start queueing while you listen to the audio guide, it moves really quickly, less then 10 minutes queue for us at 11am ish. Free to go inside, and the rose window is lovely, and there is a good information point inside which shows the history.. The guide explains the architecture of the building and explains the various features on the façade. Best views of Notre Dame from the Left Bank, a very pleasant walk towards the latin quarter where you'll find some reasonably priced eats & drinks.

Amazingly beautiful Cathedral. The line to get in is long but moves quickly and it is well worth the wait. It is a beautiful old church with beautiful artwork and stained glass windows. The architecture is fantastic, particularly when you think about when the construction was started and how long it took to build.

Beautiful cathedral but nothing too different from all the others across Europe.. This is a magnificent cathedral. The one thing that made this Cathedral stand out from the rest is it's stained glass. The magnitude of the stained glass were captivating, especially with the sun behind it.

Very Beautiful, but wouldn't say it was the best of the best. . We have been to many Cathedrals all over Europe, & though this one was very beautiful, it was underwhelming to its popularity. They do allow photographs which was very nice, as well we really enjoyed listening to the Pipe Organ during our visit. We were only aloud in the first half of the main floor, which was a little disappointing. But still a very lovely place.

Impressive building, ok to see once.. Impressive building to visit once when in Paris. The public toilets were broken and we had to go to a restaurant with all the drama that brings like being ignored, having to buy a tokens etc. Watch out for the Roma pick pocketers outside! They ask you to sign a petition while they steal your wallet. Fortunately we were warned in advance. Not a pleasant visit!
Nice!. We didn't want to wait in line to go inside, but the outside was beautiful. I wish we had enough time to tour it, I'm sure it was just as beautiful on the inside.

Well worth a visit. We were very lucky, as the day we visited Notre Dame, there was an organ recital being performed that night which we went back to. Fabulous. What a sound.The cathedral was a must see when you are in Paris and we were not disappointed.Free to enter although donations are always welcome.
Beautiful. The low tourism numbers this summer worked in our favor, there was no line to get into Notre Dame. We only had to go through the perfunctory baggage check line and we were inside. Lovely!

Breath taking iconic church. As you approach Notre Dame do not be perturbed by the long line, it moved quickly and is a simple security check. Once inside you can take your time to wander among the columns and admire the gothic architecture. Cameras are welcome but no flash. The is no entry fee. And when you are done head across the river and back a few blocks for reasonably priced cafes and bistros.

Amazing Church. Free to get in, but there is a charge to see some of the antiquities of 10e.The structure itself is quite magnificent, and while walking inside they have a display of how the church has looked throughout the years and how it came to be the building that it is today.There's a big que but it went down pretty quick.Unbelievable architecture, exquisite icons, many areas to light candles for prayers.
A must see... A visit to Paris would perhaps be incomplete without a tour of this monument. One of the most visited attraction, it is a wonder of a creation.

Wonderful gothic church. Visit to Paris is incomplete without a visit to Notre dame beautiful grand and imposing there was a service going on in the church and being there at that time made it more magical you can climb up the stairs and have sweeping views of the city from thereChildren really enjoyed the visit

I went to church. I'm speechless. The exterior grounds are lavish, the inside, even more so. Only visited as it was part of my tour package with ParisCity Vision. The tour guide brought this immense building to life. It's crowded but the line goes surprisingly fast. And it's free! You have an opportunity to donate if you so chose.

Interesting cathedral with a bit of history. Notre Dame is probably on everyone's list to visit when in Paris. Its quite an imposing structure, and with the hunchback story attached, is very popular, so be prepared to queue up. Its free to enter, but you will pay a fee to climb the tower.
Stunning, a must visit. In summer, make sure you go early. They open at 8:00 and there is mass at 8 as well. But, you can go just for a visit with NO line at that time which I absolutely recommend.

go early - no really.. we got there just as they opened. totally worth it. no line. stunning. for simple tour, it can be done in 30 minutes. there's a couple of important churches around there as well.
Made short tour stop here. We had time to go in to the cathedral, pray, and take photos. Worth the visit. Even though the entry line was long, it went quickly.
Beautiful Cathedral - another highlight of our Paris holiday. Notre Dame Cathedral is a spectacular place to visit, we absolutely loved it and would recommend a visit it if you are in Paris.

Most beautiful Cathedral ever?. One day in Paris? There are 4 obvious places to go and this is one of them. Free to enter. Best time is late afternoon when the choir is singing, a service is on (please be quiet!) and you see and hear the most stunning Gothic architecture you can imagine. Judging by the number of wedding pictures taken outside it's stunning beauty will take you at least a dozen photos outside before you even enter as well. Very accessible from the metro and a short walk away from a number of other attractions like the Sorbonne, Hotel de Ville and many more.

awe-inspiring. Very sacred experience. Learning about the history and how long it took to build was awe-inspiring. We took the free self-guided tour. If you want to go to the top and see all of Paris, there is a cost. Afterwards, we strolled over to the left bank, had a beer in a local cafe and then walked back to the Marais district.

Worth the climb. Cathedral is amazing, queues grow quickly and move slowly. Get there when it opens and then you can join the queue for the towers but we did both before 11. View is superb and you've got to see the bells!

No hunchback noted. Free to get in, but there is a charge to see some of the antiquities of 10e. It is gothic. It's terrifying. To be locked in the place alone at night it's easy to see how a novel such as the hunchback of notre dame can come to be.

Breathtakingly Beautiful Church. We came with a tour group so we didn't have to stand in line which was nice. The structure itself is quite magnificent, and while walking inside they have a display of how the church has looked throughout the years and how it came to be the building that it is today. Inside is dimly lit so that candles and the natural light coming in allows you to transport yourself back in time to imagine what it would have been like to be there during a service long ago. The stained glass window catch the light and display amazing colors inside. Definitely will remember this experience for a long time to come.

Our neighborhood cathedral.. Stayed directly across the Seine from Notre Dame which made it so easy and convenient to just "pop in" when we wanted. In addition to the beauty and history of the building, the various cultural offereings are outstanding. We attended an extraordinary concert our very first evening as well as an organ recital, Gregorian mass and a son et lumiere over the course of our two weeks. Although the lines look daunting, they move quickly and, once inside, the huge space accommodates the large numbers.
Stunning!. One of the most beautiful buildings I've ever seen! Superb, you have to check it out. The gothic style is fascinating. There's a big que but it went down pretty quick.

Mrs Maria . Loved how easy it was to get in to see this great cathedral. Unbelievable architecture, exquisite icons, many areas to light candles for prayers. Solemn, holy place. It will touch your heart. Wish I could have spent more time there.
Amazing architecture. Sadly we only got to see this amazing structure from the outside. It is imposing & is breathtaking. The architecture is absolutely amazing.
forget the crowd. unfortunately nowadays there is no time to visit without the crowd which takes half of the enchantment of the visit.but in your first trip to Paris you should go.

You have to visit Notre Dame. A visit to Notre Dame is everything you expect...except you will need to share it with hundreds of people and a long line to get in the door. We were there on a Monday, which was supposed to be a slow day, but there was a 45 minute wait to get in the door. We had access to the towers via the Paris museum pass, but that was more than a 2 hour wait so we skipped it. Still this is worth the grief and should be on your must do list.

Amazing inside and out. Third time to the Cathedral and it impresses every time. Amazing detail outside and in. The center of Paris (look for the circular marker) is located in the pavement in front of the cathedral. Always busy. Worth visiting daytime or nighttime. If you are visiting with children, pick up a small bag of rice at a convenience store to bring. There is usually a group of pigeons to feed on the right front side of the square in front of the cathedral. Pour some rice into your hand (or on your head ) and you'll be covered in pigeons! Our kids begged us to go back just for the pigeons.

Great Sight & Setting. It was almost as if there were more people here than those queuing outside The Louvre. That suggests it is better to go earlier in the morning.But because of the queues, we decided to not go in, nor go up the tower. Note that there is an entry fee.We were very content to explore the outside. The classic frontage is every bit impressive as you would expect, but with the added advantage of being able to spend time looking at the detail. The side view just adds to appreciating the size of the building. A work of art.The setting on the Isle, surrounded by the Seine is special, more so on the sunny day we visited. The large plaza at the front throngs with so many people and nationalities.The Big Bus stops at the Cathedral, and there is an underground station for the Isle, not far away. Neither is it far from both the Louvre or the Musee D'Orsay. The walk along the river bank is beautiful.
Lovely cathedral. Never actually been in it as the queues are always massive. The outside of it is beautiful and great for photos
Excellent. One of the largest and most well known church buildings of the world... excellent place to visit... historic place....
Amazing. It is a must seen place in Paris. You should go when its sunny to see all the stained glass. It has a lot of beautiful statues, including one of Jeanne D'arc.

Stunning. Notre Dame is everything it is cracked up to be. It is in a superb accessible setting on the Ile de la Cite so that you can see it from all sides and many angles. We kept going back. The queues to get in, however, are forbidding.
Unreal. There are no words that can describe this cathedral. You really must see this absolutely beautiful architectural work of art. It took 850 years to build and it's just breath taking.
Grand. This cathedral is unbelievable, grand. calming and serene. On a busy day we found it to be very peaceful

Cathedral from the 1200s. The cathedral was built in the 1200s and it took almost 200 years to build it. It's built in gothic style and has many gargoyles to help drain the water. Apparently only the gargoyles that have an opening in their mouth are truly gargoyles because gargoyle, the name, come from a French word that pretty much means to gargle, representing the sound the rain makes pouring out. The stained glass decorating the cathedral looks black from the outside but is a beautiful rainbow when you look at it from inside the building. There is a large window made of smaller windows out of stained glass which tell a story of a Roman soldier who converted to Christianity and when he was told to start believing in Roman gods and he refused he was lifted safely into heaven with his whole family. This is a story that has since been removed from the church history because of how ridiculous it is but this cathedral still tells it. In front of the church there is a gold metal circle on the floor and it marks the middle of Paris; apparently every city in France has that circle marking the middle of the city. The wait to get into the cathedral is not bad; 10 to 15 minutes and it's worth it. Make sure to check out the back of the cathedral.

Amazing !. The cathedral is a work of beauty.
It is always busy and the lines outside can be long. In the summer months take a hat or an umbrella as the heat can be brutal.
We explored the various sections of the cathedral and all are beautiful.
A must go if one is in Paris.

Peaceful Beauty. My Wife & I visited on a warm (90+ degree day) Monday as part of a small (22 person) RS group. Our guides got us in without having to wait in line. The interior is breathtaking! The side chapels are numerous. You can see the "real" crown of thorns relic (?). Great place to reflect, say a prayer and light a candle (2 or 5 euros). This is the heart of Paris!

Peaceful. Visited Notre Dame and were amazed by the Gothic structures, colorful stained glass windows and the peaceful atmosphere of this cathedral. Highly recommended attraction in Paris to get away from the hustle n bustle of the evergreen city!

Huge lines. There were really long lines. The 1st line was as long as the cathedral and was to buy your ticket. The second line was to get into the cathedrial and was just as long if not longer. I would suggest getting there a bit before they open so the wait would be less.

Lovely Church. Free entry to the main part. A small queue due to security checks but it moved quickly. Certainly worth a visit if your in Paris. The stained glass windows are excellent and the vastness of the ceilings

Beautiful . A lovely experience. We were very fortunate to visit during a short service. The soloist was wonderful. However, I do wish people would not talk especially during a service. But this did not detract from a lovely experience.

People need to remember this is a place of worship first and a tourist attraction second. The queue seemed huge but moved really quickly through bag search area and the queuing was helped by a lovely gentleman playing music nearby. The Cathedral is beautiful inside and really creates an environment of self reflection despite people entering prayer only areas with cameras and selfie sticks.
Free. The entrance to the cathedral is free, but the tower cost is 10€ ( not really worth it, since you can see the city from the top of the Eiffel Tower).

Stunning , place to visit,. This place is stunning ,the river the cathedral and the walks were fantastic ,, if you are on a budget go to a supermarket ,buy your wine crisps ,beer and lunch ,take it to the river ,, wonderful way to spend the day
Notre Dame. Notre Dame was amazing! Beautiful to take the tour up to the top, worth every penny. Loved loved loved! Architecture and history are just breathtaking amazing.
Amazing . Simply amazing. The wait for the entrance is long, definitely don't go in the afternoon. Get up early and go enjoy this beautiful cathedral.

Extremely beautiful . Extremely beautiful cathedral. Entrance is free, so the very long cue to get in took only a few minutes. The cathedral was amazing inside but do not miss the fantastic carvings on the exterior

Didn't go the queue was 2 hours long. Having been to wonderful Sacre Couer Notre dame was next on the itinerary. the entry queue was unbelievable, three times around the square. we settled on a walk along the Seine instead. I'm sure it would have been great had we persevered.
Moral - Go early!

A medieval cathedral. The interior of the cathedral is nice. However do spend some time in line and climb up the numerous steps up to the cathedral's roof. You will get face to face with the gargoyles.

Must see. You can't go to Paris and miss Notre Dame de Paris. We got to the cathedral about 10:00 which was about two hours late. It opens at 7:45 and I'm sure there would be fewer people at that time. We had to stand in line for a while but the line moved quickly and we were in the shade most of the time. There is no charge to enter the church.When we entered a choir was singing which added to the religious ambiance of the place. There are beautiful stained glass windows throughout the cathedral and side chapels with ornate altars. My favorite thing was the model of the cathedral that is displayed under glass. We were going to climb to the top but the line was too long and we were too tired. There is a charge to climb to the top.

Crowded but worth a visit. My partner and I stood for 20 minutes to get in. Our hats and my umbrella as a parasol saved us in the hot sun. Once in, the cathedral was crowded, but we were able to walk around and see what we needed to see.
Notre Dame Cathedral. The Notre Dame Cathedral is a beautiful structure and shouldn't be missed. The Cathedral is a beautiful work of art & history with many statues surrounding the grounds.
Worth it.. You have seen in on television I say once you have the time you should visit. Going through I got a better understanding of the history and was wowwed by the architecture.

Beautiful cathedral on the Seine. This is such a glorious cathedral! We didn't climb the towers, however, we felt like we experienced Notre Dame. Don't forget to walk all the way around the cathedral - it's so beautiful from the back!

Avoid Deaf & Dumb "Charity collectors" they are pick pockets. Loved the Notre Dame.Was less impressed with the 'charity collectors' who managed to pock pocket my friends purse.I was lucky as I ignored them and kept walking, she unfortunately is much kinder then I. She stopped and spoke with them and had her purse / wallet pick pocketed. We saw this scam at various tourist spots.Loved Paris and will be back but it is the worst City I have been to with regards scam artists and pickpockets trying their luck. I may be blonde but I'm not that blonde!!There should be posters up at Tourist spots warning re boggus collectors. Police were in vacinity and ignoring them.
Amasing. Something you must definatelly must visit . It gives you a feeling i cant even describe , its amasing with all those sculptures and details .... just stunning

Breathtaking.... I'm glad I made time to visit Notre Dame cathedral. Truly a masterpiece. I was in awe the whole time. And the history behind it all made it even more interesting. I had to stand in line to go through security before entry. Didn't take long and it was worth it. A bit weird as Mass was being celebrated while all us tourists are being tourists on the side. It took me an hour to go around inside the cathedral...stopping to read a bit more of its history and take pics. A must stop if you're in Paris.
First cathedral to see here in Paris. And make sure you go on up and explore the whole complex. It is worth the time. Spectacular stop for people of any religion.

Stunning inside and out!!. We visited the outside of Notre Dame on multiple occasions and it was an amazing building, truly stunning architecture, then we went inside....This building is incredible, so beautiful inside and steeped in history, and we were lucky enough to visit around Christmas and were able to watch a public mass and it was fantastic, a brilliant experience!

Breathtaking cathedral. This cathedral is breathtaking! We only waited about 5 minutes to get in. Admission is free if you do not climb up to the bell tower. We spent about 30 minutes walking around the cathedral and taking pictures of the inside. The stained glass windows are amazing when the light shines through! So much detail. This is one of my favorite places in Paris.
Beauty. This is an astounding cathedral. The energy when you walk in consumes you in a good way, leaving you emotional.
Long line moves very quickly.. I hadn't been inside for years as the line was so daunting but you are inside before you know it. Lovely, historical site not to be missed.

Cathedral from 12 th century!. This was stared in he 12 the century! This is free to enter. No ticket or booking required. But there will be queue!! If Paris has a heart it lies in here!!! A must visit

Beautiful!. Your first Paris trip is not complete without a visit to Notre Dame! It is a beautiful sight to see and definitely worth paying the ticket. If you want to get a view from the top, then you better get to the place as early as possible because the line can get ridiculous very quickly.

HUGE and Beautiful. It was huge and beautiful (like my title says). It wasn't like the other Cathedrals I went to however, I was amazed with it's size that something so large was built so long ago. I was able to sing in French in the center during a worship. They seem to have a service going on constantly and it was quite cool to hear such beautiful music. It is also free to enter which made it cooler.

NOT to be missed. Our first visit to Paris and what to see, what to sacrifice because of not enough time and what is a must - Notre Dame must be in anyone's top 3 MUST sees!Easy to get to from several Metro stops on the Ile de la Cite. Chatelet and Pont Neuf are both on the other side of the River Seine, but you can easily walk across - or Cite which is on the Ile and if choosing that maybe take a look at Sainte Chapelle on the way.But Notre Dame is an imposing sight as you approach it. You can see it's traditional view or walk to the right and view through the trees. Once you'be been inside, go left of main entrance and along the street to a small garden area with fountain for a quiet reflection at the southerly entrance.After getting there it is free to go inside this historic cathedral - but take care as the lines/queues can be long. But there is so much to see - you can pick up a multi-lingual audio guide (for a cost) inside or just wander around self guiding.It is as you would expect, very impressive inside. Stain glass windows, statues, chapels etc as befits such a majestic religious icon of Paris.We had a beautiful morning at Notre Dame - and all for free
Amazing. Love the city and its amazing buildings relaxing drinking coffee or eating in the shadow of this biluilding

Great Work of Art. Norte Dame Cathedral is simply breathtaking! Very colorful and intricately placed stain glass windows and lattice work adorns the high ceilings . I was in awe during my visit. The atmosphere is serene and tranquil. It's amazing to see the amount of people waiting just to get a glimpse inside. My 8 and 12 years old nephews enjoyed every minute of our visit. I would definitely like to visit again. Denise BU.S.A

A monument standing since centuries!. The Cathedral has been build over 8 centuries. It truly stands as a testimony of architectural supremacy of France over centuries.It is an attraction with a free entry, we had to stand in queue for 30-45 mins.From inside the architecture again is mesmerizing and we really appreciate the supremacy of art.It is peaceful inside and we took a paper guide to understand the history behind each artifact. Audio guide is also an option.

Majestic!!!. It is incredible inside the church. It is so awesome looking at the materials there that has been preserved since so many centuries ago. Go up the tower and look at the beautiful Paris. You might see the friends of Quasimodo ;)

Massive beauty. It is hard to miss this church if you are in Paris near the Seine river. The larger building in its time the cathedral is a gothic masterpiece. Adorned with statues and gargoyles you can spend hours in the outside looking at the amazing art and architecture. Admissions to the church is free and it is both an attraction and functioning Catholic Church so please be respectful when you visit. The interior spaces are massive and only surpassed by St Peters in Rome. Definitely a must see if you come to Paris.

Beautiful Cathedral. No matter how long the line, it will move quickly, I promise. That being said, there is no-one there first thing in the morning, and it will be much cooler if you're visiting in the summer months! If you intend to go up, that line takes a while, but it is beautiful up there.
Beautiful. I am not religious, but I enjoyed learning about how the cathedral was built and seeing the architecture.

The Ultimate Church. Actually, the rear view, with the "flying buttresses" is the best in my opinion. Buy a baguette, some jambon (ham) and fromage (cheese) and sit on a bench and watch the changing scenery at the back of this iconic church. Then go to the front to see the amazing facade. If you are a church-lover, pay the price and go inside. I prefer to observe from outside.

Love Old Churches - and this One's Awesome. I cannot write anything new that you've not already read. The architecture is incredible, there is so much history - and the statue on the side dedicated to Pope Jean Paul II was a nice surprise. Lovely, lovely church...

Climb to top & view better than inside visit. 3rd visit to Notre-Dame and first tour inside. Much preferred the climb to the top than the visit. Audio guide is confusing to use (don't know where you are vs # to listen to). If you are knowledgeable about the catholic faith, it may be more interesting and informative, but for others, it was difficult to know what they were talking about. Beautiful nonetheless, but no access to central area is disappointing. Conversely, walk up/down 400 stairs to the top is a great experience and offers a breathtaking view of the city. If you like pigeons, there are tons!!
heritage . notre dame cathedral is a historical place  it's a church building. we also saw one of best and fine  French architecture here.

Breathtaking. A truly remarkable place to see. Words cannot describe how spectacular this cathedral is. The history of it to the modern day was amazing. We were even blessed to see mass being held and the bells going off whilst in the cathedral. A must see when in Paris

Quasimodo and Gargoyles . Yes that's what I associate with this wonderful intriguing building. But that's all Victor Hugo 's fault. Inspite of the various digressions in his namesake novel this monument is every bit as awe inspiring today as it was back then.

Amazing Gorgeous even for the tenth time.. I have been to The Notre Dame Cathedral many times in my life and each time, I am in awe of its beauty and history. It is hard for me to leave each time and I have to tell myself that I will be back.
Beautiful gothic masterpiece. A stunning and monumental 800 year old gothic masterpiece. Try to visit during Sunday Mass and you'll hear the magnificent organ and singer.
Beautiful!. A trip to Paris is not complete without seeing Notre Dame. It is an amazing structure. The Rose Windows are incredibly beautiful

Fast line, worth the price. It is worth taking a look inside this cathedral. The line may seem long but it most quickly since there is no charge or ticket. The statue of Charlemagne in the piazza is awesome.

Beautiful. If you're going to Paris you can't miss this church. There's no easy way to get in there's no Paris pass there's no fast pass There's No Reservations there's just waiting in line. So because of that try to get there as early as you possibly can in the morning. But it is without question worth it. It is one of the quintessential examples of High Gothic architecture that one can see. Make sure not to look at just the front of the church but walk around it and see the entirety of the outside of the church. If you can bear the line weight and climb to the top of the tower and see the gargoylz. Whatever you do go inside and see the astoundingly beautiful stained-glass windows and the rose window. If you're lucky or if you can plan it try to be there at some point during which they're having services so that you can hear the Magnificent organ. if you like churches it is one of the most magnificent ones that you can find in Europe.

Amazing architecture . We visited the Notre Dame yesterday during our first day in Paris. Due to the time of year it is very busy however it is a must see building due to the magnificent architecture.We loved it and would love to visit again in the future.

Prepare to wait to enter the tower. The line to get into the actual cathedral is deceiving; it looks long but moves pretty fast. It's the line for the towers that is achingly slow. We went there on a miserable cold day. There are some touristy shops across the street from the line I was able to buy a hat and scarf from for cheap to make the wait a little warmer. I'm glad we waited. You might want to bring something to read, however.
Amazing architecture. This is amazing to see from all points. We had lunch outside and enjoyed viewing the front then went on one of the cruises and discovered different views of it. Loved it

Must see!. I'm not Catholic and not particularly religious, but this place is historical and breathtakingly amazing. Get a guide (personal or audio) so you can hear about the history. Make sure you find the model that shows how they built it. Super cool.

Deal: Free Admission.  The 2016 edition of DK Random House's "Top 20 Paris" lists the admission price to Notre Dame at 12 Euros. When we visited this world-class site today, July 30, 2016, what appeared to be a permanent pricing notice showed the admission price to be "Free Admission," as was, indeed, the case. The line to enter was quite long, but moved along at a comfortable pace.Tom and LisaBroomfield, CO

Spiritual. Go for Vespers, stay for the Mass, take it all in. Climb the steps just before close for the shortest line. We made the mistake of seeing that line on a Friday evening- about 30 minutes long- and deciding to come back the next morning. Arrived 10 minutes before opening and the line was already 2 hours long on that Saturday. It was worth the wait, but should have done the climb the night before!

Superb architecture. For those that are interested in Gothic style buildings this is a must! it's free to enter the main area and around the outside however it's about 10 Euro to go up to the bell tower. I did not get to go up this time around but i will next time for sure!It's vast inside and has plenty of other tourists walking about there is also areas for those of faith to pray and light candles (for a donation). When I visited it was during mass so we all had to be super quiet and as it was rather busy inside it could be easy to lose one another. Outside there is a small park behind the Notre Dame which is well kept and peacful to sit in and just marvel at the Cathedral.
Beautiful. Visited here on a Monday just before lunch and queue was about an hour to climb to the top. Totally worth it despite the long wait. Inside the cathedral is breathtakingly beautiful

Beautiful church!. We took the hop on bus early in the morning. The lines are long, but they move fast. The Cathedral is beautiful inside but my pictures did not come out on my iphone. What s beautiful church.

An Architectural Gem. This Cathedral deserves all the attention it gets! It is so beautiful, both inside and out. They do provide quiet spaces for prayers and reflection. To tour the cathedral itself is free. There is a "treasure room" that has a minimal cost, but the relics that are in this room are very beautiful and some are "priceless". If you want to climb the bell tower, there is a cost for it, but it will be included in the Paris Museum Pass. The climb is worth the views, even if you are nervous of heights, but you will definitely get a work-out if you are not used to "taking the stairs".
a church with cultural background. Notre Dame Cathedral is my first destination in Paris. It is a bit church with cultural background. Audio guide is available at the entrance.

Ooh... Ahh... Excuse me.... Obligatory visit to the Notre Dame Cathedral... Arrived on a Thursday Morning around 10am... there was a queue of about 300 meters... some aggresive pan handling of the people in line.... Police had to intervene... We only waited maybe 20 minutes to get through security... It is a magnificent cathedral inside and out... the architecture is a modern marvel... You should not miss this attraction if you are in Paris... However, there are some problems with over crowding.

Excellent free activity!. The lines might look long, but they are fast. It's just a security measure that keeps people from walking right in. It's a beautiful cathedral and a must see along the Seine River.

Sunday Mass a wonderful experience, despite selfie sticks of others.. We were looking forward to attending Sunday Mass at the Cathedral, and it was a very rewarding experience. Be sure to be there at least 15 minutes ahead of time, as there is a queue for the security check. Once inside, there were plenty of seats. It was very distracting at first that quite a lot of visitors thought nothing of talking away loudly, taking photographs etc. while there was clearly a religious service taking place, but (sad to say?) you get used to it and can tune it out. Some visitors even joined the queue for Communion just to get a good position for a photograph. There was no need for such disrespect, as once Mass was over, there was no difficulty in moving around the Cathedral and seeing it all. There was a little shop selling quite nice religious mementos inside too, the queue was long but not overly so. Outside the Cathedral, around the back, there is a lovely little public park. We enjoyed a lovely picnic here (bought sandwiches at Subway across the river) and listened to a band play while we ate. There are little playground areas in this park too, for younger children.

Be sure to visit early. Visited here mid-afternoon one day and the queue to enter the Cathedral was far too long to consider queueing, but enjoyed seeing the outside and sitting in the lovely park behind the Cathedral - which has free Wifi! We then returned at 8am and found it was the ideal time to visit, there was no queue to enter and we got to really appreciate the beauty inside the Cathedral, added bonus was getting to listen to the mass that was on while we walked around the Cathedral. Would highly recommend visiting here, there's no charge to go in, and really is a work of art.

Breathtaking!. A must see! We attended a mass and were in awe of this massive building. It is truly breathtaking. I recommend reading up on the building as there is so much detail, and having a guide book to walk you through all the details helps you appreciate it more.
What an experience!. This was a photographer's delight! I will have to Google all of the highlights, as I spent more time taking pictures than paying attention to what our guide was saying!

A must visit in Paris. A historical landmark you have to see when you go to Paris, take a minute and look up in the side chapels as you go through as they are stunning and make sure you check out the stained glass windows on either side of the main sanctuary. Only thing to remember is to keep quiet as you go round, it is a place of worship and can get quite noisy with tourists!

Stunning inside and out. Steeped in history I had to visit Notre Dame and when I arrived it looked like the whole of Paris picked the same time as me. The queue was huge but to my surprise it went down very quickly. Once inside the cathedral was magnificent and atmospheric. The stained class windows are stunning and there is a lot of things to look at inside. I was lucky enough to witness a sermon, which although I could not understand the language it was a privilege to witness. A note of caution: bring money if you want to purchase souvenirs as it is quite expensive.

Amazing history of the Catholic Church in 1 monument. We got to notre dame @ 9 am so were first in but the tour groups must have earlier time slots so it was full already though no wait to enter. The nave has many monuments to saints & notables such as St Franco, st Vincent de paul & st Teresa. The oldest part of the church from 1169 is behind the alter. There is a nice placard with building plans to show the progress over 8 centuries. The catacomb & steeple climb/ gargoyle tours are extra & entry is outside of the church. They open @ 10 am.

Part of the Paris bucket list. Another must do in Paris. Words seem so inadequate to describe the amazing historical splendor that is Notre Dame. As beautiful as it looks in your dreams about Paris. This trip was part of living a childhood fairy tale and Paris did not disappoint on any level. Just breathtaking.
Interesting. We visited the cathedral and we're happy we did. Surprising that the long line to go in passed quickly. Check out my photos. Everyone should go if they get a chance.

Gothic beauty. Gosh, Paris is beautiful. I visited the cathedral today with my 16 year old son. The line was long but quick. The cathedral's windows were breathtaking, even my son stopped complaining for a good ten minutes. Another must see.

Beautiful. Notre Dame was absolutely beautiful. A highlight for us was going into the towers. It is a tough climb but the views are amazing. If you do decide to tour the towers, the view is almost the same as the view we had from the very top of the Eiffel Tower. Notre Dame was a lot cooler but is a tough climb. The cathedral itself is gorgeous - especially the stained glass. Just get there early and get in line for the tours about an hour before hand!
Don't leave Paris without stopping here first!. ... and when you do, you will realize what the big fuzz is all about... so, make the line and wait to go in... worth your time!

Incredible!. I visited the Notre Dame Cathedral twice in my 3 day visit to Paris. My first visit was with a tour. We climbed to the top of the Cathedral. This is a must Do, if you are able! The views of Paris are wonderful. My second visit was to attend Mass on Sunday at the Cathedral. This was an amazing experience.

Grand and awe inspiring!. Really magnificent visit, with the grand structure on the outside and even more intricate work on the inside. The stained glass windows are really beautiful. You must approach the cathedral on foot from across the island to be able to view it from either side.It is indeed quite breathtaking and one of the must visits in Paris.

Awesome place. . Beautiful building, stunning Windows and pictures. Not really tailored for the English speaking to read any info do I recommend you buy the information book from the gift shop at the end of your visit. Awesome info in that. Can take photos in there but no flash.

May god Bless us all.. This place is for everybody, you may pray, see the architecture or take a stroll next to the canal. Situated in between two canals its almost like an island. Good restaurants around, you have plenty to explore. There are two good souvenir shops behind the cathedral if you want to take home some memories. Something worth watching.

Be aware of the Towers vs the Inside of the Church. We bought skip-the-line tickets through a tour company. Then when we arrived, we found out that the tickets were for the Towers - 422 steps up...422 steps down. That was one long line. The other, much longer line, was to go into the church. Separate lines. I'm writing this review to let people know (those who might not already know...) that there are two aspects to seeing Notre Dame. We skipped the line and went up 30 stairs to the gift shop. We walked completely around the outside of the church, which was beautiful. The tour guide pointed out to us how only the front of it was maintained and cleaned. We did not have enough time to wait in the long line to see the inside of the church.

stunning: gardens + playground, too. The cathedral, of course, is breathtaking. The lines can be long. Go early to avoid them. To the east of the cathedral is the Square Jean XXIII, with lovely gardens, views of the cathedral and a playground: terrific for attraction-weary kids to burn off some steam.

Amazing!!. Decided that this was a definite must see when we were in Paris and we were not disappointed! It is massive and so peaceful inside! There were lines to get inside but they move pretty quickly (and it is free to go inside) so there was no more than a 5-10 minute wait to walk inside. When you do get inside though.. wow! The architecture is simply stunning- and they make sure that you are quiet so as not to disturb the people who actually go there to pray- you can take pictures as you walk through and there are a couple of shops as well as donation points. The building's story is told as you walk through in pictures and models along the way, gardens are lovely and the view from the Seine (we did a canal cruise as well) was stunning. Definitely worth a visit!

Spectacular church and even prettier if you walk around the back with fewer crowds.. This is a lovely old church and should not be missed on a trip to Paris! I suggest getting there early to avoid the lineups.

History, Beauty and Resolve in a Single Building. Notre Dame is another "must" visit if one travels to Paris because both of the history that has taken place here and because of the sheer beauty of the cathedral.The waiting line is long but moves quickly. It is a short walk to several Metro stations and a bit further from the Louvre and other major buildings by foot... but a great walk!

Great views. Very rude staff. Views and gargoyles are fantastic and worth the trip. Staff is very rude. Lady (employee) came up to middle and shoved us from behind to get to staff area. No excuse me or warning. Just shoved everyone in line. Then we waited 20 minutes to go up to top and yet then were rudely told (same lady) we had to leave after 5 minutes. Why did the people before us get 20 minutes?

It really is as breathtaking as they say. Stop in, light a candle, gaze at the gorgeous stained glass. I'm an atheist, but Notre Dame is spectacular. The line out front to get in usually moves rather quickly, so don't be too put off by the length. If you have time, see the ancient ruins just outside beneath the square.

Beautiful! . This is a busy site but a must see. The architecture is amazing and the stained glass and artwork is stunning. When we arrived the lineup looked long but it moved fast so don't be discouraged.
Quality Experience. We went during sunday service and it was stunning, we aren't over religious but the pictures doesn't do it justice

Iconic Paris. There is often a lot going on here as it is still used as a place of worship and as a venue for performances, including those centred upon the magnificent organ. I find it good to get there early in the morning. While there is no charge for general access, you will have to queue although it tends to move quickly. To visit the towers you do need to pay and queue and while the view is good and the architectural detailing close up is interesting, it is not an absolute must. It is certainly an important building which has a key role in the entire history and identify of Paris as a city. Like all Gothic cathedrals, it is architecturally impressive both internally and externally. Take time to savour it all, the details, the sheer majesty of it all, built with the skills, equipment and technology of the day and still standing. Take a walk around the entire building outside also.

Free-Entry, Breathtaking Architecture. Notre-Dame is an iconic monument in Paris, and one that is not difficult to get to. Situated on the Île de la Cité, you may run across it on a stroll along the Seine or on your way to/from the Latin Quarter or Le Marais. Living in Paris, I often attend Mass here, which is a beautiful experience in itself, but even for those that just want to gawk at the gothic structure and take in some rich history, it is worth a stop. Expect crowds, but it moves quickly. I have never taken a tour around the top, but have never felt compelled to do so, as there is much to experience from the free entry portion of the church. Around the church are (also free) gardens that are seemingly underrated. Quiet, serene, massive, and contemplative. It is my number one suggestion for people who visit Paris, not just for the stunning design, but also because it's an excellent starting point to explore the remainder of the city.Metro Stops: -St-Michel Notre Dame – RER B Train Line (blue)-St-Michel Notre Dame – RER C Train Line (yellow)-Cité – Line 4 (fuschia) (BUT) if I were you, take the simpler/quicker (brown) line 11 to Hôtel de Ville. You'll cross off another monument on your way (Hôtel de Ville), have a lovely view of the river as you cross over towards Île de la Cité, and much less traffic.

It's free and worthy a visit, when in Paris!. The Notre Dam is one of the most popular churches of Europe and if in Paris, demands a visit. It is free if you want to go inside but it would cost some money to go right to the centre of it.One way of skipping the tourist lines (which are a permanent feature) is that you go inside to pray. Spend some time in the area in the vicinity to observe the activities around this historic church too. It's worthy of all the praises!

Amazing. Wow, what a site.
To try and explain the beauty of the Notre dame is extremely difficult.
You have to see it to believe this amazing cathridral that took 150 years or so to complete.
Breath taking.
Outstanding. Quick line to get in. Actually had confession there as they have a priest available for that. Wonder of the world.

An Awe Inspiring Experience. Notre Dame Cathedral was magnificent. You don't have to be a church-goer or history lover to thoroughly enjoy this architectural masterpiece. It is easy to see why this is one of the most famous church buildings in the world. The stained glass alone is worth seeing, as well as the pipe organ. Even amidst the numbers of tourists milling about, being inside the Notre Dame gives one a special feeling of admiration for such a brilliant piece of architecture.
Always spectacular and never fails to be a must see!. To truly appreciate Notre Dame, a guide is best. The history and the architecture, the windows are just beautiful.

Must see . Came here solely because of the hunchback of Notre dame! Queues are long to get in but move pretty quickly however. Stunning architecture and humbling cathedral.Don't confuse the queue to get in with the one round the corner to go up the tower to get up close to the gargoyles!Check out the lovely park behind as well.Well worth the visit.

My daughter's choir sang there. We were there to see my daughter's high school choir from California sing during the 630pm Sunday mass. It is such a beautiful grand Cathedral. Best time to go is not during mass because they close off certain areas during mass. It is worth standing in line to see this majestic church and it's beautiful stained glass windows. The outside is just as amazing as the inside and the back of the church outside gives the best view of the flying buttresses. Read up on the history and the various statues and parts of the church so you will know what to look for when you go. Just an amazing venue you can't miss while in Paris.

Stopped by, Impressive. Stopped by on my trip to Paris. An impressive cathedral, no doubt. Doesn't compare to St Peters in Rome, but the architecture, stained glass, and tall ceilings are all very impressive. Did not climb the tower, so that may have increased the rating. Best part is the short line and it is one of the free to enter places in Paris.

Beautiful. We were nearly frightened off visiting Notre Dame by the size of the crowd lined up to enter and view the Cathedral. We found, however, that the line moved quite quickly and we were inside the Cathedral within a reasonable time and the wait was worth it.Paris was our final stop after four weeks touring Europe and we visited a number of Cathedrals but none were more beautiful than Notre Dame. When you couple this beauty with the significant history attached to the Cathedral it provides a lovely place for quiet refection, irrespective of your religion.Well worth a visit in my view.

Booked a Tour. My teenage daughters and I booked a tour with Fat Tires (see my review of Fat Tires under Tours) called 'Skip the line Notre Dame Towers and Sainte Chapelle Tours', so glad we did. For Notre Dame there is no ticket required for entry into the chapel as it is an active church, so you don't have to pay but you do have to queue to get in. The line was long but moved quickly so I guess it took us about 15 minutes. During this time our guide Lavanya was able to give us lots of interesting information through our ear-pieces. Once inside we learnt more whilst we explored this beautiful church. We then walked around the church to the back which is equally as beautiful. The entrance to the Towers is lined with people queuing to get in. We completely skipped this line which saved heaps of time. There are about 400 stairs to the top and it is definitely worth it for the view and the experience. Definitely recommend taking a tour and climbing the towers.

Organ concert at Notre Dame. Visited with 12yr old both during the day and at night for the organ concert. If you only have a little time, skip other attractions, but don't skip Notre Dame. Also, the line to enter moves fast. To get to the towers, you can buy skip-the-line tickets, but when we visited, there wasn't much of a line for the towers. The organ concert was fabulous at night.

Beautiful Gothic Cathedral. One of the Paris attractions that must be seen. This is a very busy tourist attraction and is patrolled heavily by police as well as soldiers. There is also security at the entrance to the cathedral where all purses, backpacks, and bags are examined prior to entering. As it is still a place of worship, silence is expected when a service is taking place. The inside and outside features of this cathedral has to be seen to realize the beauty and grandeur of this structure, ornaments, and stained glass. One can take an optional guided tour to the top of its towers, but there is a fee.

Magnificent Architecture. Originally Notre Dame was not on our honeymoon list of things to do, we were initially just going to look at it and take pictures but it was too tempting to line up and have a look inside.The place is glorious, you must be very quiet as sometimes services are taking place but there's a lot too see and read inside and it's very accessible apart from the upper floors as they are out of bounds sadly.Beware the beggar women outside, they may look innocent and heartbreaking but they are scammers. Instead make a donation to the nuns inside for the upkeep of the building, it's incredibly beautiful and worth queueing.
Not too bothered. It's obviously a must see if you go to Paris. However, those who cannot be bothered with churches should not visit it. At least you can take a photo of it.
Must see. The Cathedral is one of the places in Paris, you have to visit. It is impressive. People tend to forget it's an active church so some silence is appreciated by the visitors.

Huge and awesome. We visited on Sunday morning when harassed volunteers tried to stop visitors from taking photos while the service was underway. But despite the distraction of watching elderly French grumpies intervening while three Buddhist monks snapped away with iphones, the church was a beautiful space.

A great learning experience. This massive cathedral is an icon of Paris. Like every other popular place in Paris, it is best if you go early. We arrived at 9.00am before the mobs were out of bed and virtually had the place to ourselves. To say it is a magnificent place is to under rate it. You can experience the past power of the Church in this magnificient creation and feel a presence within its walls. A half day could easily be spent in this wonderful structure, learning so much from the architecture to the stain glass scenes. Did you know that the reason there are stain glass scenes is because most of the population could not read or write, so by looking at the windows they could learn of the stories of the Bible from the interior of the cathedral as they gazed heavenward to the light. Use your imagination when you go to this site and see what it was like hundreds of years ago and how revered the clergy were and how they dominated the masses of illiterate.
Lovely Cathedral. Beautiful stained glass windows, phenomenal structure, so much beauty in one spot, it is a must-visit!

Wonderful view!. I loved it! The entrance to the Notre-Dame itself was free of charge for us, but getting to the top we had to wait in the line and pay the entrance fee, which is totally worth it! See the gargoyles from the childhood cartoon in real life is great!

If you want to experience Notre Dame go on a Sunday and attend services. Cathedrals are designed for services - the music resonates, the voices echo, and the whole experience is complete when you attend an actual service. One does not have to be a devout Christian to appreciate the service, but if you really want to appreciate a Cathedral visit and attend the service

Must See. Do the tourist thing and visit this must see spot in Paris! Climb to the top. Take as many photos as possible. Listen to your tour guide. Spend hours there. Try to be in attendance of a symphonic concert. Must purchase tickets in cash though. Just do it.

AMAZING! but crowded. What can one say about this amazing structure built so long ago. You HAVE to see it if you visit Paris. The line was too long to go up to the gargoyles which I really regret. I suggest that they have a better gift shop to make $$ for the church. I would have loved a better Christmas ornament I got what they had but it didn't really remind me of the church. How about having some notecards with photos of the beautiful stained glass windows...for example...

Amazing church . A really beautiful church with brilliant architecture and sculptures set in an awesome area. We took the free guided tour offered at the entrance of the church and our volunteer guide, a history student, was excellent. She explained the meaning of the sculptures, architecture etc. along with their interpretations and significance. The interior and exterior both are worth observing. Near the church's exit you can also see the Paris zero point. Once done with the church we walked around the area to see some local artists perform while we enjoyed our berthilon ice cream. This was our favorite place in Paris.
Breathtaking. Gorgeous, you could feel the history just walking in the building. I would have loved to have been able to take a part of a mass, but we were not there during that time.

Beautiful church . Definitely worth a visit. Go when mass is on (we went on Friday) as you will get the full experience. Was impressed with the architecture and there were even confessional booths. Lots of history to read up on and there is another section if you pay a few euros to view artefacts. Entry is free which is always a a bonus. A wee bit of a wait but not too long to get in. Souvenir shop inside overpriced.

Guided tour of Notre Dame. When we arrived, there was a very long queue to get it and that was around 10.30am on a Wednesday. We chose to do the free guided tour available there - apart from an excellent and well informed guide (a vacation student from Puerto Rico), the best thing about this was that we did not have to get into the long queue. The history, symbolism and meaning behind the impressive sculptures is very interesting to learn about. Amazing that they had so much fundamental engineering knowledge way back in the 1100's to be able to construct a building as so very large as this. All bags had to b checked for security purposes.

A free gem! especially if you skip the bell towers... One of the best cathedral experiences, lot of history in the making of this. It does not cost anything to tour most cathedrals in europe, as they are all active homes of prayer. Please be respectful and maintain silence. You will need to pay to take a tour of the belltower etc.

See the gardens behind the cathedral. Go early to climb to the top. Even in the off season there's a line. Totally worth the climb, though. The garden behind the cathedral is one of the most beautiful places in Paris. Many skip it or are unaware. Don't miss it.

Beautiful structure!. On our visit here the line up to get inside was massive! Even the line up for pre ordered tickets was way too long (completely down one side on the footpath). The problem is once your lined up, there's numerous smokers who have no consideration for others around them. So we didn't line up and walked around this stunning structure. Which didn't disappoint. It really is beautiful! I am disappointed that I wasn't able to see inside....but I refuse to be in smokers company and subject myself and family to second hand cigarette smoke!

Warning re Scammers & pick pockets. Do not stop with fake petitioners holding clip boards. They are not charity collectors, they are pick pockets.Do not stop with them at all even to say no, keep on walking. They are very skilled pick pockets.Paris is full of them we saw them at three differecnt locations.
Lovely Cathedral. I really enjoyed visiting this place , the interiors are absolutely amazing , this place is very welll maintained and I would say its a must visit place

Beautiful . So huge and beautiful. I'm not a person to visit museums at such but this was something else. Outside as well as the inside is spectacular. Paris is sooo romantic it is a must to b in love and visit Paris and its cathedrals

Lovely cathedral!. Just beautiful!!
Climbing up the towers wasn't worth it, if going up the Eiffel tower, no need to go up these towers. Wait in queue was 1 hour, for a few minutes up.

Over crowded place. . Long queue for entrance and up to the top. Over crowded with full of tourist. No crowd controls. And top entrance need to pay a fee. I've skip that in the end and took a scroll along the exterior of the building and found the back of the cathedral park rather a different view and interesting. Had a rest there to enjoy the cool breeze and sun rise. Overall the interior of the cathedral is grand but again just too crowded.

Beautiful . What an incredible visit we had to the Notre Dame Cathedral. Nothing is quite like the European cathedrals with the massive pipe organs and choir singing. It will truly give you goosebumps. The history that is contained within those walls is just incredible. We did want to do the tower tour but it had already closed by the time we arrived. Also I hear they do nighttime concerts inside which I would imagine would be absolutely wonderful. Notre Dame is something you just can't miss in Paris, it was one of my favorite attractions and the best thing is that it's free!
Stunning. This is a must see, it is absolutely beautiful and massive. It is on the banks of the Seine and close to the Louvre. Rich with history, don't miss it.

SIGNAGE would be nice.. We had a museum pass and wanted to go to the tower at Notre Dame, but when we saw the line wrap all the way around the building....with no sign of course to tell you that it was the line for the tower, leading everyone to believe it was the line to get in. It was a bit discouraging because everyone we asked had a different answer and gave incorrect information. Too bad really, because the city really makes you believe a museum pass (bought months in advance) will really send you to the front of the line. Not really the case.

Beautiful but crowded . Easily accessible as many tour buses stop here & major stop off on open top bus tours& bateaux Mouches. Very crowded as many tours going on & the square outside very busy. Lots of little stores alongside river Lots of cafés local across the river Be careful of the scammers dropping rings on pavements and trying to con you, we sat & watched it going on & there was no police presence dealing with it. Cathedral stunning inside & out

Beautiful. . Incredible and moving. We did not have time to stay long but enjoyed the Windows, art and statues. We spent several minutes sitting and being peaceful inside. Bring some change and light a candle for someone.

Beautiful and well kept. Visited here with friends a few months ago. The building is amazing and because we were all under 26 we were able to take a free tour of the roof and bell towers from which the view of the entire city below was breath-taking.

Amazing architecture. I'm not a religious, so I'm more interested in the amazing architecture and the stunning stained glass windows. Despite my lack of religion, I have great respect for those who have a religious/spiritual connection, which is spoiled by the visitors who disrespect the signs for silence and the areas just for pray and not for photographs. Maybe more multilingual signs would help this situation. Spectacular though

a must-see when you're in Paris, and it's free!. Don't miss this beautiful Gothic cathedral! Admission is free and guided tours are available in lots of languages. I suggest going early in the morning to avoid the crowds and experience the peace and wonder of this architectural marvel. Exploring on your own takes less than an hour, but take advantage of the tours - you learn so much!
A most see !!!. you won't regret to pay a visit to this place !! take the time please because it is worth it ,I recommend it !!!
Magnificent. Go early in the morning when there is no line. You will enter and see what is one of the most gorgeous churches on this planet. Its gothic style and majesty are simply breathtaking.

A must-visit when in Paris. The history and architecture are enough to lure you in, even if you aren't particularly religious. While the line out front may seem long during the day, it moves VERY fast so don't let that discourage you from going in (free and just a cursory bag check at the doors). The tower climb has a longer line (it seems to average 45-60 minutes throughout the day) but at 10 Euros also worth it for obsessive climbers like me. The gift shop has a moderate selection but everything is essentially related to the church (jewelry, crosses, some magnets) and overall the church and the area around it (including the Latin Quarter across the river) are a great place to spend several hours.
History of Notre Dame. The cathedral was lovely. They have added information about how the cathedral evolved over the years. This is a lovely place to go to mass while you are in Paris.

There are not words enough. It is very difficult to summarize the experience of walking into this cathedral. When I was there on a Sunday evening, Mass was being celebrated. All I could think about was a thousand years of prayers that have been offered at this special place.

What can anyone say that hasn't already been said?. Probably the most famous Roman Catholic edifice in the world, or at worst second behind St. Peters in Rome. Hugo wrote a book about it. And yes, we visited it to show it to our friend who was on her first trip to Paris, and that's on the short list of things you have to see when you come to Paris. But I enjoyed seeing it again myself. We were there during a Saturday evening Vespers service, and the singing by the cantors was generally quite lovely.

Awesome! Very much worth seeing. First off, this was the one thing I had to see in Paris. It did not disappoint at all. The exterior architecture was awesome, and then I went inside. It's such a beautiful place. It's far bigger than I thought it would be. Lots of little things to donate money to as you go, but it is free to tour the church itself. I highly, highly recommend a visit while in Paris.

Fascinating place and iconic tourist site in Paris.. This has to be one the places to go when in Paris. It can either be a place to visit for silent reflection or just to see the magnificent stained glass windows and religious iconography. However, be warned, if going for the free option of the church only, and not the towers, then the queues to get in can be lengthy at this time of year. When we arrived in the early afternoon it stretched all around the square in front of the building.Also, be prepared for the queue jumpers who, if challenged, will try and bamboozle anyone who challenges them by saying in French, or another language, that they have either left something inside or that someone from their party is already inside. If you understand the language challenge them or call security; they will quickly disappear. People will already have been waiting for between 20 and 30 minutes to get to the door and that is when the queue jumpers make their attempt.Inside it is quiet and understandably people should respect that this is still an active place of worship. For the most part people who were there when we were respected this.
A must seen. A beautiful gothic church with a beautiful interior.It can be crowded but when inside it is a wonderful place to be. A really must Seen on your trip to Paris.
A Paris must see. A beautiful Cathedral with the most impressive rose window I have ever seen. It does not take long to walk through but if this is your first trip to Paris please put it on the list.

HOT. We went to mass on Sunday a few weeks ago at the Cathedral and of course expected the mass to be in French as it was, but we're not ready for how HOT it was there. Between the tourists trying to see the church at the same time as mass and packed pews it made for a very log hour +.

Norte Dame is a human milestone. While the facade and contents may not, in and of themselves be any more impressive than those of other famous cathedrals like Westminster Abbey, for its significance to the architectural and the engineering accomllishments of people, Notre Dame is truly amazing and a milestone everyone should see. Amazingly, those see,Ed to be the only major monument or attraction not overrun with Roma people looking to fleece tourists, but do expect lines and crowds.
Beautiful. Must see. This is a beautiful, historic cathedral. Don't miss this wonderful place. No entry fee, of course. Got lucky and we were there during choir practice.

Definately a highlight of any Paris visit.. Be sure to walk south across the river and visit the Latin Quarter. The area around the Cathedral is a delightful place and almost as enjoyable, without the long line.
Notre Dame. Stunning .... beautiful old and classic building. Free to public only need to pay when entering the Tower. Inside the Cathedral it's to beautiful for words.

Light a candle for loved ones lost.. Not sure what is was but in my 3rd visit to this fabulous cathedral, if you are a catholic, you may find this place spiritually moving. Light a candle for loved ones lost, great place to sit and reflect.
Beautiful Cathedral. Amazing and queues not too long. When we visited there was also a food market where local produce could be bought. Very relaxed atmosphere.
Always interesting this different gothic church. Always interesting this different gothic church, different to most of other churchs . Also nice work in surrounding neighborhood like Latin quarter.

Speechless . For architecture lovers, this is a must see. There is beauty in even the smallest detail. The only downside was that perhaps some visitors weren't as quiet as the should've been. If you're visiting a place like this, please try and be respectful and keep the noise to a minimum. Other than that, I was left speechless in the beauty of the place, as was my teenage son.

Beautiful. Beautiful building, busy area, very high, huge inside but difficult to get out and quite dark, too many chairs in the middle part of which you have to weave your way through to get out as its not easy to find the exit
Notre Dame de Paris. Notre Dame de Paris is huge, go in buy some souvenir coins, key holders etc. its a true beauty and the river Seine flows behind it

Dignified and well managed. The presentation of, and welcome at, Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris as a 'must visit' tourist attraction is an absolute joy.Entrance is free, and the history of this iconic building is well explained by enthusiastic guides. It is also very well discussed o recorded audio guides which the visitor controls as you progress thru the building.We were struck by how this famous venue had managed to remain dignified and combine its primary role as a place of worship with its function as tourist attraction.
A must see.... We visited the cathedral and whilst we were there mass was on. I would highly recommend to anyone visiting paris.

Most famous cathédrale in France. Although it is not the eldest nor the most beautiful cathédrale in France, Notre Dame de Paris inspired many writers, painters, singers and walking inside you can totally understand why !

Just MUST DO!. I had much more enjoyment from the Sparrow Man who sits outside on the white marble steps and has birds all over him, so 'St Francis'! The inside is dark and not as grand as expected. But to walk up and then down and to know you've been there and done that is something special.

Amazing!. We visited on a sunday in time for the mass. It was one of the highlights of our trip. Don't forget to light a candle for your wishes. I just love wandering around , loved the smell of the candles/incense . It was an enigmatic experience really. I'm a deeply religious person and being able to visit the Notre Dame was a dream come true.

Can't miss!. Even more magnificent than imagined. Once inside, pay the extra five euros to go into the Notre Dame treasury. The artifacts are unbelievable. I would encourage people to respect the request for silence. Notre Dame is a house of prayer and contemplation.
long yet fast queue. the queue is amazingly long. make sure you dont queue in the tower entrance. queue to cathedral is very long but fast
A Must Visit Place. Definitely a must visit place in Paris. The time as if turn back to 19th century when I step into Notre Dame, which makes easier to imagine how's peoples' life in ancient time.

Didn't meet my expectations. Considering all the hype to visit this place, I found it not to be as impressive as other churches in Paris and I suppose after coming from Russia and Estonia the week before, it was a bit of a let down.

Great visit. We took a guided tour by a Parisian, he knew his culture and the history behind the small decorative elements of the cathedral. It was an amazing visit full of great cultural and historical tips.
Love attending mass. Beautiful Gothic Catholic Church. Excellent mass. I wish they had confessions in English. Worth visiting inside.
Amazing. It was just so beautiful in the church; the feeling I got inside was something that I'll never forget. I wanted to come here for a long time.

Sunday Mass. Highly recommend. Make sure you walk all the way around it for parks and perfect picture opportunities. The bells tolling were incredible, an unforgettable moment, so do be around for that. Mass on Sunday was very moving, if you decide on attending mass make sure you line up in the mass line as you have priority before non mass goers. I just looked on their website for mass times. The organ was a highlight at the end of mass. The whole experience was truly beautiful.

Beautiful Architecture in a beautiful area of Paris! . Being from Montreal and having a replica of the Cathedral there, I can easily say that it's just as gorgeous as the replica we have, but I won't lie, I did expect it to be bigger! But I got to see it during the day and the outside architecture is just gorgeous! The inside was also beautiful!
Love this place. Finally, I got to visit this place. I was in awe. Don't care for the merchants outside though. The inside was just magnificent. What a beautiful place. A must see.

A must see in Paris. I have been to Notre Dame three times, on three different times of year. Just got back from Paris and it was extremely crowded. I would recommend going to Paris in the Fall. It is much less crowded than July.
DO IT. Beautiful architecture. Worth checking out for sure. It's very large inside, and didn't seem crowded even with the tours going on. And people keep quiet enough because it's a church.

Beautiful Gothic Architecture . Notre Dame is an amazing sight that should not be missed. Take the time to walk around the entire site, take in the pretty little park at the rear, the lovely flower lined walk between the church and the Seine on the South side, enter the cathedral at the front and, if you're physically up to it, and you don't mind waiting in line, definitely climb the 400 steps to the tower for an fantastic view of the heart of Paris. Be sure to take photos of the gargoyles on the way up when you come out onto the first gallery as there aren't any statues on the top of the tower. (tip: go to Notre Dame first thing in the morning before the line starts growing for the cathedral and/or the tower climb)
Must see. One of the most famous places to see in Paris ,u can check it out in less than half hour and it's free ,there is no ticket you have to pay to see this famous church

Avoid the crowds, get there at 7:00 am and have the place to yourself!. Each and every day when I am in Paris ( when it isn't raining). I make my way across the Seine to visit this glorious cathedral in the dead center of the city. Peaceful and quiet, an early morning visit just as the priests open the doors allows you to explore the cathedral in all of its early morning glory. Make sure that you walk around back and visit the wonderful gardens and sit in the shade beneath the closely shorn Plane trees. Roses abound, the scent of Rosemary, of lemon balm. AND they have free wi-fi in the garden!
The Cathedral of Paris. Wow!. A must see. We visited the inside of the Cathedral and this is amazing. We also strolled around the Cathedral. There is no charge for the visit.

Beautiful!. This is a must see! It is absolutely gorgeous all around. The lines are long so get there early. Don't miss Point Zero which is opposite the statue of Charlemagne. Point Zero is the point in which all distances are measured.

Forget the queues - just look at the façade!. If you arrive at Notre Dame in peak season (virtually all year in Paris!) and find the long queues daunting, a nice alternative to going inside ND or up into the towers, is to just study the façade. This you can do for free and, if you do your homework (google / Wikipedia), you should find it endlessly fascinating. Understanding what you're looking at can be more fulfilling than being herded through the interior like a flock of. sheep. The portals are beautiful and their significance enhanced when you understand their meaning.

Incredible building, long slow wait to enter. Overwhelming amount of Asian tourists with no respect for a working cathedral, it was so very rude to ignore signs and be voyeurs of the worst sort. However loved the magnificence of the building. Highly recommend the cost to view the vault - blown away by the opulence and amount of precious stones and gold, shameful really.

Very beautiful. Went to visit Notre Dame in the afternoon and there was an extremely long queue for the free entrance to the cathedral. Returned around 9.30 the next morning to find a much shorter queue which moved very quickly. The interior is amazing, beautiful stained glass windows. A lot to see and also a place for quiet reflection. The outside was a little underwhelming and not as spectacular as I was expecting but the inside certainly compensates for this!! The choir were singing at the time and it was so very beautiful.There is an entrance fee payable to visit the treasury area or climb the bell tower.Definitely not to be missed when in Paris but would suggest doing this earlier rather than later in the day.

Beautiful church. Norte Dame is a magnificent church. The line was long but it moved very fast. We sat for a while and took in all of the beauty and we walked down the side isles and read the plaques. It was good
no words. very nice, always an impression, and the areas is very nice as well no need to pay better in the morning less people

One of the Most Incredible and Iconic Structures in the World. We have been to paris more time than one can count one the fingers of both hands, but every trip includes a visit to Notre Dame, if for no other reason than to sit in the plaza in and gaze upon the intricate gothic facade of the cathedral. But if this is your first or even second or third time to Paris, it is worth repeated visits to the interior and even to climb up one of the towers for the view.

Notre Dame. Queued to get in as there is a high-security alert in Paris at the moment and all bags have to be checked.
It is free to enter and it's history is incredible.

Breathtaking. Go early in the morning! I can't stress that enough. We were in Paris July 18th-22nd and we stayed at a hotel that was a 7 minute walk from the cathedral. The lines in the summer get extremely long especially if you want to see the bell tower. My husband and I lined up at 9:15 and waited over an hour to get in. I'm not sure we would have wanted to wait any longer than that in the sun. However, if you do get into the bell tower, they really allow you to take ample time for photos. Just be sure you're not wearing bulky backpacks. Parts of it are extremely narrow and you'll end up hitting people left and right. Like I said, go early (right before they open) and take in the church before the crazy crowds get there. It's beautiful, quiet, and you can really get a deep appreciation for it without folks getting in the way. Also, right after you see the church, get in line as soon as humanely possible for the bell tower!

Amazing catedral, must see the gargolas.. The Notre Dame Cathedral is a mandatory point in Paris, is an amazing gothic cathedral. The inside of the cathedral is beautiful and the tour to climb the stairs and see the the gargoyles and the Bell is awesome, be ready to stay a little while in the lines because only a small group can enter per time. There is a long walk to the top of the cathdral so be ready!
Beautiful. The building is unbelievably beautiful, outdoor and indoor!! Loved it!!I didn't go up to the towers due to long line and waiting time. Maybe next time.

Mandatory Visit... Essential. For an 850 year old structure, Notre Dame is still a beautiful Gothic Catholic church and worth the walk from St Germain (15 minute gentle walk). We chose to visit on a Sunday mid morning in order to listen to Mass Service whilst we were there looking at the stunning chapels within. The queue to enter was long but moved very quickly - free of charge- though you can easily make a voluntary €2 contribution and light a tealight candle as you enter. A must-do if visiting Paris even if you're not religious. The history of the church including information about the building of the various stages is worth the visit alone. You can also pay to climb the front towers - the quere was huge and the pace slow - we opted against it and instead wandered to the back of the building and sat on another beautiful garden and observed the people and the church on a perfect Sunday morning.
