Overrated. Wasnt all that in my opinion. Overrated because of the rep of having a gothic architecture. The Chartres cathedral around nearby is a much much more breathtaking architecture. The glass paintings are incredible. Go there instead. Was surprised at how overrated this was out of all the Cathedrals that we had the pleasure of seeing all over France.

Amazing Cathedral. If you choose to go inside any Cathedral in Europe go inside here. We went inside few cathedrals while in Europe but are very glad we went inside Notre Dame the stained glass and architecture is amazing inside.

A Must See. This is an absolutely exquisite cathedral. The feeling that you get once you enter is unbelievable. So worth the wait, and even though I'm not Catholic, I attended mass. Wouldn't trade that experience for the world.

Amazing architecture; such rich history!. Such a beautiful, majestic Church building with amazing carvings and architecture. Being a seminary student and having briefly studied church architecture, this was a real treat for me. The grandeur of Notre Dame Cathedral can be seen from the outside, but when you step inside, it's just a whole different thing. It's very different from the other cathedrals, such as Westminster Abbey or even Sacre-Coeur. Each has their own unique character and personality, and Notre Dame is no different with a dark and 'gothic' feel to it. They even hold masses in there, and we managed to go when one was in progression. I really enjoyed sitting there and soaking in the whole experience. Do make sure you check it out when you're in Paris! It's beautiful!
A nice church . We visited this church during the time of the Mass. So it was definitely beautiful to experience the beauty of the church in this atmosphere
Great. One of the best church in Paris, but i still prefer Basilica of Notre-Dame de Fourvière in Lyon. However, you have option to climb up the towers and see nice view of Paris.
Must-see and spend time here!. Fast queueing process so dont' worry if you see long, long lines! Plenty of time to stroll around and take lots of photos; no strong-sell from staff;
Cathedral to visit. This is a very old church with excellent architecture ,thought the climb to the bell tower is 422 steps but it is all worth the climb because the view is out of the world.

Beautiful place of worship and rich history, inside and out.. Again, the audio guide is so worth the small cost of it. This cathedral is so deep in history it boggles the mind and astonishes the eyes, the heart. Lighting is gorgeous, really shows the architectural wonders. Central nave area is still a place of quiet worship and contemplation (NO cameras) but all other areas are open to photography without flash. Beautiful side galleries of sculpture, colored walls, frescos-freizes of saints and apostles and Christ, a huge modern cross at the back of the altar soars over a classical statue. The displays and explanations were well-done and easy to follow. We didn't climb to the top, but if I were younger & more able-I certainly would do it.

beautiful notre dame. i lined up for this, it doesnt take too longIf you've been in one big church then its much the same, but i love this amazingly spectacular buildings and go into everyone i can, to sit back and imagine it being built all that long ago is surrealI never get tired of the experience and the detail of this spectacular building is remarkableAt the very least stop and take pics from the outside
Breathtaking inside and put. You can't miss the cathedral when in Paris. The stained glass is amazing and the exterior with all of its gargoyles won't disappoint. Line moves quickly
Vacation. In the 15 days we spent in Europe, Notre Dame was one of the most beautiful churches. Easy to tour through and not feel rushed, plus got to attend daily mass!

Remarkable!. Its architecture is astounding, it's beauty is breathtaking. Yes outside its a bit of a tourist circus but the line moved very quickly. The moment you enter you feel moved. Everyone should be lucky enough to visit this wonderment at least once

Wonderful. To say that this is the one tourist destination that is everything you think it is going to be is an understatement. It is fantastic. Its a working church you come in and there are people praying holding sermons etc. everybody is very respectful and the atmosphere is superb. There is a lovely café across the road as well to have a refreshing beer. Well worth a visit highly recommended we have been twice now and loved it both times.

Great cathedral. The line to go inside was so long I gave it a pass. Instead I went to the garden/park area at the back of the church. No crowds, with amazing views of the church, and the Seine. Beautiful, and definitely a hidden treasure.

Underwhelming. I was sadly disappointed with our visit to Notre Dame. I was expecting a more grandiose cathedral, but instead I found it dark and depressing. We booked an individual tour and I enjoyed learning about the saints and stories behind the statues and its history. If you want to see beautiful craftsmanship, I would recommend the Saint Chapelle church for its beautiful stained glass work, instead.

3 Great Church Attractions. Couple a visit to Notre Dame with a tour of Sainte-Chapelle (both on the Isle de la Cite - and close to each other) and then schedule a trip to the Basilica of Saint Denis on the outskirts of Paris (Metro line 13). After seeing all three, you will then have a great understanding of Gothic art and architecture. As well, you will appreciate the huge influence this art movement had on French culture. Walking around Paris, you'll recognise the Gothic style on churches everywhere.
Holiday in Pris. Once again , if you try to go into Notre Dame it will take you about 1 and a half hours in the queue in the searing heat .Paris is out of control with too many people everywhere.
Beautiful Cathedral. Free entry. Don't let the line fool you. It's long but moves quick. Could not time it right to climb the tower. That line was long and did not move.

Go on a Sunday morning and attend a Service. The Cathedral is an iconic landmark in Paris. But if you take the time and schedule your visit during a Sunday Service, you heighten your experience withe beautiful music, and listening to the Word in another language. Heightened security requires you to plan a little more time for your visit, as the line is slower to get in. The artwork inside the Cathedral is as beautiful as the stained glass windows and the marvelous stonework.

Love this cathedral. I love architecture, old buildings and churches and this one ticks all of them. I couldn't get tired looking at this massive building. The interior is even better. The queue was long but quick. They have good information about how the history of the church - useful for tourists.

Cathedral and Gargoyles. You can go into the cathedral at no cost. But if you want to go to the top, you must go around to the left side of the cathedral (as you are facing it) and stand in line to walk the 400 steps to the top. I think it was about 15 Euros. Warning: the 400 stairs to the top is a pretty strenuous hike and you have to keep up with the group. They only let about 15 people go in at a time. Once at the top, you have a limited amount of time to look out over the city, check out the gargoyles, etc. It's one of those things you should do as a younger person. I'm glad I did it because it might be the only time I get to got up there.

Tourist Trap. Notre Dame is one of many cathedrals that pepper France, most are more Historically and architecturally significant than Notre Dame. Enjoy walking around Notre Dame and don't miss ile saint Louis nearby. Paid visits to parts of Notre-Dame, especially when you need to queue is not recommended.

best place that i see in my life ever. hi travelers;I been many Notre Dame Cathedral before but it is the place that i can not compare with another Notre Dame Cathedral, it is really amazing and the best in the world. Especial about the design, very special.

Majestic place. Went with a small your. Learned a lot of history about this place. The inside is quite impressive compared to other cathedrals in Europe. So many details in the decorations impossible to capture in one visit. Although the front of the church was my favorite part with the stories about heaven and hell and the first Paris christian who was beheaded right where the church was built.

Amazing and beautifuk. This history of this facility is unimaginable! I visit here no matter what anytime I am in Paris. I love the architecture of the area and even more so the vibe. It is always so lively yet laid back. I would highly recommend grabbing snacks at the street vendors around it and just chilling!

Amazing architecture. Before I went there I didn't know what to expect as it was my first ever visit to a big cathedral. But when I reached and had look at the wonderful Gothic architecture I was amazed by its architectural beauty.

wow. get there early so you won't have to stand in line.
but you must see it and walk around it. there is a garden near so you can sit and relax.

Majestic. Truly awesome sanctuary. The building is magnificent inside and out. It is an active church so there may be a service going on when you are there in which you can participate or just watch. Allow yourself to be moved by the majesty.

A definite must. So much history. Allow enough time to see and appreciate all of the art work. Be sure to use a tour guide or video option to fully understand and appreciate all there is to see. The murals are indescribable. Windows are beautiful but St Chappelle are even better. WOW.

Moved to tears by the beauty here, I wish my tour would have allowed more time to explore.. So difficult to describe the beauty of the stained glass, the gravitas, We were on a day tour of Paris so were unable to spend more time here, would have loved to simply sit and reflect.

The historic heart of Paris. Amazing cathedral, historic geographic center of France is located in front (all points in France were measured from this location). Located on an island in the middle of the Seine (hence the Île-de-France), you will see some of the older bridges of Paris close by. The church is really fantastic (flying buttresses indeed) but France has so many incredible ancient cathedrals that you can see. Pretty incredible to imagine this being built 800 years ago and still standing!

Big cathedral . After so many times going to Paris I've never been inside.. until now. It's beautiful and very big. If you see a line outside it's okay, it moves quite quick. If you stand in line to climb the tower however.. you'll be there for a good 2 hours in summertime. We thought we'd queue at 10 AM when it opens.. so did a lot of other people. But since we were there anyway, we decided to queue. The reason why it takes so long is because they can only allow 20 ppl at a time. You get in, go up a couple of stairs to enter an area where you buy your ticket and wait till a group leaves. The stairs are narrow and get even narrower the higher you get.. that's why it's a group at a time per level. After the ticket area you climb up some stairs and get to a lookout where you can see the gargoyles and where the big bell is.. that thing rings for quite some time. While you're at that level you have to wait for the group that's on top to come down before you can go up to the highest point. Once you've climbed those final stairs you get to see all of Paris for 5-10 mins. It's worth it though, especially when yoi have the weather in your favor.
very intersting. entry is for free, not too long line to stay, perfered to go early.nice shop inside to buy souveniours.
Very impressive but a bit of a queue . Too many disrespectful visitors with phones ringing and camera flashes. An impressive site for the religious and the atheist alike.

The lines are worth the wait. Oh my goodness! The history and architecture is awe inspiring. I spent hours in the cathedral examining the architecture and artifacts. There are masses being conducted daily. There is a small gift shop inside the cathedral. If you are a history or architecture buff, you have to go to the Cathedral Notre Dame.

Amazing. This was the only Cathedral we could take pictures of the inside...the stained glass and architecture is beautiful. You can climb the tower if you want to do that. Lines were long as security was heightened the day we were there. Free to get in, charge for climbing to the top.
Amazing . Seriously the most beautiful, serial place to visit and view. Recommend you get there first thing in the morning as queues are huge as the day goes on but well worth the wait

A surprising find!. We knew we wanted to go into the Cathedral, but the line for the tower was absolutely worth the wait. The climb is a big harrowing and not for the feint of heart, but once we reaced the top we were rewarded with a view that parallels (if not surpasses) the Eifell Tower. I would choose this over the Eifell next time just because the view includes it and it's much more interesting to see from afar than it is from inside it. Do not skip this fun event, but make sure you are in good shape before attempting the climb.

Beautiful but long waits. My review is put at 3 stars but should probably be 4, here's why it is less:Queues.All of the big attractions in Paris have major queues but the Notre Dame was so long (and it was a hot day) that we actually didn't get to go inside. That's why it was 3 star, but even just a walk around the outside was great. There's a little garden out the back that has WiFi and was practically deserted even though it had a great view of the flying buttresses.
amazing gothic church. Located in the heart of Paris, on the island of the citi, Notre Dame Cathedral is a must-visit in Paris! Free of charge and open every day, simply beautiful!

Amazing Cathedral . This is a must when visiting Paris. I didn't climb to the top of the tower as the wait was 2.5 hours but with free entry to the main part of the Cathedral and the huge scale of this place it is amazing.

Beautiful Notre Dame Cathedral. We were finally able to visit the beautiful Cathedral on our latest visit to Paris. We tried to get in 3 years ago while on a big ship Mediterranean cruise but there were two many people in line and our cruise hadnt made arrangements for our visit. This cruise our Gate 1 tour guide had arranged our visit ahead of time and we walked right in. We've been to many cathedrals in our travels; however im glad we didnt miss this. I couldnt help shedding a few tears as our guide pointed out the beautiful scene of the life of Jesus. It was spectacular and was one of the highlights that i will never forget. The stained glass window were amazing and the history of this beautifuul cathedral made our visit.
Lovely old church. It's a must visit place in Paris. Though always crowded it's worth a wait.good architect, glass paintings etc..

If you are in Paris you should see it. Do not go to Paris because of the Notre Dame cathedral but if you are going anyway, swing by. The buildings and grounds are interesting, the crowds are exhausting but the history is interesting.

Beautiful church . Located on a small island in the river Seine, the Notre Dame cathedral is well worth a visit. Currently it might take a few extra minutes of your time to get in due to security checks. We walked here from the Louvre and continued to Luxembourg gardens. Which brought us through many beautiful streets on the way.

Awe inspiring. Beautiful. To God be the glory.. The cathedral is amazing. How did they do this with string, stone, hammer, and basic 12th Century tools. It is hard to explain, but you have to see it. The line is long, but it was free to go in (donations accepted), and it moves fast. For the believer, there is space to pray and contemplate God. An amazing cathedral.

Outstanding!!. There is really not much I can add to what may be one of the most written about buildings in the world. My recommendation is that its great for kids as well as they are impressed by the stained glass. And if you are planning to climb the tower (no elevator) arrive at least 30 minutes before opening (10am in the summer) as its slow.

Must see!. I'm not big into touring churches in Europe but Notre Dame was an exception. The line up to get up the towers was 10 euros and took about one hour but had amazing views of the city and was well worth it.

Truly a architectural marvel. A beautiful and stunning sight inside and out. Suggestions:1. Arrive early in the morning as the lines can become lengthy2. Tour the exterior of the building front and back as the front is not original due to damage during the French Revolution3. The rear of the cathedral is all original and you will marvel in the craftmanship4. Keep valuables secure as there are many pick pockets working in teams
Towers are worth the wait. Gorgeous church. I waited in line for about 2 hours to climb the towers, but it was definitely worth it.

Beautiful Outside. The outside is quite impressive. The inside is very dark and without paying for an audio tour it's hard see/read all about the works of art. I so wanted to see the Pieta, but from where they let you sit in the church, it's about a football fields length away. I need binoculars. I visited it during a heat wave and that Tuesday in July it was 98 degrees. I wanted to climb the tower, but the heat got the best of me. I was melting just waiting to get inside. There is no shade anywhere near the front of the Cathedral.

Spectacular!. WOW and WOW and WOW! Lines galore but they move fast. We took many, many, pictures during the day and at night, all lit up. You can take pictures inside without a flash. Unbelievable opulence, paintings, sculptures. This was our first stop while touring Paris with seniors from Camden, Tennessee. We spent lots of time and that is what you need. Lots of time to take it all in. Unbelievable that this exists after so many many years. We really LOVED it! Made lots of memories

"The Mecca of France". For myself, it was like my life had come full circle. As much as I've fallen in love with the french culture, this is where I've ALWAYS wanted to be. If you decide to go though, make sure you get there early. Our line wasn't extremely long, but it was long enough to eat a good snack.

Notre Dame. This cathedral is the largest one I have ever been in and it is truly awe inspiring. The sculptures and paintings are remarkable and very well kept. I walked away feeling like I had been blessed.

Wow. Amazing Cathedral, one of my favorite church. A true testament of the engineering capacity of the Middle Ages and the power of the Catholic Church. Every time I visit Notte Dame I keep wondering about the difficulties faced to build such an marvelous building and the resources and logistics required to accomplish it.
awe inspiring. the richness and depth of this cathedral will take your breath away. make sure to get the audio tour to understand what everything is
Beautiful!. This was a lovely Church and the history and architecture worth the visit. The line was long to get in but it move fast. The stain glass windows amazing. The organ beautiful.

Beautiful Inside but Long Line to the Top!. My wife and I spent a few weeks traveling through Europe and saw several beautiful cathedrals. This was one of our most anticipated and it did not disappoint. It was very interesting and beautiful inside and out. The only issue we had was the queue to the tower climb. It took us almost two hours to get in, they only let like 20 - 30 people at a time every 10 minutes. That said once in and to the top it was amazing. I think it was the best views of Paris we had, mainly due to the gargoyles. You would get this fantastic shot of a gargoyle with Paris spread out behind and below it. We didn't have to wait to climb the towers of any other gothic cathedral in Europe, but this one had the best views, gargoyles, and was worth the wait.

Amazing architecture. The Notre Dame is a beautiful building. You definitely want to visit this iconic building if you are in Paris. It is free to the public, and the wait is tolerable. It is better if you go early. The history of this structure and its construction is worth knowing. The cathedral is beautiful and is a quiet restful place in a busy day. Bathrooms are available but (BROTP-bring your own toilet paper).

This is good to see to get off of your bucket list. Compared with the other sights in Paris it was ok but I expected more. It has great architecture and history but I have seen other places in Italy that were more impressive.
lovely old church. Lines move quickly and got to be there during service. The organ is played so loud it hurts your ears.

Cathedral visit and stair climb. The cathedral is amazing; lines move quickly; not so for the stairs to the bell tower. We arrived early and waited two hours to get into the stairs; It was worth it though, the bell tower is very interesting, great views and our fave was the up close views of the gargoyles (Chimeras); bring an umbrella for shade while waiting in line!
Ahhh...a work of Art. When in Paris you must visit the Notre Dame.It is spectacular, and the history is awesome. Take lots of pictures.

Stunning church full of history...a must see!. We were lucky enough to take an evening "behind the scenes tour" of Notre Dame. Our guide gave us valuable insight into the famous landmarks of Paris. The view from the bell towers is stunning. Yes it is quite a walk up & the steps are steep but it's not impossible! You get a close look at the famous gargoyles & there are some funny stories for several that were pointed out to us. We got to see what they claim is the "home" of Quassimoto - the famous hunchback of Notre Dame where two of the oldest bells still remain (though they are no longer in use). Fascinating explanations as to the intricate carvings at the front of the cathedral. Many biblical scenes & statues of famous biblical Kings. We returned the following day to see the inside of the church. The stain glass rose Windows see every bit as beautiful as you can imagine, as is the gothic architecture. The choir was singing and it felt like just a serene & holy place. Lots of information on the 200 years it took to complete the castle & you can etho the statue of Joan of Arc & the Pieta at the top of the alter. Don't miss this amazing landmark! Well worth waiting in line for!

Impressive architecture but wayyy too crowded during summer!. It was free to enter but you have to pay to go up the towers which I didn't, but either way it was an amazing view from both outside and in. There was a really long queue, which moved slowly, but it was worth the wait. Don't miss this!

A day in Paris. The Notre Dame cathedral in Paris is also a must see. The architecture is spectacular and depictive of the history and the earlier times of the city. The geographical location on the Seine points to the earliest human settlements in and around Paris and evokes a strong sense of history. The architecture of the cathedral from times of antiquity is a marvel to behold for those interested in history and architecture. Be sure to subscribe to the audio guide when going through the cathedral to pick up the full story behind this great and timeless monument.

Beautiful. Went on a Sunday morning and then you can see mass being said around 10am. Free entry and its just amazing. There are many small crypts to go and see and the architecture is out of this world. The mass was very special and you have to be very quiet when walking round. There are lovely candles you can light to remember loved ones and it is just a fabulous place to visit. I have been before and it feels very special.
Awesome. Keep bag safe and zipped up had my purse stolen in the church would you believe. fter that had to walk back to hotel as had no money
Impressive sight. We were not inside since the line was very long and it was in the sun on a 35 degree celcius day. However we wallked around and studied the impressive building, a must see!

Love this cathedral. My third trip to Paris and I still love seeing the Notre Dame Cathedral, in the light of the morning, as the sun is setting and at night when the city is illuminated. Climbing the tower to get a wonderful view of the city is well worth the many steps, being there when the church bell rings is an incredible experience.

Outstanding!. Gorgeous attraction relatively easy to get into - except the tower, which is a separate line and requires you to purchase a ticket. We stood in line for hours to climb the stairs because the kids insisted, and it was worth it - an experience we will never forget! The views were amazing, even in the rain!

Awesome, must see while in Paris. Don't miss this. Take a tour up in the towers as well. Very worthwhile. Make sure you check days/times it is open. Also, it is best to get a "skip the line" ticket or tour. The line to go up in the tower was crazy long.
Impressive when up close . Don't forget to walk around the cathedral. It's a nice garden and great views of the Seine too. Long queues but then again it's free entry and we went during Summer!
Nothing special . Good place to visit for the history behind it, but nothing remarkable. Lots of people queued up to do the tour, so we just went inside, as the tour queue seemed endless and static.

Awesome. We made our own way to notre Dame, when we came around the corner and saw it for the first time it was like wow the way it stood there took our breath away, the architecture was outstanding, we queued to get it and got searched and had to empty our bags before going in but once inside it was magnificant so much to see, it was absolutely beautiful inside it took our breath away. It was free to go in. We loved it so much that we went back again a couple of days later before going home
Worth a visit. Notre Dame Cathedral lived up to expectations. Beautiful structure and if you only have time to visit a few places in Paris, this should be on your list.
Beautiful cathedral.. Notre Dame Cathedral was everything I thought it would be. You can't miss this if you are visiting Notre Dame.

The second time I visit The Cathedral. First time was 30 years ago and still wanted to see it again. The Cathedral was about 20 to 30 minute walk from "Le Marais" area where I was staying. It's easy to get to. You can see it from anywhere.

"Our Lady," Notre Dame Cathedral. This is a magnificent Cathedral. The architecture, the history, and the view make this a must see. It is free to tour the church but there is a charge to walk up the 422 steps in the tower and see the breathtaking view as far as the eye can see. It took almost 2 decades to build this Cathedral. The structure was first started in 1163 and completed in 1345.I sincerely appreciate the greatness of the architecture and the historical role this Cathedral played in the heart of the city of Paris, it's true religious value. The facade tells a pictorial story as well. Be sure to visit a gift shop Inside. I purchased medals and small candles with photographs of the Cathedral on the side which I brought back to my elderly relatives. Mass was in French, but they hand out prayer books in 4 languages. Take your family and enjoy this treasure.
Beautiful. Everything you expected and more- hard to even describe. The choir was singing and it truly was a breathtaking experience. Lines weren't bad.

Fantastic place. Took tips from previous reviews and went early. Got there about 9 am. Place was really quiet. Queue starting to form about 20 for the tower, we gave it amiss, cos we did the 283 at the arc yesterday . Anyway studying the history wall inside it is awesome to think this building was started 800 yrs ago and the original end is in such good condition . I am not religious in any way but I do admire the dedication and conviction of the craftsmen who build these churches, and 800 yrs ago with crude tools and a horse and cart. Now we today reap the rewards of seeing the spectacular results of superb architecture. Must do visit.

Actually a rather average experience. Visiting Paris on our honeymoon we tried to see as many of the famous sights in the city as possible, so of course Notre Dame was on our list.Getting there was a little tricky as there are no Metro stops on the island itself, but it did give us the opportunity to have a nice walk along the Seine.Arriving at the cathedral itself I must admit we were slightly underwhelmed by both its size, the queue to get in and the amount of tat touters in the vicinity.Inside the cathedral itself it was again a decidedly average experience- it was fairly dark so it was fairly hard to see anything, and what was there was rather less impressive than less hyped cathedrals we have visited elsewhere in Europe. It does have some lovely stained glass rose windows which are worth seeing though. One thing that really amused us was the incredibly loud announcement telling people to be quiet in around 8 different languages - it really did sound like the voice of God was angry with the visitors!Overall it is still a must see sight in Paris but not one that we will be hurrying back to any time soon.
Beautiful . Really beautiful Cathedral. Although the the line was long it only took about 10mins and we were inside. Nice to go when a service is on

nice visit. 15 min wait in line to go through security.. very nice chronological information with pictures on how the cathedral was built in stages. Dark inside, beautiful windows. amazing architecture. 1 hr wait to climb the tower, we skipped the climb because it had started drizzling/raining. plenty of places to eat nearby.

go early. we went early on a Monday morning in July and it was great! Not full of tourists. We used the steve ricks walking tour audio.
Definitely check out the park and the outside back of the building.
I believe they have free interior tours (we saw a sign advertising for it)
Impressive. Very beautiful cathedral.It deserve to watch a service there with organ and priest singing.Don't miss it.
Not To Be Miss. We have a day out with my family, and truly enjoyed the surrounding of the Notre Dame Cathedral, fantastic.

A must see when in Paris. The line moves quickly and is a must see when in Paris.
Of the many, many Cathedrals in Paris and France, this is the one to see, just for its size and history.

The Hunchback of Notre Dame. I was really dissapointed he wasn't there. But the gargoyles were!! The architecture is impressive. I went to the top, going up like one million steps. If you have asma ir a heart condition i do not recomend it.
Stunning architecture . This is a breathtaking feat of architecture. Stunning both inside and out. There are several bistros close by where you can dine and admire the view

Beautiful cathedral to visit!. Whatever religion (or no) you practice, this is a lovely building to explore. The pictures do not do it justice, both in size and looks. Every visitor to Paris should see this cathedral.
Nice!. The long line to get inside the church is worth it. Beautiful!!! I think I got one beautiful Rosary which they sell inside the Church.

Talk about an impressive cathedral. Notre dame is an impressive structure, and that is just from the outside. The inside feels palacial and truly amazing. It definitely had me in awe with the size and the age. A must, especially since it's free to go inside.If you plan to climb the towers, be prepared for a long wait or be there right away when it opens.... with your museum pass in tote.

Must See!. Seeing Notre Dame is a must for anyone traveling to Paris. It is a great example of gothic architecture. We went mid day and expected a long line. The line was not as bad as it seemed and moved very quickly. The audio guides are great especially for anyone interested in art, architecture, or history. The line to the tower is extremely long. I'm not sure I understand the appeal of climbing it, but if you are interested, I would suggest getting there early to avoid some of the wait.
Elegant and beautiful cathedral. The outside cathedral is elegant but we have no chance to get in because there were a very long queue. The view around the cathedral is great.
Historical Church . Notre Dame church. Is another great Church in Paris. It has good history of chiming of the Church bells.

Search for Quasimodo. Of course the famous photo op is the front but my favorite view of the building is the back side with all of intricate flying buttresses. Different and gorgeous perspective of the famous cathedral. Always a bit crowded, but a "must see". I prefer the outside architecture more then going inside. You can pay extra to go to the top for a view. Nice to enjoy a stroll along the Seine before/after seeing Notre Dame.

Loved Notre Dame Cathedral. What history. Within walking distance of the Louvre. Short lines and you can just view at your own pace. Good historical representations on the way explaining the expansion over the years.

Super!. Amazing cathedral!!! Get there in the morning... Right when it opens. No lines then. Do not go in the afternoon. Carry light because of security. Quiet within to respect prayer and sacred. Beautiful at sunset.
A must see in Paris. A short entry line, no fee charged, easy to access, interior photos allowed, iconic landmark - not to be missed.

Very nice, worth visit to top also. Very nice Gothic style cathedral. Make sure you also go to top from Demon side of the building, worth a visit on top, free with Paris museum pass, ticket can be purchased, but as most places in Paris, it's big queue during peak day times and no priority lines for passes. Make sure you do pigeon food act outside of the cathedral, worth trying once. 4 star because of queue otherwise 5 star.

Gorgeous historical site. A must-visit. But at the same time visit the near by Sainte-Chapelle. Both entrance tickets are included in the Paris Museum Pass. Also, walk south through Latin Quarter to visit the Pantheon (also on Museum Pass) and the Catacombs (not on Museum Pass).

Very beautiful cathedral inside and out. You have to see this. There might be a long queue outside but it goes quickly just wait a while. Inside you have the chance to go around the cathedral and maybe even go up but it costs something. After you come outside walk around the cathedral so you can see every piece of it. It is quite amazing.
fantastic. free to visit and not to be missed the perfect place to light a candle in memory of missing loved ones
Awesome to be surrounded by such beauty. We were able to attend Mass which was very moving . Just remember as a guest you should be silent. Many tourist think they are in Walmart.

Spectacular, an absolute must see!. Notre Dame should definitely be on any tourist's "to do" list. It truly is a sight to behold, the architecture is amazing inside and out. It can be busy at times (naturally) but there is never any queuing whilst I have been there, the security keep everything very organised. Also aside from the building the latin quarter around Notre dame is beautiful in the summer, the riverbank is a perfect chill spot. Although photographs inside are forbidden, make sure you take your camera for compulsory outdoor snap!

900 years to buikf. Every time I visit Notre Dame Cathedral I am in awe of what it took to build this magnificent church. We were there at Sunday mass which made it even more majestic with the organ in the background.

Iconic cathedral in a interesting area of Paris. Lovely tour. Take the self guided tour, you take a cell phone type device and it talks you through all the different areas and even shows video clips. Spend the extra to see the relics in the Treasury room.
Awesome attraction . This is a must see in Paris Right on the river and a great spot for taking your holiday snaps The architecture is wonderful and amazing to see

Notre Dame. When we arrived at Notre Dame Cathedral, we were saddened by the HUGE line waiting to get in. We decided to stand in the line while we looked from the outside and decided where we wanted to go next since a long time in line was not how we wanted to spend our limited time. All of a sudden the line began moving (opened the doors?) and we were inside within about 10 minutes of our arrival. This Gothic edifice was amazing. I especially liked the scale reproduction and the photos with documentary explaining the evolution of the church.

Amazing. This is my second visit but this time is different, this time I decide to take tour, it's very amazing but My advice to people who suffer from health problems related to the effort, such as heart disease or pregnant women should not do this tour, because they have to step up stairs is to very high floors in circular way, when I reached up I remember the Movie "The Hunchback of Notre Dame" specially the cartoon when I saw the status I thought it move or talk to me.Finally it was very nice tour also I advise to go around the Cathedral there's nice cafe

Something very special about this Cathedral. Visited Notre Dame on May 5th: Celebration of the Ascention . Participating in Mass at Notre Dame was a very special experience. People from all over the world sitting, kneeling, standing side by side responding and reciting prayer in all different languages was very moving. Such a sense of community; even though we're all from "somewhere" else; it gives one hope!

Spiritual . Even with the crowds you can feel its serenity, be aware that it is still worshiping church and be mindful of parishioners in prayer. The day we visited was National Day, and the crowds were exceptionally large queuing in the heat. Take an umbrella for shade.
Exquisite. The art and stained glass are remarkable. Right in front you will see the spot that is dead center of Paris. The line looked long but moved quickly. So glad we went.

Must Visit!. Notre Dame is one of the most famed cathedrals in the world, probably the most famed of them all. Its construction and innovation of medieval architecture is taught in American public schools. On my first trip to Paris we arrived too late and the church was closed, so it was a 2 year wait before getting to see the inside last August!The square out front is a wonderful gathering place, and its location on Ile de la Cite offers gorgeous views of the Seine. Take a walk around the complex to see the grounds and lush gardens behind the building.Inside the church lies the typical beauty and show of wealth from the Catholic Church in the Middle Ages. There are many seats available for quiet reflection and prayer in the sanctuary and the altar is very beautiful. Several small chapels can be found along the sides of the church. On the left side visitors can find a big expose detailing how the cathedral was built and revamped over the centuries along with a small scale replica of the actual cathedral. Lovers of architecture will especially be pleased touring the site.

The Amazing Notre Dame!. The Notre Dame is hands down my most favorite place in Paris! I'm overcome with those stained glass windows, the architecture, and all of those intricate and ornate details that make up this cathedral in its entirety. Our rented apartment was only about a 7 minute walk from the Notre Dame...we could actually see the towers from the kitchen window. We made two lengthy visits to the cathedral (lengthy meaning 1-2 hours both times). The first time we walked around the inside several times just taking in structure itself, stopping to light candles in memory of those we've lost, listening to one of the masses taking place, etc. The second time we wandered around back inside and then climbed to the bell tower to take in the views. Again, time well spent if you're able....Note there is not elevator to the bell towers. After our visit to the bell tower, we spent time walking around the outside admiring all the features this part of the cathedral offers. Just a few points....Entrance to the cathedral if free however there is a charge to climb to the bell tower....There is also quite a line that forms for the bell tower so I'd advise arriving to do this first thing in the morning. The line for general entrance moves relatively quickly including a security screening at the door. Once inside, you there is a desk you can purchase audios for a self guides tour. There are also a variety of different sized candles to purchase and light in memory of others. This cathedral speaks for itself!
This is wonderful. Would recommend combining this with Louvre as it doesn't take long. Opens at 8:00am and that's the time to do it.

Breathtaking experience. I was here many years ago when I was a child, and never fully appreciated it. But when you first see it's famous arches, it such an imposing building, and makes a lasting impression on you. The closer you get, the more impressive the building becomes, and the massive doors lead you inside, where frequent tours are conducted. I like how it is still a functioning church, so that everyone must be quiet and respectful of their surroundings. Additionally, you see such fantastic sights like the stained glass windows and the organs. Light a candle for a loved one, and take in the sombre surroundings. Also - visit the cathedral at night when it is closed, it makes for fantastic photographs, and it is not as busy (it's closed) so you can go right up and appreciate the architecture. There's also a lovely parl behind it, which is nice for relaxing and getting a good view of the back of Notre Dame. The next time I'm in Paris, I will come here again, and anyone else who is in Paris sould do the same!

ABSOLUTELY MAGESTIC. Have visited Notre Dame on previous visits to Paris and it never fails to amaze. A glorious structure with a magnificent interior. During this visit I was lucky enough to hear the choir practicing. The acoustics were astounding. The Rose windows on the East and West transepts are magnificent. Beautiful chapels and sanctuaries are in abundance with wonderful altar pieces.Even if you are not religious it is a must see for visitors for Paris.You can even climb to the roof now for wonderful views
worth a visit. It's hard not to like this cathedral if you know the history around it. I would have loved to explore it from top to bottom. (Underneath was interesting as well.)
Bombastic!. This is a must see for people who enjoy architecture and the grandiosity of big religious structures like churches and cathedrals. A must see in the Île de la Cité!

Do Not Miss It. Even though there may be a line to get in, wait and go in anyway; the line moves quickly, there’s too much history, and the cathedral is too beautiful to pass up because of a 5 or 10 minute wait. My wife and I each got an audioguide; they’re very, very informative and only 5€ each – worth double that. Notre-Dame is a lot more than just a beautiful rose window. The architecture is stunning; it’s easy to feel that the gargoyles are almost real. We could easily have spent the larger part of a day just trying to take in all there is at Notre-Dame, both inside and outside. That’s one of Notre-Dame’s charms; it means different things to different people.
Glad to have seen it. I was not as awe inspired as I thought I would be, after seeing the Vatican and even the Saint-Chapelle, Notre Dame was a bit of a let down

Beautiful, historic - a must see in Paris!. The line outside the cathedral moves pretty fast so don't let it stop you from visiting this beautiful place. The stained glass windows are incredible and the chapels for the various saints are so different from one another. We paid the 5 euros to see the additional artifacts on display in the museum part. If you are Catholic you might enjoy that part more because you have some context for some of the pieces, including relics from different saints and garments worn by the Pope. You can pay to go up in the towers, but just visiting the inside is a great experience on its own.

Best attraction in Paris. I loved the true sanctity of this visit. It is like literally stepping back in time to see the way the former church saints, and leaders worshiped. It is still a practicing church, and they have places to pray, and light candles. they remind people from time to time to be silent. No wearing hats either. If you like a lot of chatter and hustle and bustle, then this is not for you. If you love seeing and feeling true history all around you, this is perfect.
Historic must-see Church. the Notre Dame is a must-see church. It has so much history. The building architecture is impressive. some restoration is needed.

Breathtaking. Try to attend Mass and hear the choir. It was crowded, but quiet, and lines moved easily. There are many beautiful statues and alters, to see. This is quietly done while others attend Mass,but best to do both.

Goosebumps. Although I've visited Notre Dame many, many times, the building never fails to give me goosebumps. It makes history come alive. Do try and avoid moments when there are too many tourists: they do not always keep quiet and steel away from the magic of the atmosphere.

Excellent. Spend an hour exploring the cathedral and another hour exploring the area around it. Very easy to find and you can walk here in around 5 minutes from 3 or 4 different metro stations, we walked from Hotel De Ville on line 11.

Breathtaking!. I visited the Notre Dame today for the first time and was blown away by how beautiful it was. The queue seemed very long at first but the time waiting went much quicker than we thought it would. We can't have been there for longer than 10 minutes! It was absolutely stunning and a real treat to be able to go and visit. Definitely worth your time if you're looking for things to do, and it's free to go in!
Worth it !. Excellent ! Try to visit when music is playing . We went to mass during the vespers . The sound was terrific .we went during Mass and it was busy but peaceful .

A Fine Example of Gothic Architecture. The Cathedral sits on an island and is accessible both by water and land. It is a fine example of Gothic architecture and has flying buttresses inside the hall. There are two entries to the Cathedral. We waited in queue outside the one marked for Paris Pass and with guide access for nearly and hour before we got to know that the guided tour in English had been cancelled. Luckily, entry through the other side didn't take us much time in spite of the queue. I took an audio guide once inside for 5 Euros and it was completely worth the money spent. The cathedral has some beautiful stained glass windows in the pattern of a rose. The hall and the nave are a little different from other cathedral as they are supported with flying buttresses. There is a shallow vessel in the hall near the exit with water filled in it. I saw people touch the water to their forehead. This is the first time I have observed such a vessel inside a cathedral and I would love to know more about its significance.

Beautiful church. the Church is beautiful and one of Paris' landmarks, of course if you have been to Rome this church will not amaze you so much, I was much amazed by the exterior than the interior, however it is a must see :)!

Beautiful Building. We didn't get the chance to explore this wonderful building's insides because the queues were just too long for our liking, but we were able to look at the building's breathtaking exterior. My girlfriend also enjoyed seeing a part of Paris that's in Disney's 'Hunchback of Notre Dame'. I think that added to the experience. We will definitely be going inside when we go back.
Organized tour. You cannot go to Paris without seeing this, an added bonus is to get a guided tour to learn some of the history. It does have the wow factor.

Must attend mass. Going to mass at Notre Dame is a truly spiritual experience. While there are plenty of distractions with tourists walking around the church, it is amazing to hear mass in this beautiful and enormous church.

A Paris "Must-See". Even though the line looks daunting, we only waited a few minutes to get in and it is well worth the wait. Architecture and artwork that makes even the most non-artistic awestruck.

Nice Visit. Beautiful place, Crypt underneath is very interesting. Line was too long to climb the tower. Lots of cute restaurants near by. Great gelato place in close proximity plus beautiful views of the Seine.

Such beautiful architecture . What an amazing spot. I love how hauntingly beautiful this place is. We didn't get to go to the top of the Cathedral, as we were too late for it, but I definitely would have loved to do so. Inside is also beautiful with lovely stained glass. You don't want to miss this place.

It is beautiful, but.... We had started our trip with a visit to Chartres Cathedral in Chartres, so I'm afraid every Cathedral after that just did not impress us. It is beautiful and worth the 10 minute wait (the queue goes quickly) and of course a must if you are in Paris.

Beautiful Architecture. This free attraction is a must see. The architecture, the stained glass windows, murals, crypts, Joan of Arc - just awesome. We spent a lot of time here. Don't forget to walk around the sides and back, the carvings and architecture are even better. You can also get good pictures from the bridge at the back.
good. it's free and it's open everyday, Inside is amazing and stunning, we waited like 15 minutes and it worth it to go. You take like other 20 minutes to visit the place

One of the most awesome churches in the world!. Even for those non-religious or non-Catholics, this is simple awesome. The architecture is amazing. It is a religious establishment, you need to respect the quiet and prayers of parishioners. Pictures are fine. Don't miss this if you have time. If you have more time, you can walk up the tower but the line was too long that day for us.

Exquisite History and Architecture. One of the main sites in Paris, and definitely a must see! Situated on the island where Paris was founded! The Gothic architecture is splendid from the outside, we were lucky with the sunny day and great pictures. The queue was not too bad to go inside (which was free), you can also queue along the side street to get tickets to the top. The inside is magnificent with its stained-glass windows, high ceilings and how it remains a functioning Church.

Awe-inspiring and grounding building. Nearly put off by the huge entry queue, glad we waited as it was actually quite quick to get in and well worth the wait.
When inside it really makes you reflect (especially as we were there just after the Nice attack). Incredible windows and architecture.
Gothic wonder. Entry is no charge. A magnificent gothic church built over many centuries. The entry queue is long but moves quickly. A stunning masterpiece.
Very old Church in France. Excellent sculpture and must visit attraction. This attraction is 10 min walk from metro station and is next to the beautiful river.
Beautiful Church. Love to visit this church. Beautiful inside as well as outside. Stunning building. We could sit and pray as Catholic during the day.
Church . The church is beautiful. I enjoyed the service. The souvenirs were a bit expensive but they were nice. I got a nice candle and rosary.

Active church, a must see, many articles of interest. The beauty, the collection of both art, sculptures, paintings and displays of French history as well as a place of worship. Many mini-chapels all in encircling around the main cathedral. DIdn't find the entrance to steps up.

Stunningly beautful and detailed both inside and out!. Notre Dame Cathedral is something that any traveler to Paris should see. Although we did not walk up to the top for the views of the city due to the extremely long and slow-moving lines, we enjoyed going in for free to see the wondrous place.Its design is phenomenal, and such details on the monuments, such as the statue of the Bishop whose head was cut off which stand near the exit, head in hand. The inside of Notre Dame was much more stunning to me than that of the Duomo in Florence. Exquisite colors of light emanating though the stained glass windows. The angelic voice of a beautiful solo singing Kyrie Eleison reverberating through the hall. Paintings and statues throughout the sanctuary. So glad we got to experience this wonderful place!
As good as the photos!. Very crowded but well organised so you didn't have to cue for too long. The building find atmosphere is so impressive. Plenty of good photo opportunities.

Trapped by it's own fame.. I've visited a few cathedrals and was a bit disappointed by Notre Dame de Paris. It was very dark inside and the crowds made you feel on a conveyer belt about the building. From the outside the architecture is wonderful, but inside it's not so welcoming.
Day visit. Stunning place ,very iconic ,the history behind this place is breathtaking , well worth a visit , will be back again sometime
Church . We pre-booked a tour which was great. Beautiful to see and so much history. Climbed to the bell tower and the view was magnificent but make sure you can climb about 300 stairs.

OK. After reading about Notre Dame, it became obvious my expectations were high once we saw the building up close and toured the inside. Unfortunately, I wasn't as impressed as I thought I would be. The building has some great details but overall, not a site I'd go out of my way to visit again.

Beautiful architecture. It is one of the best cathedrals I have ever seen. Architecture, both inside and outside are really amazing. It take 10 minutes to get into the cathedral due to long queue, but that's worth. Ambience, outside the cathedral, is really great, specially with the words flying around, it gives a great look.

Truly Magnificient!. No need to be Catholic to enjoy the beauty of Notre Dame. Although, being able to participate fully in the sacraments added a dimension to the trip that would not be afforded to the mere tourist. I had the wonderful experience of attending Mass and receiving Confession at Notre Dame. The priest was simply wonderful. The Mass was reverent and as one would expect, universal. The architecture alone is enough to keep one occupied for several hours of exploration. A must see for anyone visiting Paris!

Beautiful! . A must see!! The long line moved quickly and the view inside is awe inspiring. It's free to enter, of course. My friend and I paid 5€ to enter the Treasury. This area is a collection of small rooms containing priests tools of the trade, if you will. We walked the outer pathway of the cathedral, taking in the alcoves and architecture. It was 2€ or 5€ to light a candle. I didn't see a change machine, which would have been nice. I didn't have the proper coins.

Beautiful. The only thing I found strange about this was that there was tourists there during the mass on Sunday. We went for the Gregorian Mass and it was beautiful. Even though the entire thing was in French, it was still amazing.

A must in your life but avoid tourist groups. I have been extremely lucky of having the opportunity of visiting Paris' Notre Dame several times. Unfortunately the last time during summer was a nightmare. The lanes for getting in were very long. I cannot imagine the situation inside trying to appreciate something of the marvelous place with tents of people surrounding you because we decided not to enter. However if a summer trip to Paris might be your once in a lifetime the you must go very early in the morning or very late. Also, for general purposes if possible go to Paris during shoulder season.

Quite Disappointing. Having visited the Fourvière in Lyon and the cathedrals in Chartres and Orange, Notre Dame was disappointing. We were unable to view the Rose window and the high altar because of a movie screen blocking the same. The stained glass windows were underwhelming. And, there was no sense of reverence. In the other churches, there was a clear sense of divine presence. ND was simply a museum.

Architecture is spellbinding. We took the metro to the Notre Dame station and came up the steps to see this high, lofty cathedral and were just spellbounded to see this huge masterpiece. We read about it in Rick Steve's guide and would you also be awed if you came to know that this building was started in the 1100's by the townpeople, many of whom did free labor to help construct creating the true hunchbacks of Notre Dame. Those people knew they would never in their lifetime be able to pray in the church but knew that one day their descendants will come here.The stained glass windows, the statues, arches, are worth a long see. We stood in the line outside to enter the church after a security check and the line moves pretty quickly. If you would like to climb the tower, then the line is atleast 1 1/2 hour long, I know because I asked this nice lady who was waiting in line and she was still about 50 people or so behind and was already waiting for an hour.

Beautiful, but.... Our Notre Dame visit was amazing. It's an incredibly beautiful cathedral. But seeing the shops inside the cathedral doing a roaring trade somehow takes away the sacredness and the beauty of the place you're in. Sort of ruins it. The other cathedrals we saw in Brittany while not as grand, are somehow closer to our hearts.

Awe-inspiring, but get there EARLY. My most important tip is to get to the cathedral early if you want to have a more meaningful experience. As the day wears on, the lines form and there can be a very long wait. We slipped in at about 8:15AM on Bastille Day no less and shared the entire space with less than 50 visitors and worshippers.
Beautiful inside and out. This was a must visit while in Paris. The center of Paris is right outside so that was a fun addition.

Second visit, still amazing. More than just an attraction, although it is visually spectacular. If you are there for Mass or confession etc, no need to queue. Having your photo taken by tourists while in confession is a little disconcerting but Notre Dame means different things to different people.
A must see if in Paris, it's breathtaking.
Exceptional and Grand. The history behind this cathedral was good to know! Photos do not do justice to how grand this holy place is!

Very Dramatic place of worship. You will probably have to queue to get into the cathedral, but it doesn't take too long to get in, in the meantime you can take in the detail of the architecture from the outside of the building. Once inside you get to see the immense scale of the building, you can take photographs, but please remember this is a place of worship, unfortunately whilst we were there people seemed to be forgetting this and going into the centre to take pictures of the centre aisle and alter where people were praying, they cold have done this from behind the barrier area and still got the same picture. You can hire a audio guide, but I just used my guide book as it was quite informative. You can also see how the cathedral as been extended over the years at a display towards to back of the building.

Spectacular must see. Expect to wait in line to get in. It is a self walk about and they only let so many in at a time. Very beautiful and incredible inside. You enjoy the presence of peace inside. The stained glass and structure and models and history inside will amaze you.
Magnificent building. Sadly we did not have time to go in to this magnificent building, viewing it only from the river cruise on its island.

What a magnificent building!!. I was in love with the architecture of the building, the history of 850 years to finish building, the stain glass windows, the beautiful old lights... You walk around in awe... It's spectacular. Make sure you get there early in the day as the queues are long.It's free entry.Put it on your to do list

There is a long line to get in but it moves quickly. We had a guided tour here, which was great. It really is beautiful and a must see- just be prepared for a bit of a line. Once you get in it is so big you don't feel the crowd as much.

Breathtaking. What an awe inspiring space. The inside seems to be limitless. We've seen all kinds of religious buildings everywhere we've gone and I was touched that this is not one of the over the top gold encrusted edifices. The columns are stately and reminiscent looking back as trees as Gaudi has worked his columns in Barcelona. Very inviting feeling and reverential even as well known and well visited as it is. I highly recommend a visit.

One of my favorite places. One of my favorite places, my advice is to arrive VERY early, we did and had no lines and the cathedral almost to ourselves. We were meeting for. Wego walking tour at 9, so we were there by 8am or so.

Get there early!!. We got there around 9am and looked around the cathedral first . The line is to the side of Notre dame if you plan to go up the tower. They take around groups of 20 people at a time. Line moved quickly and we had finished by 1130.

Night visit. It is illuminated late in the evening and looks so beautiful at night. Great visit always a must once in Paris. It is always crowded but I just like to walk in and feel the atmosphere and pray or meditate for a moment

Beautiful and free!. Once you are inside you will be amazed!
This is a very well known sight in Paris.
The stained glass is beautiful and give the church a special light and a nice atmosphere.
A must-do even for non-Catholics.
Visit to norte dame. one of the must visit if we visit paris. I make it a point to visit when I go to paris. The place is amazing.

Breathtaking. We visited around 9:15am and there was a small queue which went down really fast. Security at the door checking all bags and coats do prepare for that. (Note hats and camera flash are not allowed inside). Just an amazing place to visit, worth every second. It foes get very busy inside and there at least 3 tour groups operating at the same time which made it difficult to navigate around. There are machines inside for a small guidebook in several different languages, there are coin machines to get a large printed coin with your choice of Cathedral picture on (€2 each) and entrance to the Cathedral itself is free. You will not be disappointed.
Grand yet small.. Made in a grand style with intricate details that would impress you. But, but, what surprise you is that it's quite small as compared lot of other cathedrals in Europe.

Lost its spiritual feeling. This church is a tourist business. That is what you need to know - it's like a grand museum of religious icons and paintings. I believe it has lost its spiritual feeling. There were a lot of people the day we went. Line outside moves very quickly - most people that go just take the photos and don't read the information and then get their pressed coin of the pope from the vending machines at the entrance and exit. It is quite sad because it is such an imposing grand church and the stain glass windows especially the rose windows are breathtaking but as an overall experience just OK for me.

Must see!. This is an amazing place to visit! I had not seen anything like this before I came here! Just magnificent it truly is a wonderful place to visit and experience a different culture, loved every moment.
Absolutely Beautiful. It was absolutely beautiful!!! As a Catholic, it was simply breathtaking and moving. There were places to sit and pray that transforms you.

Stunning Gothic Architecture. The architecture of this cathedral is amazing. It is a large church with beautiful stained glass. It is free of charge to walk about the church. Individual tours are available. All information is detailed on the Cathedral's website.

Notre dame. I liked the h old whole experience in Paris I enjoyed every single Moment in Paris ,One of my experience is Norte dame which is different nice experience , what I like is the outdoor activity as there was music gathering outside the church

A must see attraction! . Make sure to visit this Cathedral. The entrance is free and despite the looks the queue moves very fast. We visited around 2pm and had to wait less than 10min. They have free guided tours a few times a week, make sure to check those out in order to make the most out of your visit!
worth seeing. This is a very tranquil place to visit and has some stunning stain glass windows to view, go early as it gets crowded in the afternoon.

Amazing to see in person!. The line to get in was long but moved very quickly! There were several "beggars" outside that we felt bad for as they were older women. Once inside you will be amazed! The church ceilings are so high and just amazing to see! We walked all around and loved all the stained glass. This is definitely a must see on the inside and the outside.

You'll see all the details that never make it into books or pictures. It is truly an awe inspiring creation of the middle ages. Take the time to wander and look at all the amazing artwork and the construction of the building. Beyond religion this is a living piece of art.

It is a must in Paris. This is a very well known place in Paris. The construction is very famous and the stories even better. The stained glass give the church a special light and atmosphere and even if you are not a catholic, I recommend you drop a couple of euros, just in case ...

Amazing and free. Make sure to visit Notre-Dame, it's an amazing building that words cannot really describe and entrance to the cathedral is free! We didn't have time to climb the towers, or visit the treasure, but that's an option too (for a fee).
Fabulous place. The most beautiful historical place every had to climb the 422 steps to visit with the gargoyles and my they are impressive. Quite chilling...

Must see. Attraction is always jam packed with tourists. If you wanna see inside the cathedral and climb the tower, come early and/or take patience to fall on a long queue. We came at 2:00 pm and chosed not to go inside because of the very long line, though we are satisfied just seeing the external view. You can easily find the place, very convenient to reach it via bus or boat.
what a wonderful place. A beautiful cathedral, you will be amazed with the magic it has on you...out of this world, the way the carving are done
Beautiful serene visit. The church is well worth a visit but you have to remember that you are in a place of worship. Beautiful and peaceful place.

Stunning architecture. We only visited Norte dame in its grounds and surrounding area.
The architecture and detail in the building is quite simply breathtaking and is a must see.
The queues to get inside were long though and we simply didn't have time to get there.

Exceeded expectations a truly beautiful cathedral!. Well worth going in at least once if not more. The North rose window & stained glass is spectacular to see. This
cathedral is full of detailed stories and history inside and out.

In a Europe bursting with cathedrals, this one is a must-see. From the imposing facade to the flying buttresses to the gigantic stained glass rose windows, this cathedral stands out as one of man's great religious edifices. An exhibit shows the history of the building of the cathedral and the alterations that have taken place. Thousands of usually respectful visitors wander around among the religious faithful praying in pews. If you go to Paris, you simply have to go to Notre Dame.
Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful cathedral, free to enter but very busy. Best to visit in the morning as there were long queues in the afternoon

Visit on a rainy day - the line is much shorter. I happened to visit Notre Dame on a rainy day and the queue time was under 5 minutes. The church interior was fairly packed, but I was still able to move about freely. This Paris landmark is a medieval masterpiece of stone and stained glass that best comes to light under the multi-color rays beaming downward from one of the rose windows. Being that I was there on a Sunday, we happened upon a small ceremony running down one of the side naves where church elders and a priest were marching in perfect rows and were dressed in traditional French Catholic church member regalia. It was a fantastic scene which I witnessed only by luck in timing.

Icon. I'd say Notre Dame is a place to see just because it's so iconic. The architecture is really spectacular when you consider a good deal of the structure is held together just by pressure.Side note: I was there in 2007.
Rainy visit. Its a beautiful cathedral and a must see if visisting paris. Remember to to take a raincoat if there is any chance of rain. The queue is fairly long but moves fast.

Gorgeous. Don't be discouraged by the long line, it moves quickly. The cathedral is beautiful, and they have done a good job of explaining how it was built. A visit to the archaeological crypt is worth a stop to appreciate the Roman history of the area.

stunning!. At first the lines looked too long, however they moved quickly, and it was free entry. Beggars were constantly kneeling close to people in the waiting line, but occasionally a security officer would come and tell them to move. The Cathedral was beautiful. Please do not take photos of the services in progress, there were tourists doing this and it really upsets the people that are using the church for prayer. There are plenty of other parts of the church to take photos of.
Visit Early. Visit early in the morning if you want to climb. Otherwise, the walk around the cathedral is lovely, and worth the time. The queue also gets long for this though!
No words for this tittle!. Notre-Dame is amazing! To enter in Notre-Dame is free but to go to the top you must pay (and get a line for 1 hour more or less).

Amazing to see. Pictures do not do it justice! It was so majestic and the line, even though it was long to go in we stood in it. It went quickly though. Once inside there is just treasure after treasure to behold! I loved each of the little places for each of the saints and places to make offerings to. It was beautiful and I loved the stained glass windows.

Free entry, historic cathedral . Notre Dame de Paris is in the heart of Paris, located in Cité, it's famous for everyone, whatever your religion is and wherever you come from, we just want to see the beautiful works. Keep silence inside and avoid to take pictures, at least turn off the flashlight. There's history brief posted inside which was blank before, helping the visitors to know better Notre Dame.
How Did They Do This. Just beautiful. I can't imagine how this was built. It was a dreary day but that added to the fun. What a beautiful cathedral. Pictures were allowed to be taken inside.

Celestial experience.. This grand cathedral was built in stages from the 11century and the engineering is jaw dropping. Visitors should be mindful that this is a place of worship for the locals and to keep talking to a minimum. I was fortunate to be present when a choir was singing. A truly heartfelt experience. The queue was 15 mins arriving early with Paris pass. You can also access the tower by the side of the street but get there early or very late in day.
Best time to visit is Sunday!. If you want to see the cat head at its best and be astounded by the priest procession as they enter to worship go there on Sunday evening service. You will thank me
Very interesting. Great cathedral to visit. Easy and simple to tour. Mass was occurring while touring and this added to our visit.

Spectacular!. The windows were breathtaking! The small museum inside was more than worth the nominal price of admission. Don't let the long lines out front discourage you. It moves quickly. Budget at least 90 minutes, but you could easily stay longer. My 6 year old wasn't all that excited about it, but tolerated our visit fine. Our 12 year old loved her experience here.
Gothic Cathedral. This cathedral is awe inspiring. The detail is mind blowing. We were able to listen to the children's choir while we were there. I got goosebumps. It was so beautiful.

20 years since I visited the cathederal. I feel I am not much help to you on the cathederal but the immediate area is very expensive to eat so bring your croissants or whatever and buy a coffee on the go.
Awesome.. Great architecture with lots of history! You only live once so take your time and marvel at it all. On top of everything else it's free!

peace and love. you will find there peace and love! beacutiful experience! the entrance was free ! you should wait in the que! the security guys will check your bag before the entrance! dont miss it! you should definately go there!

Gorgeous Cathedral. We were on a guided tour while visiting Notre Dame. It was very helpful to have somebody point out things that you could easily miss both inside and out. He talked about the stained glass and changes to the Cathedral over time. It was definitely worth visiting.

So beautiful inside and out. We visited while a service was going on and the
songs were being sung. It sounded like being surrounded by angels. It is breath taking beautiful. Take time to explore and consider going to the top of the towers. There are steps or an elevator. A treat not to be missed.
Must see in Paris. One of the must see in Paris. I strongly recommend to visit the towers. You need to climb ca 300 steps but the view is amazing.
A Must-See. The line to get in moves quickly - do not let the line stop you. There is no talking inside - but plenty of opportunities to take photos.
Like in movie. Saw this place a lot of times in movies, but in real life this place more gorgeous and fundamental. Has beautiful garden outside. Wery good place to relax after hours of walking.

This is one of the must see holy places💛💛. The place is so amazing .fabulous place to take the kids.the church is free to enter and beautiful inside but it's well worth paying to climb the stairs to the bell tower.The queue is long so there can be a boring waiting time.

Worth the wait to go up. Go early in the morning, or with a tour group to avoid the long queue to go up. We went in the morning and had to queue for 2 hours to climb up the tower. However the view from upstairs is breathtaking. The stairs are okay if you just take your time walking up.

It is very impressive Cathedral!!!. Notre Dame Cathedral was built 8 centuries ago. It is worth visit it, because it is a historical place. It is very dark inside, but when there is a bright sun, it lights up the stained glass windows of the cathedral. It is magic.

Impressive religious monument. Visually impressive but did not compare for me with Gaudi's more modern masterpiece, the Sagrada Familia in Barcelona. I was interested to see the coin-in-the -slot machines to pay for electronic candles and mint your own religious coins. Clearly the church is up to date with both environmental issues and revenue raising. Watch out for the pickpocket gangs that operate in the area.

Great visit!. We arrived at Notre Dame around 9:45am, just before it opened at 10. We made the mistake of going inside first. While there was no wait to get in line to go inside, we ended up waiting for about an hour and a half to climb the stairs to the top, as they only let so many people in at a time. If I were to do it again, I would get in line for the stair climb first (it's on the left side of the Cathedral when you're facing it) and then go inside after. While there was a long line to enter the Cathedral when we left, it moved pretty quickly.

The Best Gargoyles. You can not visit Eiffel Tower, but you must see Notre Dame Cathedral. It's amazing and beautiful, and it's basically located on it's own island. On sunny day you can sit outside and look at the cathedral and it's Gargoyles all day. This place is defenetly worth visiting.In the souvinire shop, which is located just next to the Cathedral you can buy a beutiful candlesticks in a shape of Gargoyles.

Magnificent architecture with glorious views. We had to queue both to visit the church inside and again to climb the stairs to the top, but it was worth it! Seeing the building up close is amazing, and the views over Paris are simply wonderful.

Beautiful cathedral by the Seine. Beautiful cathedral with gothic architecture. Nice to walk around the area and take pictures of the cathedral by the river. Worthwhile to go inside the church and it's free. Quiet calm inside the church and time to say a prayer or just sit and have some quiet respite.
Nothing but smiles. Sunset was absolutely majestic. listening to singers and the warmth of the sun dancing from the river. It was like a dream.

Gothic Paris at its best. More than the eiffel tower, i relate paris with the Notre Dame. I visited with my wife and it is an intimidating structure to say the least. You can feel the centuries of history associated with this cathedral weighing down on you as you walk through it. It is a MUST visit and the long Que you need to stand in to enter is totally worth it. Also, post the visit you always have the Latin quarter on your left to go freshen up!

A must do in Paris. We were travelling out of the tourist season so the line to get in wasn't too long; only a 5 minute queue. Although I have visited a number of times in the past this cathedral never ceases to have a "special" atmosphere about it for me. I particularly enjoyed reading about the origins and changes to the building through the centuries. An amazing place.

Beautiful. I have been there many times but it is always just as beautiful. I am particularly fond of the gargoyles. Always somewhat of a line but it moves quickly.
Beautiful stained glassed windows.

Amazing Church . This church is awesome and a must see. Make sure you have a guide or something similar so you can get the whole story as you go through it. It is free and fun, make sure you do it. We didn't go up to the top and still enjoyed it very much.

Can't miss this!!!. Notre Dame Cathedral is THE Cathedral of Cathedrals. Imagining the middle ages, the engineering feats of building such a large cathedral, the flying buttresses, the gargoyles, etc. Grab a Rick Steves book to learn about the cathedral. There is a security line, but it moves fast.

Impressive building. Notre Dame is my favourite church to visit (have been there a couple of times) and the size of it always impresses me. There are many details all over the building so you can stroll around for a long time.

A peaceful sanctuary in a busy city. Notre Dame Cathedral is beautiful and a peaceful place with a hushed atmosphere. We did not go up to the top. It is free to enter, and a great place to go early in the morning, such as 8 or 9 am, before the long lines start. It is very easy to get to and has a nearby Metro stop.

Get Up Early to Avoid the Crowds. Having twice before on previous trips to Paris attempted to 'experience' Notre Dame only to be repulsed by the absurd crowds, we invested in a different strategy this time. It opens between 7:30 and 8:00 depending on season. Check first and get there early as we did and you'll have an unhurried, uncrowded and magical visit to a cathedral marvel. Its certainly Top 3 - 5 in Europe, but so much more wonderful visited before the hordes descend.

have seen before. We did not go into the Cathedral as the lines were too long and we had seen it inside before. We viewed from outside and walked around the gardens and the building. We also saw it from one of the tour boats on the river. This is a visit I would save for off season.

The most Impressive Cathedral ever seen.
