Majestic construction, unique, the building dates from 1345, Gothic architecture with Baroque contributions, full of history and color, can attend Mass, confession ( in different languages), and if you're lucky you can see ceremonies of the order of the Holy Grail, what an incredible experience, free entrace so you can´t miss it
ND. Beautiful Church. We were able to visit during a mass on Saturday. Free admission. Line moves fast, don't need to purchase a ticket.

Imposing!. Went to see this iconic building and was suitably impressed! Amazing architecture that too hundreds of years to develop into the current state. As with other places in Paris, the sheer volume of visitors make it hard to really appreciate the interior. Despite many signs asking for silence the majority of visitors did not observe this request, hence the noise was somewhat off putting. There were many beautiful panels and statues but the interior was quite dark and flash photography is prohibited. Some interesting photographs, but I bought a guide book to make sure I had better images. Could have stayed longer but it began to get a bit claustrophobic with all the people.

Super long line. Wonderful view and gorgeous architecture. The line was entirely too long so we didn't even bother going in. There is a archeological dig at the road near the entrance to the cathedral which has really good history about Roman Paris and Paris through the centures. Good for kids too.

Beautiful old church. We completed a bicycle tour of the city and this was one of our stops. A lovely view of Notre Dame Cathedral from a bridge.
The front side is crowded with tourists and I would suggest getting there early to miss the long lines.
Highly recommended

It's worth going up the tower for the view. It is worth going up the tower for the view across Paris, to see the gargoyles up close and personal and to see the bells...you don't need to be super fit but it is up a lot of stairs so be warned. Also the shop is only on the way up so buy your gifts then as we were disappointed not to come back through the gift shop.

Must See. After six weeks amidst the baroque and romanesque spenders of Italian cathedrals, it was a shock to the sense to return to the world of gothic architecture. At 7:45 am there are no lines to get into the cathedral. I find the effect somewhat somber and spooky compared to, say, Chartres. At some point since 1991 the confessionals were replaced with glass "consultation booths" - sign of the times? Look for the statue of St. Denis holding his head in his hands. Literally.

Lovely. Beautiful Cathedral with stunning architecture and the queue was surprisingly short to enter. We stopped by in the evening when the cathedral looks pretty all lit up. Would highly reccomend visiting.
Spectacular. This is a very unique building its one of the places you vist on your trip to Paris if you are lucky to have a guided tour it's worth every penny

Good historical place. Good place to see from outside the building is amazingly beautiful going inside you need buy tickets which is a bit expensive but good for people interested in history & archeology. Location of this place is close to metro station.

Worth the wait. When one enters a historic building, much more a cathedral, you expect to hear so much chatter. But upon entering the Notre Dame Cathedral, people were silent & you can see their eyes marveling on the beauty of the place.A must-see when in Paris !

Lovely church. Nice visit attended a french mass last sunday. Only downside are the other tourists who ignores the signs and still take pictures along the altar where the mass is taking place. One of the church member has lots of patience to inform people/visitors to respect the holy mass.

Catholic or not go here Sunday morning. This is a magnificent cathedral and with free entry a must see when in Paris. The entry is free and the line moves quickly even with security bag and metal detection tests. Go here on a Sunday morning when Catholic Mass is being served in French. Whether a Catholic or not it can be a moving experience given the feeling of peace in here at this time. Beautiful building.

A cathedral truly steeped in history. This is such an amazing and surreal place. This was our 3rd visit, but this time we had my elderly Mum travelling with us and for her it was the highlight of our trip. The enormity and magnificence of this beautiful church needs to be explored and admired. There are many places of information and easy to ready about the structure and the transformation of this gorgeous piece of architecture.The stories of the great priests and saints who lie there are also fascinating, as are the stained glass windows and many of the monuments.You can get free tours every couple of hours, but we opted to wonder at our own pace and enjoyed every minute of our time here. It's free to go in, but there are plenty of places to leave a donation or buy a paper backed guide for 2 euros, all which benefit the ongoing restoration of this beautiful building.

Must visit. It is certainly an amazing place to visit. It is free as most of the Churches, you do have to pay if you want go to the top, but to visit the inside of the Church there is no charge, it is amazing, the architecture, the design , the vitraux. Even when there might be lines to go inside the Church, the wait time is reasonable.

Beautiful. I can't even tell you what it's like to experience the 'bells' when they go OFF. We heard them on a Sunday evening calling people to Mass, people were literally stopping in their tracks it was unreal. Beautiful structure and the square around it is lovely to sit in and just gaze at it for a little while. You do get the mad pests asking you to sign petitions, they are just begging so ignore them and don't let them spoil your experience. Notre Dame is opposite the Latin Quater, we loved all this part of Paris and came here twice during our two day trip.
Recommend . Such a beautiful place to visit even if you can't get up stairs Everything about the Notre dame is amazing It gathers hundreds of people but don't let this deter you, go inside

New view of grand cathedral. I have been to Notre Dame quite a few times so this time although I felt I needed to see it up close I did not go inside. However, I walked along the side and sat in the garden at the back of the cathedral and began to notice the beauty of the building from a different perspective. Not the doors and designs in the front but a lot of intricate angles and beautiful structures along the side and rear. Really special place besides the religious significance.
Don't visit church on Sundays. Unless you are a church goer don't go there on Sunday. Church service was in progress when we arrived and they were unhappy although we were very discreet.
The church. The way it was built was unbelievable...i was amazed by the ceiling design of the church....Beautiful....

Beautiful views from the towers. Notre Dame is a classic Paris attraction that is well worth the stop. Don't miss out on the towers. They offer breathtaking views of the city that are well worth the climb!

Dark and Crowded. It is dark, crowded and the back of the church is filled with gift shops. We walked in and Mass was being celebrated. It's just a bit jarring to go in to a place like this. Would probably not go back, just was a bit too crowded for my taste.

Stunning medieval cathedral . This place was the first monument we visited in Paris and it didn't disappoint us. It's extremely beautiful the architecture, the intricate craftsmanship, the history, the surroundings everything. The entry is free, hence super crowded it took awhile to get in but was completely worth the wait :) I'm sure it would be absolutely delightful to attend a mass here, which gives us a reason to visit Paris again :p

Incredible. One of our main destinations while in Paris.The size of the cathedral is just incredible. It's also easy to visit. Accessible by hop on hop off buses. You go through a very long line that moves very fast. No admission fee, they just check your bags at the door. The outside is just as ornate as the inside. We've been to Notre Dame in Montreal as well. This is larger. The inside is a bit darker than it was in Montreal. No flash photos allowed. A must see if you are in Paris.
You need to go inside! . Absolutely breathtaking place. Don't just stop on the outside and take a selfie, go in because it's also stunning on the inside!
A Must See. A must see for the atmosphere, organ playing and art work. Stunned and delighted at the fact that there is no charge for entry
Impressed . I came for the photos and was not disappointed at all. A very impressive building and well built for its time.
Good Attraction. Free to get in which is something rare in Paris. Not religious but well worth a visit even just to say you have been.
Too beautiful , do not miss this. Romantic... historical ... beautiful architecture.. you will love this. It s crowded most of the time so pick you time of visit wisely..

Great Timing of a mass service inside and outside church. its one of the greatest relics , monument, story of paris.. not to be missed and we lucked out as the pope was having a mass service and the atmosphere was really one which was out of this world

You might get to see some guy blow his brains out ... We were there when the anti gay old guy jumped onto the alter and blew his brains out.. Never a dull moment right..? The cathedral is beautiful. The amount of imbeciles is off the chart. It is free and well worth seeing. Who knows..? Maybe you will see someone getting all crazy too?

Another classic Paris destination. We visited as part of a self-guided walking tour of the two islands. The cathedral is incredible from a historical sense - around 700 years old. It's such a time consuming effort of craftsmanship and skill, and we were blessed to have a visiting choir performing during our visit. The acoustics were wonderful. The flying buttresses are visible from the sides and rear of the cathedral. A good highlight in our day!

Great Tour Through City Wonders. We were in Paris for only a few days and we took their tour of Notre Dame. We walked from out meeting point to the Cathedral and our guide pointed out all the different points of interest and the stories that go with them. At Notre Dame we were told every little known tidbit, pieces of history and the back stories. He was great!!! We've used City Wonders for many of our European tours on this and prior vacations. We look at City Wonders' tours 1st because of the wonderful people they have leading these groups and the interesting tours they put together.

Beautiful architecture. Like a lot of Paris buildings, Notredame cathedral is beautiful!!! The bottom level can be covered within 1 hr. To see the bottom floor, go at 9:30am so you don't wait in long lines which has can get to be very hot. If you are planning to go to the top floor, get there by 9am which is an hr before it opens. The lines can be 2hrs long if you come at 10:30am.Paris in summer is high 80F and the sun can be very hot to the skin - wear sunblock
Like heaven. This is my favorite spot in Paris. Inside the cathedral everything is wonderful. I watched the mass and there is a beautiful chorus and a heavenly environment. Perfect!

Best early in the morning. Be sure to visit this as soon as it opens. We went there around 8am, and there were no queues, we had time to walkk and loo around. Also take time to go up to the towers - really worth it
Crowded. It was nice to look at, but I was not overly thrilled by it. The history of the building (and age) is interesting. There was a huge line to get in, but it moved very quickly.

A must do and if you want truly feel or in need to be connected with God please stay fo the mass services.. A must do a holy experience between the breath taking vitrals and architecture. A must stay for one of the mass services a true expense of spirituality and connection with God. (No matter your denomination trust me) please have an authentic fromage and jambon crepe a few step away from the Notre Dame must eat it by the bridge. A true Parisian experience super safe only 7 euros and its huge that trust me 2-3 can eat from it. Depending f your appetite of course ;) enjoy

A must see. We attended an early Sunday Mass at Notre Dame Cathedral (in French) singing was amazing!!!!!!!!!!!! Even my kids were impressed by the singers voice and sound inside the Cathedral. We then walked around to see the chapels and other parts of the cathedral.
beautiful Paris site not to be missed. Lines moved quickly so don't be intimidated. Amazing cathedral - we spent far more time exploring than I would have anticipated as each small chapel was unique.

Awesome Building . Stopped by here because I heard the building is fantastic and when I walked up to it I couldn't believe how pretty it was. Tried to go in but the line was too long. Definitely want to take the tour when going back.

Impressive but very busy. Putting aside its real architectural beauty, this church is the home of the famous hunchback of Victor Hugo! Very nicely located next to the Seine river and the St-Michel area, the church is definitely worth a visit. Issue with Notre Dame is that it is always flooded with visitors. Queues practically on anything; to enter the church and to climb up the stairs for a birds' view of Paris. If you are willing to wait, then both are wonderful things to do, if not, then the mere external visit and appreciation of its historical and architectural beauty is enough!
Stunning Beauty. Gorgeous church. Lots of artwork - statues & paintings. Dual bell towers. Incredible height. Detailed craftsmanship.
Stunning . This place is amazing. The architecture is incredible. Coming from Oz, the history of this is unbelievable. Definitely worth it

You can take your stroller in. There are lots of rules but taking in your stroller is allowed. There are steps that you'll have to carry it over, but they're doable if you have a little one that is sleeping.
And check out the garden in back. There's room for your little one to run around in before you head to your next destination.
Beautiful church. The Notre Dam is a must see and you must read about its construction to see how much work and how long it took to get it to where it is now. Walk around the area if you have time.
Beautiful. Absolutely breathtaking. Massive and everything you think it should be. Beautiful inside and out. The grand dame of them all.

A Paris Must. I enjoyed visiting the Cathedral. It is an architectural marvel, and a very spiritual place. The Right Bank of the River Seine where it is located is also very beautiful. It is free of charge and probably takes 30-60 minutes to visit.

Majestic Go to a Mass. Notre Dame is a Cathedral that is inspiring. It felt like a holy place to me! I am a Christian but not Catholic and I felt like this was a spiritual place and had a sense of peace while I visited. It was also moving for me a my mother recently died and I light a candle to remember her. Go and experience this holy place for your self!

Notre Dame. We recently tour the Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris. We participated in the English speaking tour. The tour was one hour in length, started outside, then throughout the cathedral. The information provided by the guide was exceptional. The pace was appropriate and all questions were answered. Most interesting fact we learned is that the crown of thorns is stored in the cathedral.

Iconic!. Another enjoyable visit to this historic and very beautiful cathedral. This time happened to be on a Sunday when a mass was in progress.We are not religious but it really does add to the experience to witness traditional mass, especially to hear the organ and choir and the amazing acoustics. This time there were hauntingly beautiful Fijian hymns included.Notre Dame will seduce lovers of history and architecture, but I suggest taking in a service to experience it as fully alive. Needless to say be prepared for crowds.
Heavenly. We went during a mass and the beauty of the sound echoing round the superb architecture infuses the mind. A beautiful experience, so moving.

Nice. This huge cathedral is worth the trip. Queues to get in can be massive but even the outside is impressive with fantastic detail. But far the worst aspect is all the selfie takers outside... Be prepared for huge crowds! - gutted not to have seen the hunchback!!!

Much larger inside than expected!. We were able to get right in to see the inside of Not-re Dame and it was worth it. Lots of history there from the 12 century on and it is well documented. Lots to see and it is a functioning church as well.
Crowded. This is crowded. Once inside though it is worth it because of the beautiful paintings in masterpieces inscribed in the walls and ceiling's.

Gothic Cathedral at its best. A must see while in Paris.
Free entry for the cathedral but I highly recommend paying to go up the towers. The view is the best of central Paris.
You should have shoulders and knees covered.
Amazing building. The building, like so many in Paris, is stunningly beautiful. Definitely worth waiting in line (and it was a rather long line), but free to walk around.
Pretty amazing art. Very intricate work through the building, and free, very impressive overall! If you have a free half hour or enjoy amazing architecture it is worth a stop by
Awesome!. The exterior is absolutely worth seeing. Beautiful architecture! Add this to your list of things you must see in Paris. The surrounding restaurants are also worth visiting.

Long lines -- good to see people back in Paris. Lines moved very quickly so don't be disappointed if you see a long line. Service was going on and so good to see it still being used for what it was built for.

A paris high light😊. notre dame is such a historic 12 century cathedral. Feel the history of paris and work your way around the selfie takung asian people😀
Just enjoy going around the stages and see the altar. Cant go wrong!

Fascinating but crowded. Beautiful architecture and so much history! This is not just a place for those who are religious, it's history reveals so much about France and its people. Sadly the crowd to climb the tower was horrendous and we would have waited for most of the day just to go up. If you want to climb the tower I'd recommend arriving before it opens. In contrast we only waited 5 minutes to go inside the cathedral.
This is HUGE!. You can not miss Notre Dame. It has been featured on movies, tv shows, magazines and most of all, children's books. An attraction that has to be in a "must visit" category.

Impressive site . The history & seeing how long it took to build the cathedral is out of this world (over 100 years to come to its current shape)
It's free as well :)
We also came in when signing (if that's proper term) was going on, which made it even more enjoyable.

Breathtaking Place - A Must See !!!!. A must see place in Central Paris and some of it is free !!! - I only had an hour to spend so lined up and after a short wait walked through the place during a choral session - just wonderful !! The stain glass windows are breathtaking and it is just so peaceful - despite the crowds. I was careful though as lots of warnings about pickpockets.

Simply beautiful!. Must see attraction! It's one of the most beautiful places I have ever been, both inside and out! We also paid to climb to the top which is also worth it but very tiring on the legs!
breathtaking. this place was more than expected. A little side note, have the crepes from across the street. They are terrific
A Classic. Don't just walk by Notre Dame Cathedral, take the time to walk inside and appreciate the beauty. A very short line moved quickly and once inside lots of places to see.

Beautiful. I could not believe it was free to get into the cathedral. Everything was perfect and it was exactly what I thought it would be. There was a huge line out front, but it moved very quickly. It was definatley worth seeing.

Moving experience. Notre Dame is a breaktaking cathedral. The exterior is beautiful to see; however, the interior is where the real magic is. I've visited twice - once during a mass and once while a mass wasn't go on. I would try to go back during another mass, as it heightens the majesty of the building. I will definitely visit again!

A classic must see in heart of Paris!. Day or night you can miss spending time in or near this beautiful CathedralWhat more can be said that other reviewers have not already included- take yourself or the family here.If it come super early you can get in without the crowds-better to do that an imagine how this place has changed over the years versus queuing with hundreds others and be herding through!Don't miss it and go early if you want to get inside.
Easy walking distance along the river.... Definitely worth a visit...see the padlocks on the fence around the Cathedral...makes a great pic with Notre Dame in the background.
A must see. Point zero on French maps for the center of Paris. Watch out for pickpockets however. Lots of restaurants and cafés in area. Walk over to the Ile St Louis. Again, stroll, get lost, enjoy.

Cathedral. This cathedral is breath taking, free for all those who want to walk in and visit, walk through or sit and listen to mass. Great history, there was a line to get in but it moved very quickly no more than 10 minutes. There are plenty of restaurants and bus stop all around.

A Paris must see. Since I was at Notre Dame last in 1987 something has changed, maybe the crowds, maybe my vast travels, I don't know. It just seemed to lack the impact it did that first time. That being said, don't miss a visit to this beautiful cathedral landmark. If you can find a quiet spot it is a very spiritual place. Go in the morning the lines are shorter and the plaza is not as hot. Across

Astounding. There was a long line up when we arrived but it moved surprisingly fast. Once you get inside, the crowds dispurse and realize the magnitude of the church. Really astounding that they could build such magnificent structures so long ago. The stained glass windows are so beautiful. There are information bulletins posted throughout the church providing information and history. The information is provided in many languages. This tour is free, donations are accepted. A must see!
Beautiful and stunning. Take your time to go through and appreciate the stained glass. To avoid lines, try going at lunch time as there tends to be significantly less people line.

Magic in the morning. I was recently in Paris and was waiting to go in when they opened the doors at 7:45. Being in that beautiful, peaceful place with half a dozen other people was the perfect way to begin my days. It was possible to walk around and enjoy the building without crowds. I particularly enjoyed the representations of Christ's appearances after the resurrection on the sides of the choir. I don't remember seeing them during previous visits. It is also possible to attend services in the choir. Being there in the morning set a peaceful tone for the rest of my day.

Amazing!. Every time we come to Paris, this is the first place we visit. It's amazing that a structure from the 12th century can be so beautiful. It's massive, but has wonderfully delicate features both inside and out. We have been to this cathedral many times and, each time, we discover something new. It's special! Awesome! The only detracting aspect is that tour guides are allowed in the church speaking to their tour members. There are large signs RIGHTFULLY REQUESTING SILENCE. Why, then, are tour guides aloud NOT to be silent? This should be stopped!
beautiful and serene. great example of the gothic architecture , be in good shape and comfortable footwear to climb the 380 odd steps to the tower..worth it
Simply stunning!!. What a place!!! So glad I came to see this! Absolutely beautiful!!The hop on hop off bus tour takes you right outside! Really handy and central to everywhere!!Awesome architecture!

Beautiful from the outside, unable to see the inside. . Notre Dame is absolutely stunning. Definitely worth visiting for a few snaps. Unfortunately we were unable to go inside on the day we walked by, but I think the outside is probably what's most worth seeing. We also caught a glimpse of it at night and it was lovely then, too.
Spectacular architecture. No hunch-back spotted anywhere!The building itself is a work of art. I love the gargoyles on top this massive church, slightly gothic and dark.

A Must for Both Non-Believers and Believers. My darling and I stayed in a beautiful VRBO apartment on a charming side street (Rue de Maitre Albert) across from Notre Dame. Both he (as an active RC) and I (as a recovering RC) were thrilled with the proximity to the Cathedral. I loved hearing the bells and strolling around the exterior. We attended a Gregorian concert at the Cathedral one evening (expensive but worth it) and attended mass one morning. The history is explained in pictures & several languages and there are audio and live guides available. I highly recommend and will return

Disorganized. Confusing. Still must do. . The line to get in was very long, poorly organized, and confusingly run out through large tour groups and the lines for going up into the towers. Was still a killer site to see in Paris

Nice to see. It's free which is hard to beat and you can use the hop on hop off boat ride to get you here. It's a Paris staple so you kind of have to go. The ground area is really nice. Expect to wait in line though.

Beautiful. Inspiring from the outside, take the time to walk around the building. Beautiful inside, don't be intimidayed by the line which may sprawl across the courtyard, it moves quickly. My wife had always wanted to see the rose window, so a very moving visit

Keep calm and see Notre Dame. Notre Dame is one of the Paris landmarks and this time I only stay outside the cathedral and enjoyed both the architecture and atmosphere of the church. A huge number of people were there both during the day and evening. A popularity is understandable.

Gothic Architecture. This is a great example of Gothic Architecture, and does not go over the top like some other cathedrals I've seen in Europe. The inside is very beautiful. There were very long lines to get in both the cathedral and the tours up until the time of close (about 1 hour for tours, 20 minutes for cathedral). Cathedral is free and tours you have to pay, covered by museum pass.

Great Place to start in Paris. This cathedral is a grand sight to see. Not only is it stunning with the décor, but its even beautiful in the rain. It was raining when we arrived, but there are multiple shops around to grab a cheap umbrella. The best part about this cathedral was the vastness inside. Make sure to walk around to the other side and the back to get some great views of the outdoor architecture.

Great Visit. Again places as beautiful as this will be ruined by the souvenirs being sold relentlessly outside and inside. Some are very in your face about it which intimidates a lot of people. This is not to scare people, just be aware as after a very long day of sightseeing and having people trying to sell you stuff you don't want tempers can flare and can ruin a much long awaited trip!

Got here early in the day.. The entrance line wasn't too long getting here around 9ish in the morning. Was a bit disappointed that some people visiting were not respectful of the rules like no selfie sticks and observing some quiet in the cathedral but overall I was happy to visit here and have a little prayerful time in the cathedral also.
One of the most beautiful cathedrals. Every time I am in Paris I go to see Notre Dame. It is a must see on everyone's list. The architecture of the building is spectacular

Site is a must see. . Without the technology of today, to see what they built over 700 years ago, is unbelievable!
Must see!

quiet, serene & lovely. Had a lovely walk through the Cathedral. Gives you a chance to take it all in and look at the architecture in the building.
Im not a religious person, but this is such a place that when you walk through it will make you think about the little things in life that are important to you.
A quick trip. We didn't have a lot of time to spend here, but felt it was well worth the visit just to see the Rose Window.

Awe inspiring. We were fortunate to have a short line to enter the free entrance at the front. A line about 20m long gets inside very quickly so don't bebput off by the numbers. Of it stretches right across the courtyard maybe that's questionable as to worth to wait...
Amazing building. Huge building, and even more beautifull than in the pictures. Entrance is free. When i was there a qoir was singing, and the aucustics were amazing. A must-experience when in Paris
Beautiful but crowded!. A must see in Paris; absolutely beautiful! Yet, there are a lot of people waiting to see it as well. If you have the opportunity, get there earlier to avoid lines.

Beautiful and sacred cathedral. As iconic as the Eiffel Tower to me is Notre Dame, an amazingly stunning cathedral inside and out. The flying buttresses and gargoyles are a sight to see on the outside, and the stained glass (particularly the Rose Windows) are stunning inside. Bags are checked here (and elsewhere these days) but admission remains free. Silence is required because this is a house of prayer -- and people really do respect that. For a few euros you may light a candle in several areas inside -- a wonderfully spiritual thing to do for those of us who believe. Admire the art -- and to the left of the altar be sure to look at the timeline of the great cathedral's construction. It's amazing.Masses are still conducted here and my son, who was in Paris November 13, told us that a special remembrance mass was held immediately after that tragedy which was very special indeed.There are some 432 steps to the top of the tower, which allows for a scenic view of Paris. Not for those who have trouble with steps but for those who don't might be a must do.The Little Sisters of the Poor were at the exit accepting donations. One shouldn't just walk by -- my two cents -- these lovely ladies serve the poor and especially the elderly poor. They do not allow anyone to pass from this life alone -- those without means and family are never left alone (I have volunteered in the past with these sisters in our community) -- their quiet request for funds in the church of our lady is especially poignant to me. Notre Dame should be on everyone's bucket list for Paris.

Notre Dame From The Outside. As always an amazing site and never disappoints. Packed with amazingly carved stone work and very intricate. This landmark has to be one of the top three must visit sites in Paris. Queues to get inside are always extreme so soak up around the outside and gardens rather than stand waiting for a peak inside with thousands of others.

Spectacular . The architecture is amazing. What an incredible work of art. You just can't miss this one. There are tours all the way to the top but the lines are crazy. We will visit this one every time we visit.

Not very Christian!!. Absolutely shocked that they were selling stuff inside the cathedral!!! I'm my s Christian but I do know about Jesus tipping over the tables in the church telling them not to sell stuff in the church!!Apart from that it was just another cathedral & we didn't find anything interesting about it - the cathedral in Rheims was far more fascinating.....

Breathtaking !!!. We went there in morning to avoid the rush. It was my second visit and was once again totally awestruck with the magnificence of this place. Massive, soaked in history and really peaceful and divine experience. Must visit while in Paris.

A must-see in Paris, including going up in the towers. Notre-Dame de Paris is a must-see in Paris, including going up in the towers. The view of Paris and the Eiffel Tower from the Notre-Dame tower (300 steps, be ready!) is breathtaking. Enjoy!

Good for a quick visit. I loved seeing the outside of Notre Dame but there was a crazy long queue to go inside so we couldn't wait. The cafes around it are terrible, it was the only time we had bad food and bad service. I guess it's a captured audience.Next time I'll just go for a walk around and leave. Worth seeing it though.

Grand cathedral... . If there is one place which I found architecturally marvellous reminiscent of European masonry in Paris, is the notre Dame. The stone work is just beautiful and somehow looks much well preserved than the rest of the buildings in Paris. The inside of the cathedral is massive and the church organ is next level. We got to witness an ongoing wedding which added to our experience. The entry to the cathedral is free but there is a charge for climbing the tower. Oh, and be prepared for big lines... Though fast moving big lines.

Didn't see the Hunch Back, but saw the belfry. Beautiful Cathedral. Was humored when over the public address system we heard SHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH. It is a church and it is expected that you speak softly.

Ding dong. One of the most famous churches in the whole world. After my visit one I can say is worth every single pennie to go and visit Notre Dame. In the church you can find the whole history of the building and you can go all the way up to the roof and see all Paris in your legs.

Amazing! Wonderful!. Of the places that is a most in Paris is this amazing Cathedral! The way the architecture was detailed is simply flawless. Plus to me as Catholic has a more special meaning even though I saw people from many places of the world and many different religions and they were just as amazed as I was. We had to wait in line for like half hour to get in but by the time we took some pictures we were ready to go in.
Beautiful. Was with a tour group & went early on a Sunday morning before the big crowds. Was able to hear lovely organ music & singing during a mass.

Overestimated. Like lot of things in Paris, overestimated, overpriced (5 euro for the treasure?? Why!??...go and visit the treasure of St Gennaro in Naples)... If you have been in Italy and visited any church, this one fails to impress in comparison. Rome St Peter, Milan duomo, Florence santa Maria del fiore. Go and visit those churches.
Yes!. The gothic architecture, the stained glass windows, and atmosphere makes this a must see when visiting Paris.

After Hours Tour of the Towers. Booked an after hours tour of the Towers through Viator, could not have been more pleased.
Received grwat info about the Cathedral, the architecture and history. Went up into the Towers without a crowd or a long wait in line. The time flew by, great tour.
A must see. You cannot come to Paris without coming here. A very long line to enter the towers...but a much quicker one to enter the cathedral.
A must see. A beautiful cathedral worth visiting in day and night. Attend an organ concert if you can, to get a different appreciation of the acoustics and splendour of the architecture.

A classic one must visit - line long but reasonably fast. The line to enter the cathedral seemed awfully long, but it moved very quickly, do don't be deterred by the long line in front of the cathedral. Very interesting and moving once inside. We did not visit the towers or crypt, so can't comment on those lines.
Awe-Inspiring. Walking into the Notre Dame Cathedral is even more breathtaking that seeing out from the outside. The stained glass windows are incredible and the history is worth taking in!
Must visit while in Paris. It is the most popular cathedral of paris . It is beautiful, lively,full of people , and lots of eateries around .

Beautiful Cathedral, breath taking craftsmanship.. Both exterior and interior of this Cathedral is beautiful from the wall carvings to the stain glass windows. We were lucky that a street band was diverting all the attention away and the line was short. When we came back out there was long line which would take probably 30mins to hour wait. Early visit would definitely have less people!

Breathtaking beauty!. When we arrived, there was a long line, but it moved very quickly and within 10 minutes, we were inside! We did not have a guide, but everything is marked with plaques in various languages. As we toured, we heard beautiful music begin and we were actually privileged to witness Mass! It was an amazing visit! We spent about 2 hours total there. You can purchase tickets to walk up into the spires, but we did not.

Awesome experience. We visited on a Sunday whilst there was a mass, very special place inside, the history of the cathedral and everything about it is amazing, a must do on your top things to see in Paris.

Magical!. When you enter chatedrale from all that rush outside you feel like you have entered in a whole new world!My friend and I came at beggining of mass and it was so special. I was speachlees. Building is outstanding!! Definitely one of the best things I have seen!
24 hours in Paris. Don't miss Notre Dame Cathedral! Moving, inspirational and beautiful. It was definitely a high light.

Spectacular View. We did a tour that included the Notre Dame Towers and Saint Chapelle. The Saint Chapelle was breath takingly breautiful. We also loved the view from the towers of Notre Dame. Be prepared for a lot of steps - it is worth it when you reach the top!
Beautiful church. This is a beautiful church, on the Île de la Cité island on the Seine. Beautiful but ... perhaps less so that some of the other amazing architecture in Paris.

There's nothing like this Dame. Rolled up to this iconic edifice during the wettest week in France for a century, plus strikes, storms and terrorist threats. Yet our blacked-out van was allowed to park outside the front door for half an hour - with not a security patrol in sight. Good thing our intentions were benign.

Fascinating. While the visit inside the cathedral is free, you need 10€ to go up the tower - which is worth the visit. The view from above is breathtaking while you enjoy the cathedral's numerous roof decorations. The queue to enter the cathedral is quite long, but the one to the tower is dreadful - we waited at least one and a half hour!

Great Cathedral Indeed. All I can say here is this has got to be a MUST for anyone, the Cathedral is spectacular both inside and out, warning the queue is MASSIVE and will take a while due to security checks.

Worth the line. Hadn't been inside Notre Dame in about 15 years, because there is always a big line to enter. This time we decided to enter, it was drizzling, and it took us 25 minutes to enter. Once you are inside, it is so beautiful and majestic that you fall in love with it and come out with such peace.

Icon of Chrisianity. Notre Dame Cathedral is a functioning parish church and not just a museum. Please respect it as such. The building is just extraordinary and perhaps the height of medieval architecture. The stained glass windows are world renowned and beyond description, the rose window is emulated in many churches. It is a privilege to be allowed to stay during the service, to hear the music and listen to the service. Way past impressive. Everyone needs to see it at least once.
Breath taking view from this Masterpiece. In ore of a mastery of architecture, craftsmen, artists .. skills to be truly admired & appreciated. Thankyou

Nothing to see inside the cathedral. The exterior of the cathedral looks magnificent, with all the reliefs, gargoyles and ornaments. However, the interior is nothing special. It's free of charge to enter the cathedral, but if you walk inside you will find it just like any average church in Europe. There's little to see. Spending 2 minutes inside is enough.

Pleasantly Surprised. I wasn't sure exactly how this place would be, but it surpassed my expectations.From the outside, there was a daunting line to get in; however, this line moved very quickly (I spent around 10 minutes there). Once you get inside, there are audioguides that can be purchased and candles that can be lit in memory of loved ones (although a donation is recommended for this). There is plenty of history to read about and plenty of architecture to take in. Photos are allowed, as long as the flash is off. The church is big enough to spend a good amount of time there. This is a location worth visiting.

Breathtaking!. We actually came here in 2014 the month of October... Beautiful architecture that withstood time and maintained it's integrity . The inside is as impressive as the outside, serene and sacred. I lit a candle and said a prayer for my father who just passed away in the Philippines, a day before we arrive in Paris . It will always have a soft spot in my heart forever......

In Awe. A wonderful day walking along the Seine and in the Latin Quarter with its relaxed atmosphere watching the world go by. Finished by a trip to this remarkable building. Amazing to see the architecture and how the building developed over the years. Didn't get a chance to climb the stairs to the top. Long queues can develop quite quickly so need to get there early. Have to pay for this part although free entrance to the main building. Must come back.
Iconic. This is the cathedral all others are compared to, take the time to wait in line and go up top to hang out with the gargoyles (and chimeras) and see the bell.

Went for gregorian service on Sunday at 10. I would rather we just made a walk through tour during the service to get the feel or essence of the tour. Felt a little bored/obligated to stay seated for 1 hour for a French/Latin service. Was beautiful and enjoyed walking to the flower market and Ile St Louis afterwards.

Attended Father's Day Mass -- Beautiful. Attended the Father's Day Mass in June 2016. Great service held by the Archbishop of Paris. Although in the French language, was a moving experience. A must see to look around the cathedral and try to attend a mass as well.

Beautiful . We wondered in to the Cathedral during Sunday mass. It was bizarre to see mass going on as hundreds of tourists made their way around the outer edges. This is a truly beautiful church and it was a very pleasant visit. Entry was free but we left the recommended donations to light two candles. We wanted to go up to the top but the July queue was enormous so we didn't bother.

My favorite spot in Paris. Norte Dame is truly an amazing Gothic feat. Every time I enter this magnificent cathedral I am enthralled by its beauty yet out of this world simplicity. It is like a sleeping giant ready to whisk you away into an astonishing trance. On a practical note, entrance is free. And be sure to visit the gardens in the back. Also, there are very clean toilets in the gardens. The view from the towers is worth the entrance fee to go up to the towers. And of course, you can imagine Quasimoto from the Hunchback of Notre Dame ringing the bells from right up on top.

THE Notre Dame Cathedral. Make sure for the full experience you plan your visit when there are services going on as you will get the privilege of hearing the choir and organist run through a selection of songs. If you don't want to pay the €5 for a candle to burn, people leave the tops to them all over the place and it is a nice souvenir for no cost to you. Beautiful piece of architecture, history, and pop culture all in one magnificent venue.

Mass and Communion was the highlight of my trip. Even though it was all spoken in French and I understand none, the spiritual feeling was overwhelming. We really enjoyed this tour. I would strongly recommend getting the audio tour. Much is missed without.

Beautiful and impressive. You can visit for free or take guided tours (which I never did, so can't comment on those). For me it's about the awe-inspiring effort and achievement of people centuries ago. There was also a mini exhibition on the side of the altar area, on the different stages of construction. Like all religious sites I find it important to show respect by dressing and behaving appropriately.
unique!. It is the most wonderful moment when inside we can enjoy the wonderful songsthousands of tourists step into hoping that they will be held to admire the church's inner beauty.Free entry
Architectural master piece. Wonderful monument and a must watch when in Paris. Has withstood the test of time and still stands shining brilliantly.

Perfection in Paris.. Simply a perfect Parisian experience. I absolutely love this building, the architecture and history are mind blowing. Just stand in front of this cathedral and bask in all of its glory. There is not one inch of this place that does not hold your full attention. Don't rush through and if you have time, go more than once. The outside appearance changes as the sun rises and falls. Breathtaking.

Beautiful. This church was amazing to see, experience! We did a tour with a guide, learned so much of the history of this place. The stairs to top were tough and very tight- don't do if you are cloister phobic .

Breathtaking. It is free to go in. The line looked really long when we got there but we only waited about 15 minutes. The inside is stunning and much bigger than I anticipated. I would try and go when they do mass.

Notre Dame Cathedral. For those who loved to see churches, this one is also sightly. The inside is fascinatingly set up with appealing intricate church ornate around. This is considered to be one of the largest and most well-known church buildings in the world.

Read the wiki page on this. Evidently it was used for food storage during the revolution. A lot of the artifacts were stolen or destroyed during that time also.Now it mostly functions as a tourist attraction. Lines are long! I'm not very religious so I don't know much about that part. The stained glass is pretty spectacular I can say that. Plenty of candle vending machines you can put those pesky euros into.

Being Catholic, this was a must for me. . I planed the trip so that we would be in Paris on a Sunday, so we could attend the 11:30am international mass. It did not disappoint. There was a long line in the front when we arrived, but that was the line for the tour. We walked straight in for mass. The only surprise was that during mass you could see the tourists walking around and taking pictures. Very different than most churches that don't even allow pictures inside let alone during mass. Make sure to walk around the whole outside of the church. It's beautiful inside and out and all around.

Beautiful . Very beautiful and peaceful church.lots of history to know and how it was built over the years. We went ona sunday and we are not Christians but it was soo peaceful. We couldn't understood the prayers ad they were singing them in french but still peaceful.

Notre Dame - c'est si bonne.. I love Notre Dame, the Rose Window thrills me silly. It is exquisite. Our last visit was on our wedding anniversary, which was also the Feast of the Annunciation. The service was chokingly wonderful, but my sons were amazed when it was over and they were kissed in turn by nuns.A photo of me offering a Votive candle shows tears streaming down my face. Say no more.

Wow. Just plain wow.. *Note: If you are aiming for the towers, head to the left part of the cathedral straight and queue up. Its a totally different entrance. We won't need to queue up that long for the main building and it was wow. Amazing. We were there when there was a wedding going on and the bells were ringing which made it even more amazing. The view from the top was great too. The sculptures, the gargoyles were just wow.
Get a guide if you can. My second visit but first with a guide. What a masterpiece and access is free! Walk around the outside too, it's also fascinating.

Spectacular Cathedral. O.k. so we had to queue for a while to get in but once in it seems worth the wait, I'd recommend getting there early especially if it's warm outside.You can climb the tower if you want but we chose not to, although people said its worth the climb.Peaceful inside, the declaration and detail inside is spectacular.A must see in Paris
Sacred. Part of the Parisian trip. Very sacred and reverent. Felt like I was transformed to the era. Though the cathedral was packed you could feel the history walking through the halls.

Magnificent . The cathedral and grounds are lovely! It is truly magnificent and a special cathedral. We visited on a Sunday during preparation for an ordination mass, and it was special to see the clergy in preparation. We didn't have to wait long to enter, although the crowds were thick inside. The kids like the gardens and playground around the cathedral.

Nice History. It is a nice place to visit but if you are looking for one of the grand cathedrals of Europe, this does not match the many cathedrals we have seen in Spain, Malta or others. We would have liked to do the walk around the top but it closes very early. Please be aware that even though the attraction is open until 5p, they close the entrance down early depending on the size of the line. They gauge the length of the line and stop allowing people to even line up well in advance. We arrived just before 3 pm and were denied entrance because the line was too long already.

Beautiful history . Waited in line for twenty minutes was worth itSo quiet so beautiful a French treasureUnbelievable big and ornate A must see in Paris Try to go early in morning or late in afternoon will miss lines

Quite crowded, though people respectful. This is a stunning cathedral with the expected beautiful stained glass and flying buttresses, etc. The one thing that bothered me was the shop inside the actual cathedral, where they were selling items. Couldn't the shop be an annex to the cathedral, somewhat separate from where people actually worship? This detracted from the spiritual atmosphere one expects of a structure like this.

Amazing church. Second time to be here. It is a nice church to visit. Just looking from outside because of long queue. Going around the church to see how beautiful it is. I stood contemplating for many hours.

yes you are going here. Everyone goes to Notre Dame. It is a spectacular place to visit and yes it will be full of tourists but you will be happy you went. Now I do want to warn you about a few things. First the tour buses and groups all show up about 9 am and will continue to do so all morning until right around noon or 14:00. So go around 8 am or in the afternoon unless you love huge crowds and lines. Second, if going up in the belfry is on your list of things to do well do so. You are going to stand in line a bit and pay for the privilege but be my guest. Be warned - those bells there are not for decoration, About every 15 minutes they ring for a set duration which depends on the time of day and time of the hour. THEY ARE LOUD. It will not be pleasant.Walk around to the back of the church on the outside and enjoy the view on the Seine as well as of the architecture on the church.When you are done go to Ste Chapelle and La Conciergerie. They are an easy walk
Nice to visit, but crowded.. If you want to go in the Notre Dame...prepare for a BIG waitingline. Nice spot to chill, people are often preforming or drawing.

Magnificent. The cathedral is beautiful and while queuing provides innumerable photo opportunities. The visit to the tower starts from the left side of the building. Expect quite some time on line. The line is admitted in batches of about 30 people because of the narrow stairs and corridors on the tower top. The view from the top is very nice, especially if you come here before going on the Tour Eiffel.
Wonderful. Wonderful church. A bit of a queue, but not too bad. And you can still feel rather like you are in a house of worship.

Stunning, An Iconic Landmark. The Notre Dame Cathedral was breathtaking. For years we have seen it portrayed in stories, movies, video games, etc., but seeing it in person is better than you can imagine! Lines can be a bit lengthy, but move rather quickly. Entry to the Cathedral is free, though certain features like the treasury and towers cost a small fee. The museum pass will enable you to climb to the tower. (The lines were too long for us to utilize our pass, but we definitely plan on visiting again on our next trip to Paris)

Climb to the top!. We read alot of guide books that said "not worth the climbs with the long lines". We got to Notre Dame at 9 am. There was no line to get in the church, and there was a short line to get to the top. They only let a few people up at a time, so it will not be crowded at the top. The price and wait are worth it. It may not be best for small children, or for people unable to climb the stairs.
Gorgeous. No go on the queue to the tower. I don't do 500 ppl queues. Sunday mass was super cool though - for about 15 minutes.

Very beautiful and peaceful . Don't be put off by the queue at the front, we joined it at 100ft long and got in within 5 minutes. The tower tours (from the side of the building) have a larger and slower queue (and is ticketed with a charge). Entrance is free so well worth a look at a beautiful place and they still host services several times a day.
One of the world's finest cathedrals! . A visit to Notre Dame is a must on a visit to Paris. Read up on the history and take a guided tour to gain most from a trip to the cathedral.

Beautiful . We had a private tour guide for the morning and he gave us the whole history of the place. Political. Spiritual. Engineering/structural. The windows are beautiful. Entrance is free but drop a donation so they can maintain it.

Read its history!. Its interesting how this cathedral needed hundreds of years and countless renovations to get to its present glory. Read its history and get a glimpse behind the beauty of Notre Dame.

Impressive architecture. A very impressive Gothic cathedral. Admission is free to get into the cathedral. It is an active church, so if you're there at the right time there might be service or a choir performing. Certain areas are reserved for those who wish to pray and photos in these parts are not allowed.For an additional five euros you can go into an exhibition of the treasures. These were all in French, but appeared to be relics from bishops and other religious figures who have been ordained saints. If you go outside there is a line to climb the towers. When we went, the line to get up was a few hours long, so we didn't climb the tower. It is probably advisable to go early if you wish to climb the tower.

Amazing. This amazing building with all of its history and literary connection is an awesome inspiring place to visit. The architecture would be a challenge for modern building methods and blows your mind to think they started to build it 900 years ago- and it's free!
Wonderful!. Always grand entrance. It is impressive to see the towering ceiling. The edifice is awe inspiring and you can feel the history of the place once inside. Opens early. Worth the trip.

Amazing cathedral in an amazing location. Notre Dame is probably so popular not only because if the majesty of the building itself, but due to its really prime location. If you're in a hurry and need to see a little of everything, I recommend ND as your token cathedral.

Almost too much to take in!. It's hard to put into words - the beauty, the magnitude, the craftsmanship - it is overwhelming. Every single little detail exquisite...the lines may seem intimidating, but they do move along and so worth it both for the cathedral and the tower climb.

As you would expect. We visited Christmas week and it was lovely with the atmosphere and special nativity etc. Sad that so commercial onside with every opportunity used to sell you something vaguely related to the place...A shame really as it's a place of worship first and foremost
Amazing place. It's a Must See when you are in Paris! Historical place, with a incredible atmosphere and amazing views.
A religious experience . If anyone asked me to describe Notre Dame Cathedral in one word, I would have to say: "WOW." It os magnificent, gorgeous, peaceful, an architectural masterpiece!

School choir in song. Lovely, free activity. You can give a donation if you like, to assist with upkeep and maintenance. We were lucky enough to have school children singing there on a Friday. The accoustics in the church are fabulous! Light a candle for the dearly departed by donating a small sum. Amazing place with beautiful spacious surrounds. Not cramped like Sacre Coeur!

Great views, lengthy wait.. Entered the Cathederal at Notre Dame relatively swiftly, stunning architecture and spectacular stained glass windows. Joined the end of the queue for the trip up the towers, took just over a hour to get to the front, but the views across the city made the wait well worth it, even after the 400 or so steps to get there.
Picturesque. Lovely structure. Took the young kids to see it. Didn't spend long there. Has been years since I had been. Absolutely stunning

Worth to come back . Beautiful cathedral... I understand it why Victor Hugo could love this place and explain it in his novels. Just be careful on this square. A lots of pickpockets are around here!!!

Wow, what a Cathedral!. Don't go for skip the lines tours. We got inside in less than 5 mins. We had the pleasure to watch mass. And so much to explore! Don't miss the treasury room! The towers and grounds... This is a wonderful place to see architecture at it's finest. To see the history of christian religion in one place.

Lovely building. There was a mass going on when I visited so I refrained from taking many pictures but they have stations with artifact of the church and history around the outskirts of the pillars. Gorgeous architecture. Get there early if you can to avoid crowds and heat (no a/c). Oh there are full restrooms available outside the church, a few yards away incase that's helpful.
Get the Paris pass. Amazing cathedral. I'm not even Catholic. Long line to get in but it moves quickly. Beautiful architecture.

Go to the travelers Mass. They have services on Sunday morning for people who don't speak French. I loved it. It's one thing to look around the cathedral, it's quite another to see the services there. I also recommend climbing to the top to see the gargoyles. Well worth the price, wait, and sore legs.

Did not even go inside!. But we should have. Maybe. We visited the grounds several times and were just blown away by the whole thing. Awe inspiring. This building will live in my heart and mind forever.
Impressive. This cathedral is very impressive from outside and in. It is also free to get in but have to pay if you want to go up to the top. I would defiantly recommend going to see this place.
Amazing Place. My husband and I visited during our trip to Europe, and had mass during the visit, as well. It is a beautiful structure, and I loved being there in person, finally.

Beautiful. An amazing cathedral with an astounding history. Entrance is free. There are long queues outside but they move very quickly. I reckon we took about 10 minutes to get in. We were very lucky to have a superb guided tour in English with a volunteer guide. For free! Our guide was an American lady living in Paris, and she was excellent. Her name is Michela, if I remember correctly. The participants were called to meet under the organ balcony at 14:30. The tour was open to anyone. The visit was a highlight of my trip to Paris with my wife and young daughter.
The great cathedral. Go about 9 a.m and listen to the bells toll. What a great treat. Of course, seeing this iconic cathedral is a treat anytime of day or night.
Note Dame. I don't know much about architect but you can not resist not to pay tribute to this masterpiece.The visit in for free.
Beautiful cathedral. We did the tour and the cathedral. Very beautiful. The tour is close to 400 spiral steps but offers fabulous views of the city.

Must See. This site, like the Eiffel Tower, is a must see for anybody visiting Paris. The line to enter is long but the wait is worth it. The Cathedral has amazing stained glass and carvings and one can spend time just admiring the delicate work done.

Heading to the Latin Quarter for dinner in the fog our bus stopped and I was one of the last getting off.. Because I was one of the last off the bus, and the fog so thick, I had no idea I was alongside Notre Dame. A couple, with their little girl from the bus indicated when I told them that the last Mass was at 9 p.m. to join me. We went inside and I walked all around and wept at the fact that I had finally gotten to see the inside and the wonderful glass windows and the fretwork. It was amazing.
Spectacular . Incredible display of architecture for someone ambivalent to the religious component of the building. Long line but moved quickly. Would visit again
Notre Dame a Must visit if you are in Paris.. Unbelievable Architecture a must see and right next door some of the best places to eat in the whole city.

Long lines that really quickly. A magnificent architecture, with many, many special artifacts. Although a long line of people to go in, took less than 5 minutes. Inside enormous and easy to get around. Well laid out explanatory notes on almost everything. Spectacular.
Must see!. 20 minute detour so if you're in the area then its simply unmissable.The queue's outside tend to be longer than the amount of time you spend inside. Very elegant cathedral nevertheless.

Amazing ..... Took my breath away!. Probably the highlight of our visit to Paris! Done it before but never get enough of it! The silence and ambience drags you into another world! I didn't realise the impact it had in me personally!

Fascinating history.. We used a tour guide who was excellent and told us so much about the construction of the Church and its history. We did the skip the line tour to climb the tower. Wow, what a view.

Beautiful views from the top. I thought the Eiffle Tower views were beautiful, but after climbing up 400+ steps we saw even more amazing views of Paris. The stairs and the alleyways are narrow at Notre Dame so beware, but it's all worth it. The gargoyles are so cool! Pray that you get a slight bit of rain because it's awesome to see them in action. (They help drain). This is a great attraction for views and exercise haha! Going inside the main floor is free but climbing to the bell tower is not. The bells were cool. The views were more interesting.

Amazing architecture. Notre Dame is a beautiful cathedral that is awe inspiring. The stain glass is incredible as well as the ceilings and stone work. People can sit in the pews or go to confession with priests that are multilingual. There is a lot of history and beauty to take in.It is free to enter the cathedral; however, the tour of the dome has a charge. Notre Dame is in an area nice for walking around, eating, or souvenir shopping. Also, convenient to the metro and buses.
Beautiful. Every corner has so many details that is even difficult too se it all. Amazing to even think that it's been there for so many years.

Plan extra time. There is SO MUCH to see! I recommend a recorded tour, you can take your time looking at things. Don't forget the gargoyles! That's a long line, and a LOT of stairs, but worth every step!

What's Not To Love?. Serious history, beautiful architecture, and some nourishment for the soul, if you're into that. This church makes St Patrick's in NY look like a quaint chapel. Considering it was built in the 1100's and has a 13 ton bell installed in the 1600's, it's amazing there aren't more hunchbacked skeletons buried nearby.
Land mark. When you are in Paris it is not possible to ignore this attraction .It is crowded with tourist of all nationallities
Awesome. Great architecture and nice views from outside.above the door outside. Be prepared for the crowds as well!

Can not miss.. Beautiful Cathedral in the middle of Paris. While the stain glass isn't as lovely as the nearby Sainte Chapelle, the sheer size of Notre Dame is impressive. Note the flying buttresses and the stories carved above the 3 main doors.On the side, you may purchase tickets (included on Paris Museum pass), to ascend the Towers. After a long and claustrophobic climb, you are treated with a great view of Paris and up close and personal views of the gargoyles.

Beautiful church, amazing concerts. Was fortunate to have enjoyed the church while watching one of the best concerts I've ever attended. It featured early music by Notre-Dame composers as performed by the Notre-Dame choir and ensemble with its more-than-a-thousand-year tradition. Unbelievable experience. Do your best to attend a concert!

spiritually uplifting. The Cathedral was built in the 1200s and has many side altars and displays to view. You can be there while Mass is being held as that is in a roped off area. You are asked to be quiet during your visit. We were there when the Gregorian Mass was held and to hear the music and Latin was amazing. If you closed your eyes you could imagine being transported to the Middle Ages. If front of the cathedral is a marker that is the "Center of France" All boundary measurements come from this spot. There is also a statue of Charlemagne in the front square. You can pay a fee and climb up the stairs to the bell towers for the city view.

A must see. If you're planning a trip to Paris, consider Notre Dame a must see. Besides the gorgeous architecture, there's an indescribable feeling when you step inside. For those who appreciate history, I would also suggest the Archaeological Crypt. It is much less crowded than the towers and contains the ruins of early Paris. And don't forget to find Point Zero, the literal center of France from which all distances are measured.

Very moving. To be at Notre Dame was indeed an emotional experience. Well worth standing in line to be let in. Just watch the beggars approaching you rattling their cups and pleading for money. The cathedral is an absolute wonder.

Organ concert in Notre Dame. My husband and I have toured Notre Dame several times and it is always a highlight of a Paris visit. We attended an organ concert during our last trip and it was amazing. If you have a chance to visit on such occasion don't miss it.
Beautiful. It's free to get in, just please respect the place. Some people were talking loud while a service was going on.

beautiful. This is a must see in Paris. It's much better organised than any where else in Paris and whilst it was very busy it didn't feel it. I felt welcome and un-rushed and there didn't seem to be anyone trying to rip off the tourists which is the scourge of every where I visited.The cathedral itself is amazing - so beautiful and serene - I can't recommend it highly enough.

Architectural beauty and amazing history. Having been to Notre Dame pre kids it was time to show them one of the majestic beauties of Paris. Whilst a mass was being conducted in French you were able to walk around and see the magnificent structure from the inside. Amazing stain glass windows, statues and history surrounding the Cathedral. Well worth a visit.

Just wow. This place is absolutely gorgeous! It was so cool to be able to go inside and admire it's beauty! One thing that I did that I absolutely recommend is lighting an offering candle. It's only a couple of Euros, but it was a really nice experience. Be careful of the various scammers near Notre Dame because they are everywhere!

Beautiful & Amazing!. Visited in October 2014. One of the stops during our private tour around Paris. So beautiful..I just wished we were able to have spent a longer time in this beauty. Another must see!!
If ever there was a movie set cathedral, this is it!. Artfully lit, clean and just as a proper cathedral should be, with mysteries, a history, overwhelming scope.

An awesome church with a long history . We briefly visited the NOTRE Dame Cathedral. It is huge with beautiful stained glass windows. It has many small private chapels along the outer sidesDown the center there is a huge long carving of the story of Jesus. It goes up one side & down the other. There is also supposed to be a part of Jesus CROWNE Of Thorns off to the side of the main areaA very impressive Church

A stunning gothic cathedral marred by queues. Notre Dame is a wonder to see- something that I feel is a must for any cultural visit to Europe. The entrance is free and the cathedral is vast, filled with Catholic iconography and decor and beautiful to behold.Like most things in Paris, you'll be queuing for an hour to get in. Security involves a glance into your bag. The long queues that result mar the experience, sadly.
Excellent Notre Dame Cathedral. One of the most visiting place of Paris. So many people every year come to visit and to have ancient time'S feelings.
Visit on a Sunday Morning. Notre Dame is a beautiful cathedral. We visited on a Sunday morning during mass, and that made the visit even more memorable!

Something else. Visited this great cathedral for the second time recently.It is a terrific place both inside and out. Expect large queues between mid day and the afternoon, but it is well worth it. The climb up to the towers is neither for the unfit or those with a fear of heights, although the views when you get up there are tremendous.

A Paris Icon.. If you go to Paris this is one of those places you need see.I've been to Paris quite often and this is an iconic spot. The whole area is special.Tours are on the go regularly. You'll get a real feel for the religion, politics and power plays of French history. If you go early you'll avoid the queues to get into the church.Get some local food and relax in beautiful the garden at the back on the banks of the Seine...wonderful.

beautiful. There was a queue the morning we arrived but the wait was only 15 minutes. The inside is stunning and there is lots of information on the history of the building. Set aside an hour to complete the visit
Amazing in Paris. This name, you've been heard from stories even when you were young. You'd better go and give it a visit for sure.
Very Beautiful . The Notre Dame Cathedral was really impressive from the architecture to the Stained glass. We enjoyed our tour. So much history that I was unaware of. A must see.

A MUST see when in Paris!. I really do love this church. This was my third visit in my life time and it never gets old. It is a beautiful church in a beautiful location and makes you feel at peace when you are inside. The line to get in is usually long but it moves very fast so don't be intimidated. The line to climb to the top can be over an hour if you come in the late morning and throughout the afternoon so plan accordingly! Lots of great restaurants and shopping streets around the area so do a little research ahead of time and you can make a great day out of your time spent in this part of Paris (the Pantheon and Luxemburge Gardens are very, very close!).

Good, but not the best Notre Dame Cathedral I've visited. Big impressive church but I really enjoyed Notre Dame - Montreal much more. The outside of the building is really more interesting than the inside with the flying buttresses and sculptures on the outside entrances walls. The inside of the cathedral was plain in comparison to Montreal.
Just remarkable. The cathedral was spectacular and if I was in Paris a little longer I would have liked to do mass there. The history is just astounding.
A Must See!. I can't imagine visiting Paris and not visiting Notre Dame. It is so beautiful inside and out and doesn't take much time. Go early to avoid the line!

Do the tower too!. Famous catherdral! Loved the art work, especially the Gospel scenes (painted on wood). By design, you can feel a sense of the sacred, or just of quite. A respite from the hustle and bustle of Paris. Doing the tower, to see the gargoyles up close, and the views of Paris are worth the extra €8.5, although of you do the Paris Museum pass it's included. Whether a person of faith, history, a photography, this is a must stop on your trip to the City of Lights
Impressive. One of the most iconic places in Paris. Notre Dame Cathedral is a beautiful cathedral and a must on anyone's list traveling to Paris.
super. Anice place to visit with lovely windows and architecture.The best is when it has churchgoing. It is something you will remember.If you car go on with the stairs ( 422almost )

Traditional Sight of Paris. There was a long line to get into the main Cathedral which moved very quickly. There was a mass going on during our visit, but it added to the overall experience. Unfortunately the line to climb up to the towers was down the block and very long.

Extraordinary!!. As a Christian and a tourist and a traveler this Cathedral means a lot to me by its interior and exterior design full of greatness and luxury and history!! Not to visit Paris without seeing Notre Dame Cathedral.

Well worth the walk around. Hubby and i kept going back to this Church bringing different friends to see it within the same trip. It is definitely a breath-taking cathedral. The outside alone will amaze you. i suggest seeing it once in the day and once at night

Truly Beautiful. The line will be long most likely, but a view of the rose window will make you forget all about that. The history of this building is incredible. Take in the beauty and take time to read the signs and information as you walk around. Take time to sit for a minute and take it all in. It won't take long to go through if you are in a hurry, and there are many things to eat and see around the Cathedral when you are done.On your way out, check for any upcoming concerts that may be happening. An organ recital, or a Bach Mass may just be the best thing you experience in Paris.

Beautiful!. The church is amazing inside a great representation of architecture and how the cathedral has grown over time. Although the line looks daunting it moves exceptionally quick! I would highly recommend going up into the towers for great views of not only the whole city but close up of the Gothic architectural details.
Breathtaking.. Located right off the river Siene. The gargoyles will captivate you. Inside is undescribably beautiful. Must do in Paris.

Spectacular. Majestic cathedral and must seen in Paris. One of the most popular buildings in Europe. You can go inside, but only until 18:45 pm, inside there is quiet and peaceful, even during the mess.

A beautiful experience. I'm not very (at all) religious, but I do love history so while in Paris we visited the Notre Dame Cathedral. The line up for entry was reall long...just like everything else in Paris, but the experience was very good. Instead of waiting in line all day we kept walking by and stepped in line when it seemed to be at its shortest. The staff were quite rude, but we ... There's no excuse, they were rude, but the cathedral was beautiful. I recommend this attraction if you are in Paris.
Fantastic. free attraction, lovely windows and architecture. worth waiting in the quew for and there is tours available for a small fee
Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful Cathedral in centre of Paris with a beautiful facade. Inside is silent with a really great serene and peaceful feel to it.Love visiting here.
Fun but closes early. Aside the large queues, it was a great experience, bad part is that it closes at 6 p.m along with most parisian museums
Beautiful!!. Absolutely loved walking around this building. We didn't have the time to wonder inside, but I recommend everyone to visit this building!
Do not miss this!. We used Rick Steves free phone app and toured the cathedral listening to all of the information. The views and history is simply astounding - too good to pass up.

Visiting Notre Dame. Visited and went in the church 2-3 times. Either be really quiet during mass or schedule your visit outside church service.
Make sure to go up on the bell tower if you can. Get there early to wait in line and plan on waking up 435 steps and down 365
Out of this world. A truly beautiful experience , really worth a visit , free as well unless yo choose to go up the tower..its an amazing place to visit

Seriously, they built this in the 1200's?!?. The chapel is mind-blowing when you walk in. How they were able to plan and build this with the tools they had at the time is beyond me. Make sure you go up the tower and touch the gargoyles and take in the view. It's a once-in-a-lifeitme experience.

Beautiful cathedral!. We visited twice, once in the evening from outside to take photos and once in the morning. We had a Museum Pass, but we're told it's free to enter inside the cathedral, but to visit the towers you've to have a ticket. We didn't get a chance to do that as the lineup was extremely long, line going around the cathedral. So if it's something you interested in doing get there early and be patient. The cathedral architecture and it's decorative windows are beautiful. Also, if you'd like to see the Treasury inside, the pass doesn't cover that and you've to buy separate ticket.

Spectacular!. Notre-Dame Cathedral is one of Paris' top sights and attracts crowds which correspond to this status! You will find two queues here - one in front of the cathedral and along it's left side as you face it. The queue at the front of the cathedral is for entry to the inside. It takes about 5mins to get to the top of this queue and entry is free! The second queue is to climb to the top of the towers. We spent about an hour queuing here but the wait is worth it! The view from the top and the close ups with the gargoyles are worth the wait!

Wonderful, it's a shame the long line to climb. Wonderful , stunning , spectacular. It's a shame the long line to climb the tower, we had very hot and the line was not moving and we had to give up after a long time. I would loved to climb. Otherwise it is beautiful inside, takes your breath away , the windows are a vision and is very well preserved considering it was built over 800 years ago
Incredible!. Wonderful experience. I definitely recommend going early because the lineup can get long. The climb up to the top of the cathedral is a must, you can't beat those views
Be prepared to queue all day. We queued for hours to up the tower. It is worth a wait, but not nearly 4 hours. Best go in the off season or get there seriously early!!
Beautiful. Astounding architecture. Everything I thought it would be. Many churches in Paris, but this is a must see.

Easy. Well, Notre Dame has two tickets (also 2 for 1 eurostar offer does not work here we tried):1 12 euros - for the first floor( 3-4 min waiting time)2. 8 euros additional for the second floor(much longer line up 20-40 min)Inside is the usual church with scupltures, frescas, coffins, benches, dark atmosphere, hundreds of people snapping photos of everything- usual stufIt takes about 1 hour inside if you are very slowThe attraction is MUCH nicer from outside, picturesque and has garden at the back where many people lay down on benches romantically hugging and kissing each other, drinking water, juicesLocation wise: CENTER, accessible by subway/metro
Impressive. Another must see item in Paris. Recommend using the audio tour as the building has many stories to be told. As with most museums and locations in Paris, children are admitted free

One of the most amazing cathedrals i have ever seen. This was a beautiful place. The cathedral is so big and massive it gives you the feeling that you are very small in it. It has a full history vibe, I strongly recomand to pay to go in the treasure hall. Also the line outside it goes very fast.I also recomand to pay to go to the top it has a very nice view.
