The line is about 45 min but it is worth it.

chef d'oeuvre from middle ages. The cathedral is wonderful specially in sunny days. Lot to see for free plus the treasury for few euros (incredible pieces of art). It is quiet unless you talk. Do not miss the explanations on the vitrails (glass)..
One word - Magnificient!. Huge & magnificent are the only words for this church.. Very beautiful & peaceful place..Lots of paintings on the wall.. But please take care of timings before visiting !!!

Not to be missed.. This is one of the most famous Cathedrals in the world,it was a great feeling when I first saw it.This is our third trip to Paris and we always visit it ,it is a marvelous piece of architecture,inside and out weather your religious or not.You can climb to the tower for a small fee but it can get busy and the top can get packed out,making it difficult to take decent photos. Its not just the Cathedral but the surrounding area that always has something going on.In the front you have street performers ranging from buskers to fire eaters its also a place people just like to come to hang around.It is on an island in the river Seine and there's always people sitting on the banks in little groups just chatting away.From the front of the Cathedral you can walk down the left side to the rear and get some good photos.Also you will come to a bridge (blocked to cars) which cross's over to another island.You will find groups of people sitting on the bridge listening to what ever musicians are playing (this was in the summer) .There are several outdoor cafe's in the area.We tend to end our day in this area because there's always something going on.

Into the book!. I remember when I was a child I was wathcing the movies based on the novel of Victor Hugo - "The Hunchback of Notre-Dame". There's some kind of magnificence I felt there. You can enter the building and see it from incide but also you can go to on the top of the roof - there are stairs at the back side of the building - vary steep stairway! But it worth!

Just as beautiful as the pictures seem. It's a beautiful cathedral next to the seine and is just a picturesque shot all together.Always filled with tourists but you can go to mass too. The inside is breath taking and a bit cold so do take a jacket.
Nice. I suggest to everyone to visit the famous Notre Dame Cathedral. Sometimes there is a lot of crowd but it is worth to wait a little bit to enter it

A must for any visit in Paris . Centrally located, Notre Dame must be seen by any tourist of any religion while in Paris. The architecture and details are magnificent. The visit can be short or you can spend an entire day checking all the different areas and artifacts exposed. Some areas require a fee to enter. You may even catch a mass in process (hours available on line).

recommended to visit, especially during mass!. A fantastic "sight" in Paris. I happened upon a mass when I visited, which was wonderful as I am a fan of choir songs. The lady singing had an amazing vocal. I remember opting to sit with the religious folk in the front, just so I could hear her better. The interior is magnificent, as in most cathedrals, and interestingly enough, the people walking around are not annoying. I do not believe in taking photos in places of worship, though the exterior is really quite interesting and deserves good photographs! There are usually crowds both in and out the cathedral, unless it's a rainy day. I was off-season so it wasn't too bad, especially inside. All in all, I recommend visiting it! Actually, don't miss out on it.

So beautiful!. A beautiful cathedral with spectacular views from the top. Take the narrow stairs all the way to the top. You still stop of the middle level where you can see the bell room and get a decent view, but continue up. It is worth it!

Beautiful historic and spiritual site. A beautiful historic and spiritual site! Just be prepared to queue up for a little bit. Handy to have an umbrella in the summer or a hat since there is no shade when lining up.
Absolutely beautiful. I found this cathedral amazing, something about the stained glass and history that really took me back in time.
Still worth a visit. Still worth a visit - must be the 8th time to Paris and still a beautiful place to relax and marvel at the Cathedral

Love 💘 . This was one of my favorite places in Paris. The architecture is really different than most of the other cathedrals we saw in Europe. It wasn't the biggest or the grandest but very unique. I really wanted to climb to the top and take a picture of the view with a gargoyle but wasn't feeling well that day. Do it for me! Make sure you walk all the way around the building. It looks like a completely different building from the opposite sides. It has a pretty garden and is next to the siene river. We saw out in the day, then went back for a concert that night, it was awesome! The acoustics in those cathedrals are amazing!
Beautiful. Queued up for less than ten minutes to get access to Notre Dam Cathedral and was so glad we went. Fantastic place to visit and free entry,

You have to go. There are other Notre Dame Cathedrals In France that are more visually stunning (Notre Dame de Fourviere in Lyon for instance) but this is THE Notre Dame Cathedral. The sheer size and history of the Cathedral make it a must see while in Paris.
Surreal place to visit. Although not a religious person I always feel comforted visiting here. This visit I wanted to light some candles in memory of those important to me.
Tremendous architecture. Beautiful cathedral, well worth a visit. Didn't do the tour around the top as there were long queues, but plenty to see inside. Truly amazing the time span to complete.
Beautiful. Great building a lot of history a large line to come in so If you have patient and time you could do it if not you can be outside and take nice pictures

Beautiful Cathedral! . A true treasure in the world. Amazing Cathedral just outside Paris. Short train trip & easy walk. Free entry in a long line than moves quickly. Long line along the side of the cathedral is for tours - 25 people go thru tours every 10 minutes. Wish I did a tour

Tourist trap. We took the audio tour, it was just ok. Seemed like every time you turned around there were signs advising how many euro it is to light a candle, seemed more visible than other cathedrals. Thought it was a church, not Disney World. So while you are trying to enjoy the scenery they have an obnoxious tape they play every few minutes saying quite loudly "shh, be quiet" in every language. Just tacky. Westminster Abbey in London was a pure delight compared to this. Would not recommend.

C'est magnifique!. We loved the architecture and the interior. A Catholic mass was taking place while we were there. The construction and design are a mixture of spirituality and magnificence. Must visit.
Nice place on a nice island. Familiar building from the Disney movie. The catedral was beautiful inside. Be prepared to wait hours in the line of you want to the top.

A must see!!. Norte Dame beautiful' peaceful and serene no matter how many times you view it.Sometimes you may get lucky and a choir will be singing other times a mass. Be quiet and be aware of your surroundings.The church is free and you can show bare shoulders - you will just need to remove your hat if your wearing one.Bring a few dollars or euros to light a candle and say a prayer:)There is a part of the tour that will charge as well as you can climb the towers which we didn't but is recommended.

Breathtaking!. So much to see and contemplate in this ornate cathedral, from the stained glass, sculptures and artwork inside, to the architectural features, gardens and various statues outside. My 9 year old daughter and I were awed and inspired. This is a "can't miss" for any trip to Paris.
Beautiful.. We unintentionally ended up a Sunday Mass and it was really lovely. A beautiful church, inside and out.

Cathedral builders. Inspiring construction and amazing detail, beautiful glass. Visit to the belfry and the huge bells is impressive. But bring some patience, you queue for entry: groups of about 25 people every 10-15 min, then another wait to visit the top of the tower.

One of the most spiritual places on earth. I love this cathedral. Last visit we were fortunate enough to hear an organ concert. What an incredible experience! It was as if the sound came directly out of the stones of the building. If you are in Paris, you shouldn't miss the opportunity to visit Notre Dame Cathedral. Find out when there is a concert that can be attended. Also walk aroubnf the cathedral, there are many things to see. But PLEASE BE RESPECTFUL of its history and other visitors.
Another piece of great architecture and history.. Its good to stop by and have a look and this grand piece of art. Crowded on holidays, best to go on a weekday.

Great area to enjoy Paris. I must have been to Notre Dame for half a dozen times in our 6-day trip. This is the area you can enjoy rich history and modern life, arts and fine cuisine, tranquility and crowd-please performance, ever-flowing Seine and up-and-down sun, Shakespeare bookstore, new wed photo-taking, ...
Extraordinary. This was the most amazing cathedral we have seen. The stained glass windows and the museum within were outstanding
beautiful and inspiring. A must stop in Paris, we used the Rick Steves audio tour on his app and that really added giving us some history. Highly recommend.

Our Lady. Wonderful. Yes there were queues but they were well managed and we gained access very quickly. Superb attraction. Only marred by some daft French woman who decided to police photographers on Palm Sunday. Not your job Madame!! Otherwise very good. Free. A must see in Paris. Beautiful architecture. So much history. And a few films refs for kids to identify with and thus better engage. Really beautiful.
Every Visit is Special!. This was my third Paris visit..and to Notre Dame! Beautiful as always and certainly enjoyed the gardens around the cathedral!
Norte Dame. Neat historic site. Great sculptures and paintings. The altar was amazing and the graves. Neat history lesson!! A quick site to see!

Mass was beautiful . I attended mass at Notre Dame during my first visit to Paris. It was wonderful to hear the mass in French and the parishioners were very nice. The only annoyance was those using flash photography who were visiting the cathedral during the mass time. I walked around afterwards and enjoyed seeing the Joan of Arc statue, the wood carvings and just soaking in the beauty of the cathedral.

Paris day four. Breutiful and a sense of awe. 854 years of history. This has more history than any other church we have visited. You could go to the top and llok down. To think the people that started the building never saw the finished church.
Stunning. Such beautiful architecture. Witnessed a mass as well and very good displays and history inside. Good souvenirs as well

A great old Cathedral that is a must do in Paris.. A large and in many ways beautiful cathedral, but I have seen better both in presentation and attractions. It does not have effective lighting to highlight its many great pieces. But then that may be because of the cost. But as I indicated this is a must do if you are visiting Paris. Make sure you walk around to the rear for some great photos in the small park.

Stunning, Inside and Out.. We were not staying that far from Notre Dame, so it was easily accessible within 20 mins of where our apartment was. You can see how big it is from quite a way back to be honest, the two imposing towers at the front of the Cathedral standing proud. Outside it is architecturally stunning, but inside it is unbelievable, it actually takes you by surprise how impressive it is inside, you sort of know it's going to be good, but not this good. The stained windows and the way the light enters the Cathedral give it an almost mystical feel, as if something is about to happen. It is huge inside, there is also an impressive exhibition as you walk around on how the Cathedral has been developed over the centuries and added too on numerous occasions. It is free to get in, but you do have an option to throw a couple of Euros into a couple of collecting points along the way. So glad we decided to go and have a look. Definitely worth a visit, with plenty if tourist gift shops and cafes and bars close by.

Impressive architecture. It was raining so we went inside the church. The atmosphere was peaceful and soothing. Beside it is free to public to visit. I recommended you are a Catholic or Christian, it is worth a trip to attend service.
Notre Dane cathedral. What a lovely architecture. We didn't get to go inside because of the long line. We were planning if ging hackney ran out of time.

Couldn't be more amazing!. Besides the extremely long lines....it's a fabulous must see. The front door to the church part is lined up 200 deep with people. But...the line moves fast. If you want to climb the bell tower....that's a different story. They let in very very few at a time and the line is a killer. So...if you have to do the bell tower then go as soon as it opens and be the first one up the tower then leisurely go to the church. And...by the way...the crypt is a must see which is right infant of the church on the same grounds. And....one more thing, definitely walk the gardens in the back. So pretty!

A classic. If you are in Paris for the first time, of course you have to see Notre Dame. It's a landmark and an amazing sight. The size and scope of it, along with the history, is breathtaking. Of course, everyone else visiting Paris is there also. So it is very crowded. But it is a free entry and things move along smoothly, so it doesn't really matter. The stained glass is something to remember!

Don't miss this!. We went on our own, no tour and it was great! It is free to enter and walk around all you want! What a cathedral! Very spiritual. Our only complaint is, as often is the case, some of the tourists. We always respect what the rules are for where ever we go and it is very difficult not to loose it when you see people in the "prayer only" areas, going in and taking selfies and family pictures where they are not supposed to be! But that happens when you are in popular tourist areas, I guess!

Beautiful piece of architecture. Notre Dame cathedral is a must visit if you are dropping in Paris. The cathedral is one of the finest examples of gothic architecture. The cathedral has been built over couple of centuries and inside the cathedral you will find a picture explaining the evolution. Admission is free. However I do recommend going early in the morning as the queue can get quite long. There are couple of eating joints/cafes next to the cathedral as well in case you plan to grab a crepe.
Wow!! . It's one of the top places to visit for a reason! Only recommendation is to check when mass service is on as they rope off an area.
For architecture lovers. Beautiful cathedral with lots of history and architecture. The glass paintings are a treat to watch. The architecture from outside is more beautiful than the inside one.

A must see. Didn't get to go up to the towers , should of seen the towers , free admission to walk into the church however a line up but moves quickly. The work , stain glass especially is something to see. This church should not be missed.

Definitely visit but no need to book a tour. This striking cathedral is a remarkable church which is stunning on the Parisian skyline.
Worth visiting as a member of the public rather than booking a specific tour. Paper guides can be bought for cheap in the cathedral itself.

Amazing place to see and walk around. whether you sit in the gardens for a picnic, or do the tours this place is simply beautiful. It is a place if your in Paris you must go to a real gem of a place......
Huge, imposing and awe inspiring. One of my favourite examples of gothic architecture. Made me wonder how can one build this magnificent monument almost 1000 years ago.

A must-see place in Pari!!. Notre-dame should be on the top of the list of the places you want to visit in Paris. In high season, the queue could be long and you might have to wait up to an hour to get in but it's definitely worth it. The interior is so majestic and you can't stop admiring the architecture of the cathedral.

a must see, do not book a tour. Admission to Notre Dame is free. It is very easy to access by subway. Do not book a tour with a tour company. You must wait in security lines regardless of being with a tour or not. The security lines go very quickly. Once inside, you can pay for an audio guide if you prefer. You will save hundreds of dollars by just showing up on your own and avoiding tour company rates that don't offer enough to justify their prices.

Beautiful . Beautiful inside & out!! If you know the history or not definitely worth a visit & a few pics if only to say you have been!! It is free entry & even if there is a queue don't be put off it moves very quickly!!! Even our 3 year old enjoyed looking around & lighting a candle!!
Magnificent. The stained glass windows were magnificent. The architecture is amazing! I am so glad we included it in our visit to Paris.
Long lines but quick entry. I waited in a very long line to get into the cathedral, but it moved along quite quickly. I was impressed with the many different chapels within the cathedral.
Breathtaking. The light in the building was amazing, beautiful and well worth spending time here. Don't miss out!!
Nice.. It's Notre Dame! Difficult to say anything negative. However, some of the other religious sites in Paris are much more interesting and are more peaceful.

The outside is wonderful!. This church is one of the iconic sites of Paris so it is a must do! The outside is spectacular with the famous gargoyles who appear to be stretching to reach for you and the flying buttresses that support the body of the structure. Visiting the inside is free but with the exception of beautiful stained glass windows the inside pales in comparison to the cramped city church of St Paul and St Louis in the Marais district. The position of Notre Dame on a generous plaza and in close proximity to the river make it a photographer's trifecta.

A beautiful experience! . Bring a lunch and sit in the nearby park. If you plan it right, Saturday afternoons there is an impromptu orchestra that meets in the park. It was a lovely afternoon and a great jumping off spot for our next adventures!
Lovely. Then Cathedral is so beautiful to look at from outside....and from inside is a stunning piece of architecture
Awesome. A must visit whether you go as a tourist or for business. The place is awesome and will make you feel spiritual. It was nice to be there on a Sunday morning.
Amazing. Absolutely stunning by day and night. Had the good fortune to hear mass there and thought it was amazing. Not crowded either set on beautiful gardens

A must see when in Paris. A nice cathedral inside and out. Very busy but that is to be expected as it is free entry. You can go to the top of the cathedral for 10 euros but we didnt do that.Be careful of pickpockets and beggars, but that is all over Paris.

Amazing. Really amazing. It costs 10 euros to the top and has a long line but it's worth it. The view is breathtaking and the gargoyles are beautiful. The entrance to the church is free and you should see it.

Don't miss a trip up in the towers!. Notre Dame is beautiful, inside and out. It is definitely a must-see during your visit to Paris. While there, be sure to go up the tower. You get gorgeous views of the city, the gargoyles and the bells. I recommend you line up before it opens, which is at 10am. The line is on the left side of the church if you're facing the front. This was the longest line we waited in while in Paris (about an hour and a half), but well worth it. You can't make reservations, so get there early. They only let about 20 people in every 15 minutes, so you may wait a while even though the line may not seem long. Once you get up there, you'll appreciate the small groups that are let in. You can easily move around and take beautiful pictures without worrying about bumping into someone because it's so packed (like the Eiffel Tower). My boys are 6 and 9 and loved being up there. It's very safe, but there are a lot of stairs, so make sure everyone in your party can navigate spiral stairs easily.
Excellent visit . Visited Notre Fame Cathedral many times and it never fails to disappoint. Breath taking architecture inside and out, with a calm and tranquil atmosphere once you step in.

Beautiful Cathedral - but watch your belongings. First of all, Notre Dame was was absolutely gorgeous and definitely worth the visitUnfortunately, I got my wallet stolen right outside of it. A mute woman approached me with a clipboard pretending that she wanted me to sign a petition, I said no and tried to walk around her. She blocked my path each time I tried to walk past her, she was aggressive. She physically harassed me to the point where I saying "PLEASE STOP" over and over again. She eventually stopped. About 15 minutes later, I figured out why she stopped. She had stolen my wallet. Definitely go see Notre Dame, but WATCH YOURSELF!

Over rated. Its a very nice cathedral, but based on how famous it is i was expecting it to be more huge.
Thank you
Great historical building. Very nice building to visit lots great architecture and history. They say no photos, but everyone was doing it and no one enforcing. Would make it a stop on your visit.

Most fave Architect Masterpiece in Europe... I found this Cathedral to be very peaceful (despite hundreds of tourists visiting while we're there), most interesting features is the mozaic windows and crazy high ceilings..
God certainly bless this craftmanship with expertise to build such masterpiece..a must-see in Paris definitely whether you are Catholic or not..

Beautiful cathedral. I have seen it in movies before but standing in front/inside of the Notre dame is an unbelievable experience. Never could i have imagined the size and beauty of it. It was truly breath taking.
Very nice. A beautiful church , which attracts both outside and inside . The special and stays in beautiful memories .
Wow!. Fascinating historical cathedral. It is a bit like many small churches in a very large, ornate, ancient building that is still in use today.
Notre Dame. Its a nice church that is free for see , if you can I suggest you to see the place in evening , the lights make it more beautiful.

Symbol of Paris. This beautiful cathedral should be first on everyone's list of places to visit in Paris. It is one of the few medieval structures left in Paris and along with the roman ruins near it, helps to give you the feel of Paris beginnings. We attended the Gregorian chant mass on Sunday (May 29, 2016) and it was beautiful.

Outstanding. The cathedral never ceases to amaze even after several visits. The interiors towering heights, the intricate cupola, the beautiful rose Windows and other stained glass windows are incomparable, the courtyard outside the church are also worth the visit. With the statue of Charlemagne on a horse. The facade is also beautiful. The gargoyles and the intricately carved doors and arches are amazing
NOTRE DAME.. I have to go again.... A visit you cannot even think about skipping.. it is the first attraction in your list if you have one... you can go ANY day anytime.... please don't miss it..

Great experience!. Even if you are not religious, this place is a must-see. It has so much history and they have guided walking tours or headsets for cheap that you can listen to while walking around. Very crowded so know that going into it. I'm a huge fan of "The Hunchback of Notre Dame" so to see it in person and the gargoyles was fantastic. If you are interested in visiting the bell tower I would HIGHLY recommend booking it through a tour as far out in advance as you can as it fills up quickly and the line for standby is extremely long and will take hours!

A must see in Paris. This is a classic piece of architecture but the crowds are daunting. We went later in the day and still waited 30 minutes to get into the church. In my mind, St. Chappel is far more stunning because I love stained glass. There were no crowds or lines for those with a pass. The biggest line is the security screening line.

Worth every 387 steps!. We went up the steps to get an up close view of the magnificient architecture work. My husband was very excited about the gargoyles.The view of the city from the top was breathtaking as Île de la Cité is located within Siene River. You will also get a view of the splitting of the river.Do take note that the entrance to the tower is located outside the cathedral. So do NOT go through the long security queue to go into the cathedral if you intend to climb up. Go to the left side of the cathedral at Rue du Cloître Notre-Dame for another queue to go up the tower.

Unbelievable!. We arrived to Notre Dame Cathedral at 9:30am on a Saturday and decided to get in line for the towers first. It was only about a half hour wait and we purchased our tickets and walked the 400 steps to the step. It was well worth it, the views are amazing. It only took about 5-10 minutes to the top. After exiting the towers we got in line for the Cathedral which there were about 300 people however it moved very quickly and we were inside within about 15 minutes. It was quite amazing and much larger than I expected. This is a must do in Paris!

I really loved Notre Dame. I'm not Catholic but I'm a religious person and I appreciated the history, detail, and reverence of being in the Cathedral. Even if you don't go in, the incredible detail on the exterior of the building is amazing. As you get closer you realize what you thought were scallops or arches are really images and faces of patrons carved into the architecture. There was a longer line to get in but it moved quickly and it is free admission. It is $5 to see the treasury which was interesting but there really isn't that much in the treasury because it was sacked during the french revolution. I would definitely take the time for Notre Dame.
Amazing Cathedral. Take time to go inside to understand the scale of the Cathedral which personally I didnt think was evident from outside. It does not cost anything to walk through

Gargoyles are the best!. No wait to see the inside, we walked right in. There was about a 45 minute wait to climb to the top. It was worth twice the wait! Amazing views and intricate gothic architecture up close! Amazing!

Go first thing, or the lines are never ending.. Our first attempt to go inside was a bust because it was mid-day and although the line to get in was moving pretty steadily, was at least 45 minutes to an hour to get in. We tried again first thing in the morning on another day (Sunday) and we walked right in. There was a service going on, so we were limited to the perimeter of the building, but that is the primary part to visit anyway. Entrance is free unless you want to go up the tower, but I never saw where that entrance was. The architecture is truly unbelievable. A breathtaking building to see. There are no services (food or restroom) in or around the building, but there is an alley way across the street that houses a string of cafes and gift shops.

This is a Cathedral!. This is the Cathedral all others should be compared to. And there is nothing like its allure. It is such a beautiful building that it has the power to draw you to itself and you just cannot resist, or at least that is how we feel every time we visit Paris. Simply beautiful, irresistible, majestic, impressive. Full of history and beauty.

Stunning Interior, Well Worth the Wait. I visited here with my husband on our honeymoon. We had to wait in line but it moves quickly and we only waited outside around 10 minutes. The architecture and stained glass are so much more beautiful in person and we stayed for well over an hour and a half marveling at the interior. If you are visiting the Champagne region of France there is a cathedral in Reims that Notre Dame was modeled after and is worth a look inside as well. After you leave Notre Dame I highly recommend popping into the crypte archeologique. The entrance is just west of Notre Dame and underground. It tells the history of Paris from Roman times and has the foundations of many of the original buildings there to view.
Outstanding. Not much to add that hasn't already been said, it's an experience that everyone should have, a truly outstanding experience. Don't just go inside make sure you walk all the way around.
Inspires reverence. Inviting in that you feel free to wander at leisure and soak up the long history of beautiful France, and leaving you wishing the walls could talk.

okay. ive given two star rating because i am not a history lover or an architechture lover ... history lovers might just find it amazing... but in my opinion on a trip to paris you can do a whole lot of better things than just visiting this cathedral
Like moths to a dame. This place was hiving. Well worth a look but keep your belongings close as this spot is so busy outside that the unsuspecting could be easy targets

It's ok. The aspect that makes this a must-see is the Victor Hugo novel, Hunchback of Notre Dame. Other than that, it is just ok. Pales in comparison to the beautiful ornate cathedrals in Florence. Go early if u want to climb the 300+ steps to the top. We went around 4 pm, and the stairs were already closed. Don't go on a Monday either. Most museums are closed that day, so places that are open on Mondays have really long lines.

Impressive. What a great place to visit in the heart of Paris!Crowne jewels not really worth it, but the Cathedral is awesome!Beware of long lines of people waiting to get in, and even longer lines to go up in the Tower.Definately a place to visit when in Paris!
Inspiring. Love this cathedral so much that I would visit it everytime I visit Paris.Quiet place to rest and just "feel" the spiritual quietness.Light a candle and pray for peace when you are there.

Ehhh. . Second visit to Notre Dame. Was more impressed when I was younger. The architecture is still much to be appreciated but the visit itself is anticlimactic. Long lines, dark and poorly lit inside, in dire need of surface cleaning, chicken wire blocking your view from the towers. All in all there are much better ways to spend your time in Paris.

Spectacular! . Do yourself a favor and make sure you see Notre Dame! It is truly incredible, and if you happen to be there when the bells chime for evening mass, you will be amazed at how beautiful and majestic it sounds.

Wow! Stained Glass Everywhere.. This Cathedral is really something to see.Old Gothic architecture.It was free to see,but you could pay for a tour.There has been much restoration over the years to make it look this good. A must see while in Paris.

Must see, but not my favorite church in Paris. It's big, it's crowded, and it's still impressive. New to me on this visit was a model of the church and displays that show how it was built over the ages that are very well designed and interpreted in English. I also paid the 5 euros to see the Treasures of Notre Dame, a small exhibition of religious robes and objects created for Papal visits, as well as other beautiful items made in honor of various saints. The same evening we went back to see and hear the Danish Royal Choir perform a concert there. It was a cash-only event and well-attended. The acoustics were amazing. There's much more to Notre Dame than this, but dark Gothic cathedrals really aren't my thing. I much prefer the Basilica of Sacre-Coeur, especially at Vespers, but unfortunately I didn't get to visit there during this trip.
Impressive. Rent an audio guide to learn more about the cathedral. It costs 5€, and it worth the price. My advice is to go there earlier, after 11 there is a long line to enter.
Impressive construction!. The whole building is outstanding! If you plan to go inside be patient because the line is usually big and you will have to wait a little bit.
Take the tower tour!. So beautiful inside and out... and so much history. Take the time to enjoy a tour and learn more about the building. The tour of the towers is worth the wait!

Audio tour. We took this self guided audio tour after going to Mass. Once we got the hang of the handset it was great. Very informative about not only what was in the cathedral but why they were so important. As a Catholic I loved hearing about this beautiful place at my own pace
Stunning. Beautiful inside, there was a mass going on while we walked around and looked at everything. Very peaceful. Afterwards we walked to La Louve, not too far

Got SO much more out of it with Unique Paris Tours,. This was my third visit, and I learned more than the first two COMBINED. They can arrange for you to skip the bell tower line as well (remember, that's a SEPARATE line!) and get you through at your own pace, seeing what interests YOU, and without being stuck with the "herd". We had several folks leave their tours and tag along near us because they heard our guide and broke ranks! I learned so much more than I did on either the "headset" tour or the "group" tours that I took previously. My husband, two twenty-something and two teen children are so NOT history fans, but even they were enthralled. We were able to see everything including the crypt in two hours, it was perfect.Make sure to stop at Berthillion afterward, best ice cream in the world!

Must See!. Don't come to Paris without seeing the Notre Dame. It's free and you can spend an hour just walking around. If you are adventurous and have time (the lines are very long) you can purchase a ticket to walk up the tower to be rewarded with amazing views of the city. Unfortunately we didn't end up waiting because the line was too long. Be sure to walk around to the garden behind the cathedral. And if you have more time - venture around the adorable neighborhood. I actually which we spent more time in this area.

If your into churches this is not to be missed. Very touristy and busy but worth the effort. Not sure if churches should be an attraction but it is magnificent. Try to arrive during lunch when the queue is smaller, still we did not have to wait very long.

Excellent worth a visit . This cathedral was well worth the visit it's architecture is fantastic very detailed sculptures and artistic design on the Windows is very impressive. There is a small gift shop here too which sells religious chains and pendents which is a nice touch they are not very expensive. There Are isles where you can light a candle to a particular saint for your loved ones. Highly recommend a visit.

Notre Dame Cathedral. Wow. Just wow. Notre Dame was just amazing. I strongly recommend that everyone see Notre Dame. It is free to the public on certain days as well. The stain glass windows in the church are out of this world and you can even buy replicas of them at the gift shop. There are tons of amazing historical moments in the church and it was just incredible. Definitely a must see while in Paris.
Worthwhile view. On a rainy day, this worked ok. Lots of stairs to climb to the top but the view is spectacular even if it was raining. The museum part is interesting too.

Beautiful and impressive. We did a quick walk through but it is worth the visit. It's a massive old building which has been more or less in its current form for 100s of years. Never had a chance to go up the towers but this would be fun.

Easter Time. How do you review a church? Do this tour. This was a stunning time to visit even with a crowd and a tiny bit of enhanced security threat it was spectacular visit. Participated in the Veneration of The Crown and it was singularly one of my best moments in Paris. Watch out for pick pockets they were out in force.

Unreal site. This was a special visit. The epic size of this stone structure inside was nothing short of amazing. Starting in 1140 this has gone through an amazing transformation. What a bucket list site to visit...visually and spiritually unreal!

Gotta do it.. It's just one of those things everyone visiting Paris should see. It's free, and although the line may be long, it goes very quickly. It's really beautiful but we went after seeing Sainte Chappelle, and in my opinion, it's hard to top that.
A must see. The architecture and stained glass alone are worth the visit. A definite must see when visiting Paris.

Saw a little, gotta go back. Our visit was a real quickie. We spent about an hour walking inside the cathedral, looking at the windows, altar, and so forth. Of course, Notre Dame is not to be missed and we'll make a longer visit the next time we're in Paris. Side notes: 1 - Stop and shop along the Seine at the little plywood shops, which contain old books and maps, other French or Parisian items of interest, and the usual 'Made in China" tourist junk. 2 - watch the buskers near the entrance of the cathedral and pay them for their work. 3 - Get a crepe from a street vendor nearby.

It is Paris. Unless you just don't have an interest in churches, Notre Dame is an absolute MUST visit. It is a must-see site because the building is spectacular but also because the history of the church is a lot of the history of Paris. Enjoy the architecture and the stained glass windows. Notice the accommodations for 2016. Good luck if you decide to climb the towers. I did that almost 50 years ago but there is no way I could now!

Sunday morning visit adds great organ music to your visit . We visited on a Sunday morning so while we quietly observed the historical and significant surroundings, we had organ music. Do not skip the awesome Archeological Crypt and museum at the western end of the plaza. You can really see Roman history. Old Paris and the construction of the church in their multimedia displays and the well labeled ruins.

Get there early.. We set off to arrive before 0730 and we were near the head of the queue. Lots of places nearby to grab some breakfast. From memory, the queue was over 100 within an hour ( so we got in with the first batch). The views from the top are fantastic and the architecture of the belfry is amazing. I loved it.Pádraig
Paris during floods.. Notre Dame was not effected by the flooding. It is an extremely beautiful building. If you are interested in architecture and design this is a must!

Wow impact factor. Now ive seen castles and ive visited churches. Been to historic sites.......but this takes ur breath away.The building, every inch of it is amazing. The immense size. The carvings. The huge doors. All a must see.If ure fond of photography, like me, you will be spending an hour just composing and clicking. Every minute worth it.The metro station is a 8 mins walk from notre dam, but every step is beautiful and worth it. I didnt go in as prayers were underway.

Gothic beauty!. This cathedral is well worth the visit. It's free to visit inside and there is a line but it moves fast. The architecture is amazing with its flying buttresses and gargoyles. The size of the cathedral is immense. It's worth a walk around the entire cathedral so that you can admire the carvings on the entire front facade and then the buttresses in the back. I have been to the tower in the past but this time did not want to walk up the 200+ stairs which I recall being steep and claustrophobic. So we bypassed the long line of people waiting to climb to the top and simply admired the cathedral from the ground.

Gregorian Mass at 10 AM Sundays; Daily Mass in the choir. We attended Sunday Mass at 10 AM, which includes sung Latin chant led by the choir. For many visitors this will be as close as they can get to the way Mass was celebrated in the centuries before 1969. Tip: allow plenty of time to get through the line in order to find seats.Daily mass is held at 8 AM and 9 AM weekdays. Seating is in the choir just behind the main altar, which was a thrill all its own.

A must for a Paris visit. Wonderful cathedral. The grounds around it on the Seine side should be explored. We found the museum wasn't really worth the price of admission although the church relics were beautiful

Magical. I came here on the first Sunday to attend mass. I don't understand french, but I still came to pray. Oh, to all those who do not pray in the cathedrals, please keep silent while the rest of us are worshiping, resectfully. I bought 30 eiffel tower key chains for every body back home infront of the church. Sitting down gave me a great opportunity to look a the place, actually drink it it.

Not the Grand Dame after all. If you're a real world traveler, you won't be as impressed with Notre Dame and it just doesn't have the wow factor of many of Europe's other grand religious landmarks, but it's still worth seeing.

In awe!. The cathedral at Notre Dame has no rival (that I have currently experienced). I was in absolute awe at the beauty of the place.As with all large tourist attractions in Paris, the crowds are ominous. Be prepared for a line and a wait.I planned my visit during Sunday mass with the intent of attending the service. The service was conducted in French (there are English services, check their website) but they provide a program that you can follow along to. Even if your French isn't so great (mine is beginner level) it is easy to follow the sermon and participate without feeling awkward.

Stunning. This stunning cathedral is a definite must-see in Paris We went around 4pm and only waited about 10 minutes to get inside, although we were accosted by gypsy beggars nearly the entire time we stood in line so that made it quite unpleasant. If you encounter them, just ignore them...they will often follow you through part of the line but don't give in. Once inside, take plenty of time to explore the cathedral. It truly is beautiful and words can't quite describe it. We spent around an hour there, but could have spent more (we were pressed for time). Afterwards, I recommend walking down to Le Berthillon, a 10-15 walk, to get amazing ice cream (it's closed on Mondays but you can find the same ice cream at many cafes and a window down the street).

Breathtaking . A truly stunning place. We were lucky enough to visit when there was a service and the choir were outstanding. It was so nice just to sit and relax and listen. The architecture is breathtaking and this a must for anyone visiting Paris! The queue was really long but goes very quickly! The queue for the tower is also long and does go abit slower than the queue for the cathedral.

Worth the visit. Incredible building worth seeing but my daughter and didn't like being herded out by an official with a gate on wheels and made to leave while they were still letting people in at another door to look around. We don't know what that was about as he just cleared the aisle of everyone whether they had seen everything they wanted to see or not.

Must go. Great church with ancient soul. The church is the most beautiful from the outside, so you dont have to go inside. Of course the view from the tower is great and inside the church is amazing.If you want to see inside the church and not to wait in the long queue, go there after 5 p.m.

Its not cool to charge enter to churc!. Its not cool to charge enter to church, arhitecture is awsome, but is overcrowded. If you go in time of the year when there is no to much turists its actually very nice.

The One Place not to miss in Paris. If you go to Paris on pleasure or business. This is the one site not to be missed. Visit it during the day, then return after dark for the m,most beautiful view you could possibly imagine

Must visit!. We went here on our last day in Paris. The church was very solemn and well preserved. If i was not pressed for time i would have explored the crevices of the church and would be willing to pay the entrance to the other areas. There was also mass going on in English when we were there; again if I had more time and not catching a flight I would have stayed. I did buy a bracelet and pendant to remind me of my visit in Notre Dame and Paris!

Simply beautiful!. It is a must see ! Gorgeous architecture on the outside and an amazing warm feeling inside. Plus you will find Bertillon not far from there, where you will savour the best ice creams...

A must see. We waited in line to get into the cathedral. Be sure and take a hat so you can cover your head if it is sunny. The cathedral itself is stunning. I love to look at the gargoyles. Be sure and take a look around outside as well as inside. There is no charge to get in but there are candles you can purchase in honor of someone. Also a souvenir type area. Restrooms are outside and they do cost may 60 centimes.

Beautiful views. The building itself is quite small and I didn't spend more than 1/2 an hour in here. I am not a religious person so did not attend for spiritual reasons as some might, but more for the aesthetics. The views were great. The crowds were quite small and quiet.

always long queues to get in, and disrepectful tourists, but fab. finally braved the queue and made it in. to be fair, queue moves quickly, and the crowds soon disappear inside. magnificent building, even for the less religious. but scum tourists in danger of spoiling it for everyone - going where they are not supposed to / taking flash photos when asked not to, being tourists in area clearly reserved for prayers etc.
Truly wonderful!. A stunning church, but it has long lines to get in, arrive early!Prepare and research before you arrive to get the full value of the visit.
Stunning. Try to walk there and enjoy also the nearby neighbours. Need to have more facilities for visitors . Also enjoyed it at night.

Try to visit when they are doing a service. The acoustics are amazing!. Definitely worth visiting while in Paris. I would go to the top and see the gargoyles and if you have time listen to the choir singing and just enjoy!
So so peaceful. Wish I could see it again.So blissful and amazing and it's free to everyone. Love the treasures visit
The best. If you're visiting Paris, you should definitely see Notre Dame. Its one of my personal favorites in Paris. Its accessible with subway. Its not crowded at noon.

beautiful building and tower tour was brilliant. We booked the after hours tower tour and it was brilliant, informative and great views of the city, we had a group of 25 and got to spend a good amount of time up in the tower and belfry. Would definately recommend.
Always magnificent..... Although there were many people visiting the Cathedral is always a great place to visit and worship. The altar the windows and the whole ambiance is terrific.

Very Crowded. While beautiful, the security was very lax compared to other places in Paris like the Eiffel Tower. I was very disturbed by the noise and lack of respect of all the tourists. It was upsetting. People were at Mass..tourists were just walking around, talking loudly, etc. If you go, go early before the crowds arrive.

Incredibly beautiful. I have never seen stained glass windows as beautiful as those in Notre Dame. We have visited before multiple times, but never tire of seeing this breathtaking cathedral. This visit there was a choir from Florida singing a cappella - it was beautiful!If you are in Paris, this is a must see.

Great picture op, big line to go in, skipped that, but great shopping and restrants nearby. Nice place to shop and eat, french cuisine close by and plenty of choices. Was a long line to get in on a Saturday, so we checked out the local shopping
Magnanimous. We loved it totally. Has some amazing food outlet by its side. That being addition benefit. Worth being there.
must see in paris. the architecture of this building is magneficent. love the details from outside, takes me back to the movie hunchback of notre dame. lol

Amazing building with quite a history.. We did not spend too much time here, just a nice walk through to get the idea. We have visited many churches in Europe and enjoy them, but they do get repetitive after a while.

International service not international . Church was impressive and entry is free, so definitely worth the time to stop by for a visit. I went on a Sunday to attend the 11:30 "international mass" which turned out to be identical in all ways to the mass right before from what I could tell. There was no English here or there as promised by the website. As a Protestant just wanting to attend a service in this amazing church, however, it was still a great. Beautiful singing and organ filling the air. Of all the cathedrals I have visited in Europe, this one seemed the most alive as there were so many worshiping. Don't bother getting there too early as the mass before only lets out around ten minutes before the next one. You can't sit down too early.

Fascinating Architecture. We visited Notre Dame Cathedral with our private guide and the tour was fascinating. It did rain off and on the day we were there and we had a bit of a wait. The tour itself could easily be done in an hour or less for most people who are not there for religious reasons.

BLESSED. I am so happy and so lucky when we went to visit the cathedral. I remember i didn't even take a photo when i first came in. Me and my husband went straight to sit in front and pray. We stayed for about over an hour max inside the Cathedral. It's truly wonderful and i felt so rejuvenated and feel fresh after our visit.

Masterpiece . It made me remind the Disney movie....I found myself searching for Quasimodo next to the bell ahaha A masterpiece that worths visiting, inside and outside, so I recommend taking the free walking tour to learn more about this monument. The back of Notre Dame is absolutely beautiful and has a pleasant garden where you can sit and enjoy the place.

Beautiful!. One of the Most Beautiful Cathedrals of Paris. The Artistry that's on display in etching and on the Pillars and Ceilings in itself is gorgeous. It's dimly lit and usually has long queues to get in.. but don't let that deter u from going in. it's really worth it and the queue moves quickly as well. The Glass etchings are an Art in itself and it's atmosphere makes one feel like entering another world in another age. I'd say this is a Good 1 hour plus activity and should not be missed whilst in Paris.
Outstanding. If your time is limited, take a guided tour as this will also help stave off the crowds. Lovely plaza in front and a great place to sit and have lunch or coffee.

Time to say our prayer!. Our family feels so blessed that despite of our simple status in life,we were able to make ways of this wonderful mini road trip here in Europe.and as a Roman Catholic, we can't let this opportunity not to pass by at this beautiful cathedral and say our thank you prayers to the Lord for keeping us safe in our journey.weve seen so many churches,Cathedrals,basilica and we can't help not to be amazed .each of them has their own character and history to tell . we're just so glad that we had the chance to visit this Cathedral

Beautiful and imponent. When you visit Paris for the first time is hard to choose what to do. Notre Dame should definetely be one of the first places you go. The building is beautiful and it was recently clean and if you found yourself in Paris on a Sunday make sure to go either to the 9 am service or the 6 pm one at those services the organ is played and being able to listen to the organ in that setting is just a magic experience. I visit Paris aprox two times a year and always try to make it to Notre Dame even if it is only for 5 min.

Beautiful Church!. When I firsted walk up to the church I was taken back by the detailing of the building from top to bottom, breathtaking! I loved the gargoyles statues. I was able to attend a mass at the church. The inside of the church is well maintained and the details including the stained windows were beautiful. You are allowed to enter Notre Dame for free and the added bonus was attending the mass in French, it was an enjoyable experience. You are allowed to take pictures and videos in all places, except during mass in the center of the church.

Avoid the queues and don't worry about the towers. Inside this cathedral you will see magnificent architecture and crowds of people. Pick up the sound tour and wander with the others. I was lucky to have been treated to a choir of 100 singing without accompaniment for about 30 minutes - amazing to hear the voices fill the air

Wonderful. We visited with a private guide, which made the visit more interesting. She was able to describe the history of the building and pointed out some exterior figures that were replacements for ones destroyed during the Revolution. You really have to get close to study the intricate architecture and carved figures. In mid-May, there was no line or cost to enter.
A good rainy day activity!. I was surprised that the lineup on a rainy Sunday afternoon was not too long - it also moved quickly. Magnificent architecture
Beautiful place. We weren't actually able to get in but we enjoyed the gorgeous park behind the church. Lots of benches to sit and enjoy the flowers.

Otherworldly even for Tired Kids. Unless your family has reached its saturation point, entering the cathedral is like entering other world. The glowing glass window art, reverent crowds, soaring vaults, banks of candles, and ancient atmosphere feel like entering another world in another age. It is a cool escape for a moment from the modern world.

Lots n lots of tourists . Our visit corresponded with the Euro tournament this year, perhaps this accounted for expanded crowds? Line town tee was long but the cathedral is worth the wait! A little disappointing to pay for entry to the treasures but generally a good visit.
Breath taking. Wow this building is awsome, we were lucky enough to vist when there was an actual service being held, magical.

Notre Dame is Impressive. My wife, a friend and I visited Notre Dame Cathedral on a Friday afternoon. there was a queue for about 100m but it moved reasonably quickly at about 20 mins. Inside the Cathedral has spectacular columns and an ornate ceiling. Two large circular stained glass windows, face each other in the middle of the church while there are many stained windows on high and in the various ornate naves on both sides of the church. A masterpiece not to be missed!

So Much History & Such A Beautiful Cathedral - Notre Dame Cathedral. The first words coming to mind after seeing the Notre Dame Cathedral in person is simply magnificent. One of the details I learned when touring the Notre Dame Cathedral is the length of time that it's construction was on-going [from 1163 thru 1272, and then completed in approx. 1345]. Of course, since then there have been modifications, and restorations. At this point, I can assure you that you would be hard pressed to find any Cathedral that would be even close to the same level of detailed architectural designed, constructed and maintained at such a high level. This is an absolutely beautiful Cathedral, and I would consider it a 'must see' when in Paris, France.

Amazing!. Made our way to Notre Dame and found a long line extending into the plaza in front of this cathedral. We looked for a Paris Museum Pass line, however there was none. Surprisingly, the line moved very quickly, as it was a security checkpoint and the staff were very efficient. It's mesmerizing inside. The colors and sheer size of this monument are amazing. You make your way around the interior in an orderly, flowing stream and can stop at the little side chapels to pray or take photographs. We were very impressed with this cathedral and were going to attempt to do the roof tour, but that line was huge and again, there was no PMP shortcut. We very much enjoyed this church and would love to visit again - it probably takes 10 times to be able to take in all of the architecture, stained glass, etc.

Awe Inspiring.. The cathedral is amazing, the size of the building makes is hard to picture how they accomplished constructing it centuries ago but luckily there's a model inside showing how it was done.
Also a Fantastic Place to see a Concert.. Not only is Notre Dame a fantastic Gothic Cathedral, they also hold classical concerts from the Orchestre de chambre de Paris.

Only viewed from outside.. This is a magnificant structor in itself. The line (like all the attractions) was way to long for our tastes. We only had 3 days in Paris so did not want to wait in lines. We will be back with more time to spend.

Such an experience!. This is a free tour, you can walk through and take pics, we went 5 min before they started mass and that was neat to experience. I took soooo many pics here, it is a MUST and may only take you 30 min to walk through. You could def stay longer if you wanted.

Spiritual and enlighting iconic structure. Amazing example of gothic style architecture standing tall since decades and providing strength to followers of almighty. Beautifully designed and built, make sure to visit top. Often crowded and huge queue can be seen during opening time. If you are unaware about the historical and religious importance be sure to maintain decorum of the place while visiting.
Breathtaking cathedral. Notre Dame is simply breathtaking with the most amazing history and wonderful gothic architecture. Probably the highlight of my trip to Paris

Beautiful, Solemn. This is our 3rd or 4th cathedral/abbey visited while on our trip around the U.K. and Europe, and each one has it's own charm.We enjoyed seeing the treasury, admired the organ and stained glass windows, as well as the tombs and monuments. Be aware the treasury does cost to view, but otherwise it is free (donations are welcomed) to walk around.I think my favourite part was the climb up the towers. This part also requires the purchase of a ticket. 400 steps total, but well worth it for the views of the city and of the gargoyles and architecture. The bellfry is a treat, as well.Well worth a visit, if only to admire the exterior architecture from the wee square down below.

Must see landmark. Not only is this a must see landmark, it's free to walk around the first level. If you are lucky an actual service will be going on! A beautiful church, a beautiful site! I did not go up to the towers but it is still worth a visit!
Gothic cathedral . Amazing cathedral! its style is gothic and was dark on the inside but still breathtaking. We couldn't get on the roof because of the long queue and we were short on time.

Iconic lsndmark. Paris' Notre Dame Cathedral is one of the iconic landmarks that defines Paris. On this trip, we visited it twice. Once in the evening just after dusk to admire the grand exterior. The crowd was mostly gone and the towering cathedral stood in the dim lit lights more graceful than in the harsh light of day. The 2nd visit was in the afternoon, for the interior. We did not visit the tower in part for the 200 some steps to climb, in part for the long lines. But I have made the trip once before and did enjoy seeing the flying buttresses and gargoyles up close and personal. The view was also excellent. If you's like to mount the tower (require ticket), best get there early in the day.

Breathtaking and beautiul architecture, interesting history. We did the free walk through after missing our assigned towers time slot and were not disappointed. This is a magnificent piece of history and I was very impressed with the time period placards explaining how this cathedral came to be. We happened to be there while a choir sang and this was nice although perhaps not as awing as some other reviewers have made it out to be. I found it strange to have such a beautiful place of worship also to be quite touristy (e.g., paying for access to specific sections) but I guess it needs to be maintained in some form given there is no admission fee.

Light a candle. This is one of the many must visit sacred places in Paris. It is worth reading the history before going to avoid being overwhelmed. We also lit candles and said a prayer or two. Very humbling and a reminder of the importance of faith and reflection, in these troubled times.

A reverent and quiet place that welcomes the Disabled. Free, fast entry for the wheelchair bound and a carer. Fully accessible in the Cathedral but not up the tower. Staff were helpful and kind - very different from Sacre Coeur, which was awful.

Wander and wonder, come back for a magical mass.. You have to see Notre Dame, from all the different angles and lights, wandering inside with or without a guide, and the Sunday Gregorian Mass is almost magical. As always in Paris, go early, but the long lines do move fast, so don't be intimidated either.

Girl Scouts Tour Notre Dame. Just to see the Cathedral was magnificent. We got rained on while waiting in line, but were pleasantly surprised to see a Chinese Bridal Shoot going on out front. The girls loved feeding the pigeons while waiting and it gave us more time to appreciate the beauty of the building. Once inside we were so awe struck there were no words for the awesome beauty of the cathedral. The light coming in created fantastic effects with the stained glass windows. Everyone enjoyed this stop on our tour.
Beautiful!!. The apparent long line moved very quickly, we were inside in under 10 minutes. The cathedral was beautiful inside, very much worth the visit!!

What amazing Architecture . Just loved everything about this Cathedral, we were able to take photos as long as we didn't use a flash. We were lucky enough to hear the Nuns singing just beautiful. It is free to entry but if you want to see their treasures they is a small fee to pay I thought it was worth the money we paid The architecture inside is amazing. A must see when in Paris

Breathtaking. The one too famous cathedral every tourist has possibly heard of truly deserves its name, as the first think you'll notice is it's elegance. Fantastic spot, fascinatingly complex and impressive with every single detail. A must-do while in Paris.
Beauty and Art. A long line to take to get to see the beauty inside , quite close to everthing , and we had meet super cheerful people around ,
One of the most beautiful Cathedrals of the world. Beside being beautiful to see it is nice to site in the pews and just sit there and take in all around you. Even attend a mass if you can.

Beautiful. Read and learn before you visit. Before you go, get some literature and read about the Cathedral. All of the decor on the front has special significance and it would be a shame to walk by it or look at it without knowing what it is. Learn about St Denis, who is the statue holding his own head, the kings of Judah and the awesome story about their heads and where they are now. We toured inside and then went along the north side of the cathedral to get in a long line for a climb to the top. This was worth the wait. Lots and lots....and lots...of steps in spiral staircases, but the views are awesome and the close-up look at the architecture, gargoyles and so on are incredible.

Amazing cathedral. Notre Dame Cathedral is amazing. I enjoyed the visit of course but it was the last day of our trip and I had sensory overload by that time so I feel I didn't really get as much out of it as I could have. We happened to be there during Mass so our private guide couldn't speak up and we weren't able to learn much of the history from her. Despite the services, we were able to quietly walk through the cathedral. Visitors were quiet and respectful for the most part. Pictures were allowed so I took several. We didn't have time to climb the stairs to the top so I hope to visit Notre Dame again some day, climb to the top, and learn more of the history.
nice building. Was just hanging out outside. Beautiful infrastructure by the river. Way too many people outside. it was ok

An uplifting and amazing church. Notre Dame Cathedral is located on an island in the Seine River. It is a massive building with unbelieveable flying buttresses on the outside. As you enter the church notice the saints carved on the door way and mostly covering the front of the building. A good travel guide book with enable you to name these saints and know the history of their sacrifices. Speaking of guides, there are free English language tours during the summer, and, you will need to wear your comfortable shoes for the wait in line, but it is really worth the wait. The stained glass tells a marvelous story of faith, as does the magnificent, soaring vaulted ceiling. Don't miss this marvel and make sure you have a knowledgeable guide or you will miss out on the amazing details of this Cathedral. Oh, at the very end of this island there is a Holocast Memorial that is very moving as well. Have a great trip.
Lovely. We went to Norte dame cathedral on a Wednesday morning. You were able to walk around and enjoy the atmosphere. We sat down to watch the 12pm mass. Would really recommend a visit
Good old Cathedral. The place is very vibrant and attractive.The location is also very good and easy to reach.Good place to visit
A classic in the city of Paris. Notre Dame is a classic, but depending on the time you have in this great city it may not be the must do site.
A classic in the city of Paris. Notre Dame is a classic, but depending on the time you have in this great city it may not be the must do site.

Historic and Beautiful. There is not much that hasn't already been said. Beautiful architecture and stained glass windows makes this among the most famous cathedrals in the world. Climbing as high as you can is well worth the trip- the views on a clear day are spectacular

I was in awe of the size of the Cathedral. Wonderful experience and worth the wait in line.. Thank you to France Just for You for helping us plan our trip! We had a lot of fun! From the charming, elegant hotel in Paris -Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais - to the charming Chateau Damigny near Bayeux to the quaint b & b in Giverny (Les Jardins d'Helene). We enjoyed our trip tremendously as all of the accommodations and attractions were perfectly tailored to our liking. Once again thank you and we will definitely keep you in mind for our next trip to France.

Cathedral . What an amazing place. A must when visiting Paris. As a person who is non religious I was moved and emotional. As a building that is over 800 years the sense of history hits you as you walk through the door.

Amazing views from the top and breathtaking inside.. I absolutely loved visiting Notre Dame. I have now been inside three times and to the top twice. I would highly recommend going to this place at least once. The easiest way to go to the top is to be there a little before opening time and avoid the long lines. Same goes for going inside, beware the long lines. They do move quickly, but depending how long the lines are it can take some time to get inside!

A must but don't be there during rush time. The best way to visit Notre Dame is to attend a mass. The Catholic celebration, would you be a Christian or not, will bring you up to a unexpected level of understanding of this magnificent edifice. It was built by architects, ingineers, mason, carpenters... fully in the hands of they thought is the Holy Spirit and what is probably human genius. To perceive this initial spark of human talent and inspiration take a break in Notre Dame and pull your spirit and soul together

Speechless everytime. I never get tired of such beauty. It was crowded but the line in went very quick. We took a tour up to the top and enjoyed the view and loved learning about the gargoyles and chimeras

A must visit!. If I lived in Paris I would visit frequently - Notre Dame is such a wonderful calming place to reflect and find your center. The architecture is breath taking the history is captivating. Is definately worth spending 10 minutes or many hours!

Bucket list checked off. This is such a famous place, you have to visit it. The stained glass windows are marvelous, besides the architecture, it's a must do. There is an interesting model of the cathedral at the far end. It is a working church so be respectful. The line moves quickly so don't be dismayed by it. There are also gardens at the back to enjoy as well.
One of the most beautiful churches in Paris. This is a beautiful and historical church, good to learn about French architecture, history; Remember to light a candle for your beloveds or yrself.
AMAZING AND BEAUTIFUL. I have loved this church for more than 35 years; it is very special and you will feel it when you come in. If lucky you can hear a concert inside!

Always a favorite. Though I have been here before, it is always nice to go back. My Catholic wife had never been here, so it was an awe inspiring experience for her, and it was nice for me to enjoy it through new eyes once again. If you visit Paris, this should be high on your list.
Stop by while a Mass is going on. Very cool church. We stopped by on a Sunday while an active Mass was being lead. Great way to see this old church in action.

An Amazing Iconic Church. Although we did not take the stairs to the upper level, the cathedral is one of the top 3 churches in the world to visit! Our hotel was just across the river, so we were able to visit the property inside and out a few times. How do you compare with anything else.

00. Really cool that this Norte Dame Cathedral has the 0'0' lang lat right in front of it. Not sure if any one else would find that interesting but I did. Also, the design and art of this place is really breath taking.

Sad for the parish, the diocese . I'd always heard how fantastic the Cathedral was, and architecturally it lived up to the hype. A beautiful example of the period. Sadly, the vending machines inside the church, selling golden Pope Francis coins destroyed the visit for me. It was free to tour, and I'm glad I went for the historical experience if nothing else.
Stunning.. It's a fascinating to walk around and learn about the historical building. The stain glass windows are truly spectacular, especially as the sun hits.

Great gothic building. On this day it was not crowded and we are lucky to be here long enough to avoid the queues. On the weekend there were several hundred people outside waiting to get in. And I am not talking about the towers, just the church. Once in, allow time to observe all the details of the ceiling, the stained glass windows and the small chapels.

A beautiful cathedral in one of the most beautiful cities in the world!. This is a must for anyone visiting Paris, there are no words to describe it's beauty, both inside and out. Architecture is amazing.Outside the cathedral, sparrows gather to be fed and it is wonderful hold a piece of bread and have them land in your hand

Unique - not to be missed.. Not just a rainy day recommendation - its nice and cool in the summer ! A magnificent gothic cathedral built in the eary Middle Ages on what was the original site of the city of Paris. Always very popular with tourists (and locals - like me !) it is better to arrive early.In any event it is well worth the wait !.Before or after the visit you can also relax in the pretty gardens behind the cathedral.

What, no Hunchback???. This place is amazing for its history, architecture, religion and pure beauty.We were lucky to do a free tour and some of the stories are gobsmacking!Do you know the Last Judgement is explained in detail in the statues at the front?And that its the geographical centre of Paris?And that its name was for Mary's mother Saint Anne?And that the Rose Windows tell stories from the Old and New Testament?And can you pick the St Dennis statue, patron saint of Paris? Clue: he's off his head!And did you know that the word "Gargoyle" comes from the word gurgle as the sound they make when rain water passes through them???And that there are at least 37 statues of Mother Mary in and around the Cathedral?And the Chinese bride and groom getting their photos taken are just models!!!!No you did not..... And neither did IWhich is why you MUST GO!!!Just go.... Free walking tour is worth every penny :)

Amazing to see!!. Well worth a stop off on the boat trip to see this awesome building.Queue was huge to go inside but just seeing this structure from the outside was worth the time spent here.A must see!,

Amazing architecture, don't forget it is a church. I actually enjoy the services. It's nice to do this when I travel, and being able to light a candle for those who are not with us gives me a lift. The tourists can be distracting during the service, especially if they ignore the signs and walk through the seating area, but you learn to ignore it. The architecture is gorgeous, with lots of stained glass and artistic touches. It's usually very busy, but you are still able to get in and see it without too much delay. Don't be frightened by the line - it moves pretty quickly.

Very nice view and amazing main attraction. This cathedral is superb amazing with good view. You can see whole Paris on top of this place. Very suggested but very crowded as well. entrance is free but have to queue.

Amazing cathedral. This is a very beautiful cathedral in Paris, we really loved the artitecture of this stunning site but you have to wake up early to go there before the crowd's comming. If not, you have to queue up for a long time to go inside
Beware the que. Beware the que, it was so long we didn't get in as we ran out of time as we had to go fetch a train. So instead we crossed the river and got a coffee.

Stunning!. This place can get crowded, but it is well worth the visit. I would suggest visiting the inside while it is sunny so that you can really appreciate the stained glass windows with the sunlight shining through. You can take lots of pictures inside and the windows really are beautiful. also, take a night river cruise to see the exterior lit up at night, also very beautiful.

Astounding. We had a professional guide (Violet). The statues in relief were magnificient. Telling the story of Jesus for people who can't even read. The interior was spirit filled. Was impressed it appeared to still be a functioning church.

Just an awesome place to experience . Great architecture, massive building with tons of historical significance. This is a great free thing to see in Paris, and I'm glad we came. The wife says it blew her away. I agree.

One of the greatest cathedrals in the world. Notre Dame is the heart of Paris--next to the Latin Quarter, on the river, just an amazing place. When my son and I were in Paris in 2009, we came here every night.

A must visit. One of those places if going to Paris, you simply must go to.
Entry cost is free but we chose to take the audio equipment and 5 euro well spent.

A passerby only. We walked from our apartment in the 3rd down to the river and crossed over to see the cathedral. It was amazing from the outside with lots of architectural details to admire. We did not go in, but just walking past and feeling the history of the location was amazing.

Pictures don't don't do it justice . A recommendation to definitely go. Fair bit of a queue to get in but worth it.
The architecture is simply stunning and I could have looked at the building for hours! Each column and brick is almost like it has been personalised and individually created.
Make sure you have a few hours and enjoy!

Most beautiful gothic style cathedral I have visited!. There is not much I can say about visiting this cathedral outside of what you'd expect from a cathedral visit. Make sure you catch a glimpse of Point Zero in the plaza out front. If you are hoping to go up in the towers, don't wait too long like we did. They stop letting people into the line around 5:15, even though it doesn't close until 6:00. There is a very scary looking bouncer at the end of the line making sure you don't cut in. And if you are counting on your "skip the line" passes, they don't extend that privilege there. Make sure you go early so you don't miss out like we did!

Beautiful exterior, but unimpressive interior. In my opinion, Notre Dame Cathedral is simply overrated. The symmetry of the building and the fascinating facade of the beautiful exterior along with the lovely setting right on the banks of the Seine are absolutely attractive, but the interior of the cathedral is rather unimpressive. It’s quite gloomy and looks simple and lacking ornamentation. Moreover, Notre Dame is overwhelmingly crowded, which takes away from the charm that such a religious building should project. The line ups at the front are annoying, and the waiting line to visit the Tower of the Cathedral is huge. If you really want to marvel the most beautiful cathedrals of France, you should consider visiting the Amiens Cathedral, Bourges Cathedral and Chartres Cathedral, just to name a few, which are UNESCO World Heritage Sites by themselves. Basilica of Notre-Dame de Fourvière in Lyon and Cathedral Basilica of Saint Cecilia in Albi are also among my personal preferences.
Gorgeous and My Favorite Place is Paris. This was my favorite place that we visited out of all of the tourist spots. Even if you aren't catholic or religious the energy inside is strong. Must see.

A cathedral!. Queue to enter but moved swiftly, a few beggars around. Security bag check. Very crowded and does not have the feel of a cathedral in use, despite a service in a side chapel. Not my favourite place.
Amazing place. Just beautiful! What is also amazing is that its free to see this. Watch your bags outside, queue is long to get in, but moves fast.

Beautiful, peaceful walk through Notre Dame. The interior of Notre Dame took my breath away yesterday. Stunning architecture and windows, and beautifully lit by candles and gothic style chandeliers. It was so quiet inside! Lovely to sit in the middle for a few minutes just being there.

Just breathtaking. Notre Dame is just breathtaking. Get there early and avoid the crowds as we did. I found the history of the construction fascinating. The gift shop was very reasonably priced and information helpful. This is a must see when visiting Paris.

Essential Paris attraction. Highly recommend climbing the towers of Notre Dame for great views of the city, to see the bells and view the gargoyles up close. The Cathedral is spectacular and a must do when in Paris

Beautiful Inside and Out. Take a tour. The structure is beautiful but comes alive the the stories of how prostitutes use the work in the side chapels during the revolution. Listening to the expert guides tell the story of how Christianity is built into the structure and its political structure is not to be missed. If you can't take a our, follow and group and pretend to listen.
So much history. I loved this place. Well worth a visit. Mass being held whilst we walked around. Wonderful choir singing. Art work amazing
stunning. don't be put off by the queues - they go down very fast.Inside was as beautiful as I'd imagined - must see

World Class Cathedral. This is a must for Cathedral goers. We were fortunate to visit during a mass, although I am not Catholic I was humbled to see the many people worshipping and any time I see that I am humbled.

Wow, simply wow!. No written description could do this visit justice, so I won't even try. Instead I'll offer you a couple tips to get the most out of your visit.1) Get there early: Arrive before they even open to be able to go in and enjoy the cathedral before there are throngs of people in there with you.
