If you time it right, you can complete the inside visit and get outside to queue up for the tower tour before it opens also.2) Get there early! This is CRITICAL for the tower tour. The line gets crazy long really quickly. It is worth getting there and lining up 15-30 minutes before they open to get in among the first group(s). Don't skip this! The tower tour was a fantastic addition to the visit.

Eye opening - Spirit filling. Notre Dame Cathedral is a master piece in architecture. The enormity of the building is unbelievable. Once inside, the ceiling height with all of the life sized saints carved in minute detail is amazing. The Corinthian pillars are overwhelming. It's like taking a walk back in time. The service was beautifully done and the music seemed to be piped from every corner of this gigantic building. A must see and experience whatever your religious views. You will not be disappointed.

Tours . We decided to go for the tour option when we went to visit Notre Dame. Ques are expected but it was well worth the wait. Extraordinary 360 degrees views of Paris with the added option of going into the Cathedral's Belfry. Prices for adults was 10€ but free for all under 18s and free for under 26s who live in the EU. Be aware there are lots of stairs and narrow corridors but great experience over all.

A long wait but worth it!. Having visited the cathedral before, decided to climb to the top this time. One and a half hour wait before getting in to the billetterie but views from the top were breath-taking even though it was a grey day and being in beside the bells was great ! Would I do it again? No because of the wait. Am I glad I did it? Absolutely !!!
A must for Paris. The outside provides a great view, but being it free to enter the interior is what makes the cathedral. Well worth the visit. Gift shop overpriced as anything for...well anything.
Cathedral of Lady of Paris. Notre Dame de Paris is known for its colorful stained glass windows and lofty towers. This was built 200 years ago. Must place visit for history and culture lover.

Early to rise...or should I say walk the stairs. Get there early if you want to walk the 422 steps to the top for a fabulous view. The Paris Pass gets you free entry. Look for "Point Zero" on the ground out front, a small brass disc on the ground where distances from Paris are measured...superstition says if you stand on Point Zero, you'll be back within a year. I thought it was bogus but found myself back in Paris less than a year later.

Beautiful Cathedral. You must visit Notre Dame while in Paris. The architecture is truly amazing. Entrance is free, don't bother to book a tour. There is plenty of information inside the cathedral as you walk through.

Best to Visit in the Afternoon. Notre Dame Cathedral with its famous history and its extreme size, I always regretted that our sightseeing happened in the morning. In order to take proper photo to capture its beauty, afternoon sun shine on the front of the cathedral will give the structure's justice. Our photo ended showing the rear of the cathedral by the morning sun.
Very beautiful - huge lines for climbing . Great. Did nit climb this time as the lines are huge...... But still the inside is also amazing. Its a touristic highlight- but yet- theres a teason
Worth seeing.. Anyone can go inside and it is free. The crowds can be rude and not respect the silence, but overall you can appreciate the reverence of the church. Amazing architecture.

Notre Dame lords over the Sienne River with its Twin Towers. Gothic Gargoyles and Twin Towers. The cathedral of Notre Dame lies at the heart of Paris alongside the Seine River. We were lucky enough to tour inside and outside on a perfect summer afternoon. It was our last full day in Paris and wish we had allowed more time at this treasured landmark.
Ebd point on the London to Paris bike ride. We ended up at this historic spot at the end of our 265 mile bike ride. What an iconic site to behold at the end of such a trip. Amazing spot.
Amazing. Make a reservation so you don't have to wait in long lines. It will make your experience much better!
Magnificent. The cathedral is all that we had heard about and expected it to be. The altars, stained glass, and the quiet reverential atmosphere was wonderful. This is a must see in Paris.

ENGLISH SPEAKING TOUR. We were very lucky and had an English speaking tour. I learned so very much about the history of the construction of the rose windows and the cathedral itself. Learned also about Jesus' crown of thorns in the possession of the cathedral.

Can't miss. Don't let the long lines discourage you from visiting. Don't miss the crown of thorns. This is a must see, and you have to take the tour up to the top. Yes, the stairways are narrow, the steps plenty, and a bit crowded, but you can do it. The views from the top will be worth it. There is a gift shop where you can buy a rosary. I brought a few home and gave as gifts. They were loved by all.

Beautiful building. Went to the Notre Dame Cathedral with friends recently. We caught the metro and then walked. The building is very beautiful from both the outside and inside. Was ever so pretty and surprised no charge to go in as well. The walk around is nice and very interesting. Would definitely recommend going and would definitely go again if visiting Paris.
Notre Dame , lovely and historic. I'm not much of a church person as Ive seen too many already so dont get too a excited anymore , but its certainly worth a stop and a quick look.
A gem!. The twin rose Windows are extraordinary! This cathedral is very beautiful & I can't get over all the details everywhere you look, even the doors are amazing!

Very long queue for the tower. I visited on a beautiful day and looked around the cathedral, so that was lovely. There is also an adorable park around the back where I sat under some trees and ate lunch. However, I would have liked to go up the tower, but the queue was just far too long.

Charming and inspiring. A beautiful testament to the faith of the people with side chapels and altars that are quite splendid. Mass was being said whilst the tourists walked around the outside aisles but there was a dignified respect by those visiting. Very special windows are a key feature. Queue to the tombs was quite long. Plenty of little bars nearby. Thirty minutes is all you need (if you don't go to the tombs) but well worth the experience.

Beautiful Cathedral. We're not Catholic, but we decided to attend the International Mass on Sunday at 11:30 to experience the cathedral. That particular mass is supposed to be partly in English, but was totally in French. We enjoyed the choir and organ music. Don't wait in the long line if you are attending a church service - just go to the front of the line and enter where it says "Mass."

Must see in Paris. The cathedral is interesting, but tour at church tower is a must see. It puts the Ile and the Latin quarter at your palm. This tour is included in Museum Pass. Tip: arrive early, 9:45 to avoid long waiting in queue.
Impressive. Having visited this as a child I couldn't really remember it. The ceilings and walls are very impressive. It is free to enter. Outside of it is equally impressive.

Amazing inside. . Beautiful cathedral inside and out.
Photos don't do it justice, you need to walk around inside to appreciate it's full grandeur.
Long queue but it moves very fast. Absolutely worth a visit if you are here. Entry is free (there is a fee to climb the towers).

You simply must see it. Impressive cathedral with stunning architecture. Unbelievible what people were able to create and build in the past without computers and modern machines. Remember all the men who contributed to build this masterpiece. Free entrance.

Symbol of lofty spirituality.... Art and religions combine here in unique forms. Knowledge of religious and architectural history would enhance you experience, but even otherwise the aesthetic is enchanting.
very thought provoking,,,,,. REALLy amazing, one does wonder how they were built... when no large building machinery was around... and certainly built to last unlike todays build.....

Beautiful Architecture. We always love visiting this church. It can be crowded at times, but worth a visit. Entrance to climb is separate to get inside. It is free to get inside, you just need to get in queue. The line moves along to circle/cover the whole place, but you can step aside to stay longer and not get dragged. The inside is well preserved and breathtaking. The details are exquisite and just a delight to experience. We light a candle inside and say a prayer of thanks when given the chance. There are plenty of cafes nearby and it is only a 15 min walk to St. Germain.

Not free concerts. Somewhere in TA forums said the concerts are free at night at Notre Dame, not true. This church is an incredible structure but if you come here because of it, you'll be disappointed, if you been in Italy and visited any church, this one fails to impress in comparison
Beautiful cathedral and nice climb up bell towers. The cathedral is beautiful but crowded. Definitely recommend the climb up to the bell tower for the views and opportunity to see the bells.

Fabulous Cathedral. This is a must see....the outside is incredible but inside you experience one of Europe's most impressive cathedrals. Take some time to explore the history of this magnificent building.

A must see. We arrived to the line at about 10:30am and waited a short time. Inside, we were free to wander and enjoy the historical importance. Most guests seemed to recognize the significance and did not make noise nor take flash photography. Very moving.

Magical Visit. It was just as I had hoped - A bit crowed but to be expected. I recommend getting the skip the line pass if you want to walk the stairs to the top - Our tour guide was very nice and knowledgable.

Lovely but tower closed!. Visited back in December 2015. Have visited before a few years ago and must say exhibits are much more interesting. Suitable for all ages. Tight security too which was reassuring. Only problem we found was that the tower was closed, this wasn't mentioned online before our visit and there was only a small sign to say this outside which was disappointing
Extraordinary magnificent building . Gorgeous inside and out, also free, there's a lot to see here. And hear, if you go to the late afternoon Vespers service which is musical and also free.

Stunning. The cathedral is known for the stained glass and it didn't disappoint. Recommended time to visit during daylight to experience the beauty. There is a clear instruction not to use flash on the cameras and the annoying part is people don't follow (either they don't understand or care). To beat the crowd get there early else be prepared to wait. Recommended to visit.
Escape with wife. Amazing Cathedral, history and how it has constantly adapted and developed over the years. Amazing architecture and FREE entry. Thoroughly recommend a visit.
Stunning! Must see the inside.. The lines are intimidating but they move very quickly and once you are inside it is so worth it. You will be glad that you did it.

Amazing. Too bad bakery fair on the Parvis. Beautiful and such an icon of Paris. Too bad it seems that the mayor of Paris like to obstruct the front view on the Parvis with some ugly expos tent or stairs... empty the Parvis again for the full picture of Notre Dame.
Stunning. I am not overly religious but this visit was interesting and informative and the stained glass windows were beautiful.
Beautiful piece of history. . Do not miss this amazing attration. Beautiful building so detail from the outside. Much more amazing than the la familia in spain. Feels like a church holly grounds.
Nothing out of ordinary. Beware of pickpockets....usual drill in Paris :-)The Cathedral is good but nothing out of ordinary that can be brought out

A bit disappointing . I love visiting churches and cathedrals so I always wanted to go see the Notre Dame Cathedral. I have had great expectations and was left a bit disappointed. I have seen a lot much more fascinating Cathedrals so this one left me a bit disappointed. It is a very nice place to go see but unfortunately for me there was nothing that would made me "wow". The place was also overcrowded and very noisy.

Like many other Paris attractions, Notre Dame is grossly overrated. There are many more beautiful, grander and older churches in Italy, Britain and other European countries and even in other cities of France. For example, the grand church of Lyon is much more impressive. Paris in general is not a great destination for a short trip. Many paris' top attractions are not worth a trip flying from other parts of the world. Unfortunately, they are the things most tourists do in Paris. The city is undeniablly beautiful. However, it doesn't have the historical feeling of Roma and London nor the diversity and bustling of New York. Even its much prouded food is a bit disappointing: besides French food, the offer is limited. paris is the place for long stay. Its romantic and artistic atmospheres are magically hovering over every street, park, square, market, cafe and every corner of the city. To fully enjoy Paris, one should immerse him/herself into daily life of Paris.
Stunning. The outside of the building is stunning. We did not go in due to the crowds but still worth a visit just to view the outside.

A must for those who enjoy religious venues. Entry is free (which is not always the norm in other European cities) and worth your time. If you have not seen other European Cathedrals then by all means, see this one while you are in Paris.

Beautiful Gothic Architecture. We went here late May 2016 and though it was a rainy day, so glad we went in. They were having Mass and still let tourist walk around the perimeter of the worship area. So beautiful, being a rainy day it was especially dark inside but still a must when touring Paris. The line outside went very fast. This site is free and good for all ages.

Second visit . My second time in Paris and my second time at Notre Dame! A must see for all visitors to the area. Yes there is often a line outside that appears quite long - however, it moves quickly! Worth the wait :)

Absolutely Awe Inspiring!. The line up to get in was so long that we almost skipped going in, but we are so soooo glad that we waited. The line actually moved extremely fast, as it's free to get in, and once inside there is a vast amount of space to accommodate all the people. It is very much worth a visit. Be sure to walk around the back and sides as well as they are equally beautiful.
must see. extraordinary architecture in combination with a very special site and very interesting historic buildings
Exceptional. I was awed by the scale of this cathedral! It is an awesome experience to be inside and just amazing stained glass work. A must visit!!

Nice walk. Walked along the River to Notre Dame which is an interesting area and worth seeing! Really can get busy but nice atmosphere a bit touristy in some parts but some of the art work sold on the river really well worth a look

Crowds and limited views. Truly beautiful, but difficult to see its true inside beauty for the crowds and the sectioned off areas. Unlike many places in France, they do have English language descriptions for those of us who don't like the audio tours.

Better Outside Than In. It is grand to look at this Cathedral from the outside. I found the inside dark and dreary. There really wasn't much to see. We've really enjoyed visits to St. Patrick's in New York City, St. Paul's in London, St. Peter's, etc. but this was very crowded and not as beautiful. Entrance is free but they charge 5 euros from the reliquary which I thought was a bit of a rip off as it was very small with few items. The lineup started over to the left of the Cathedral (if looking at it from the front) and went in a big loop out front to the door on the right. It didn't take long to get in despite the length of the lineup, perhaps 20 minutes. It is rather confusing looking because there is also a large crowd out front and people were butting in line at random. The entrance to the stairs to climb to the top are along the left side of the Cathedral. There is a charge for this and the line was long each and every time we were there. There is not a separate line for tickets; you buy your ticket and then go up. Although it was confusing and unclear to us if there was a separate entrance for folks with the Paris Museum Pass but there was none. I'd suggest staying outside and taking some great outdoor shots of this historic Cathedral.
Amazing Architecture . Outlived my expectations, amazing beautyful architecture. Need to be careful of your purse and pocket .

OK, but a bit of a let down.. Magnificent building set on an Island in the middle of the Seine Very dark inside and no flash photos allowed - so disappointing in that respect. Surprisingly, totally free to enter - and, no one rattling tins at you either. Terry Pratchett fan? Look out for "Death" somewhere in the gloom!
Amazng. Worth taking the time to see. It is so old and so beautiful. If you get the audio guide it makes it a bit more interesting. Also kindof cool if you can make it when a service is in progress
Notre Dame. Historically and religiously significance place. Huge place surrounded by eateries.Relax and spend time inside.Souvenirs available.

Line is very long. This is extremely impressive from the outside. Unfortunately, the line to enter was very long and we didn't have time to wait. I can only imagine what it must look like inside. We will definitely make more time for it on our next visit.

Impressive . An enormous church with impressive architecture and some interesting stained glass Windows. Highly recommend that you don't join the queue immediately, take time to walk around the cathedral first to get a sense of the scale of it before going in.

Architectural design very ornate.. Packed with tourist, the cathedral is nothing but amazing. Wish it wasn't as rainy and cold at the time of our visit in March-April. Brought home the candle as a souvenir from the candle stands to offer prayers. Much cheaper inside the church rather than the souvenir shop inside the church.
A beautiful church. The Notre Dame cathedral is a must visit in Paris and not without reason. The interiors are simply beautiful and breathtaking.
Amazing!. I always wanted to visit, this is quite the place. I recommend to all lovers of history and religion, it is an amasing place!

Quick visit. I wouldn't say it was one of my favorite places in Paris, but I will say if you're in the area, its worth a quick visit. Great history, interesting gargoyles, and of course a nice link to "The Hunchback of NotreDame" story most of us are fond of.Didn't make it up to the tower, but one look at the long line and I was like "forget it".
Must see. Stunning as you'd expect. The line moves fast, fast, so do not be intimidated by it. Could spend hours there.
Superb!. Thoroughly enjoyed Notre Dame Cathedral. What an incredible place. The stained glass windows were amazing.
Very Crowded. Even there in mid May the crowds to enter were considerable , but a sight well worth the visit , if only from the outside.
Awesome. We only visited for a little while, but it was a lovely, beautiful cultural and historical experience. I recommend this to any families with older kids or adults.
Crowded but worth it!. It's so amazingly beautiful inside, be sure to sit and just stare at the stained glass. Also very nice to go around to the park in the back and enjoy the view.

Tour is worth it!. I always said if I am ever in Paris again I will tour Notre Dame, and that's exactly what I did.How can you not be in awe of Notre Dame, just beautiful in all its glory.You can tour the cathedral for free, and pay for a more extensive tour of the building as well. You also can attend mass.I took a tour of the cathedral, got there right before it opened and there was no line, only a handful of people.It's just breathtaking, I really don't have words to describe the feelings you feel, well I guess I do, you can tell this was a church built for God; this is a place he has placed his hand on. You feel it when you enter.So very happy I took the time to tour the cathedral, and just a little advice, even if Catholicism isn't not what you practice, be respectful of the ones who do ,who are attending mass, saying prayers try not to push through them to get your picture, your time will come, have patience.
Impressive!. Stunning & always impressive! A great location for wedding pics.Crowded but large enough to accomodate all the tourists. Plenty of seating all around the forecourt & garden too!
A engineering marvel. The Cathedral is just beautiful, the Chagal windows breath taking.....Walk around, say a prayer, take in the amazement of this church

For lovers of architecture, history and Assassins Creed an absolute must!!. I can't really say much more than this is fantastic. So much to be taken from this experience. Make sure to take a high quality photo from in front of the building, dead centre if you can. Designed using the magic number this is a wonder of Paris and testimony to how they just don't build them like they used to. If you want photos inside make sure you have your low exposure settings are correct. It's quite dark inside. Research it on YouTube before visiting so that you know what to lookout for when you visit. Enjoy!!

The Best. This is a breathtaking experience, one of the most beautiful cathedral of the world and also a Paris icon and a symbol of Gothic architecture.Discover the magnificent space after passing through the small door in dazzling.Notre Dame It is a Top ten must-see place in the world.Climb the towers and see the gargoyles is a great experience too.

Beautifully detailed. A must visit if it's your first time in Paris. Such an iconic and beautiful structure. Pros: So much to see inside and out. The building is so beautifully detailed. Make sure you line up to go inside and see the stained glass windows. Cons: Incredibly busy so be prepared to battle your way through crowds (including tour groups) as lines movement through the building is not organised.
An Icon For Sure. Very compelling to sit in the pews and absorb the beauty of this beautiful place. The architecture is breathtaking. A must see!

amazing architecture !!!. i visited it twice in the last 2 years and every time i enter it i feel so small you could only imagine how this piece of art was designed and built by people when there were no advanced means of building but there is one thing that i hated and it is that there are machines that sell collecting coins all over the cathedral i believe that this is a place of peace and spirituality not a place to profit fromof

Nostalgia. Read Alexandre Duma's Hunchback of Notre dame when I was a kid. From that day Notre dame was a name associated with my childhood. When I actually visited the place felt completed one circle in life. It was a very nice place.

A Must-See while in Paris. This is a must-see for everyone- for the faithful, the art lovers, the history lovers and architecture lovers. First the bad: If you would like to tour the inside, the bell-tower and the crypt at ND you have to do them all separately. I was unable to find a tour that covered all 3 and it appears that each of them are managed by a different group. I would recommend booking the bell-tower or the crypt in advance online. I did not do this and was sad to discover a huge line for the bell-tower and that the crypt was closed on the day of our visit. Now the good: The main attraction, inside ND, is easy to see. There was a line but I found that it moved quickly. Also, it's free to get in! I recommend paying the 5 euro for the audio-tour, it has an abundance of info, more than I cared to listen to actually. Also, the audio fee includes the Treasury (otherwise 3 euro) which should not be missed because you get to see the most beautiful treasures up close. I found the gift shop to be expensive but I had collected the tokens from the machines (I think 1 euro each) placed around the outer edge of the cathedral and I sprinkled them with holy water from the large fount. These made nice gifts that traveled home easily. Overall it was a great experience, I found my visit to be truly divine. Helpful hint: they hold a picture ID for the audio guide unit, I was glad I had my driver lisc on me rather than hand over my passport. However, it didn't seem to be an issue for anyone that I could tell.
Beautiful!!! . When we arrived there was a massive queue to get in and I almost did a u-turn but I'm glad I didn't because it was so beautiful inside!!! A must see attraction.
Beautiful history . Amazing to walk the same grounds, and stand in the same church as they did in the 1100's. It's a quick must do while in Paris.

Beautiful. The Notre Dame Cathedral, in Gothic style, is one of the greatest in Europe and one of the best known . Located in the Ille de la Cité, it is usually very busy. The cathedral entrance is free but guided tour payed!

Amazing!!!. I arrived around lunch time and was able to go straight into the cathedral. The architecture and intricate glass work was amazing! I would definitely recommend going to the museum that is located underneath the cathedral, it was really interesting.

Must See Cathedral. Notre Dame is one of the must see sights in Paris due to it's history and signifance.. It is an active church so sensitivity to worshipers is necessary. If you speak too loudly the staff will ask you to be quieter. You can purchase a map from a vending machine for 2 euros. The audio guide was helpful and allows you to get into the treasury for free. Please note that free admission to the treasury is one per each audio guide. The staff was not very friendly or helpful. If you want to climb the steps to the bell tower, you will probably want to line up early as the line can be long.

Breathtaking. This is a beautiful cathedral and a must-do while in Paris. London has Westminster Abbey and St. Paul's, and Paris has Notre Dame. Be sure to stop by and get the audio guide, it's very beautiful.

Piece of French History . This is a simply amazing place and with its extraordinary stain glass windows this is a beautiful place. Personally we liked better that St Pauls Cathedral at the Vatican. We opted for the 5Euro audio tour, well worth it with plenty of information and the development of this church over so many generations. Thoroughly recommend this and a must see.

A spiritual lift. I was transported by my visit to Notre Dame, which coincided with Sunday mass. The sung mass was a thing of almost indescribable beauty and I felt privileged to witness it. The clouds of incense, the priests in their splendour and the singing of the congregation all combined to make my visit so much more wonderful than it would have been at any other time. The cathedral itself is a beautiful and graceful jewel in Paris' crown. I just loved it.

The towers are nice, but if on a budget or not able to do stairs, the Cathedral itself is great. Quasimodo fans will want to pay to climb the tower, some will want to pay to see the Treasury, but for free you can stroll about one the the most impressive buildings in the world. There is a exhibition with the history of the Cathedral for the history buffs. Take the RER or metro to the Ile de Cite, and walk to the south east corner of the island. ANd after your visit, cross the Seine and walk down to fully appreciate how magnificent the exterior is, as well.

Gorgeous. Before now, I have only seen photos of this beautiful cathedral, but it certainly didn't do it justice when I saw it in real life. The most amazing architecture I have ever seen. The flying buttresses are so amazing. This is a true treasure not to be missed. Be sure to get there early in the morning..the lines to get in are VERY long.

Famous Cathedral. If you love churches, stained glass, grand ceilings, precious art, beautiful paintings you must visit this beautiful church. It is quite dark on the inside but when the sun is in the right place coming through the stained glass windows you will be rewarded with an awesome sight. You can also go to the top of the towers for a fee but because only so many can go up at one time the queue can be quite long.

A classic church. We have visited this church before by ourselves, but this time we had a guide. She pointed out several items which we hadn't known about, which were quite interesting. Probably due to the high Seine river, we lost power in the church and had to leave early.
A Majestic Cathedral. A must visit and a to do for a tourist. Entry is free but you would appreciate the Cathedral when you look at it and when your also inside.

Not to miss!. We were in Paris during the record rain (and floods). Maybe that's why the lines were so short! We skipped the tower tour due to the rain - perhaps next time. Very worthwhile - don't think that this is an obligatory stop.
magnificant. Magnificant structure - and great marketing making best use of tourist curiosity for well being of historical structures.
Beautiful. Such a beautiful cathedrale. I went there with some friends on Christmas 2015 too... It was amazing. A very calm and peaceful monument.
Amazing. The Cathedral is located near River Seine, with easy access using the Metro. The art work on the walls and inside the cathedral is amazing

Beautiful cathedral. Visited the cathedral on Sunday to hear the 8.30am mass. It was all in French, but the leaflets that are distributed have translations in English and other languages. The stained glass is beeautiful.

Must Visit in Paris. Its impressive and stunning, and everything I expected it to be. I also love the area surrounding it! Although in Europe its easy to get confused with all the different beautiful churches, after a while it becomes a blur. So maybe start with this one. But definitely take your time to appreciate all the beautiful details. Especially the gargoyles.

Stunning Notre Dame. This is not to be missed if you're travelling to Paris, the architecture is simply magnificent. We had a guided tour tell us the history of the building, it was so interesting finding out everything there is to know about Notre Dame
Notre Dame. This was an amazing experience. Attend mass, if you can. (No kneelers, so the hard floor is an experience!) Beautiful, serene experience. Have been there twice and would love to go again.
The Flying Buttress. A true Parisian treasure,not to be missed. Supported on outside by buttresses which make it so unusual

Awsome!. If you love cathedrals, magnificent works of art, historical importance, or are of the faith - this is a must in your lifetime! It was everything I had hoped and more. Truly a beautiful, magnificent, and holy place.
Breathtaking!. Almost a feeling of nostalgia. A must visit when in Paris! Entrance is free. Architecture and ambience wise was amazing.

Beautiful cathedral. Notre Dame Cathedral is truly breathtaking! Queue to get in was really long, however it moved quickly. We weren't planning on visiting the cathedral so my wife didn't have a top which covered her shoulders, this was an issue but we were waved on through.
Thankfully we were as it truly was stunning! An architectural marvel!
It is Notre Dame. Notre Dame de Paris what else I can add. I think everybody has to visit it at least once or even to be close to cathedral.
Remarkable. Take your time to visit this unbelievable structure. The details are in every nook and cranny. Look beyond the obvious to enjoy the artistry and workmanship from bygone eras.

Been there done that. Everyone said this is not to be missed Just because you're in Paris, you must try to stop by Notre Dame. Just because of its historical symbolism, you must wait 45 min. or longer to get inside to walk through and marvel at the architecture and decadent design of this church. I'm glad we had time to see it as I would never feel the need to go back. In my opinion, especially if you have limited time in Paris, skip this place.
Of course, amazing. Be there before they open and beat the hoards of tourists. The peace is worth it.It is truly amazing!

Just another tourist attraction, but an impressive one.. Like the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre, if you've never been to Paris or will probably never go there again, I guess you'll have to see it. For myself, I hate going to places frequented by hoardes of tourists.

THE cathedral. Well, I assume almost everyone is familiar with the front picture of this cathedral. However, one needs to be in front of it, to see its true greatness and incredible architecture. Be aware that normally is a huge crowd expecting at the entrance (the entrance is free). I would also recommend visiting the treasury (although all objects are after the French revolution, but this is the case for most of the arts objects available in churches). Be aware also in case you want to visit the towers (the stairs are extremely narrow and there are are about 400 steps).

Another must see in Paris!. Well, this is another must do in Paris. If your healthy enough, climb the stairs ALL the way up to the bell towers and then all the way up the bell towers. I have RA and made it, but it was VERY challenging. This costs a few Euros, but is well worth it. We were there during Pentecost and up at the second level even with the base of the bell towers when the bells were rung and it was amazing!!! We had scheduled a 2 hour visit, but wound up spending 4 hours and could have made it another 2. The cathedral is amazing and fascinating inside as well. There is an area where you can pay 5 Euros and see some of the artifacts held by the church. They hold several passion relics including part of the nails and cross and the crown of thorns. There was a service going on for Pentecost, but the church was still open to visitors.
Brilliant Architecture. Shouldn't miss this place. It is famous Gothic cathedrals in France. I visited Notre Dame twice!! Best time to visit is in the evening.

An icon . . . recognized around the world.. Regardless of your religious beliefs, Notre Dame Cathedral is worth the time to stand before it and within the walls of its beautiful façade. The back is as beautiful as the front. Notre Dame is an icon recognized around the world.You can almost feel the history that has occur here as you walk the interior. The experience is like many you can have in Paris . . . it's like stepping back in time.In my opinion, you do yourself a favor by making time to visit Notre Dame Cathedral.

Loved all the gargoyles!. While visiting the Eiffel Tower, we discovered that we were very close to Notre Dame. So glad we decided to jaunt down and explore. Just taking in all the gargoyles is worth the trip.

Amazing place, long lines, eat lunch in the garden. Some tips:-- Get there early. The line is very long. It only took about 20 minutes but get there early to reduce stress.-- It's free! But please make a donation :)-- Apparently there is an extra charge to go in the towers. I couldn't find it.-- Hire a guide. We didn't and regretted it.-- There is a park behind the church next to the river. It has a playground for kids, free wifi and plenty of park benches. Grab sandwiches and hang out in the park -- esp if you have little kids. Nice to eat and look up and this great building that most people just pass through.

A symbol of Paris. It is very easy to visit Notre Dame, the entry queues move fast and the church is beautiful inside with large stained glass windows. It would also be worthwhile to go to the top and see the famed gargoyles, there is a fee of around 9 Euros and 400 steps to consider and the queues are long and slow moving. Not recommended if you are short of time but probably worth the time investment. Additionally there is also the crypt where you can explore many other facets of Paris

My Favorite Place- Notre Dame Catheral. A moment to take yourself and pray in a magnificent surrounding and architecture. We stopped there every time when we visit Paris as it is really a nice historical of the religion era.

You've read about it, so you have to see it -- and it's free. It's steeped in history (over 850 years old) and uniquely spectacular (just imagine the what it took to build this thing using mostly hammer and chisel). But, read up on its history before you go - it'll make the visit much more interesting. The queues tend to be long during peak hours, so try to visit it in the morning, when the crowds are smaller.My recommendation is not to take the tower climb; the waiting times are long, and except for a nice view of Paris from a height, there is not much to see. If you want to see Paris from "above" go either to Montmartre or take the escalators up to the top of the Centre Pompidou (both are free).

Pure magic. My visit to the Notre Dame Cathedral was on a day when it was cold and rainy outside. It was wonderful to sit for a few hours to stay dry and soak up the history, the amazing Architecture and overall brilliance of this magnificent church.

Great views from the top. Here's what we did: We got up early, ate breakfast at a place right across from where you line up for the towers. We had a window view of the line, used their bathroom, and when we saw a few people start the line, we joined them. Glad we did. The line went around the block. About 20 mins or so before they open, about 3 or 4 people come to set up. They take this job seriously. One guy, really I think he was a sweetie at heart, liked to bark orders to the line to 'go back' and this is difficult because the half mile of line behind you isn't sure why everyone is coming their way. But this MUST be done, before anything else is done. They take about 20 people at a time into the tower. We were in the first group. They take you up circular stairs (which you will soon learn to hate) into a gift shop and ticket processing area. Don't make the mistake that I did...I thought the tour would come back through the gift shop and it would save me carrying things. The tour DOES NOT go back through the gift shop, you exit from out of the tower on the other side of the building. When the guide is ready, they take you up more circular stairs, it is not very wide, and just barely will let another person go past you, if you are a bit out of breath - read not in shape.) You go to the first outside level, which is where the famous sad or bored, depending on your interpretation, gargoyle is located. Hint - each level has fencing (I suppose for jumpers or people throwing things) and you have to plan your photos carefully. I found that putting my lens right up to the fencing and centering it over a hole turned out the best. It all depends on your camera and how picky you are in taking pictures. This is a good place to rest up a bit, because, yes, you guessed it, there are more stairs. You go up to another level. Note - it is pretty windy up there. This level is more or less single file, around the loop and then you head back down when the guide tells you. So how it works is when you are on the first level, they bring in another 20 people, so if you are at the end of the long line outside, you have a long wait. Get there early and I am not taking 15 mins. We went at least an hour and 20 mins early to eat and be ready for 'the line'.

If we chose religions based on their house of worship, I'd be Catholic. Incredible to think what they did without modern machinery. Worth the trip. Also there is an amazing bakery outside the cathedral where they make bread from scratch and bake in front of you and sell for pennies.

Well worth visiting. The stain glass windows were outstanding. The only real issue is that you could not view the main alter area which would have been interesting to see based on what you could see which was very good. You need to pay to go to the top for an outstanding view.

Complete disappointment - herded through the path like cattle.. Of course it's a beautiful and famous old building. But having quietly enjoyed a visit to St Paul's in London a few days earlier, was appalled by the access to Notre Dame. Interior space roped off, so all one could do was be herded along a circle around the outside walls of the cathedral, only occasionally catching a glimpse of the beautiful church when finding a small space away from the masses of people. The set up is clearly "so you can say you've been there". Would not return other than in a skip the lines private tour. Otherwise spend a few minutes on the plaza outside and move on.

Enjoyable. Most cathedrals kind of blur into one if you've seen enough of them, but I really enjoyed this one. I probably enjoyed it however.... Simply because it's featured in a Disney movie!! I don't know a lot about architecture and we didn't spend enough time there but I was blown away by some of the sculptures and the height of the main cathedral when you go inside... It's breathtaking!!

watch out for fake gypsies who will rob you. many women who looked like gypsies with gold tooth. they will ask if you are tourist or not. speak english or not. but DONT BOTHER THEM. its a distraction for tourist and they will come in many to take your wallet. usually they come with papers and you will be asked to sign some dumb questions. the cathedral as pictured was GREAT and magnificent. really big entrance. at the plaza in front many tourists taking photos.

Stunning Architecture. Notre Dame is one of the things in Paris that you don't want to miss. Though not my favorite cathedral in Europe, it is immense and historic. Expect a long line to enter throughout most of the day - though if you show up first thing in the morning the line is brief. You can also pay a small fee to climb the tower and view the gargoyles up close. Our friend elected to go up - expect a long line and a difficult climb. The 400 stairs wiped her out for the rest of the day.The cathedral is also worth seeking out after sunset. The lights give it a completely different look - there are nearby cafes where you can sit and contemplate the amazing craftsmen who constructed the building using only hand-tools.Not to be missed!

Jaw dropping beauty . An amazing ambience and beauty encapsulated within this building. The detail and colours of the stained glass windows are breathtaking. Not much to be said in comparison to being there experiencing the real thing.

A Paris must see!. Don't let the long line out front for free entry deter you, it moves extremely fast. There is a separate line for climbing the towers which costs money. Spend some time outside looking at this beautiful cathedral, it's as amazing as the inside.

Go Early, beat the crowds. Almost all first time tourists flock to Notre Dame, and it is beautiful, especially the windows which are easy to photograph now with cell phones.Big WARNING, where ever lots of tourists are also are pick pocket. . Do not be distracted, If you are with a group, pay attention to your tourist guide, he or she will get you in and out of the cathedral faster, and safer. If solo, try to go in with a group if possible. Be aware, keep personal items out of sight like cameras, cell phones, try not to carry purses, bags that are open. We got with a group who had an English speaking guide, and learned a lot from her. Walking around with open maps distracts you from being safe. Be aware, be safe

Beautiful . We toured the cathedral with its classic gothic architecture. Afterwards, we lined up (for approximately 45 minutes) for the tour of the belfry and towers. The views of Paris are amazing and it was well worth it! Kids under 18 are free, adults 10 euro for the towers.

Not as big as you think!. What we could see of the outside was fantastic but 2 hour ques stopped us going in. We didn't have time to wait. 2 Min walk from cluney station and loads of places to eat at a reasonable price.

Go Early. The Notre Dame is breathtaking and a must see when in Paris, because of heightened security the lines to go in are very long, I recommend going early in the morning to avoid the long wait times.

awe inspiring. The queue to get looked long but we got after only 10 mins as the security were vbag checking only, one you obtain entry just take your time to take in the beautiful artwork of the stained glass windows and the history behind them. The vist could take anything from 1 hour to 4 hours depending on what you want to see.We had time for some quiet reflection aswell as the tourist time and spent a couple of hours in the place, the best bit was that there was no entrance fee but donations are invited.

Amazing cathedral although not the best of Europe. Its more famous for its history rather than anything else. There are prettier and bigger cathedrals in the whole of Europe. This is more famous for its history though undoubtedly it has brilliant architecture. Its construction started somewhere around the year 1100 and was built in phases and finally got completed somewhere around 1700. You should visit it if you have come to paris.

Just beautiful!. We were very fortunate with the timing of our visit, with virtually no wait required to enter. The interior of the Cathedral is awesome, with beautiful stained glass windows. The requirement for silence makes for a very pleasant experience. There is a fairly straightforward route through the cathedral that everyone follows, which streamlines the visit. Another of the 'must-do' attractions in Paris.

Amazing French Gothic Architecture. One of the Medieval Gothic Cathedrals. The significant features are the intricate art work, stained glass and gargoyles which all contributed greatly to the grandeur of the place. Free entrance to go inside the church. In the event that you wish to climb the tower, there is a fee for this attraction as it gives you one of the best views in Paris.Also, Seats are provided outside the cathedral so that you can enjoy the beauty of the building. The location is near the River Seine and truly a nice attraction inside out whether in the morning or night time.This is a must see place.

The highlight of our trip. The cathedral is one of the most beautiful I have seen, but do yourself a favor and go up the towers. It is a bit of a climb, but the view is second to none. If the hunchback had to regularly climb these stairs, he should be referred to as QUADsimodo as opposed to Quasimodo:-)

Stunning. Notre Damn is one of my favourite buildings in Paris. The Gothic architecture and the beautiful stained glass windows inside make it a must see for anyone visiting Paris for the first time. It is centrally located and on the bus stop for all tours. We didn't have to queue at all before going inside, and once in we wandered around for a good 20 minutes before leaving. There's lot of lovely little cafes close by and although the area is obviously very touristy, it's definitely worth a visit.
Yes. It is that unbelievable.. Yes, you must go in side. Yes, it is worth it and we aren't even Catholic! Beautiful architecture and you can literally feel the history!

Charming but crowded. I am not much familiar with different architectures. For us many cathedrals in Rome looked much more majestic and magnificent. Still it felt nice to pay a visit to this cathedral. It has got gothic architecture with stained glasses all over. But you need to wait in long queue to get in and even inside it was very crowded with many tourists.

The best is it's free. It's free, that's a huge plus. You'd feel like you'd been robbed if you had to pay any substantial amount to get in.It's not as good as the Sacre Coeur, it's been significantly rebuilt in the last 200 years. If your an American that's old, if your a European, you probably have churches more original in any major city nearby. If you are English and have been to York Minster or St Pauls, this is going to look like someone built a bad gothic church from a faded picture. If you are Spanish, this will just be embarrassing.The audio tour was pretty useless.Go to one of the many other churches in Paris and skip the queues. Better still visit a local historic cathedral and marvel at its original featuresIf you go, visit the treasury, it's the only really interesting part of the church

Beautiful. We visited the inside of the Cathedral one day and then climbed to the top the next day. The line getting inside was long but moved quickly. The line to climb to the top was long and moved slowly. Get there early, before 9, the Paris Pass does not allow you to skip this line. The wait is worth the sight.

This is a glorious place. Your heart gets filled up just walking around, absorbing the place. Don't miss the Jeanne d' Arc chapel or the chance to just sit and contemplate. (Please respect the place and the other visitors and don't even think about using a flash - it doesn't help anyways - you are too far away from the focus for a flash to make a difference.)
worth the look. Not just another church here folks, get in and have a look. The stained glass windows and fantastic and the architecture outstanding.

The detail on the building is unreal. No cost to go in. This is one of my favorite places. The detail just on the outside of the building is incredible. To think all of that carving was done back then is unreal. The line looks long, but it moves very fast. There is no cost to get in and walk through. If you are in a hurry, just across the street is a sho that does sell skip the line passes and tour if you want. No flash pictures inside.

Great historical visit. Me and my husband had visited this Cathedral after getting off a boat tour we captured a few pictures while on the boat and outside but we're not allowed to take pictures inside it is definitely a must see while in Paris it is amazing and stunning inside, the architecture is breathtaking.

So beautiful . This was the first and only time I have ever visited here and I must say it is such a wonderful and beautiful building and the structure is unreal and it is so beautiful and it's unreal to think that this building had been around so long and it still looks so beautiful and a piece of history you have to visit at least once in your life.

Spectacular grandour. Free, but there will be a line. Very cool to tour one of the great Cathedrals of Europe. They have interactive video monitors where you can watch the building stages and see the city change around it, which made it evenmore interesting.

Climb to the top. Notre Dame is a beautiful church steeped in history. We were fortunate to walk through while the choir was practicing and gorgeous music filled the cathedral. I'd also recommend waiting in line to walk up to the viewing areas outside. I believe it is between 300 and 400 stairs, but there is no rush if you need to take breaks. The views of Paris are wonderful from this central point. You also can appreciate the architecture of the cathedral itself by seeing the exterior up close. Not to mention the ever interesting gargoyles.

Beautiful and crowded. The inside is beautiful, especially the windows and it's free. There's a small ode to the hunchback of notre dome outside on the left of the cathedral but you may not be able to find it it's so small.

Stunning and a must see. Line looked long but it's not, no flash photography or selfie sticks or hats permitted, mass was occurring while we were there and the church smell was fantastic. It was so beautiful, the history is insane, NO BATHROOMS, I had to use the parking lot between 2 cars and apparently so have countless people, the smell was outrageous but they deserve it for not having working bathrooms, the restaurant makes you pay to use bathroom and didn't allow we to take all the left overs with us back on the train but I made them find a way, and those same girls with their pads trying to rob people (me) at the Eiffel Tower were outside the church too, the same ones who almost robbed me tried to get my 18 year old son but this time I chased her off and embarrassed her in front of all. The church is free and breath taking just be careful.
Always impressive. . Over the years I have been to Notre dame 5 times. I always find it special in many ways. The size and beauty is overwhelming.

good for an hour or so. Notre Dame is centrally located and the area is very good for walking.. The cathedral had hardly a queue and we did not have to jostle for crowds as well.. The interiors are quite pleasing to the eye and overall it was an hour well spent..
Very nice and big . A very impressive church with huge areas. Be ready to stand in line and go through massive security even if it goes quite fast.
Notre Dame. Wonderful place to visit. Loved the stained glasses and the architecture. Be prepared for the extremly long queu.

Always Beutiful!. Every time I have come here I enjoy seeing this magnificent structure. And each time it seems that there is something cool going on in the lot next door. This time it was a Bread competition, yum! Anyway, Norte Dame is one of those DO NOT MISS tourist venues of Paris.
Nice place to visit/pray. I traveled here with a group, so the reason we went here was for the sight. It is a great place to pray as it is very quiet and relaxing. It is huge and beautiful.

Amazing. I have visited many European churches, however, the vastness of Notre Dame is breath taking. Make sure you visit the bell tower and the museum inside, although it cost to see the museum, it is well worth it. I also attended confession in the ornate building.

Must visit. WOWWWWWWW!!!!I have visited Paris ove 50 times and never bothered to go inside the Notre DameThis time, I decided to go in and well well well!!! What a revelation- every step was steep in history. Now, though I have seen it all, next time I am in town I sure will not miss it for anything. Even if you are not religious it is still worth visiting. Too good to miss

"Our Lady of Paris: Finest example of Gothic architecture". It is to be seen to believe. A massive church with imposing facade, chimera statues, rose=painted tinted windows, wooden altars and treasury of rare artifacts, this is one not to be missed places in Paris. Was lucky to enter when a ceremony was in progress. Felt totally transported to medieval world!

The Outside is the Show. Notre Dame Cathedral is a Paris must-see. However, even though admission is free, the main features are outside the building and can be seen without standing in line to get inside. The famous flying buttresses are in plain view and the interesting stories the icons tell around the front triple entrance can be seen without standing in line. The interior is pretty plain.

mixed blessings. Cathedrals don't come more gothic than this, known the world over, its reputation is well deserved, with its 200ft twin towers that for a fee you can climb to the top for an outstanding view of the city, interior is just "awesome", with its gargoyles and stained glass windows, you find yourself looking around for the famous "hunchback" of Victor Hugo!! it has a special place on the island in the middle of the Seine, and to do it justice make sure of a guide and plenty of time!

A moving experience. I visited Notre Dame on a Sunday and felt privileged to be able to attend a service with the huge congregation - although I could not understand everything that was said I got the gist of it, and the program included some information in several languages. The music and singing was wonderful to experience, and the historical significance of the building is a major point of interest. Visitors are able to wander freely around the building and inspect the artefacts and architectural features.

Breathtaking. Notre Dame Cathedral is stunning. The high ceilings, rose windows, flying buttresses, and incredible architecture is breathtaking.
For an extra special touch, you can climb the stairs and be eye to eye with the gargoyles not to mention a beautiful view of Paris . A must see!
Notre Dame. Great a must when in Paris, climbed the bell tower, bells rung while there. Views are great and inside is awe inspiring.

A nice Cathedral. Is is quite in the centre of the city and nice place to visit, as all tourist attractions has a long line. Inside it is huge and grand and look very pretty. We can also sit inside and pray for some time , it is quite peaceful and quite there.The glass ceilings and walls are really good. A place one must visit when in Paris.

Haunting . Inning up gives you a chance to few the outside facade. Amazing carvings and sculptures cover the outside. Inside is haunting with the church being finely lite. There are many tombs, paintings and sculptures with interesting histories. Worth having a guide who can walk you through.
Amazing Church. I'm always interested in visiting churches in Europe mostly because I'm fascinated by the architecture...And this one in the heart of Paris didn't disappoint at all!!
Must see. A place of good architecture. A place of peace and serenity Recommended that spend at least 45 mins to one hour .Must be visited while in paris

Take your time to appreciate this place. September is a good time to visit because there are not too many tourist and it wasn't too crowded inside the cathedral. Unfortunately, my time in Paris was limited so I had to quickly walk around the cathedral and be off to another place. The evening mass was on when I was there and it was peaceful. If I had more time, I would have sat there longer to enjoy the mass. If I had more time, I would have went upstairs and behind the cathedral. I would definitely return to explore the entire cathedral.

Un lugar para la Reflexión. A place for reflection. No olvides compra tus monedas conmemorativas ya bendecidas, se encuentran a la izquierda al fondo de la iglesiaDo not forget to buy your commemorative coins and blessed , are left at the back of the church

Paris Landmark. It's a landmark cathedral. My wife is catholic, so it helped understand the significance of many of the statues and other aspects of the cathedral. Of course it was crowded, but manageable. I found the audio devices of some value, but the numerical locations on the floorpan didn't line up with the recordings as well as you would expect which was a distraction. It's worth the effort to see.

Extraordinary cathedral! A must see if you are in Paris.. The history of this cathedral is amazing. The building started in 943. Hard to believe but true. A beautiful mass was being held as we walked through amazing structure. The big surprise is it is FREE to go inside. Definitely worth making time to visit.

Humbling experience . Went to this beautiful landmark and it was so worth being there. It is humbling to see the beautiful glass and architectural beauty. You also feel the presence of the higher power, if you are a believer. Walking thru it's like dejavu. Seeing it in so many movies and references in was like walking to a place you have been before. It was breathtaking. A must go when in Paris.

Peaceful Place . It's been a few years since we last visited Notre Dame, but this place never fails to engulf me with a deep feeling of peace. This historic cathedral is available to visit with no admission charges (makes a change in this day and age). The stained glass windows are stunning. Take moment to light a candle and say a prayer and allow that warm feeling of peace wash over you. Norte Dame is sited on the banks of the river Seine.

Notre Dame. Visited here as part of a guided tour which included Ile de la Cité and the towers. You do not have to pay for entry unless you want to access the towers which is a seperate entrance. Queue can be up to four hours for the towers so would advise people to book a skip the queue tour.Queue into Notre Dame itself took us around 10minutes at 11am but was much longer when we were leaving at 13.00. This queue is for a security check so unavoidable. I wouldn't bother with a tour if not going to the towers. Some lovely stained glass windows and interesting architecture. Neither of us are religious, but obviously remained respectful of rules such as no flash photography, noise, etc. Quite a lot of people had come to pray. It's a 15minute walk to The Louvre so would be a good idea to plan these tours for the same day.

Another European Church. Europe is so full of church's, some big, some small, some boring and some literally gold plated. This one is big but not as grand as like Westminster Abby. Crowded, watch for pick pockets, lines to get in, go see something else if you don't have a lot of time.

Beautiful church. It is a beautiful church, it is interesting even for young kids. It is free entrance and it is actually perfect for a rainy day in Paris. It is not packed and the surrounding area is actually great. You can check the other church that is 5 minutes from Notre Dame, equally beautiful as Notre Dame.
Free and easy to get to. We enjoyed our visit here. It felt safe, although there are beggars around, which you will find around most places in Europe.
Gorgeous. The Notre Dame Cathedral is absolutely stunning and free to visit. Please plan to be as quiet as possible as there can be services on progress.

Praise be!. One of the only times I've been speechless inside a building. Glorious interior and free on the Museum Pass. However, I really enjoyed the gardens behind the cathedral as much as the interior :) #protip
Lovely experience . Came with my 9 year old son as part of a bus tour. The cathedral is free to enter, but you can make donations while inside. Took some lovely pictures. Definitely worth a visit.

One of the best Gothic. It's one of the best of the world's major Gothic cathedrals. A must-see. Your walk through Paris starts from here and goes up to the arc de triumphe. Do not miss a visit to this place.

Service worth attending. As it was Easter we decided to attend the Easter Sunday service. We were able to appreciate the cathedral being used as it is meant to be HOWEVER they should not allow tourists to enter while a service is in progress. These people were extremely rude, talking during the mass and taking photos of the priests during communion!

Breathtaking!. You can go here without a guide but I highly recommend purchasing the audio tour so you understand each part of the cathedral. When you arrive and look up at this beautiful building it just takes your breath away....it's so intricately designed. The inside of the cathedral is like nothing like you have ever seen. But like many of the old cathedrals it is darker so the audio tour will help you maneuver the space more easily. This classic and well known cathedral is well worth the trip.

Everyone must visit Norte Dame. . It is worth the wait. Expect long lines and French tours. This is a French national treasure so don't expect English. The history and architecture are spectacular so just relax and enjoy, especially in the French language
Beautiful. What an amazing Cathedral. The architecture is unreal especially when you consider how old it is. Take some time to just sit and reflect. Truly special place
Love it. In summer this place is busy with tourists. But it did not take very long to queue and enter the cathedral.
must see. i have been there many times and it's always amazing! the building will leave in awe!! the architecture, the size and the atmosphere will please you!!!
Historical cathederal. This Cathederal is beautiful with so much history within. It is also a free attraction. Remember to be quiet - they remind you often!
Breath Taking. One of the most beautiful places. A must see when in Paris. Love the quiet as one walks through this church.

Breathtaking. Even though I am not catholic there was something spiritually moving when entering this church. The enormity of the church as well as the architecture was breathtaking. A must do visit to Paris.

Great history . Had a private guide (Agathe) booked through Viator. The tour consisted of Notre Dame cathedral, the Sainte Chapelle and the conciergerie.so much history in such a short walk. The cathedral was speculation, Sainte Chapelle was over the top beautiful, and the conciergerie was most interesting. Without Agathe we would have missed so much.
Sunday. Went early Sunday so not too many people. Wonderful music and quieter as the Mass was being held. An awe inspiring building with interesting time line panels on the north side of the altar.

Good historical attraction. a big historical church and great
crowded and quiet to visit
i love this place and like to walk for 4-5 hours and enjoy
Beauty and a must see. Entrance to this is free, optional headphone for cost. The architecture is amazing - I was in awe of everything I saw. Sculpture, painting, stained glass and much more.
A must see of a magnificent cathedral. This one of the most stunning cathedrals I have ever visited, with its history and magnificent stained glass windows you can not pass it up.
What's not to like?. This is a must see. It's free to enter and while the line looks horrible, it moves fast and we were in after 15 min. wait. Beautiful monument.
great view from paris. it's a really long wait to go to the top of the cathedral, and then there are a lot of stairs. but it really worth it. the view is awesome.

A must see!. This is a beautiful church and is FREE to visit so you might as well go see an amazing place when in Paris! Seeing the inside and remembering that this was built in a time without a lot of modern tools and how stunning everything was inside was phenomenal! It wasn't overly busy during the week when we went but I assume it would be packed on the weekends. Definitely make some time for Notre Dame!
Incredible. Rick Steves to the rescue! His podcast and map helped guide us on a great visit to this incredible church. Glad we took the time to really take in the exterior...so many stories to tell.

Perhaps a bit over-hyped. I find that some cathedrals in Europe are outstanding. For some reason, Notre Dame left me a little flat. It is big, yes, and with the throngs of people, it does not have the awe inspiring flavor of others.
Must See. Take your time, go slow, utilize the personal audio tour, and take mass if you are comfortable and can "time" it properly.
Lovely. Nice to visit and you can do a tour. Expect to queue to get in. Audio tours available for a small fee. Entry is free but donations for candles required.

Best historical site in Paris.. We visited and really loved it, not to many tourists, line was short to get in, once inside you see why it took 850 years of constant building, simply takes your breath away, though the loud speakers that boom out shhh, silence is quite humorous, this really is a worthwhile place to visit.

Absolutely gorgeous. was blown away when we saw Notre Dame...the first time there was a service going on, and there was singing. The next time was when we attended a symphony. It was absolutely beautiful.

Make the climb to the top. Be a trill seeker here and climb the stairs, grab shots of the square and the city from the top of the Cathedral. Notre Dame is full of history and stories. the location is close to other big attractions and it will be crowded. So take the time to soak it in and look across Paris.

France May 2016. Very awe inspiring, read about the history before you go so you can appreciate all that it holds and how much labor and effort went into it. The lines are kind of long but they moved fast
Spectacular . Having done the tour three years ago we didn't go in but just enjoyed the ambiance out side. Iconic view of the two towers. Perfect for that selfie!

Exquisite Notre Dame Cathedral. On a previous trip having seen the cathedral from the river, we definitely wanted to see the inside. We decided we would go early morning. This was perfect timing, around 10am the queue was not very long at all and within 15 mins we were inside. Quite breath taking. Take time to study the magnificent stained glass window. The various small prayer alters, the story boards are very informative and very interesting to read. We were incredible lucky to hear the choir practice. It would be unfair to detail all for you as would spoil your visit. Suffice to say, it is must do when in Paris. Do not be put off by the queue, as it moves very quickly, one way in, one out. But you can spend as long or as little you wish.
Amazing . Chapel is amazing , go light a candle do the climb on the roofs well worth the wait , see the bells and all the ornate decorations
A stunning monument . The Paris Notre Dame is spectacular - don't miss it. Its free entry but the crowds are not too bad. Make sure you look up.

A Divine experience. Notre Dame Cathedral is an iconic place to worship and visit. Its so peaceful and relaxing while you enter the place. The security is outstanding and keeps off the noisy crowd. Recommended to visit during Paris travel.
Must see in Paris . This is a free entry amazing site to visit, take your time and really look around and enjoy the sight and history. Wear comfortable shoes

Gothic Experience: notre dame. Line going inside the Cathedral doesnt take too long, approximately 10mins wait maximum...but this was on a weekday. Place to see if youre into art, culture and history.

Religious, spiritual, or neither, Notre-Dame is worth the visit.. I'm not a religious person, but I did feel intense inspiration and wonder as I experienced Notre-Dame. The statues and stunning stained glass had me in awe, and the grandeur of the gothic architecture took my breath away. It was, in a way, a spiritual experience for this nonspiritual person. I recommend getting there at 7:30 am (they open at 7:45) and waiting to get in. The queue wasn't long at this time, but words can not express the experience of the first hour, of being in this amazing building with only about 10 or 20 other people, walking the vast halls and viewing each chapel in relative privacy, before the crowds get there at 9. Also, on the Monday I visited, there was a service that began at 8 and hearing it as you stroll through the cathedral just seemed to add something to it. A highly recommended experience when you visit Paris.

Beautiful church. The architecture is nice and the interior is much impressive than the exterior as the stain glass inside the church is really beautiful. However, If i were to compare strasbourg cathedral to notre dame cathedral in Paris. Strasbourg cathedral leads in terms of architecture. Nevertheless it is still a recommended place to visit. If you happen to visit the site, dont forget to look out for the POINT Zero, which is located outside on the church ground.
Top of the list. You must see this cathedral while in Paris. Amazing art, breathtaking sight. Entry is free. Plan for some extra time for queuing.

Beautiful Cathedral!!!. We visited the Cathedral as part of our Insight Tour. They scheduled a knowledgeable young man to guide us though. It was late morning when we were there and very crowded. However, this was a memorable experience, very interesting & Oh So BEAUTIFUL!!!
Humbling. Beautiful. Even if lines appear long get in line. They move fast and it's one of the must see structures in Paris. Placards give details but it's best do go with audio or guide.

Incredible Building in History. A free tour to see one of the greatest buildings ever built. The story inside of the many years as to how the building was built with what we would call primitive means is fascinating. A must visit.
Peaceful. Went here every night the few days I was in Paris--it's calm, peaceful, and beautiful. Make sure to go and spend at least a half hour there.

Incountournable. N'oubliez pas de monter sur les tours à gauche de l'entrée, vue magnifique sur les gargouilles et Paris.Do not forget to climb up the towers at your left when in front of the main gate !
Absolute must see!. This is one of the highlights of Paris. Even was able to take in a mass here on Sunday morning and really enjoyed it

Best View of Paris. Notre Dame is a wonderful old site in Paris, almost a popular as the Eiffel Tower. Everyone goes there and tromps through the dark interior and just marches right back out again.The most fun part of the cathedral is climbing the tower, past all the famous and very photographable gargoyles, past Quasimodo's bells, to sit on the ROOF !!!!!!! and just take in the wonderful gandeur of Paris from the perspective of the island in the Seine. Do not miss this little bit of holiday exercise to take in this huge chance to have such a unique perspective on this great city

Notre Dame Impressive. Long line that didnt take long to get through. Lots of security around. Armed soldiers which although necessary are a bit concerning as if there was any problem in that crowd and they started using guns there would be chaos. Building itself was impressive and informative. A must see while in Paris

WOW. First of all, I'm not into churches at all but how can you not love this building? Probably the only tour in Paris that was free. It was odd that there was a church service while we were walking through and even worse, many people (walking around) were talking. I guess they didn't see all the signs posted stating to be silent.

Majestic . Notre Dame is steeped in history and is understandably a tourist destination when in Paris. Take your time and enjoy the architecture as well as the interior features. It's a unique Cathedral and worth checking out.
Notre Dame. A must see. It only takes an hour or so to tour the cathedral so you can plan other attractions to visit in same day.

Beautiful. Very nice day visiting Notre Dame we did not have to line up on a Saturday morning. The cathedral is spectacular, quite dark inside no entry fee. We did not go up the tower the line was long for this however. We were lucky to see a bread baking event on outside the cathedral.
Awesome cathedral. Absolutely the most beautiful cathedral I've ever been in! Stained glass & architecture was unbelievable. They. We're saying mass and the choir was singing.......heavenly

A Sacred Beautiful Place - but you can't see Christ's crown of thorns. I really wanted to see the crown of thorns that are housed in this great cathedral, but unfortunately the crown of thorns are stored in a box which is opaque and you can't see them. You can say a silent prayer around them though. You can feel the sanctity of the place. The cathedral itself is spectacular and very sacred. Beautiful stained glass and architecture. We didn't go up to the roof - too many people.

So, so crowded. During our time in France, we visited lots of churches. Notre Dame was, by far, the biggest and most awe-inducing. It is absolutely beautiful and a marvel. It's an icon and very busy. There are SO MANY people. You lose the sense of peace and calm of a place of worship a bit. There are lines to get in the door, lines for the towers, lines to go around in the sanctuary. It's an amazing place so it's expected and justified. Just be prepared!

Long lines but well worth it. We stood in the long line just to enter, best to do so after lunch and before dinner. We did not take the pay tour of the tours, did years ago and probably worth it but not if you have kids under the age of 20 as few will enjoy it. So stand in the line to get in free and then walk about inside, or just sit and marvel at the beauty all around. There were large colorful paintings on exhibition when we went which made it all the more wonderful.
Notre Dame. Most visited monument in France. Gothic - style cathedral is quite simply magnificent. Watch out for the gargoyles

interesting interior, no lines if you skip climbimg the tower. A good guide book will serve you well inside the Cathedral as you try to figure out the significance of the many points of interest.Considerable restoration at back of the altar, but still worth a stop.

Must See in Paris. We only had a few hours in Paris before heading on to Italy but Notre Dame was at the top of our list. It is free to enter the cathedral itself but you do need to pass through security. Line was non-existent when we visited around 4 on May 13th. Inside is as impressive as the outside.

Iconic. Truly worth seeing for its iconic status in French culture and history. In my opinion it isn't one of the most beautiful nor striking cathedrals in the world, but it makes up for that in its feeling of weighty history, of what it's observed and survived.
Beautiful. Wonderful church. Open to the public for Sunday mass. Beautiful services. The architecture on the outside is matched by the stained glass on the inside.
Impressive structure. Impressive structure and church. Does worth a visit once. Lines outside move quite fast so it won't really take you time to enter. Big church with nice architecture.

Always a treat to visit. Went for the 4 th time to visit. Lines not bad took us about 5 min of waiting. Security checks in place this time given recent events. Was rainy so was crowded inside but was good to see the stained glass windows. New exhibit showing the progression of the church Building from 1145 onwards until its completion which is new I think. All in all goo hour or so to spend on a rainy day

Breathtaking. An absolute must for anyone visiting Paris. Entry is free but queues get longer as the day progresses (we had a 15 minute wait despite rains). Museum Pass covers entry to the crypt and the towers, whose entry is from the side of cathedral (but there is a security screening line which was so painfully slow that we were forced to skip that due to time constraints, sad!). Once inside the cathedral, we were amazed at how big it is. You have to be there to believe the scale of this massive construction. Walk about inside the cathedral in silence and admire the artwork. Read up on the history of the building via panels displayed inside. If you have time to do just one attraction in Paris, visit this (yes, even before Eiffel).

A must see Cathedral. I didn't go up the tower as I the lines were long. Cathedral has a great collection. Admire the great stainless glass art. Must see the sculptures. to believe. Would visit again !

Lovely stained glass, amazing roof tour. Well the cathedral is good, lovely stained glass etc. To be honest, they're all pretty similar (apart from the Sagrada Familia in Barcelona, which is something else!). The best part about Notre Dame was the climb up the towers and onto the roof space. Seeing the huge bells, fantastic gargoyles, appreciating the history (having seen the charts of its 900 year development inside the cathedral and recognising some of the original roof shapes) and seeing the amazing view (even in the gloom of a rainy day). If you had asked me in the queue (there are no advance tickets with "skip the line"), I would have said it can't be worth this huge, crawling wait on a wet and dreary day! We nearly gave up. There didn't seem to be many people (? About 50) but it took around an hour as they only let a small group through at a time. However, overall I would say it was worth an hour but maybe not much more unless you had time to hang around.
Just Great!!!. A place you should visit in paris, really impressive arquitecture!!! The inside is good! Definitely a place to visit!!

Mythical... but is it really that beautiful ?.
