All has been said already, so here are our tips:- The site opens at 7:45... so be there at 7:45. arriving past 8:00 will ensure you have queues to enter, a lot of people on the footsteps of the church (not good for photo opps) and you'll miss listening to the 8:00 mass tha is held.- After visiting the inside, make sure to walk all around the church to see the old bells, the backyard gardens, and the south wing.

You must go, but go early. On the must see list for every Paris visitor but if you do not go by mid morning you are likely to be caught waiting to get in.The interior is so different to the Italian over the top approach. Enjoy superb stained glass windows wherever you look.

Beautiful cathedral. It's incredible the work that has been done in the renovation of this beautiful Cathedral. The exterior has been cleaned on it's front facade.There was a line to enter the cathedral, but it moves very fast. They ask you to open your bags, but this measure are common now a days. The interior also looks renovated, with cleaning process, specially of the stained glass.

An absolute delight. Despite the cold morning rain outside the wait was so worth it. Witnessing mass is a humbling experience in such a building and I highly recommend to spend the 5 euro and visit the Treasury which holds some amazing pieces. Overall a great experience that doesn't break the bank with admission.
Remarkable. Great site to see! When visiting, please remeber that this is an active house of worship. Photography and video are allowed but respect is needed.

Beautiful . Even just the outside is breathtaking! As a heads up for summer months, I was wearing a thick strapped tank top and was asked to put my sweatshirt on over top of it, so bring a something to cover up if you plan on going in on a hot day. Inside is also quite the site! All wonderful. Also free to enter.

Go up to the top!. Beautiful church. Not full of great art like in Italy, but the architecture is fascinating - they built it hundreds of years ago! Climb up the stairs (there is usually a queue) to see the great views and the gargoyles up close.
Beautiful architecture. A beautiful cathedral. Easy to enter. Not terribly crowded. Wear good shoes! Take a camera...NO FLASH!!

Too many people in the summer ... it's a winter activity.. Skip this during the tourist season and wait until winter ... the view and silence is better. The mass of people make this feel less than grand and more akin to Disneyland ... and not in the happiest place on earth kinda way.
Impressive. Glad that I went in and viewed this impressive cathedral. It does not take a long time to visit. The lines moved quickly. I especially liked the stained glass.

The mother of all chapels. There's a notre dame in every city of France. This one is the one not to be missedA guided tour from viator and skip the line access to the bell tower 400 steps up and you will be breathless. But the views are breathtaking as well!Once you start the climb up to the bel tower the guide leaves you... but the guided tour of the chapel was great and we got to see the part o jesus crown of thorns!

Wonderful!. We went on Sunday and services were taking place. It was wonderful to walk around and listen to the services at the same time. Notre Dame is beautiful and kept up. We also paid to go up to the tower for the tour. It was priced well and a neat experience. What a view!

Absolutely Magnificient. We went visited early this morning and the views of this Gothic architecture is very gorgeous. Though it does get very touristy around 10 o' clock in the morning, so remember to go early in the morning. It is definitely one of the most notable landmarks in Paris, but it does get too touristy around.

Enjoyed it more than I thought I would. . Before coming I figured that this was just another big church. The security line moved swiftly and I was inside before I knew it. It was definitely visually stunning and worth visiting even for the non religious. Would highly recommend seeing this place.
Beautiful! !. We visited Notre Dame during May 2016. It was so beautiful and big. We didn't go up to the top but I heard you can get a really nice view of Paris from there.

Long Line/Short Wait. Although the lineup to get in always looks long, it's really a quick wait to get inside. This isn't my favourite cathedral in Europe in fact it is one of my least favourites. But it's nice for a quick look around, and possibly light a candle for someone while you're there. It's only 2-5 Euro per candle donation.

Another visit to this amazing Cathedral. . Go there early as have visited many times before and so we didn't have to queue. Inside is beautiful with the architecture amazing and stunning stained glass windows. Just love walking round these beautiful churches of which there are many in Paris. Well worth a visit on your trip to Paris

Lovely. The cathedral itself is lovely but the recording reminding everyone to keep quiet in a dozen or so languages is a bit disturbing. Moreover, coin machines seem to be all over the place and so are the candles for 10 euro a piece.

Get there early!. We got to Notre Dame at about 8:30am and walked straight into the cathedral with no line. We enjoyed the beautiful inside and exited the cathedral to get in line to climb to the top. The top didn't open until 10am and the line began to form way before then. We were in line for about an hour. GET THERE EARLY, especially if you want to climb to the top. It was €8 and the views were AMAZING. We loved every second of it. There was a gorgeous 360 degree view. The climb was a straight up, spiral staircase and we were a bit tired & thirsty so pack a water bottle, especially on a warm day. You are able to climb to 2 different levels for some amazing photos. The climb down messes with your head because it's a straight spiral! So we ended up getting a little dizzy, nothing major though :) Our calves were sore the next day!!! Definitely go up to the top of the cathedral tower (if you're able) you won't regret it, it's well worth the money. BUT, go first thing in the morning!!!!

Fantastic. A must do, the history and feeling there is so amazing. Prepare to be respectful and be quiet. They have a nice display in there of the building phases, that explains the amazing time line of this impressive Cathedral.

Nice Architecture!. We arrived in morning at around 9 am. The queue to cathedral wasn't very long. It was beautiful inside and its really huge! If you enjoy history and architecture, this should be on your list of places to visit in Paris.
A must see. The tower is also nice, but not essential if you're also going to the Eiffel Tower. A beautiful place worth seeing.

Beautiful, but crowded. The cathedral is truly a work of art. Very crowded though. They don't seem to limit the number of entrants. The architecture is incredible, and you can read all about the history of the building and some of the pieces of art. Worth going to if you like beautiful old churches.

Europe's Greatest Cathedral: Free Admission & Photos Welcome. Notre Dame is the most visually impressive cathedral in all of Europe. I have personally been to nearly a dozen of Europe's cathedrals, and while all of them are beautiful... Notre Dame is the tallest, widest, grandest, and with the most impressive stained glass windows. It is certainly worth your time to tour this magnificent example of architecture. To think that these shockingly high ceilings of super-heavy solid stone were constructed with just scaffolding, starting back in the 1200's to 1300's AD... and with no modern cranes to lift and position such heavy objects to such lofty heights... is unimaginable. Another great thing about the Notre Dame Cathedral is that admission is free, and you are welcome to take photos (with or without flash) inside. In contrast, the greatest cathedral of England... Westminster Abbey... charges a whopping $30 per person just to walk inside, and after paying that high fee... any photos are absolutely forbidden. Knowing that makes you appreciate the policy of free admission and photos being welcome at the Notre Dame Cathedral.

Gorgeous. We went on our first day in Paris and joined a short and quick queue outside the cathedral and bought the two euro booklet guide once inside. We also purchased a coin, as they are cheap and awesome souvenirs from every place you go. The inside of the cathedral was absolutely stunning. The detail and colours and the stained glass just had be in awe. Will definitely be returning one day to get a second glance at this amazing historical church and the history of it.
Beautiful Cathedral!. How exciting to see this wonderful cathedral! So many chapels and beautiful artwork inside. Very busy landmark, try to go early in the day.

Notre dame and Sainte chapelle. Are guide Ave was awesome he knows what he talking about good job on city wonders he told us everything we needed to know and more he explain what he could in the short 2h tour we had and he told us a lot of interesting facts on other monuments close by

Well worth our walk... what a beautiful Church.. The inside is very intricate and beautiful...Most churches though I find are.. We walked from the Eiffel tower to the church, a bit of a hike but sat down and enjoyed as a service was taking place.

Simply amazing. The history in building this magnificent building is mind blowing - some 600+ years. The architecture and paintings, sculptures cannot be described here. Entry was by donation which is a far cry from its counterpart in London. Truly remarkable.

A must for a visit!. This place gave me the most thrilling emotions in the town. Semi-darkness, correct musical background, whispering people around, coolness inside opposed to the heat outside plus memories on the history of the Notre Dame Cathedral from historical sources... everything was very exciting and memorable. There is not really much to say, one must see it for himself.And not only the cathedral, the whole Cite island is the absolute germ of Paris.

Once in a lifetime Visit. Is Notre Dame to most spectacular cathedral ever? No. Is i the most lavish? No. But is it a once in a lifetime experience. ABSOLUTELY. There is something magical about entering Notre Dame for the first time. Some a little bit more special, a little bit more holy, a little bit more historic than other churches and cathedrals in France. And if you can take a tour (Viator recommended based on the quality of their quides), then do so. their knowledge will make your visit so much more imactful.

Brilliant! One of the best things about Paris! . The Notre Dame is surely one of the most amazing monuments of Paris! For one it has so much history surrounding it. It looks majestic from the outside, no matter from what distance you view it! The architecture is simply bedazzling! Once you get inside you can see all the splendour that lies there. Each chapel has something distinctive of its own. The cathedral is very big so it might makes sense to spend a couple of hours inside. Not very crowded either. Entry is free.

Wonderful- try and go during mass. I inadvertently attended Notre Dame as Sunday Mass began. Unfortunately my French isn't good enough to have understood everything but the organ was a pleasure to hear and you can sit in a pew and soak up the beauty of the building instead of trawling through the crowds of tourists.

Excellent visit: climb the tower if you can. The closest metro stops are Cite, Hotel de Ville and St Michel, each just a short walk away. I definitely recommend you arrive early, as the lines start early and in the afternoon it becomes too crowded. I arrived at 9AM. When you arrive, the first thing I recommend is that you get in line for the "Tower Climb". The line for that is on the side of the cathedral (the side facing the street). You should be physically able to climb 300 steps, but it is well worth it, you'll get great views of Paris and the bells. If you bought the "Museum Pass", the tower climb is included. After that, you need to get in line again for general admission to view the nave. After you complete your visit, you may also visit the nearby "Deportation Memorial" which is just a short walk away. There is also a nice park behind the cathedral if you would like to sit outside for a bit and if you're lucky, someone will be singing or playing music in the park.
The earlier the better. Amazing cathedral, but can get very crowded and busy with tourists, early morning was the best time to visit.

Stunning. Second time we have visited this Cathedral,but the first time we have ventured in and climbed the towers.May not be the most ornate or original Cathedral we have seen ,but has a very fascinating history and the view from the top is very special.Would recommend using a tour guide for this one ,to really appreciate it, a comprehensive rundown of its history is needed.
Impressive Cathedral. Very Impressive Cathedral. One of my most favourite site in Paris. Arrive there early to avoid the queue.

Outstanding . It was so magical to see this in person! The outside and the inside, just perfect. So majestic and opulent it makes you feel REALLY tiny. For now my favorite stop in Paris. I hope to go back there

Sanctuary!!. The history of Notre Dame Cathedral is extremely interesting and it's well worth the thought of hiring a guide that knows it. This is a church so they request silence inside. At the main altar is one of Michalangelos Pietas and is beautiful. Parts of the cathedral has been restored clean next to parts that are not, leaving it to show what it looked like. Entry is free.

Good timing. We arrived to join a long, but moving, que and were treated to the 12 O'clock bells. Inside the organ was being played and it was just moving in an emotional way. It defiantly was a good time to go.

Only in Person!. You cannot truly experience the splendor and solemnity of this cathedral from photographs. The beautiful windows glow, and the statuary impresses as you view the various tableaus from Christian history and mythology.
Amazing, inside and out. Beautiful architecture, full of history place, you can feel religious power and connection there. Don't miss to see the back of it, very special.

Must do - guide is worth it. We sprang for a guide. It was worth it. She was very knowledgable and made the visit a lot of fun. We were there on a Sunday so services were going on. Take the time to stroll and see the cathedral as an experience and not as a bunch of paintings and statuary and architecture.

Beautiful Cathedral. A visit to Notra Dame is a must, if you are in Paris. On arrival, there was a massive queue outside the cathedral which put me off going in but when I saw how quick the queue went down, I joined without hesitation. It is huge, beautiful and the architecture is amazing, both inside and out, as we were lucky enough to view it from a cruise up the Seine. Not to be missed.

Very incredible architecture. Where is coasimodo? This is a very iconic and incredible building which every visitor to Paris must to visit! Only to be careful of is the queues that can generate before the entrance which visitors must pass before allowing enterance. But in full it is amazing and so huge, to see it is to beleive it!

Morning mass. My wife is the true believer so arriving to the bells and the 10 am mass was very special..But I was blown away with the beauty and the special feeling visitors got..the building itself is stunning and is a must see..if you can do a mass please do...I would rate Notre Dame as one of the special places to visit....Oh and only a 5 minute queue..
Excellent Cathedral. The sheer size will make you look feel very small.Very tall structureVery easily accessible by tour busBig line to enter. Waiting time about 1 hour.

Must see. Do not be deterred by the long lines to enter. They move quickly. Definitely a must see while in Paris. Convenient to the Metro station. Was not up to the "climb" to the towers but understand a terrific view. Good idea to combine with a visit to Sainte-Chapelle a few blocks away.

An Unlucky Choice Of Days. Unfortunately, our trip coincided with a concert scheduled later that evening, so much of the Cathedral was blocked off in anticipation of that event. Nonetheless, no trip to Paris would be complete without a visit to this awesome Cathedral.Other views correctly point out that going on a sunny day has its' advantages (the stained glass comes alive), but again, unlucky choice on our part.The audio guides were absolutely useful, and at $5 Euro each, a bargain.So, pick your day based on the weather (if you can), and enjoy one of Paris' premier sites.

Impressive . I am not religious in any way but I can appreciate what went into building a building like this back in those times. Very impressive.Entrance is free. There was some religious ceremony being held while we were there but it all part of the atmosphere I guess. The stained glass windows are huge!! Some queuing involved but that expected.
Amazing. Short vist, concert - when ever. I experienced an amazing evening concert in the Cathedral. It was quite something. Look for concerts - you wont be disappointed!

Nice architecture. I biked there via a city bike from effel tower and enjoyed the scenery along the way. This is a nice way of enjoying Paris . There was a long q outside to enter even it was at 10 am, the q moved fast and it's well worth it to see what's inside the church. I particularly like the stained glass work.
outstanding architectual. beautiful, gorgeous stained glass windows. huge pipe organ,worth seeing. if u can walk up to the top and see the gargoyles.
Climb the towers!!. Really great experience climbing the towers. Well organised with spectacular views across the city and great pictures from the top.

Beautiful catedral . It's nice to go inside this beautiful catedral without pay or big lines. But is you want to go to the top of the tower prepare to climb a "few" steps and pay for it plus the huge lines.

Finally made the time to climb!. We decided to climb the tower and take in the views! Go around the cathedral to the left and get in cue for the climb. Be sure to buy the museum pass once you get to the gift shop it will benefit you the rest of your trip! It is very crowded no matter when you go. Be patient and enjoy the scenery- it is worth it!

You really need to go inside. Long lines but it is worth going inside...it could be a little crowded inside in some of the more beautiful areas. The stain glass windows are beautiful to see. Some good areas to walk around to get better photos without the crowds...

A must-see in Paris!. Free of charge and beautiful inside and out, walking up the boulevard to be greeted with the front of this icon will take your breath away. While you walk through, you cannot help but be stunned by the beauty of the place. On our next visit, we are hoping to attend a concert which we understand happens regularly.
Long lines. Just be prepared for long lines but it moves fast. It's amazing inside and leaves you disbelief. There is a actual confessional booth if you feel so inclined.

Great architecture. We have seen many great cathedrals and churches around the world and this is one of the top ones. It is amazing what workmanship existed 500-700 years ago. The north and south rose windows are large and beautiful. The gargoyles are still in existence and we especially enjoyed the one inspired by the architects mother in law.
Got to do it!. You cannot come to Paris and not enter this magnificent building-whether you like churches or not you really should visit.
Magnificent Cathedral. We visited in 2014 and they were restoring a wing. Just so spiritual and peaceful. We had to return. Love this amazing Cathedral

amazing stained glass piece of art. Notre Dame Cathedral is a must visit place in Paris.
Take extra time to walk up to explore the stained glasses windows. There are awesome
I had lunch at La Tour d'Argent,the famous cuisine restaurant offers special ducks (with number...I am not thrilled about the number of ducks killed, though). The view of Notre Dame Cathedral and Seine is magnificent,

Stunning . I love how beautiful this place is! The high arches of the celing and beautiful tall coloured glass windows are stunning! I do recommend venturing inside even if it's for 10 mins!! So much history in one place! Light a candle and enjoy the scenery.
Excellent!. We arrived mid morning and no queues. A few years since last visit, so it was time to visit again, to light a candle for those no longer with us!

Impressive. One of the most impressive cathedrals in Europe, Beautifully located in Ile de la Cité in the middle of two arms or the Sena river, its view is impressive from both sides of the river and from the water when making the Sena cruise Bateau Mouche.Much more impressive when you enter this gothic, middle age cathedral. Thrilling every step you take inside.
Stunning architecture. Interesting how many things are for sale once you get inside. Free entry but of course donations are welcome. Beautiful architecture and very atmospheric.

One very impressive cathedral. This is an amazing cathedral steeped in a very long history, dating back to the 1100s. Very majestic, historic and welcoming of all who would like to light a candle in prayer for another, which we did for a good friend who is Catholic, and feeling ill, way across the ocean in the United States. Thousands of people come here every day and a lot of them light candles too.
Nice but.... Don't go on a rainy day. And especially don't go up the towers on a rainy day (our case). It wasn't worth the wait. The views are nice but you can get the same from other parts of town

Beautiful at 853+. I have always been amazed with Cathedrals and their construction and history. When in Paris I traveled to the location of Notre-Dame de Paris and was mesmerized by its design and beauty both outside and in. The groundbreaking was held in 1163 and completion of the Cathedral happen around 1345. The height of Notre-Dame is 226 feet, length 420 feet, Width 157 feet, 2 towers, 10 bells and a Spire at 300 feet.While walking throughout the Cathedral you can sense a remarkable realm of holiness. The stain glass windows are spectacular as are the pillars that stand as towers of strength. Your mind will ponder who has passed this way before me, walked on these floors, spent time at this alter.The Cathedral still offers masses (Catholic Church) to the general population so please show reverence and respect should you visit.Bring your camera and your prayers and take time to give thanks.Dr. Marc, 1 John 4:4Timeline of construction• 1160 Maurice de Sully (named Bishop of Paris) orders the original cathedral demolished.• 1163 Cornerstone laid for Notre-Dame de Paris; construction begins.• 1182 Apse and choir completed.• 1196 Bishop Maurice de Sully dies.• c.1200 Work begins on western facade.• 1208 Bishop Eudes de Sully dies. Nave vaults nearing completion.• 1225 Western facade completed.• 1250 Western towers and north rose window completed.• c.1245–1260s Transepts remodeled in the Rayonnant style by Jean de Chelles then Pierre de Montreuil• 1250–1345 Remaining elements completed.
Love it!. Must see in Paris. My wife and I have been here before and every time is spectacular. Today we stumbled in when they were saying noon Mass and stayed....magical!

Climb up to the Belfry - buy a Museum Pass beforehand!. Tour inside and on top of Notre Dame Cathedral. We arrived on Monday right when the Cathedral opened and luckily were able to walk right in. When we exited a short time later, there was a very long line. We returned the following day to climb the tower. Had to wait about an hour to climb and was glad I had my inhaler with me. Wear comfortable shoes and get a bite to eat while you're waiting outside in line. Amazing views of Paris, including Eiffel Tower from the top.

Can't Miss.. I am an Athiest. Shouldn't matter, but it certainly did in this case. I was not the least bit prepared for the awe I felt in this cathedral. So many years of history, so much detail, so rich and vibrant. Like I said, awe. Jaw agape. Coming from California, we don't have old buildings. That was what drew me to Paris to begin with. I wanted to see old. I got to from the first day in Paris, but I didn't see what I meant by old until I walked into Notre Dame.
You Must Go!. If you are in Paris on a Sunday then attend one of the services at Notre Dame. Ask if there is a choir performing and go to that service.
Breathtaking!. The lines are long but they move very quickly. Located on an island in the Seine, it is very easy to get to.

Historical, a must see when in Paris. This is a must see when in Paris. Do not just drive by in a cab or walk past it and take a picture.This is worth taking an hour or so to enjoy the historical nature of this amazing cathedral. We did not make it to the towers however on my next visit to Paris I do plan to take the extra time to do so.It was must more amazing that I thought.

A Must See. Incredible cathedral but very crowded. Be ready to get bumped into and fight your way to anything you want to see. Not as breathtaking or organized as St. Pauls in London but well worth it for the history.

Vintage. Although I never got to go inside this magnificent building, the awe and beauty captured me. I found myself standing in the rain just taking in it's brilliant architecture. if your into old buildings, this is a must see. Be prepared to wait in line, it's definitely on my top 10 things to do when I visit Paris again.

Go For a Truly Remarkable Mass.. By entering for Mass you get to feel a part of this incredible congregation - so lovely and at 11pm on Sunday the Organ pipes play the most gothic fugue at the end of mass it is both intimidating and awesome.

Not a must see. A historical site, but definitely not among the most beautiful churches. Too crowded, too heavy Gothic atmosphere. Ok for a quick visit and not worth paying or waiting in lines for the towers.

Very good but no inside visit. View from the towers and the church bell were awesome. We had to climb 400 narrow steps up, it's quite an experince and exciting. No lift, so I would not recommend it for those who might have difficulty with constant upward steps (no place to rest) and who are clostrophobic as the spirall stairs get narrower as you ascend the top.

must see favouite church in paris. beautiful church, stained glass amazing caught in the right light it is jaw droppinglucky enough to visit at time of mass and heard a fantastic chorister filling the church with her voice
Steeped in history . Breathtaking place. Must visit. Walk around the outside too for different perspectives. Watch out for pickpockets when very crowded. Admire all the beautiful stained glass.
Absolutely stunning. Absolutely stunning both inside and out. A must see if visiting Paris. Architecture is amazing! Not catholic but mass is a very reverent and inspiring experience.

Very interesting - get the audio guide for detailed info. There was much more to this church than looking for Quasimodo! A beautiful place, with incredible architecture, and some interesting little chapels within.
Old and beautiful. Really nice church to visit if you like architecture. Take care with the photos, try to not use flash.
Stunning. A beautiful and outstanding building. The architecture is amazing. Definately worth looking at,inside too.

Very good, but crowded. This was really wonderful from a bucket list POV. For my money, the basillique St Denis is much better. Not nearly as crowded and the history is exceptional. Notre Dame is impressive, but the crowds make it hard to take in fully

A Holy Place. No trip to Paris can be complete without a trip to the Notre Dame Cathedral. We were initially put off by the long queue when we arrived. However, we decided to stick it out and the line moved very quickly. The cathedral is built in the Gothic style and massive in size. From the moment one steps through the doors, it has a quiet reverence despite the large crowds of visitors. An amazing site in this beautiful city!

Notre Dame Paris Inspirining. My wife and I visited Notre Dame Paris a few times and each time of day was a different experience. The lines can be long but once inside it is worth the wait. This was the third Notre Dame Cathedral we had visited after Chatres and Bayeux. Paris was more grande and elaborate than the others and we were very happy to have been able to visit it again on the last days of our vacation.
Walked outside . Cue were long. 2nd time here, so just adored outdoors to save time for other sites .architecture is amazing...must see st least 1 in life time
Breathtaking. I'm not in any way religious, but this cathedral is just breathtaking. It is huge, it is beautiful and the tides of history are strong.

A calming, awe inspiring walk through some church history. The colours in the stained glass windows are spectacular! I did not get to the towers as it was later in the day and threatening rain however, I did hear some memorable music by a woman singing (not sure if she was leading people in sung responses to a prayer liturgy) - the acoustics were astounding. Lots of people walking though and perhaps not the most silent space even though there are signs posted for people to be respectful of the space. There is a cost for going up into the towers however, church itself is free.

Absolutely beautiful. The line was fast moving and once inside I could see why it was so busy! It's absolutely beautiful and a definite must see, even if you're not religious. The stained glass is absolutely stunning and there is so much to see inside.

Don't Leave Paris without A visit Notre Dame Cathedral. We walk by a few time out front, there always a long line waiting to go inside, then we decide to get on the line, amazingly, the line move very fast, we probably wait for half hour, at first when you enter, the place looks very dark, but once your eye got adjust to the dim light, it's very beautiful inside, you can see everything, every bit well craft detail, we were glad we go in, one of the highlight of our Paris trip.

Gargoyles and the best. Cathedral is beautiful.. On our recent visit to Paris we toured Notre Dame. We arrived early to be there for the door opening. The Metro stop drops you right near the cathedral. A suggestion that I would make is that if you are going to take the 387 stairs to the top, is that head off to the left and do that first. The line to get into the church itself moves quickly all the time. The line to go up the stairs to the top of the church is much slower and limited to about 35 at a time from the best we could tell.An observation we made was that lots of folks had the Paris Pass and showed it to the person that allowed people in and he always directed them to the end of the line. The Paris Pass does not allow you to skip the line at Notre Dame. You get to wait along with everyone else. There is a wall that you can sit on while waiting so it is not too bad. The view from the top is great.Gargoyles and the old bells make for a fun adventure. When you finally get to the top level you are limited to 30 minutes because up and down use the same stairway to get to the top. So you may find yourself waiting a bit to get up top.The church itself is wonderful. We were lucky to have a young peoples choir singing inside the Cathedral. It made the visit even more special.Highly recommended!

Make sure you climb to the top. An amazing old church definitely worth a visit. It was a one hour wait to climb to the top - the Paris pass doesn't allow you to skip the line for this one - but it was absolutely worth the wait. The stairs are a killer but the view is incredible

Magnificently holy !. Very pious, extremely beautifully constructed with great amount of skill. Lovely souvenirs on sale. Extremely welcoming energy and feeling of being awestruck by the sheer grandeur of art on display.

weekend visit. another must see for any trip to this most beautiful and romantic city. Like everything in Paris it is best to arrive early to avoid the crowds. Also please remember that this is a church and not a museum; too many tourist groups act in a disrespectful manner. take e time to fully appreciate all it has to offer and the time it took to construct
Make sure you do it. Perhaps you will wait in a long line but it is worth. There as no fee or advance reservations required. Beautiful and spiritual.

Beautiful architecture. Beautiful architecture and what a colorful stained glass window. No one can say that the windows from outside could be so beautiful from inside. Its just amazing. The line outside that waits in to get in, goes pretty fast and smooth.

I n c r e d i b l e . My boyfriend and I visited when there was mass on and it was quite eerie but incredible at that! Such an old place but so pristine and well kept its unbelievable highly highly recommend !

Beautiful catherdral and amazing views from the top!. I am not much of a fit/active person and didnt realize what I signed up for when we decided to climb the narrow tower to the top. It's a super narrow and HIGH climb/steps up, but the views of the city from the top are totally worth it! We were lucky enough to catch the sunset at the top and it was breathtaking. Wouldn't recommend this to anyone with claustrophobia. At nights, there's tons of entertainment happening outside the catherdral, definitely a cool spot to hang out.

Steeped in history. Notre Dame impressed us with the depth of history attached to this cathedral and its iconic status. It was somewhat underwhelming in its architecture when compared to the gothic structures of Cologne cathedral in Germany or the York Minster in the UK, but impressive nonetheless. Again, avoid the crowds by arriving early and missing the mid-morning tour groups - expect to queue but they move reasonably quickly. BTW, watch your belongings in the crowds here....you know the drill. Also, Rick Steves free online Audio guide was very helpful for a self guided tour.

Majestic. It was a memorable visit. We did the whole tour climbing up and down the steep stone staircase looking for Quasimodo... look at the gargoyles so close and so fascinating... loved every bit of it!

Amazing Notre Dame Cathedral. The day we visited the cathedral it was the Feast of the Ascention a national holiday in France. The church was filled with worshippers for mass. Listening to the choir singing and the huge pipe organ playing is something I will never forget. The beautiful huge chandeliers were glowing and the rose stained glass was magnificent. Be sure to walk around to the back outside and view this amazing cathedral. Amazing how this grand structure was built so many years ago!

You do not have to be Catholic. Visit the most historic church in all of France. No charge to to enter a gothic masterpiece. A church so powerful with history you will never forget it. There is a timeline in the church that shows the historical development of the church. It starts in 1200. It's design is beautiful . To me the back of the church is the neatest. Think of the famous poepl even that have walked through its entrance. Charlemagne, Napolean. So many great dignitaries it is remarkable.It has the biggest stained glass window, to go along with its pure greatness. You will be amazed at what you see. Take time to visit and take in the power of Notre Dame! Bw,

Beautiful on the inside and out. I went here with a friend, we were having a day of wandering around and getting familiar with our surrounds so had not planned too much. The line to enter went very quickly, we didn't get a guided tour or anything and was just amazing to walk through and see the detail that has been put into the interior. It felt a little disrespectful to be taking pictures as there were people praying at the time but there were plenty of people doing so. Very glad we decided to enter!
It's great. It's very peaceful and calm place .... Gives sheer happiness spending time there irrespective of which religion you belong too ... I had a great time there ...

Amazing. This cathedral is so stunning inside and out and you can truly appreciate the work that went into this and the fine detail. Definitely worth a visit it's free to see the chapel part and the rest is around 7 euro to go up to the bell tower would highly recommend

A concert at the Notre Dame.. The best way to visit the Notre Dame is to appreciate a concert there. In summer, very often there is poster outside Notre Dame showing concert time. Sometimes, we can buy ticket 15 minutes before the concert starts. You will have a magical experience of listening to the heavenly melody at this magnificent place.

Wow - did not expect this!. Have been in cathedrals all over Europe, including St. Peters in Vatican city and Notre Dame in my opinion the best. No charge to walk main floor, and even heard priest performing service along Choral singers. Really great experience for our group!

Beautiful. The Notre Dame Cathedral has great architecture. The line to get in is a little intimidating but it goes quickly. And likely everywhere else in Paris there is the security check. But once you get inside you will be mesmerized by the architecture. It is a massive building and has beautiful stained glass windows. It is a busy place so be weary of pickpockets.
Incredible. This gothic cathedral is honestly so breathtaking. One of my favorite places to see in Paris. The stained glass windows are stunning.

Very crowded. There is a queue outside the church to get in. Line up to have your bags inspected. It's for your own safety anyway. We live in challenging times that we are uncertain if the person next to us may be carrying weapons. Increase in military personnel visibility in all tourist spots. As a tourist, I was extremely thankful for this.

A true piece of history. It was great to finally see the Notre Dame Cathedral on our trip to Paris and the history and architecture did not let us down. While there was quite a line-up it did move quickly. Once inside there was quite the crowd, but it was manageable.
Extraordinary in day and at night, inside and out. Our long walks took us by Notre Dame at all hours of the day and night and from every angle you see something so stunning, the scale is wondrous.

History and religion meet.... The architecture is stunning, and the art is first rate. I would recommend taking your time and staying for Vespers, which is all of 20 minutes, so you can hear the acoustics and get a taste of 16th century prayer. If there is an evening concert, go! The music, even if you do not know any Latin or French, is mesmerizing.

Worth a visit. The queues for the trip up the tower were so long that we didn't bother waiting. We did go inside the cathedral, which is free, and its definitely worth a walk around. There is another tour for the Crypte Archeologique which we mistakenly interpreted as "Crypt".. Its not. If you are a bit morbid and are hoping to see some bodies then you'll be disappointed. It's more a look at how Paris started and some Roman walls etc, not worth the 7 Euro entrance fee unless you like looking a old stones.

Beautiful, amazing, well worth the visit.. The cathedral is amazing, and an absolute must to visit while in France. It is too bad that there are not more buildings like this left. When you walk in you are in awe from beginning to end. Just a gorgeous place, what more can you say?

Must See. Notre Dame Cathedral is a must see if visiting Paris, but don’t just walk or drive by; go inside the Cathedral. The best way to do this is to go on a Sunday. Then get in the line for Sunday Mass. You don’t have to really do Mass. We were there on Easter Sunday and did Mass though. It was glorious. How many Americans can say they’ve had Easter Mass at Notre Dame?

Nice but not Great. Good to see but not the grander of the Vatican or West Minster Abby. An imposing structure but lacking the great art of other cathedrals. We did about two hours which was plenty.We did not do the towers so maybe that would have upped the score.
Amazing . Amazing stained glass inside. Outside just awe inspiring gothic at its most impressive. Free so totally worth a half an hours wander.
History at it's best.. This Cathedral is stunning absolutely wonderful, and while were there their was a choir singing which was delightful, an added bonus for us. I recommend a visit, a must see.

Architecture forever. Long time ago reading Victor Hugo novel The Hunchback of Notre-Dame make me always curious to see that church. It was very interesting experience and visit island on river Seine make memory for the rest of my life
Very nice. Beautiful church on the island. Architecture is astonishing and how well kept it is for its age. A must see while in Paris.

Beautiful. We entered this beautiful cathedral one evening after dinner. There was a music service going on, the lights were dimmed but the stained glass still had light coming in off the street and it was so amazing. We walked around the entire place and listened for a few minutes. Must see.
Notre Dame. Notre Dame is an impressive structure with expansive views of Paris from its position on the hill of Montmartre. Inside one can see some of the rich Catholic history on display.
Beautiful exterior. I'm giving it a 4 star because I didn't get to go in because the lies were too long in the summer time. However, it has beautiful Gothic architecture.
Just a beautiful place. Nice to have a peaceful beautiful experience and unusual for Paris, free. Don't forget to go to the eastern side outside for possibly the best views.
Hallelujah. Drop by the church for some solitude although it can be quite crowded on weekends. Windows are exquisite

No hunchback foubd. Notre Dame lies in a beautiful part of town and its surroundings are very picturesque if you look part the tourist trap shops. The cathedral itself is impressive, but if you've been to other great European churches it won't blow you away.
Beautiful and historic. Really enjoyed our tour of this historic cathedral. So much beautiful detail. I didn't realize that this is still a working church too.

Very awe inspiring!. We attended Sunday mass here at 10am. There are tourists going around the cathedral while mass is going on. The mass was beautiful! I feel blessed I was able to attend. The cathedral is massive and so amazing. You could spend hours upon hours here. Going to mass and walking around to view it's beauty was a lot to take in! There is just as much to see on the outside. If you want to go up into the tower, you give your name and the line attendant gives you a time and you can come back. This is great so you don't waste 2 hours in line! Definitely a must see in Paris!
Of course, a must see!. Lovely outside and inside! A very nice gift shop for religious souvenirs that takes credit cards. Many sidewalk shops walking to the island and back.

A Must Visit Church in Paris. A beautiful historic church in the centre of Paris. I highly recommend climbing the stairs to visit the bell tower, for great views of the stunning architecture and wonderful views of the city. It is $10 for the climb, but it is covered by the Paris Museum Pass. Don't miss it.

A beautiful hour away from the busy world. I took my 19 year old daughter to the Gregorian mass so that she could not only see, but worship in one of the most beautiful and awe inspiring churches in the world. Seeing it only goes so far. However, attending mass brings it all together. You can really get a sense for how inspired people felt hundreds of years ago when worshiping in this great building...and still do! I definitely recommend taking the time to do this!

An Amazing wonder. Whether you are religious or not, see this beautiful cathedral. It was amazing to walk in and see the wonder of this grand church. The art work and strained glass are really inspirational. It was a little disappointing with the way they have built up around it, but still, worth your trip. Free to enter but donation boxed are all around, and PLEASE. No flash photography like they ask. As well no need to take pictures of those praying,as they also ask. Some people.
Amazing. Stumbled in during their Evensong. Just beautiful. We like the fact that it's free to visit and only funded through donations.

Beautiful cathedral !!. This cathedral is so iconic, so beautiful and amazingly well preserved !
The inside is simply breathtaking ! I really recommend to visit this amazing place !

Very busy! . Visited in a rainy day and there were so many people. Basilique is full of history but felt that the number of people distracted from this a little. The craftsmanship in the outside is incredible That being said still worth a visit.

Beautiful icon. Its one of the icons of Paris, so you must pay a visit. Bare in mind that it is an active church, so please be respectful. We went with the walking tour of Ille de la Cite, Notre Dame Cathedral and the Bell Tower. If you are there, the Bell Tower gives the most magnificent views of the Seine and the Eiffel Tower. If you must take photographs inside the cathedral, try to do it as quietly as possible. Flash photography is strictly not allowed.

Its suppose to be very holy. Super walk from the city down lanes right up at the Cathedral. Passing by the small lanes full of restaurants, where movies were shot restaurants became popular ,were the painters lived and were born to fame. Again a perfect view of the city. What was annoying for me was the sale of liquor outside the Cathedral and people drinking it on the stairs of the cathedral. After hearing the story of the cathedral how holy it was and even speaking, talking and clicking pictures were not allowed inside it.
A moving place. Speaking as someone who isn't religious, I found the cathedral to be a very soulful place. Plus, it's free to get in

Christmas 2015. We got lucky enough to visit Notre Dame Cathedral right on Christmas day, December 25, 2016. It was out of the ordinary experience. We got there on 10 a.m. It was crowded but not much. Was beautifully decorated. Beautiful cathedral worth visiting, free entrance.

Busy place, but worth wading in the crowds. This is a staple of Paris- it is a MUST see item. Unfortunately, everyone else thinks that too, so when you go, bring your patience.The building is an incredible feat of engineering and it really is easy to place yourself as a parishioner of 200, 500, or 1000 years ago. The church holds mass at noon, and it is nice to sit down and observe (I am not Catholic, but still enjoy seeing something different, which is what a European adventure is all about!). Remember, in addition to your patience for the crowds, bring your respect too, as it is still an active church (remove your hat, speak softly, and wear appropriate attire). I would recommend taking the Metro station to Pont Marie and then walking towards Notre Dame from the south to really appreciate this amazing structure- it is also less crowded on this route.

Notre Dame. The church was beautiful! The architecture is amazing. A definite must (if you have the stamina! ) is to climb the towers. 500 steps. Exhausting but totally worth it. The view you get from the top is phenomenal. And you get up close and personal with the gargoyles!!! Have to also climb the extra steps to the bell tower! There's also the center point of Paris in front of the cathedral. A little hard to locate, but interesting!

It may not be the most beautiful but it's an incredible Cathedral.. It's beautiful inside and out. It should be ileagl go to Paris and not visit the Cathedral. The history behind it is part of the Parisian culture. Totally worth!

amazing building. Interior is really not too impressive but when you look at the building from outside, it is amazingly thought of. The figures are must see. Look into the details and you'll see some shocking figures. Towers are closed at 6 pm so we couldn't make it.
Amazing architecture. Came here with my partner on our holiday. Not too crowded, and it was nice that there was no entry fee. Quite a good way to while away half a morning or so.
It's Huge. I have been in many old churches. Notre Dame is interesting because of its history and grand size, but it's also a rather dark, impersonal feeling place.

Absolutely Gorgeous!. We visited the Cathedral at 8am right when it opened, so the place was crowd-less, peaceful and breathtaking! The only thing I regret is not being able to do the audio guide tour as that opens at 9 or 9.30am (I cannot remember the specific time). But, just taking in the detail, design and beauty of the place was something to remember. And the fact that there was almost no one inside was a plus. All other attractions that we went to had lots of school trips and guided tours where people just did not respect the need for silence in places of worship. So, even though I would have wanted to do the audio guide tour, it was also not a bad thing that we went that early.Another advantage of going that early? Getting an almost perfect picture of the cathedral from the outside without crowds milling about the square in front of it. :)

Beautiful Cathedral. What an amazing cathedral.....spoiled by thousands of people walking through, snapping pictures, talking loudly and laughing without an ounce of reverence and respect for those attending service there. It was beautiful to sit down and just listen to the hymns sung and see the beautiful stained glass windows though.
Stunning. A must see when in Paris, Great sculptures inside and amazing , also the fantastic stain glass windows.

Breathtaking and moving . This Cathedral was absolutely stunning and took my breath away. I highly recommend getting an audio guide to learn about the history and architecture of the building. Don't skip out on paying a little extra. The church is free and is a place with a rich and interesting history that shouldn't be overlooked.

better in person. as one would have guessed, you have to visit the cathedral notre-dame once in your life. just do yourself a favour and take a look around, as the pictures will never be as beautiful as the cathedral itself. beautiful!

majestic historical building. Huge cathedral, that is just beautiful inside. unknown fact is you can see the tetragrammaton of Gods name (YHWH) in the ceiling behind the altar at the front of the church.

One beautiful cathedral. Its a gem alright. If you're into catherdrals this one lives up to its reputation. I think the beauty of Notre Dame is in its contrast to the Roman version of church design and artisitic finish. Its Gothic architecture and construction, but naturalism in its finishes and details tells the story of the differences in the evolving French and Roman catholic traditions. My luck was an organ concert in progress when I entered. The pipes were amazing to hear. Its free to enter ....but.there is a donation box by the main aisle to help maintain the place.
Beautiful. We were there on a Sunday and the music was wonderful, cathedral is beautiful, we were able to walk around the perimeter of the inside without bothering the worship service.

Great concert :). We've visited Notre Dame numerous times for our 10-th day trip. The best experience was the vocal concert with Lully, Bach and organ! A bit expensive for young people but it was totally worth it :)

Beautiful catherdral . Wow!! Beautiful, peaceful serene surroundings. Loved the architecture.
It was amazing to see brides and grooms being photographed outside of the church. Very international crowd.
Beautiful. . The Cathedral is beautiful. Pice of art and history. Is almos 1000 years old. Is a must when your in Paris. There is a lot of shops and restaurants around. Love the area!
Worth the long line up.. Attended Good Friday mass and despite the huge lineup it was well worth it. The architecture is stunning and quite different from most churches I´ve seen in Europe.

Amazing Church. This is an amazing church with very interesting art inside, the construction itself is a piece of art and the gargoyles surrounding the church are incredible , you can visit the tower and see it closely, but usually there are long lines of tourists waiting.

Beautiful Cathedral . When we planned to come to Paris, visiting the Cathedral was one of the must do things I had on my list. The outside of the building is beautiful and magnificent itself but the inside is just as spectacular.
There was a long queue when we arrived however it moves very quickly!

So beautiful . You stand in front of the stage of the crosses and the saints. When we went last time they had the crown of thorns in the front. Don't believe the brochures. During the French Revolution many were buried down below. They don't like talking about it. It's been there so long you just imagine the Knights coming in there. The Kings being crowned. It's my favorite of all Cathedrals. I've been in many and some more grande. Norte Dame is so historical you can almost put yourself way back in history. You realize how small we are unless we try to make a difference. I always stop and look at Joan of Ark. At 19 I stopped and was mesmerized. At 10 my daughter did the same. It was odd. It feels like home to me.
Beautiful place . I've visited the cathedral twice and I would suggest anyone who's traveling to Paris to visit as it's beautiful during the day our even in the evening..
Beautiful cathedral. Massive queue to get in but went down very quickly. Free entry too which was good and very impressive inside.
Notre Dame Cathedral. I've visited this church previously. I am still amazed about this church. There was a mass when I visited here. It was solemn and the soloist was terrific. I will visit again
Stunning. We were lucky enough to enjoy part of a service. Simply beautiful music and singing to go along with the exquisite architecture and stained glass
intresting. Grandiose ... great for architectural lovers, one of the must see churches in Paris. I prayed and cried (no idea why)
Don't miss the North Tower. The history is great but the panoramic views of this beautiful city from the North Tower are not-to-be-missed. Even on a cloudy misty day, it's worth the 422-step climb.
Historic church. What an interesting building.a very dark place once inside but its a massive building with so much to look at so much detail inside and out

Breathtaking . Beautiful architecture and wonderful ambience. Only criticism was that they seemed to try to grab money wherever they could. I know church's are expensive to run, but the constant asking for money did ruin my experience slightly.

What a building. So, for an atheist to look at a church and give a good review is unthought of right?
Wrong, this is an amazing building and so big.
Worth a visit. Whatever you believe in.

A candle for my loss. I came here just after my daughter died unexpectedly. I am not religious but set a candle for her. You can see the Catholics give towards their churches maintenance and it is beautiful. A Paris landmark. Visit and donate please.

Breathtaking. I can only describe the Norte dame as breathtaking. Architecture and attention to dental all around the building was out of this world. Surprised and impressed by how clean and well preserved it was.

One of the Iconic Place in Paris. This one of the places that you have to spent some times to see the hard art work on the wood, on the glass and on the wall. Everything there deserve to take some times to look at it. The light turn to be dark but the great part that we were allow to take photo which was great chance to train your self about how to use your camera in the dark without flash and get the small details because I do not like to fire my flash close to this iconic places. I visited several time and I feel if I visit Paris at anytime I have to make some times to spent inside the Notre Dame.

Impressive!. It's all you could expect and a bit more. Impressive gargoyle statues.
Didn't expect to see a statue of the pope on the gardens. Good extra.
Loved the walk near water and the locks bridge nearby.
You could use notre-dame's garden and shadows to feed the kids and rest a bit. We did.

The outside is more impressive than inside. The architecture and work outside is beautiful. If you don't have time to go inside just enjoy the facade. You can see the the Crown of Thorns first Friday of the month, if you are lucky enough to be there or plan your trip around it.

It is not St. Peter's Basilika in Rome..... ...but it has its own character and "grave" beauty. Not overwhelmingly ornate and, perhaps because of it, quite touching and personal. The stained glass windows are breathtaking!

Gorgeous and must-see. We are so happy we visited and went inside. It is free, and when we went mass was happening which made it even more beautiful. Architecture, history, religion, this is an overall incredible site to go to during your time in Paris.

Magnificent . We were blessed to be able to have mass in this wonderful cathedral. The architecture is amazing, with its soaring arches and beautiful carvings. The story of the church, which goes back to 1200, is told in panels in the rear of the cathedral. It's worth taking time to walk through, read the panels and explore the sanctuary. We wanted to go up in the bell tower but the line was too long. The most amazing thing about the church is it seems filled with a spirit of peace that even crowds of tourist cannot take away.

Wonderful Cathedral. I have often visited Notre Dame and it is usually so full of tourists that the building seems lost. This time was an exception. There were fewer tourists and the building came into its own making the visit very memorable as we were able to study more of it and also get the full ambience of the building as a Cathedral rather than just a tourist attraction. That said, it is always worth a visit!

Breathtaking stained glass. Filled to the brim with tourists - but don't let that scare you. It's worth the wait to see inside Notre Dame. The stained glass was a marvel of color and design. So beautiful and an opportunity to light a candle for a loved one or sit and drink it all in. Best of all - no entrance fees!

Worth a visit. One of the must dos in paris...located within other historic and tourist places...even if u dont want to go inside you will enjoy visiting the place taking some pictures and absorbing the surrounding

Free entry, beautiful chirch. Beautiful stained glass, and nice little chapels on the sides. There are free tours in many languages at set times, but I wasn't able to attend. Beautiful, but not very memorable I thought.

Fascinating, must visit. Long queues, tiring climb to the Gargoyles Gallery!. Fabulous Cathedral, is all that it's hyped up to be and more!! But the climb to the Gargoyles Gallery is steep, 400 narrow and claustrophobic steps. Avoidable for kids and senior citizens. Now the gallery is fenced off with a wire mesh. Photos do come out ok but not like you will see posted on web. If you are not too interested in the Gargoyles, avoid, the view from the Tour Montparnasse is much better!

Beautiful. We visited during the day, the queue moves quickly and whilst you're in it you get to look at the outside of the cathedral which is breathtaking. The stain glass on the inside is beautiful. We also walked up the towers, these are old spiral staircases, quite tiring but worth for the views you get at the top. Up there you can also see the bells. Would love to visit again.

Amazing cathedral . Beautiful cathedral. Even with a long queue to get in, there was hardly any waiting time as it moved quickly. You have as much time as you like to look inside. Amazing architecture. You can have an audio guide if you like. There is a park near by the views of the back of the cathedral.

Amazing views from the back side of the Cathedral.. I have been to Paris several times. On this trip one of my coworkers suggested we walk all the way around the Cathedral onto the island behind the building. The views from this side are amazing and the little village has some exceptional restaurants.Night life is very quite but for a beer or wine and conversation it is fantastic.

EVERYTHINGS ARE EXCELLENT. before enter to notre dame cathedral you should close your eyes and after enter,open your eyes,at now you are in the very past century and ever things are excellent.ceilingis very tall and you can see the best european architecture.I highly recommend to visit notre dame even if stay in paris for a few hours.

Breathtaking . My most favourite place in the whole world.The most beautiful building. Stunning inside and out.Very very busy but free of charge and queues to get in go down quite quickly.Great atmosphere in surroundings square.Just behind the building is the river Seine and lovers lock bridge.Walk down the steps over the bridge and board a riverboat for some spectacular views Over coffee and cakes.Can't wait to go again.

The church !!! Not so great. We all know about the great Notre Dame. I allways though of going there...imagine my surprice when THE CHURCH looks more like a market that a Church. Is beautyfull , amaizings vitrals and the architecture. But all the magic of a great church is lost in the talking of the people and the souvenirs selling .
Beautiful. Notre Dame is beautiful both inside and out. I don't want to say too much but it is definitely worth the visit.

Beautiful and free!. This is pretty easy to get to via metro or bus. The line to get inside is a little long but moves swiftly - and there are no tickets so its free! If you want to go up to the towers, then you go to the side entrance and that is ticketed where you pay. This is free to enjoy and there is a lot of art and architecture to enjoy inside. It is a functioning church so there are folks who are using it for prayer.

Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful cathedral, stunning decor and incredible character build into the walls alone. There is so much to look at, so much to admire, all of the jewels, silver and gold it's all just so bewildering. I simply cannot put into words how brilliant this cathedral is, it is simply magnificent. It's a must see in my opinion.

Impressive. At first sight this massive Gothic cathedral will blow you away. When I went there was quite a line to get in but in about 10-20 minutes we were in. It is quite dark in here due to lack of light but is absolutely stunning. Make sure to be quiet for respect reasons. Highly recommend!

A Classic!. Must visit on any trip to Paris. The lines are incredibly long, but it so beautiful. The outside of the building (all the way around) is amazing as well. Be sure to spend some time wandering around the outside and looking at the gargoyles!

Grand. Like many cathedrals throughout Europe, it is very grand with the extremely high arched ceilings, painted chapels, large stained glass windows, wood and stone carvings galore. We happened upon a choir from the US that was traveling thru Europe that was giving a free performance. The sound in the sanctuary was astounding! Entrance is free. We paid a few Euros to go into the treasury. The line was too long and moving too slowly for us to visit the towers (fee reqired).

Go with a tour . This is an amazing place witg a great history . Dont miss the tour guide offered inside and outside the venue.Tge cathedral is free for public. If yiu are lucky you will get to visit it on day when there is a fair like a chocolate or bread festival near there. It is close to seine and near the metro line 4 station Citè.

A cathedral that has great sculptures and many halls of history. A place of worship but one that is filled with loads of history. Admission is free and you get a sense of church tranquility and everyone observed respect
Best view in Paris. Absolutely do the bell tower, its the best view of the city. Pictures online do not do it justice. I was surprised how beautiful the cathedral is.

Have been in better cathedrals. The Notre Dame building is very impressive but I found that inside was not particularly impressive at all, because it was very dark and dismal. A loud speaker kept saying "SILENCE" in many languages which was louder than the noise which the visitors were making. Be aware that your bags are searched before entering the cathedral.

Visit It as a Church!. Notre Dame is beautiful for sure. It is spectacular. But it is a Catholic Church first so for practicing Catholics, it can be a much more meaningful experience by attending mass while there! Plan ahead to get a seat if you can. However if the pews are full, go to the far left side up front where you can still participate (though not kneel) and take communion. At the end of the mass, the organist played dramatic and beautiful music. Take note that tourists are still wandering about around the church during mass. You can also partake of holy water and sit quietly at one of many chapels around the outside. Once emptied of mass-goers, the place can hold so many people that there is not a line or if there is, it goes quickly. No charge to enter.

Visit it (again) in the evening, around midnight. See it from all angles. It's worth it. It was built in the 12th Century: it's the window dressing of Gothic architecture. See my impression of it among the photographs - it does stand out. Really, this is NOT self-serving: I've been reluctant to sell it to anyone, I like it so much.

Beautiful with great souvenir shops nearby. Great souvenir shops surrounding cathedral. I know this is strange to put in this review but I enjoyed the souvenir shops here the most. Great selection and prices.
Free admission . 1 of the very few attractions that's totally free. The line also moves quite fast despite the security check. Amazing architecture.

Stunning church. The windows in the church are stunning and it's so old the building its self is beautiful and I've seen a lot of churches. You can go to the top of the church for €8.50 but didn't do.

Notre Dame Cathedral well worth a visit. This old cathedral had a service on during our visit. The music had a lovely acoustic quality. The tourists circulated around the outer areas, but you could join for prayers. The stained glass is beautiful. There is a nice atmosphere .
A Paris MUST SEE. Unbelieavable. If you are a Catholic, you can't miss a Mass in Notre Dame.The Treasury (which is a Paid section) let me down.

Great History Still In Action. Wonderful experience. Well worth the wait. Line went very quickly. We chose not to do the upper tour and solo toured. Plenty to see and read without the guidebooks. Our second visit.

Architecture is amazing. I am not religious but found this place to be beautiful - the stained glass windows, sculptures and doors were stunning. Such a peaceful place and thankful that people stick to the quiet voices requested. Plus it is one of the very few places that is free to visit!
Climb the stairs of a beautiful view of Paris!. This place is magnificent, full of history and gargoyles! Please climb the stairs for a magnificent view of Paris!!

Awesome stained glass wondows. Incredible stained glass windows and beautiful high ceilings. The number of people within didn't give me the sense of peace I was searching for but definitely worth a visit. An interesting exhibition of Notre Dame through the ages really brought the history of the cathedral to life and demonstrates how the site has evolved over the ages. Look for the fabulous gargoyles but head over to isle Louis for a super view of the rear of the cathedral complete with incredible examples of flying buttresses!

Fattest pigeons ever. At the risk of body shaming the pigeons around Notre Dame Cathedral, they are the plumpest ones I have ever seen. Everyone must be feeding them. This is good for some photo ops, but there is really no reason to spend any length of time there.
Amazing building. I'm by no means an expert but the architecture of this building is amazing and you do not have to be religious to appreciate it's beauty. Free entry is always a plus too.

Not Very Impressive. Everyone visits Notre Dame when In Paris, and so did I. I spent some time in the garden outside, and then took a walk around the cathedral from across the street. Good architecture, and I was quite excited to see the gargoyles on top. However, maybe since I was coming from Rome and the Vatican, I wasn't overly impressed with this cathedral. It was different, but not the best thing I have seen in Europe. I didn't go in.

No Hunchback . Really a must see in Paris and is a tremendously impactful place
Gothic upon Gothic and more Gothic
Not as impressive as St Pauls or York Minster but i will never forget visiting here
Put it on your 'must see ' list for Paris

Far More Beautiful In Person than in Pictures. I have to admit, Notre Dame blew me away! I knew it was beautiful but it really exceeded my expectations. The outside is great, but I highly recommend taking a lap inside. The glass stained windows are heavenly.

As good as the history books say it is.. No visit would be complete without a visit to the Cathedral. Access it by the Cite metro station. It is on an island between left and right banks. There is no charge but check that it is not a public holiday when you visit.

Definitely worth a visit. We visited on a cold and wet day and were very pleased to see that the queue to enter was moving quite quickly.
Worth the visit to see this beautiful cathedral. It was not too busy inside and we were able to see what we wanted without any issues. Pleased we made the effort to learn more about this building.

A beautiful place!. My friend and I spent lots of time here - about an hour inside reading and looking at everything. We were completely in awe. Then we climbed to the top where we had wonderful outside views. Fab
Seen better . The outside is quite impressive, however, I found the inside a bit dark and not as elegant as some other churches I have been to.

Must see. Situated on the Isle de Paris...must see building.
Beautiful inside and out.
Be prepared for crowds but worth the wait.
We went on a Sunday and caught a choral service...beautiful resonating music and voice to stir the soul...

Slight disappointment. I had not expected to see Charles Laughton scampering amongst the gargoyles or swinging on the great bell but, I had expected to see one of Europe's most glorious Gothic cathedrals. I tried not to be disappointed and found myself keeping two distinct images in my head. What the church had been and what it is now. It is magnificent but over restored to the point where I am seeing the restorer's vision of what it should have looked like being realised. In the well laid out visual images of the buildings history and restoration the notes say, "One might not always agree with decisions taken..."mmmm. I contented self with imagining the coronation of Napoleon I. One piece of advice. We went early in the morning and quite simply walked in. Yesterday afternoon when we went for a walk near Notre Dame the queue for entry snaked across the forecourt.
Paris for weekend. Stayed in Paris for one night Been here before but so worth visit .took some lovely photos nice just before here looking up the river. A must if you come to Paris

Go for a concert!. A friend who lived in Paris suggested going for a concert. It was a very special experience. Classictic.com is where I found tickets. I recommend not buying the most expensive tickets which are near the alter. Buy the less expensive which are from about 1/2 way to the back. MUCH better views of the cathedral. The acoustics are wonderful.

It is Notre Dame!!. Please take a tour.. Or atleast a city tour that tells you about Notre Dame. It is gorgeous with stories of its own! Like circling around the medallion in front of the church (7 times) makes sure you return to Paris in the next 7 years! :P But still.. Definitely worth a visit.
Cathedral. Architecture is booming and the whole atmosphere is marvelous i do really like this place and wanna go there again and again
Beauty and Splendor. Beautiful from the outside and breathtaking architecture inside. Saw many candles lit and prayers going up inside these doors.

Not that impressive . 14 Million people visit the cathedral every year so a visit is called for. The interior is awe inspiring but thats about all. We had taken an audio guide from the counter (5€) which was very poorly designed. The commentary and the location didn't match most of the time.
At the hindsight could have given it a miss.

Specially tour of the towers. We had a group of 16 pre booked at 6:30pm after all the crowds had been turned away! Climbed the North tower and after some 300 arduous steps ( not for the unfit!!!) we appeared on the balustrade overlooking the square. We checked out the views and an obsolete cast bell no longer in use. Climbed another set of stairs to reach vey heights of the south tower. Magnificent carved gargoyles and especially outstanding collection of chimera on all aspects of the towers. Well worth the special after hours fee tour booked on Viator!
Free!. Beautiful cathedral. Well worth a visit inside and out. Costs to go up to bell tower but free to visit cathedral although donations excepted.

Climb the stairs. Just do this. Unless you're unable physically, the climb to the top is a must. Every photographer and artist's dream is to find the unique elements of this magnificent place to capture.

Stunning. One of the few places in Paris you can visit free! .... Stunning. Even though there can be queues, these go down very quickly. You can pay to go to other areas but just visiting the church was enough for us. Worth going back in the evening to see it lit up. Great views of Notre Dame from the banks of the Seine or nearby bridges.

I'm always amazed at the architecture every time I see it.. I went for the first time in 2007. I could only spend about an hour there. But this time, I was able to take my time and walk around the church. Architecture and the sculptures are stunning! The gargoyles are my favorite part...

Nice... Its a great neighborhood...its at zero mile of Paris..lovely church...stained glass windows are awe inspiring n the detailing is gorgeous...the line to get in moves quick n the surrounding area is gorgeous to stroll by n enjoy the food along the Seine..

Breathtaking. As a Catholic, this is like the holy grail of our religion. I was nearly moved to tears (and I'm not really that emotional), it's just breathtaking the artistry and the detail work of this place. The sheer size is just incomprehensible. I bought several mementos inside the cathedral, which I didn't even anticipate but was glad they had some souvenirs there because I really wanted something other than a photo to remember my time inside. So neat. Definitely a must see!

Unreal architecture and building. Fantastic experience to see this iconic building at first hand.Takes your breath away as you are arriving. The history hits you as you explore.A must visit when in Paris.
Amazing place. The Cathedral is an amazing building and the art inside so wonderful. I believe a must see if in Paris

a world classic.... The Notre Dame Cathedral is a wonderful example of the craftsmanship and beauty inherent in this magnificent place of worship. Photography is permitted without flash and the stained glass windows are amazing.

We ended up going to mass by chance. We were on the river shuttle, got off by Notre Dame to see it. We squeezed in last minute and mass was starting. We sat through mass to say we "did it". Afterwards, we walked around and say the history of the building being built over centuries. Wonderful!

Do the climb!. A must see for all. I forgot how breathtakingly beautiful this place is and that's not just the windows. The arches and stone work. For anyone that has read "Pillars of the Earth' this is the image for Ken Follet words. Cue and pay to do the climb. Even though it was grey and miserable when I went so worth it. Just remember to time correctly ... noon means lots of bell ringing as I found out, but all part of the fab memory.

One of the Greatest. Gothic style with all the history you could want! Not too long of lines during the off season when we went, but if you get a chance to attend mass do so! Do the towers for another view of the city from above.
Amazing . I was so taken back by the beauty of the building alone..Then to go inside...I found myself getting emotional.It is a must see!

Nice architecture on the bank of Siene.. Must do. Very beautiful. Go early before 9.30 if you want to avoid queues. Very peaceful and quiet. Take coins as souvenirs which you can get by putting 1 euro in the machine inside church.Regards

420 steps but totally worth it....!!. We queued, well over an hour, to climb the 420 steps to the top of the towers........but it was totally worth it to see the views of Paris & get face to face with the gargoyles.
Amazing church. My husband and I visited Notre Dame yesterday. What an amazing place. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit. I would definitely recommend visiting this wonderful church!

Interesting . Walked around and stayed for part of a service queu to get in.
Lovely church on the outside. Dark inside
Huge !!. Good place to hang out and take pics. We didn't go inside , but it was a worth visit for us to witness the impact of Notre Dame Cathedral
C'est Manifique. Really. Doing the sights of Paris on a tour bus is the best way to catch them all without getting footsore. Both inside and out the structure is fantastic.

Large gothic catheral. It's impressive as most cathedrals are in this time period. The display of the evolution of the Notre Dame from it's modest beginnings to its present day structure was informative. Worth seeing in Paris as a brief tour.

Norte Dame. A must in Paris.Not far from every other attractions.History of this dating back to 14 century if am not mistaken.It was started in 14 century and ended up in 18 century.so I remember,,readers please excuse me if I have any mistake.An absolute magnificent architecture.
looks better outside. Looks better outside, inside its very dark, not much to see. I used free entrance. The queue was very long, however moved very fast.

Worth the wait. I went first thing in the morning and waited about 40 mins in line and then climbed up to the top of the right tower. Its a big climb but worth it and its split into stages as you visit the bell tower and then the top of the roof and then the top of the tower. The view was amazing again, its a lovely way of seeing Paris. Inside is impressive! definitely worth taking the time to go inside.

A beautiful Cathedral. This is a beautiful cathedral with lots of visitors. We took the big bus from the hotel near Eiffel Tower. After seeing the inside of the cathedral, we decided to stay in line to go up to the top of it. The line was not very long but the wait was long. It was kind of chilly staying outside for so long. Many times I want to give up and many people did. I am glad I did not leave. It is breath taking of the view on top. There is different perspective of different angles viewing of Paris when one is on top. We went inside to check out the giant bell. It was amazing. Just to remind visitor that it is free to visit the cathedral but it costs ten euro to go up to the top and long wait (over 2.5 hours for us.)

It's SO Paris. I've been to France several times and have always been in awe of Notre Dame. It's absolutely magnificent!!! This time, while inside, all of a sudden, a choir dressed in their red robes entered and proceeded to sing the most beautiful songs. Truly inspiring!!! Be sure to go to the back side of the cathedral for the view.
